text:
<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CREOLE CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can English peas, drained
- 1 cup grated Cheddar cheese
- 1/2 cup buttered bread crumbs
- 1 recipe Creole sauce
- 2 cups thick white sauce
- 3 tablespoons grated cheese
- Mustard, to taste
- Durkee's horseradish mayonnaise, to taste
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
<|steps|>
Season the white sauce with mustard, Durkee's horseradish mayonnaise, salt, and pepper to taste.
Add 1 cup grated Cheddar cheese to the white sauce and mix well.
Place buttered bread crumbs in the bottom of a casserole dish.
Layer alternately with drained peas, white sauce, and Creole sauce.
Finish with a sprinkle of 3 tablespoons grated cheese on top.
Bake in the oven until browned before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CRANBERRY SALAD SUPREME**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 cups raw cranberries
- 2 1/2 cups water
- 1 cup sugar
- 2 packages lemon Jell-O
- Juice of 1 pineapple
- 1 can crushed pineapple
- 1 cup white grapes
- 1 cup chopped nuts
<|steps|>
Cook cranberries, sugar, and water until the berries are soft.
Add lemon Jell-O and pineapple juice to the mixture, then cool.
Stir in crushed pineapple, white grapes, and chopped nuts.
Pour into a large mold or individual molds.
Chill until set. Serves 14.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ICE BOX ROLLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 quart sweet milk
- 1 cup shortening
- 1 scant cup sugar
- 2 teaspoons salt
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 tablespoon baking powder
- 2 yeast cakes
- 1 quart flour (plus additional to make stiff dough)
- 1 teaspoon sugar (for yeast)
<|steps|>
Scald milk, then add melted shortening and sugar. Cool to lukewarm.
Dissolve yeast cakes in warm water with 1 teaspoon sugar, then add to the cooled milk mixture.
Let the mixture stand for 2 hours until doubled in size (use a large pan).
Sift flour with salt, baking soda, and baking powder.
Add the flour mixture to the yeast mixture and beat with an electric beater until a light batter forms.
Add enough additional flour to make a stiff dough.
Store in the refrigerator and use as needed.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PLANTER'S PLANTATION PUNCH**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can (46 oz) orange juice
- 1 can (46 oz) pineapple juice
- 1 quart ginger ale
- 1 quart lemon sherbet
<|steps|>
Chill the punch bowl and juices.
Place lemon sherbet in the punch bowl.
Add orange juice and pineapple juice, then pour in ginger ale last.
Stir gently and serve.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ASPARAGUS MOUSSE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 4 egg yolks
- Juice of 1 lemon
- 1 can asparagus (with liquid)
- 1 pint whipping cream
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Paprika, to taste
- 1/4 pound almonds
- 2 tablespoons flour
- 2 tablespoons gelatin
- 1 tablespoon onion juice
<|steps|>
Melt butter in a double boiler, stir in flour, and mix thoroughly.
Add asparagus liquid, stirring constantly until thickened.
Pour the mixture over lightly beaten egg yolks, stirring continuously.
Return to the double boiler and cook until the eggs are done.
Add dissolved gelatin, salt, pepper, paprika, onion juice, and lemon juice.
Cut up asparagus and, once the mixture is cool, fold in asparagus, almonds, and whipped cream.
Ensure nuts are cold before adding.
Pour into a mold and chill until set.
Serve with mayonnaise.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BROILED GRAPEFRUIT**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 grapefruit
- Butter, as needed
- 1 tablespoon brown sugar
- Maraschino cherry, for garnish
- 2 cups flour
- 3 eggs
- 4 teaspoons baking powder
- 1 1/2 cups milk
- 1/2 cup Wesson oil
- 1 teaspoon salt
<|steps|>
Cut grapefruit crosswise, remove seeds, snip out centers, and loosen each section.
Spread each grapefruit half with 1 tablespoon brown sugar and dot with butter.
Heat in a 325°F oven for about 15 minutes.
Place under a broiler to brown slightly.
Garnish with a Maraschino cherry before serving.
**WAFFLES**
Beat eggs with a rotary beater until very light and fluffy.
Thoroughly beat in Wesson oil, then add milk and beat well.
Sift salt and baking powder with flour.
Add dry ingredients to the liquid mixture, beating until thoroughly mixed.
Bake on a hot waffle iron.
Optionally, prepare the batter the night before and store in the refrigerator for breakfast.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRIED APPLE RINGS**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 large red apples
- Brown sugar, as needed
- 4 tablespoons butter
<|steps|>
Cut each apple into 3 or 4 slices.
Fry slices in a skillet with 4 tablespoons butter for about 10 minutes.
Turn slices, sprinkle with brown sugar, and cover.
Cook until tender.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HOT SPICED APPLE JUICE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 quart canned apple juice
- 1/2 lemon, sliced thin
- 1 stick cinnamon
- 1/2 cup brown sugar
- 1 cup water
- 1/2 orange, sliced thin
- 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
- Mint sprig or lemon slice, for garnish
<|steps|>
Combine apple juice, lemon slices, cinnamon, brown sugar, water, orange slices, and nutmeg in a saucepan.
Heat to boiling, then simmer for 10 minutes.
Strain the mixture.
Serve hot or cold, garnished with a mint sprig or lemon slice.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SPOON BREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup cornmeal
- 1 cup boiling water
- 2 cups sweet milk
- 1 tablespoon butter
- 3 teaspoons baking powder
- 3 eggs, well beaten
- 1 teaspoon salt
<|steps|>
Bring water to a boil and add cornmeal, stirring rapidly until well mixed.
Add sweet milk, butter, baking powder, beaten eggs, and salt.
Mix thoroughly and pour into a baking dish.
Bake at 350°F for about 40 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LEMON TARTS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup flour
- 1 cup sugar
- 2 cups boiling water
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 4 egg yolks
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 3 lemons (grated rinds and juice, add more if needed)
- 4 egg whites (for meringue)
- Pinch of salt (for meringue)
- 8 tablespoons sugar (for meringue)
<|steps|>
Combine sugar, flour, and salt in a double boiler.
Gradually add boiling water and cook until smooth and thick, stirring constantly.
Add egg yolks one at a time, stirring between each addition, and cook for 5 more minutes.
Just before removing from heat, add lemon juice, grated rind, and butter. Mix well and cool.
Pour into a 9-inch baked pastry shell or individual shells.
For meringue, beat egg whites with a pinch of salt until stiff.
Add sugar 1 tablespoon at a time, beating after each addition, and continue beating for 5 minutes.
Top the tarts with meringue and bake until golden.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRIED TOAST**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 egg
- 1 cup sweet milk
- Sliced bread, as needed
- Salt, to taste
- Bacon drippings, for frying
<|steps|>
Beat egg and milk thoroughly, then season with salt to taste.
Dip bread slices one at a time in the mixture, coating lightly, and stack to await frying.
If needed, prepare additional egg and milk mixture to coat more slices.
Heat bacon drippings in an iron skillet or broiling pan, using just enough to brown one batch at a time.
Fry bread slices in hot fat until crisp and golden.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MILK PUNCH**
<|ingredients|>
- 6 oz whole milk
- 1 teaspoon sugar
- 2 lumps ice
- 1 jigger 86-proof whiskey
- Grated nutmeg, for garnish
<|steps|>
Combine milk, sugar, ice, and whiskey in a cocktail shaker or blender.
Shake well until thoroughly mixed.
Pour into an 8-ounce tumbler.
Sprinkle grated nutmeg liberally over the top and serve.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **COAHOMA STYLE EGGS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can deviled ham
- 1 can mushrooms
- 1/2 cup butter
- 20 stuffed hard-boiled eggs
- 1 can tomato soup
- 1/2 cup grated cheese
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Mayonnaise, to taste
- Stuffed olives, to taste
- Mustard, to taste
- Paprika, to taste
- Lea & Perrins Worcestershire sauce, to taste
- Tabasco sauce, to taste
- Chili powder, to taste
- Garlic, to taste
- 2 teaspoons flour
<|steps|>
Prepare stuffed eggs by mixing mayonnaise, chopped stuffed olives, mustard, and paprika to taste with the egg yolks.
In a double boiler, combine deviled ham, mushrooms, butter, tomato soup, grated cheese, Worcestershire sauce, Tabasco, chili powder, and garlic.
Thicken the sauce with 2 teaspoons flour and cook until thickened.
Place two halves of stuffed eggs in a scallop shell.
Cover with the sauce and sprinkle liberally with grated cheese.
Heat in the oven for 5 minutes before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PORK SAUSAGE BISCUITS**
<|ingredients|>
- Regular biscuit dough
- Pork sausage
<|steps|>
Prepare regular biscuit dough and shape into tiny biscuits.
Bake until golden brown.
Fry sausage into tiny cakes.
Place one sausage cake in each biscuit and serve piping hot.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TOASTED HAM FINGER ROLLS**
<|ingredients|>
- Thinly sliced bread
- Softened horseradish butter
- Paper-thin baked ham slices
<|steps|>
Slice bread very thin and spread with softened horseradish butter.
Place a slice of paper-thin baked ham on each bread slice.
Roll up the bread slices.
Toast under a broiler, turning to brown evenly on all sides.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **EGG PLANT AND STUFFED SQUASH**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 eggplant (2 lbs)
- 1 can tomatoes
- 2 cups chopped onions
- 1 small can tomato paste (if needed)
- 1 can tomato soup
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 2 tablespoons bacon drippings
- 1/2 cup chopped green peppers
- 2 cups chopped celery
- Worcestershire sauce, to taste
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Grated cheese, as needed
- Broiled buttered shrimp, for garnish
- Chopped parsley, for garnish
- 4 medium yellow squash
- 1/2 cup water
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/8 teaspoon black pepper
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 1 finely chopped onion
- 1/2 cup cooked chopped celery
- Grated chicken liver (optional)
- 2 tablespoons cream
- Paprika, for garnish
<|steps|>
**Eggplant:**
- Wash and dry eggplant, cut off a thin lengthwise slice, and scoop out the inside, leaving a 1/4 to 1/2-inch thick wall.
- Sprinkle salt inside the shell and set in water.
- Cut eggplant flesh into pieces, cover with water, add a little salt, and cook until tender. Drain.
- Cook onions, celery, and green peppers in bacon drippings until they begin to brown.
- Add tomatoes and cook for 10 minutes, then add tomato soup (and tomato paste if needed). Cook slowly until thick.
- Add chopped eggplant and season highly to taste with Worcestershire, salt, and pepper.
- Fill eggplant shells with alternating layers of eggplant mixture and grated cheese, topping with cheese.
- Bake until the cheese is golden brown.
- Garnish with broiled buttered shrimp dipped in chopped parsley, placed in each scallop around the eggplant.
**Squash:**
- Halve squash lengthwise, careful not to break the neck, and scoop out seeds.
- Place shells in water with 1/2 cup water and 1 teaspoon salt, and cook until tender.
- Drain squash and mash the flesh.
- In a skillet, melt butter, add finely chopped onion, and cook until it begins to brown.
- Add mashed squash, cooked celery, black pepper, and 2 tablespoons cream. Season to taste.
- Fill squash shells with the mixture, sprinkle with grated cheese and paprika.
- Bake until heated through. Serves 6 to 8.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TOMATO ASPIC**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 cups tomato juice
- 2 envelopes gelatin
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon sugar
- 1 teaspoon lemon juice
- 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce
- Onion juice, to taste
- Dash of Tabasco sauce
- 1 chopped avocado
- 1/2 cup chopped celery
- 1/2 cup chopped stuffed olives
- 1 1/2 cups cottage cheese
- Mayonnaise, to taste
- Horseradish, to taste
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- 1/2 cup finely chopped spring onion
- 1/2 cup chopped celery
- 1/2 cup chopped pepper
- 1 grated cucumber (unpeeled, juice drained)
- Durkee's dressing, for marinating
- Artichoke hearts, for serving
- Avocado slices, for serving
<|steps|>
Boil tomato juice with salt, sugar, lemon juice, Worcestershire, onion juice, and Tabasco.
Dissolve gelatin in 1/2 cup water, cool, and add to the tomato juice mixture.
Stir in chopped avocado, celery, and stuffed olives.
Pour into a ring mold and refrigerate until set.
For the cheese center, cream cottage cheese with mayonnaise, horseradish, salt, and pepper.
Add chopped spring onion, celery, pepper, and drained grated cucumber.
Marinate artichoke hearts and avocado slices in Durkee's dressing.
Serve the aspic on lettuce with the cheese mixture in the center, garnished with artichoke hearts and avocado slices.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HOT SPICED PUNCH**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups orange juice
- 1 cup pineapple juice (or any canned fruit juice)
- 3 tablespoons lemon juice
- 2 tablespoons grated lemon rind
- 2 cups water
- 8-10 cloves
- 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1 stick cinnamon
- Ginger ale, wine, or bourbon (optional)
- Maraschino cherries, for garnish
- Maraschino juice (optional)
<|steps|>
Combine orange juice, pineapple juice, lemon juice, lemon rind, water, cloves, nutmeg, sugar, and cinnamon in a saucepan.
Boil for 5 minutes, then strain.
Optionally, add ginger ale, wine, or bourbon for flavor, and Maraschino juice if desired.
Serve very hot, garnished with a Maraschino cherry in each glass.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SHRIMP COCKTAIL WITH TOMATO SHERBET**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can tomatoes
- 1 stalk celery, cut into small pieces
- 1 green pepper, cut into small pieces
- 1 cucumber, unpeeled and grated (strained)
- 1 bunch spring onions, chopped very small
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Worcestershire sauce, to taste
- 1 package Philadelphia cream cheese
- 1/2 cup mayonnaise
- 2 tablespoons horseradish
- Chopped parsley (optional)
- 1 jar Roka cheese
- 1/2 cup chopped spring onions
- 1/2 cup chopped celery
- 1/2 cup chopped peppers
- Chili sauce, to taste
- 1 pound shrimp
- Parsley, for garnish
- Lemon slices, for garnish
<|steps|>
Mix tomatoes, celery, green pepper, grated cucumber, spring onions, salt, pepper, and Worcestershire sauce.
Blend cream cheese with mayonnaise and horseradish, and add to the tomato mixture. Optionally, add chopped parsley.
Freeze the mixture in a refrigerator to make tomato sherbet.
For the cocktail sauce, cream Roka cheese with mayonnaise, then add chopped spring onions, celery, peppers, and chili sauce.
Season the sauce with horseradish, Worcestershire, Tabasco, salt, and pepper.
Add shrimp to the sauce.
Fill coupette glasses with tomato sherbet, pour shrimp cocktail sauce over, and garnish with parsley and lemon slices.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHEESE MOLD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/4 cup butter
- 1/2 cup flour
- 1 cup milk
- 1 cup grated Old English cheese
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 4 eggs
- Creamed asparagus, for garnish
- Mushrooms, for garnish
- Tiny peas, for garnish
- Onions, for garnish
<|steps|>
Melt butter in a saucepan over boiling water and gradually add flour.
Add milk and cook until the mixture thickens, stirring constantly.
Add grated cheese and salt, stirring until melted, then remove from heat.
Gradually stir in well-beaten eggs.
Pour into a greased flat-bottomed pan and bake in a slow oven until golden brown and firm.
Unmold onto a platter, cover with creamed asparagus and mushrooms, and border with tiny peas and onions.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **VANILLA ICE CREAM**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 tablespoons flour
- 3/4 cup sugar
- 3 cups milk
- 3 eggs, well beaten
- 1 pint cream
- 2 teaspoons vanilla
- Dash of salt
- 1 can yellow peach halves
- Sugar, for peaches
- Whiskey or brandy, for flaming
<|steps|>
Cream eggs, sugar, and flour together.
Gradually stir in hot milk and cook over boiling water until thick and smooth, stirring constantly.
Cool the mixture, then add cream, vanilla, and salt.
Freeze in a hand freezer to make 3 pints.
Place yellow peach halves in a pan, sprinkle generously with sugar, and cook until the syrup is moderately thick.
When ready to serve, place hot peaches on a heat-proof dish, pour over hot syrup, and sprinkle with sugar.
Pour several tablespoons of whiskey or brandy over the peaches, light with a match, and serve while flaming.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MRS. WOOTEN'S JAM CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 6 eggs
- 1 1/2 cups jam
- 1 cup butter
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 teaspoon cloves
- 1/2 cup flour
- 2 cups sugar
- 1 cup fresh buttermilk
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1 teaspoon allspice
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, then add eggs and beat slowly.
Mix in spices and well-mashed jam.
Sift flour with baking soda and add alternately with buttermilk to the mixture.
Pour into 9-inch cake pans to make 4 layers.
Bake at 350°F for 25-35 minutes.
Spread with caramel icing.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ORANGE AND BERRY ICE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 oranges (grated rind)
- 2 cups berry juice
- 2 lemons (grated rind)
- 2 cups water
- Sugar, to taste
<|steps|>
Mix orange rind, berry juice, lemon rind, and water.
Sweeten to taste and freeze until set.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN MOUSSE GLACE**
<|ingredients|>
- Chicken mousse (your favorite recipe, with sufficient gelatin)
- Clear gelatin (Knox Gelatin recipe, using chicken consommé and lemon juice)
- Thin slices of raw potato, carrots, radishes, cucumber, for design
- Thin strips of spring onion tops, for stems
- Seasoned cream cheese, for design
<|steps|>
Prepare chicken mousse, ensuring enough gelatin for stiffness.
Oil the bottom and sides of a flat aluminum mold (e.g., small oblong roaster or bread pan).
Pour a thin layer of clear gelatin into the mold and partially set in the refrigerator.
Keep the mold in ice water while creating a design with sliced vegetables and cream cheese piped from a pastry tube.
Press design elements gently into the partially set gelatin and return to the refrigerator to complete setting.
Pour another thin layer of gelatin to seal the design and let it set.
Pour partially congealed chicken mousse into the mold and refrigerate until fully set.
Unmold carefully onto a serving dish and garnish with lettuce leaves and parsley.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SPINACH RING WITH GARNISHES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can chopped spinach
- 1 tablespoon butter or bacon drippings
- 1 1/2 eggs
- 2 slices bread, soaked in water
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Lemon juice, to taste
- Parslied potato balls, for garnish
- Buttered carrot spears, for garnish
- Mushroom sauce (optional)
<|steps|>
Cook spinach in butter or bacon drippings until all juice is evaporated.
Add eggs and squeezed-out bread slices to the spinach.
Season with salt, pepper, and lemon juice to taste.
Pour into a buttered ring mold and bake at 250°F for 30 minutes.
Unmold onto a serving dish.
Fill the center with parslied potato balls and arrange buttered carrot spears at the base.
Optionally, serve with mushroom sauce.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FROZEN FRUIT SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 tablespoons mayonnaise
- 1 large can fruit cocktail
- 18 marshmallows
- Few drops onion juice
- 1 pint heavy cream
- 2 packages Philadelphia cream cheese
- Red jelly roll, thinly sliced, for mold lining
- Whipped cream, for garnish
<|steps|>
Line a ring mold with thin slices of red jelly roll, forming a uniform pattern.
Melt marshmallows in the juice from the fruit cocktail.
Mix in cream cheese and whipped heavy cream.
Add mayonnaise and onion juice, ensuring not to overpower the flavor.
Spoon the mixture into the lined mold (it should be too stiff to pour) and smooth the top.
Freeze until set.
Unmold onto a serving tray, fill the center with whipped cream, and decorate the base with additional whipped cream.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ELIZABETH HENDERSON'S CHOCOLATE ICE BOX CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pound butter
- 1 pound sugar
- 12 eggs
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 4 dozen macaroons
- 1/2 cup bourbon whiskey
- 1 1/2 squares Baker's chocolate
- Lady fingers, for lining
- Whipped cream, for serving
- Chopped nuts, for garnish
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar in an electric beater for 20 minutes.
Beat egg yolks for 6 minutes, then beat egg whites until stiff but not dry.
Melt chocolate in a double boiler.
Soak macaroons in bourbon whiskey.
Add egg yolks and melted chocolate to the butter-sugar mixture.
Stir in vanilla and fold in egg whites.
Line an ice box cake pan with lady fingers.
Layer macaroons and chocolate mixture alternately until the pan is filled.
Refrigerate for 6 hours.
Serve with whipped cream and garnish with chopped nuts.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **RUM PUDDING**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 egg whites
- 1 cup whipping cream
- 2 tablespoons Knox gelatin
- 3 egg yolks
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1/4 cup rum
<|steps|>
Soak gelatin in 1/2 cup cool water in the top of a double boiler, then dissolve over hot water.
Beat egg yolks until very light, then slowly beat in sugar using an electric beater.
Slowly add melted hot gelatin to the egg yolk mixture, then add rum drop by drop while beating.
Set aside to cool and begin setting.
Beat egg whites until very stiff and dry.
When the rum mixture begins to congeal, fold in the egg whites and whipped cream.
Pour into a mold and refrigerate until set.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **RUBY'S CHOCOLATE ICE BOX ICE CREAM**
<|ingredients|>
- 3/4 pint heavy cream
- Chopped nuts, as needed
- 1 cake dot chocolate
- 3 eggs
- 1 cup confectioners' sugar
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
<|steps|>
Melt chocolate in a double boiler.
Add beaten egg yolks and 1/2 cup confectioners' sugar to the chocolate.
Whip cream with 1/2 cup confectioners' sugar, then add stiffly beaten egg whites and vanilla.
Line the bottom of an ice tray with finely chopped nuts.
Layer cooled chocolate mixture, whipped cream, and another layer of chocolate.
Top with finely chopped nuts.
Freeze until set.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FROSTED FRUIT JUICE**
<|ingredients|>
- Mixture of desired fruit juices
- Grapefruit juice
- Lemon juice, for frosting
- Sugar, for frosting
- Cherries, for garnish
- Mint, for garnish
<|steps|>
Freeze the fruit juice mixture to a frappe stage.
Dip the rims of tall, thin glasses or ginger ale glasses in lemon juice, then in sugar, ensuring sugar doesn't run down the sides.
Fill glasses with the fruit juice frappe.
Pour grapefruit juice over the frappe.
Garnish with a cherry and mint.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **EGG CHOPS**
<|ingredients|>
- Dash of nutmeg
- 1 tablespoon chopped parsley
- 3 tablespoons chopped canned pimento
- 1 tablespoon chopped onion
- 1/2 teaspoon celery salt
- 6 hard-cooked eggs, chopped
- 1/2 cup butter
- 3 tablespoons enriched flour
- 1 cup milk
- 2 teaspoons salt
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- Flour, for coating
- 1 slightly beaten egg mixed with 2 tablespoons water
- Cracker crumbs or crushed corn flakes, for coating
- Fat, for frying
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 1 cup milk
- 1 teaspoon pepper
- 1/2 cup chopped mushroom stems
- 1 tablespoon flour
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon Lea & Perrins Worcestershire sauce
<|steps|>
Make a thick white sauce with butter, flour, milk, salt, paprika, nutmeg, and celery salt.
Add chopped eggs, parsley, pimento, and onion, mixing thoroughly.
Spread the mixture 1 inch thick in a greased shallow pan and chill thoroughly.
Shape into chop forms.
Dip each chop in flour, then in the egg-water mixture, and roll in cracker crumbs or crushed corn flakes.
Fry in shallow fat at 375°F for 5-7 minutes.
Drain on absorbent paper. Serves 6-8.
**MUSHROOM SAUCE**
Combine butter, milk, pepper, mushroom stems, flour, salt, and Worcestershire sauce in a saucepan.
Cook for 5 minutes or until thickened.
Serve with egg chops.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ASPARAGUS CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 large can asparagus tips
- 2 cups cracker crumbs
- 1/2 cup butter
- 1/2 pound grated cheese
- 1/2 cup almonds or pecan meats
- 1 can mushroom soup
- Whole blanched almonds, for garnish
<|steps|>
Grate cheese and mix well with cracker crumbs.
Combine liquid from asparagus with mushroom soup.
In a casserole dish, layer cracker crumbs and cheese, asparagus, nuts, and mushroom soup mixture.
Repeat layers until all ingredients are used, ending with a layer of cracker crumbs and cheese.
Decorate the top with whole blanched almonds.
Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes.
Optionally, prepare the day before and bake when ready to serve.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BING CHERRY SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 box cherry (or any red) gelatin
- 1 large bottle stuffed Spanish olives
- 1 large can Bing (or black) cherries
- 1/2 tablespoon sherry or bourbon
- Juice of 1 lemon
- Chopped almonds or pecans, for garnish
- Homemade mayonnaise, for serving
<|steps|>
Dissolve gelatin in 1 cup hot cherry juice.
Cool with 1/2 cup cherry juice mixed with lemon juice and sherry or bourbon.
Pour into individual salad molds and chill until set.
Serve with homemade mayonnaise and garnish with chopped almonds or pecans.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **AVOCADO STUFFED CELERY**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup mashed avocado
- 2 tablespoons grated horseradish
- 1/2 tablespoon Tabasco sauce
- Salt, to taste
<|steps|>
Mix mashed avocado, horseradish, Tabasco, and salt.
Fill celery stalks with the mixture.
Chill before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ORANGE MUFFINS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 1/2 cups cake flour
- 1/3 cup sugar
- 1/4 cup butter
- 1 egg
- Grated rind of 1 orange
- 2 teaspoons baking powder
- 1/4 cup orange juice
- 1/4 cup undiluted evaporated milk
- 1 cup orange juice (for glaze)
- 1 tablespoon butter (for glaze)
- 1 teaspoon lemon juice (for glaze)
- Grated rind of 1 orange (for glaze)
- 3/4 box confectioners' sugar (for glaze)
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, then add well-beaten egg, orange juice, evaporated milk, and grated orange rind.
Sift flour and baking powder together and add to the wet mixture.
Optionally, refrigerate the batter for several hours.
Pour into small greased muffin tins and bake at 375°F for 20 minutes.
For the glaze, cook orange juice, butter, lemon juice, and orange rind in a double boiler until butter melts.
Add confectioners' sugar, spread on baked muffins, and return to the oven briefly to set the glaze.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BERTHA'S SPICED CHOCOLATE CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 3/4 cup butter
- 3/4 cup milk
- 3/4 teaspoon cloves
- 1 3/4 cups sugar
- 2 tablespoons cocoa
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1 1/2 teaspoons cinnamon
- 2 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
- 4 eggs
- 2 cups cake flour (sifted before measuring)
- Caramel filling (recommended)
<|steps|>
Cream butter, add sugar, and beat until light and fluffy.
Add whole eggs, beating well after each addition.
Sift flour, baking powder, cocoa, cinnamon, and cloves together.
Add vanilla to milk.
Alternately add the flour mixture and milk to the butter mixture, beating until smooth.
Pour into two greased and floured 9-inch layer cake pans.
Bake at 375°F for 25-35 minutes.
Use caramel filling or your favorite filling.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BRULA ICE CREAM**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 eggs
- 2 quarts sweet milk
- 3/4 pound butter
- 3/4 cup sugar
- 1 cup chopped pecans
- 1 pint cream
<|steps|>
Scald milk and add beaten eggs.
Cook over low heat until it reaches custard consistency.
Melt sugar and butter in a skillet until browned.
Add the milk and egg mixture to the skillet, then stir in pecans.
Mix well and freeze.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HOT MULLED CIDER**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 quart apple juice or cider
- 1/2 teaspoon cloves
- 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1 cup orange juice
- 2/3 cup lemon juice
- 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
- Brown sugar, to taste
<|steps|>
Heat apple juice or cider without boiling, and add spices tied in a thin cloth bag.
Remove from heat and let steep until cold.
Remove spices, add orange juice, lemon juice, nutmeg, and brown sugar to taste.
Reheat and serve hot.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TOMATO ASPIC - PRESSED CHICKEN RING MOLD**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 tablespoons gelatin
- 1/2 cup cold water
- 2 small No. 2 cans tomato juice
- Garlic salt or garlic vinegar, to taste
- Lemon juice, to taste
- Onion salt, to taste
- Celery salt, to taste
- Tabasco sauce, to taste
- Worcestershire sauce, to taste
- Brown sugar, to taste
- Paprika, to taste
- 2 cups cubed cooked chicken
- 1 cup sliced hard-cooked eggs
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 3/4 cup sliced olives
- 2 tablespoons unflavored gelatin
- 1 cup chopped celery
- Avocado dressing, for serving
- Lettuce, for serving
<|steps|>
Soak gelatin in cold water, then dissolve in heated (not boiled) tomato juice.
Season with garlic salt, lemon juice, onion salt, celery salt, Tabasco, Worcestershire, brown sugar, and paprika to taste.
Pour into a ring mold rinsed with cold water or greased with Wesson oil.
Refrigerate until firm.
For the pressed chicken, dissolve 2 tablespoons gelatin in 1/2 cup cold water, then add to 2 cups boiling chicken cooking liquid.
Season and chill until syrupy.
Mix with cubed chicken, sliced eggs, lemon juice, olives, and celery.
When the mixture begins to set, pour over the set tomato aspic in the ring mold.
Refrigerate until fully set.
Serve on lettuce with avocado dressing.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MUSHROOM RICE CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup rice
- 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
- 1 can creamed mushroom soup
- 1 small can mushroom stems and pieces
- Broken pecans or almonds
- 1/2 cup butter
- 12 oranges
- 1 can pineapple chunks
- 1 fresh coconut, grated
- 1 fresh grapefruit
- Juice of 1 lemon
- Sugar, to taste
- Red cherries or strawberries, for garnish
<|steps|>
Boil rice, rinse, and season with nutmeg.
In a well-greased casserole, layer rice, mushroom soup, broken nuts, and mushrooms.
Repeat layers, ending with nuts on top.
Melt butter and pour over the casserole.
Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes or until heated through.
Optionally, prepare the day before and add melted butter just before baking.
**AMBROSIA**
Peel and cut oranges into chunks.
Add pineapple chunks (with juice), grapefruit segments, lemon juice, and grated coconut.
Sweeten to taste.
Refrigerate overnight to season thoroughly.
Garnish with red cherries or strawberries before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LIME FRAPPE WITH MELON BALLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pint can orange juice
- Cantaloupe balls
- Lime or wintergreen flavoring
- Green food coloring
- White rum
- Ginger ale
<|steps|>
Flavor orange juice with lime or wintergreen and color green.
Freeze to a mush, then whip in an electric mixer until smooth.
Return to the freezer until ready to serve.
Place in champagne saucer glasses, pour about 1 teaspoon white rum over the ice, and fill with ginger ale.
Place cantaloupe balls on a cocktail stick and lay across the top of each glass.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CREOLE EGG PLANT**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 eggplant
- 2 chopped green peppers
- 1 can mushrooms
- 2 eggs
- Dash of nutmeg
- 1/4 pound cheese
- 2 chopped onions
- 1 can tomatoes
- 1 can tomato puree
- 1/2 pint thick gravy
- 3 tablespoons frying fat
- 2 cups crumbled toast
<|steps|>
Cut eggplant in half lengthwise, scoop out the center, and boil until tender.
Fry onions and green peppers in frying fat without browning.
Add tomato puree, tomatoes, gravy, mushrooms, eggs, nutmeg, and crumbled toast.
Mix in the boiled eggplant center and season to taste.
Fill eggplant shells with the mixture, top with grated cheese.
Bake until the cheese is golden brown.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **GLAZED BAKED HAM**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 whole ham
- Whole cloves (optional)
- Brown sugar, for glaze
- Pineapple juice, for glaze
- Water, for glaze
<|steps|>
Place ham in a roaster with 1/2 inch water and bake at 325°F for 20 minutes per pound.
Remove from oven, peel off the skin, and score the fat.
Mix brown sugar with pineapple juice to form a thick paste and spread over the ham.
Insert whole cloves if desired.
Return to the oven and baste until golden brown.
During the last 10 minutes, increase heat to 450°F to form a crust.
Let cool in its own juices. Serve hot or cold.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LOUISE'S MEAT BALLS AND ARTICHOKES**
<|ingredients|>
- 3/4 pound ground beef
- 1/4 pound ground pork
- 3 tablespoons minced parsley
- 1 small onion, chopped fine
- 3 slices white bread
- 1/2 cup hot milk
- 1 egg, beaten
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Fat, for frying
- 2 cups tomato juice (for sauce)
- 1 tablespoon Kitchen Bouquet (for sauce)
- Liquid from 1 can artichokes (for sauce)
- Artichoke hearts
<|steps|>
Remove crusts from bread and soak in hot milk.
Combine ground beef, ground pork, parsley, onion, soaked bread, beaten egg, salt, and pepper.
Form into small balls and fry lightly in fat until browned.
For the sauce, cook tomato juice, Kitchen Bouquet, and artichoke liquid for a few minutes.
Add browned meatballs and simmer for 20 minutes.
Add artichoke hearts just before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MARY AGNES'S CHEESE PUDDING**
<|ingredients|>
- 8 slices white bread
- 2 cups grated cheese
- 4 eggs
- 1/3 cup butter
- 3 cups milk
- 1 1/3 teaspoons salt
- 1/3 teaspoon dry mustard
<|steps|>
Spread bread slices with butter and cut each into 4 pieces.
In a baking dish, alternate layers of cheese and bread, ending with cheese on top.
Combine milk, slightly beaten eggs, salt, and dry mustard.
Pour the mixture over the cheese and bread.
Bake at 325°F for approximately 40 minutes. Serves 8.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ARAB SEWALL'S LOBSTER THERMIDOR**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 boiled lobster
- 3 mushrooms, sliced
- 5 tablespoons butter
- Dash of paprika
- 1/8 teaspoon mustard
- 1 tablespoon minced parsley
- 1/2 cup sherry
- 2 tablespoons flour
- 1 cup cream
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 2 tablespoons grated Parmesan cheese
<|steps|>
Cut lobster in half, remove meat, and break into small pieces.
Cook mushrooms in 3 tablespoons butter, then add paprika, mustard, parsley, and sherry. Heat to boiling.
Melt remaining butter, blend in flour, add cream, and cook until thickened, stirring constantly.
Season with salt, then add the mushroom mixture and lobster meat.
Fill lobster shells with the mixture and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
Bake at 425°F for 15-20 minutes. Serves 2.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **AD'S MACARONI LOAF**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup macaroni
- 1 cup milk
- 1 tablespoon chopped pimento
- 1 tablespoon chopped green pepper
- 3 eggs
- 1 cup grated cheese
- 2 cups bread crumbs
- 3 tablespoons melted butter
- 1 tablespoon chopped parsley
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Campbell's tomato soup, for sauce
<|steps|>
Beat egg whites until stiff, then add yolks and beat.
Boil macaroni in salted water and drain.
Scald milk, add bread crumbs, butter, cheese, pimento, green pepper, parsley, salt, pepper, and eggs.
Pour into a pan lined with well-greased paper.
Set in a pan of hot water and bake at 325°F for about 1 hour.
Serve with tomato sauce made by adding water to Campbell's tomato soup.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FROSTED COFFEE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup iced coffee
- 1/2 pint vanilla ice cream
- 1 cup milk
<|steps|>
Combine iced coffee, vanilla ice cream, and milk in a cocktail shaker.
Shake thoroughly and serve in tall glasses.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HITCHING POST SALAD DRESSING**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup Wesson oil
- 1 cup catsup
- 1 cup grated hard-boiled eggs (3 eggs)
- 1 cup chopped parsley
- 1 cup small pickled white onions
- 1 cup broken pecan meats
- 1 cup mayonnaise
- 1 cup chili sauce
- 1 teaspoon A.1. sauce
- 1/2 clove garlic, finely cut
- 1 teaspoon anchovy paste
- 1 bottle capers, drained
- 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
- 3 dashes hot sauce
- 2 garlic cloves, chopped
- 1 cup mayonnaise
- 1/2 cup tomato catsup
- 1 teaspoon prepared mustard
- 1 cup Wesson oil
- 2 tablespoons cold water
- 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
- 1 teaspoon black pepper
- 1 teaspoon Tabasco sauce
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1 onion, grated
- 1 tablespoon horseradish
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients and let stand for 24 hours.
Serve on grapefruit or head lettuce.
**ROSE'S PICKWICK SHRIMP SAUCE**
Drain capers and finely cut garlic.
Mix all ingredients together and chill.
**ROY ROY'S SAUCE**
Combine all ingredients in a quart jar.
Shake well to mix thoroughly.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRIENDSHIP SALAD DRESSING**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 tablespoons sugar
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon white pepper
- 2 tablespoons Lea & Perrins Worcestershire sauce
- 1 teaspoon salt
- Sprinkle of red pepper
- 1 teaspoon mixed mustard
- Olive oil or Wesson oil
- Vinegar, to taste
- 1 cup crushed fresh or frozen strawberries
- 1/2 cup butter
- 3 cups confectioners' sugar
<|steps|>
Mix sugar, paprika, white pepper, Worcestershire sauce, salt, red pepper, and mustard.
Add olive oil or Wesson oil 1 tablespoon at a time, beating constantly, until very thick.
Add a little vinegar to flavor.
**PURVIS'S STRAWBERRY HARD SAUCE**
Cream butter and confectioners' sugar together.
Add crushed strawberries.
Serve on top of waffles.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BEA BUSTER'S FROZEN SUMMER FRUIT MAYONNAISE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 teaspoon gelatin
- 1 cup mayonnaise
- 1 cup diced canned pineapple
- 3/4 cup halved stoned sweet cherries
- 3/4 cup shredded plum
- 3/4 cup chopped pecans
- Lettuce hearts, for serving
- Mint sprigs, for garnish
<|steps|>
Soften gelatin in fruit juice for 5 minutes, then dissolve over steam.
Add dissolved gelatin to mayonnaise.
Stir in pineapple, cherries, plums, and pecans.
Transfer to an ice tray and pack in equal parts ice and salt, chilling for 2 hours, or freeze in a refrigerator.
Serve on lettuce hearts, garnished with mint sprigs.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FLOSSIE'S MARSHMALLOW SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 tablespoon sugar
- 1 tablespoon flour
- 2 1/2 tablespoons vinegar
- 1 teaspoon mustard
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon butter
- 2 egg yolks
- 1 can diced pineapple
- 1 can seeded white cherries
- 2 boxes marshmallows, cut
- Whipped cream
<|steps|>
In a double boiler, cook sugar, flour, vinegar, mustard, salt, butter, and egg yolks until thick.
Thin the mixture with half-cut or plain cream.
Add pineapple, cherries, and marshmallows.
Let stand for several hours.
Fold in whipped cream before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SUE'S PARADISE SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 boxes marshmallows
- 1 pint whipped cream
- 1/2 teaspoon mustard
- 1 tablespoon vinegar
- 1 large can pineapple
- 3 egg yolks
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 tablespoon sugar
- 1 tablespoon flour
<|steps|>
Mix egg yolks, mustard, vinegar, salt, sugar, and flour.
Cook in a double boiler until thick, then cool slightly.
Thin with whipped cream.
Chop marshmallows and pineapple, then add to the mixture.
Refrigerate to cool (do not freeze).
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRENCH DRESSING**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 cup Wesson oil
- 3 tablespoons brown sugar
- 1/2 cup catsup
- 1 grated onion
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup white vinegar
- Juice of 1 lemon
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients together.
Store in the refrigerator until ready to use.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BYRD'S RHUBARB GLACE**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 cups uncooked rhubarb, cut into 1-inch pieces
- 1 1/2 cups brown sugar
- 1/2 cup butter or oleo
- 2 tablespoons bacon drippings
- 1 pint commercial mayonnaise
- 4 tablespoons Bahamian mustard
- 2 large cloves garlic, grated
- 1 tablespoon Lea & Perrins Worcestershire sauce
- 1/2 cup chopped spring onion tops
- 2 tablespoons chives, drained
- 1/2 cup Hunt's tomato paste
<|steps|>
Heat bacon drippings in a heavy skillet, add rhubarb, cover, and stew for a few minutes.
Add brown sugar and butter, then simmer until the mixture reaches a preserve consistency.
Stir occasionally to prevent scorching.
Serve hot for breakfast with ham, bacon, or sausage and hot biscuits. Apples may be substituted for rhubarb.
**LOUIEWOOD SAUCE**
Remove any tissue from grated garlic and mix with tomato paste.
Add Bahamian mustard and mix well.
Combine with mayonnaise, then add onion tops and chives.
Let ripen for a few hours before serving.
Serve with fried or boiled shrimp.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SARAH TURNER'S SAN ANTONIO GUACAMOLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 package Philadelphia cream cheese
- 2 tablespoons cream
- 1/2 triangle Roquefort cheese
- 1 avocado
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 3 tiny scallions, minced
- Dash of Tabasco sauce
- 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
- Mayonnaise, as needed
<|steps|>
Soften cream cheese with cream, then mash Roquefort cheese.
Combine both cheeses with mayonnaise and blend until smooth.
Peel and mash avocado, then add garlic, scallions, Tabasco, Worcestershire, salt, and pepper.
Blend well, cover, and refrigerate until ready to use.
Stir before serving, as the top may darken. Serves 6-8.
Serve with potato chips.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HORSERADISH ROLLS**
<|ingredients|>
- Cream cheese
- Grated horseradish
- Chopped beef slices (2 inches in diameter)
<|steps|>
Mash cream cheese with a fork and stir in grated horseradish until seasoned.
Spread the mixture on chopped beef slices and roll up.
Place face down on a plate and chill.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LOBSTER ROUNDS**
<|ingredients|>
- Sandwich bread
- Freshly boiled lobster meat (1 can)
- Thick white sauce
- 1 egg yolk, beaten
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Dry sherry, to taste
- Grated cheese
<|steps|>
Cut sandwich bread into small circles (1 1/4 inches in diameter).
Shred lobster meat and mix with enough thick white sauce to hold together.
Add beaten egg yolk and season with salt, pepper, and dry sherry.
Pile the lobster mixture on the bread rounds and dust with grated cheese.
Toast in a moderate oven or broil until the cheese is browned.
Optionally, freeze before toasting.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHOPPED EGGS AND GREEN PEPPER**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 hard-cooked eggs, finely chopped
- 2 tablespoons minced green peppers
- 1 tablespoon horseradish
- Mayonnaise, as needed
- 1 tablespoon Durkee's dressing
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
<|steps|>
Mix chopped eggs, green peppers, horseradish, mayonnaise, and Durkee's dressing.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Spread on bread.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHEESE SPREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pound cottage cheese
- 2 squares Philadelphia cream cheese
- 3 avocados, mashed to a paste
- Juice of 1 lemon
- 1 triangle Roquefort cheese
- Mayonnaise, as needed
- Paprika, to taste
- Tabasco sauce, to taste
- Worcestershire sauce, to taste
- Parsley, to taste
- Onion juice, to taste
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Chopped nuts (optional)
<|steps|>
Cream cottage cheese and Philadelphia cream cheese in a garlic-rubbed bowl.
Soften with seasoned mayonnaise (paprika, Tabasco, Worcestershire, parsley, onion juice, salt, pepper).
Beat lemon juice into avocado paste, then add to the cheese mixture.
Optionally, add chopped nuts.
Let the mixture set overnight.
Serve as a dip or on Melba toast.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CRISP CHEESE BISCUITS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 pound grated mild cheese
- 1/2 pound butter or oleo
- 1/2 cup flour
- Pecan halves
<|steps|>
Mix cheese, butter, and flour, then roll out to desired thinness.
Cut into small rings with a cutter.
Fold each ring over a pecan half and place in the center.
Bake at 400°F for 10-15 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **VIRGINIA'S CHEESE BISCUITS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 jar Old English cheese
- 1 cup flour
- 1/4 cup butter
- Red pepper, to taste
<|steps|>
Let cheese and butter come to room temperature, then mix well.
Shape into marble-sized balls.
Place on a cookie sheet 1-2 inches apart and chill for several hours.
Bake at 450°F for 10-12 minutes and serve immediately.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **OLIVE AND BACON SQUARE**
<|ingredients|>
- Finely chopped stuffed olives
- Finely chopped hard-boiled eggs
- Cream cheese, as needed
- Sliced bread (1 1/2-inch squares)
- Bacon squares
<|steps|>
Blend chopped olives and eggs with enough cream cheese to hold together.
Spread thinly on bread squares.
Cover each with a bacon square.
Broil until bacon is crisp and bread is toasted.
Optionally, freeze before baking, following the same layering method as anchovy tricorns.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TOASTED ROLLS**
<|ingredients|>
- Fresh bread slices
- Finely ground cooked chicken
- Minced broiled mushrooms
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Lemon juice, to taste
- Onion, to taste
- Thickened chicken broth
<|steps|>
Trim edges from fresh bread slices.
Mix ground chicken, mushrooms, salt, pepper, lemon juice, and a hint of onion with enough thickened chicken broth to make a spread.
Spread the mixture on bread slices.
Roll each slice and secure with a toothpick if needed.
Optionally, store in a home freezer.
Toast in the oven until golden brown.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **DUTCH SANDWICH**
<|ingredients|>
- Rye bread rounds
- 1 small dill pickle, finely chopped
- 2 hard-boiled eggs, finely chopped
- 1 box imported sardines
- Mayonnaise, as needed
<|steps|>
Cut crusts off rye bread rounds.
Mash sardines and mix with chopped pickle, eggs, and enough mayonnaise to make a spreadable consistency.
Season to taste and spread on bread rounds.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **POTTED HAM ROLL**
<|ingredients|>
- Ground boiled ham or canned potted ham
- Commercial mayonnaise (if using ground ham)
- Pie crust dough
- Dash of Tabasco sauce
- 1 teaspoon celery seed
<|steps|>
Season ham to taste, blending ground ham with mayonnaise if needed.
Prepare pie crust dough with Tabasco and celery seed.
Divide dough into two parts and roll out each into a thin, long oblong shape.
Spread with ham filling and roll up like a cinnamon roll.
Bake until golden.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TEA TOAST STRIPS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 tablespoons anchovy paste, sardine paste, or deviled ham
- 2 tablespoons horseradish butter
- 1/2 teaspoon lemon juice
- 1/2 teaspoon onion
- 1/2 teaspoon chopped parsley
- Buttered toasted bread strips
- 1 package Roquefort cheese
- 1/2 cup butter
- 1 cup chopped nuts
- Toasted bread
<|steps|>
Cream together paste, horseradish butter, lemon juice, onion, and parsley.
Spread on buttered toasted bread strips.
**CANAPÉ**
Mix Roquefort cheese, butter, and chopped nuts.
Spread on toasted bread and serve.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TOASTED CHEESE FINGERS**
<|ingredients|>
- Small jar pimento olives, finely chopped
- Thinly sliced bread
- Cream, as needed
- 1 package Philadelphia cream cheese
- Roka cheese, to taste
<|steps|>
Work cream cheese with a little cream to a smooth paste.
Add Roka cheese to taste and finely chopped olives.
Spread on bread slices, roll, and toast under a broiler.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRIENDSHIP CHEESE SANDWICHES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pound cottage cheese
- 1 cup mayonnaise
- 1 cucumber, grated (unpeeled)
- 1 small onion
- 1/2 cup finely minced celery
- 1/2 cup finely minced green peppers
- Salt, to taste
- Durkee's horseradish mayonnaise, to taste
- Tuna spread, for filling
- Stuffed olives or parsley, for garnish
- Chopped nuts (optional)
<|steps|>
Cream cottage cheese and mayonnaise using an electric mixer.
Add Durkee's horseradish mayonnaise and salt to taste.
Blend in celery, green peppers, drained grated cucumber, and onion.
Cut bread into small rounds.
Spread one round with mayonnaise and tuna spread, then top with another round.
Ice the top and sides with the cheese mixture.
Decorate with stuffed olives, parsley, or chopped nuts.
Refrigerate on a tray until ready to serve. Can be made several hours in advance.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRENCH ONION SOUP**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 medium onions
- 1 tablespoon butter
- 1 quart consommé
- 1/2 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Rounds of toast
- Grated Parmesan cheese
- 1 clove garlic (optional)
<|steps|>
Slice onions thinly and brown in butter.
Add consommé, Worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper, and simmer until onions are tender.
Optionally, rub the casserole or toast with a cut clove of garlic.
Pour soup into an earthen casserole or individual casseroles.
Arrange toast rounds at the bottom, pour soup over, and sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese.
Place under a broiler until the cheese melts and browns. Serves 4.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ASPARAGUS VINAIGRETTE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can asparagus spears
- 1 cup olive oil
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon sugar
- 1 cucumber pickle
- Shredded lettuce
- 1 small onion
- 1/3 cup tarragon vinegar
- Pinch of cayenne pepper
- 1/4 teaspoon cracked black pepper
- 2 pimentos
- 1 green pepper
- Few sprigs parsley
<|steps|>
Drain and chill asparagus spears thoroughly.
Mix dry ingredients (paprika, salt, sugar, cayenne, black pepper), then add olive oil and tarragon vinegar, beating well.
Pour the vinaigrette over the asparagus and marinate in the refrigerator for 1 hour.
Arrange shredded lettuce in a salad bowl, place asparagus on top, and pour the marinade over.
Garnish with sliced cucumber pickle, onion, pimentos, green pepper, and parsley.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ROBERTA'S CONSOMMÉ RICE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/4 cup butter
- 1 cup finely chopped onions
- 1 cup uncooked rice
- 2 cans consommé
<|steps|>
Wash and drain rice.
Melt butter in a skillet, add onions, and cook until slightly browned.
Add rice and cook over medium heat until browned, stirring to prevent burning.
Add consommé and transfer to an earthen casserole.
Cover tightly and bake at 350°F for 1 hour. Serves 10.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **RHODA'S EGG PLANT**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 eggplant
- 3 tablespoons salt
- 3 tablespoons butter
- 3 tablespoons flour
- 1/2 cup milk
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon celery salt
- 1/2 teaspoon onion salt
- 1/2 cup grated cheese
- 1/2 cup bread crumbs
<|steps|>
Cut off the rind and slice eggplant crosswise into 1/2-inch slices.
Sprinkle salt between slices and let stand for 1 hour.
Rinse in cold water, cut into dices, and boil in boiling water for 5 minutes. Drain.
Melt butter, blend in flour and milk, and cook until the cream sauce thickens, stirring constantly.
Add paprika, celery salt, onion salt, and cheese, mixing until the cheese melts.
Add eggplant to the sauce.
Pour into a shallow baking dish and sprinkle with bread crumbs mixed with melted butter.
Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MRS. MORGAN'S MAYONNAISE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 egg
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- Juice of 1 lemon
- 1 pint Wesson oil
<|steps|>
Break egg into a mixing bowl, add salt and lemon juice, and beat well.
Slowly add Wesson oil, beating continuously until thick.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MRS. MOSBY'S EGG PLANT SOUFFLÉ**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 medium eggplant
- 2 teaspoons butter
- 2 teaspoons flour
- 1 cup milk
- 1 cup grated cheese
- Broiled bacon, for garnish
- 3/4 cup soft bread crumbs
- 2 teaspoons grated onion
- 1 teaspoon tomato catsup
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Dash of cayenne
- 2 eggs
<|steps|>
Peel eggplant and cook in salted water until tender. Drain and mash thoroughly.
Make a cream sauce with butter, flour, and milk.
When thickened, add mashed eggplant, onion, bread crumbs, catsup, beaten egg yolks, salt, pepper, and cayenne.
Fold in stiffly beaten egg whites.
Pour into a buttered casserole and bake at 375°F for 45 minutes.
Garnish with broiled bacon before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **NANNIE'S CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cans English peas
- 1 can tomatoes
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- 1/2 green pepper, chopped
- 1/2 pound New York cheese
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- 2 slices bread
- 1 egg
- Milk, as needed
<|steps|>
Soak bread in milk, then drain off excess milk.
Mix peas, tomatoes, onion, green pepper, cheese, egg, soaked bread, salt, and pepper.
Pour into a buttered casserole.
Bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MRS. EASON'S ICED PICKLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 quart large sour cucumber or dill pickles
- 3 garlic buttons
- Sugar, as needed
<|steps|>
Slice pickles and garlic buttons thinly and place in a large bowl.
Pack pickles in sugar, covering with 1/2 inch of sugar.
Cover and let stand until the sugar melts, creating a crisp pickle.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MRS. E. L. MOTHERSHED'S NUT & DATE CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 pound butter
- 2 cups sugar
- 4 eggs, separated
- 3 cups flour
- 1 package dates
- 1 quart pecans
- 1 teaspoon cloves
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1 teaspoon allspice
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1 cup water
- 1 package figs or 1/2 pound cherries
<|steps|>
Sift flour, cloves, cinnamon, allspice, and baking powder together.
Cream sugar and butter, then add egg yolks and beat slowly.
Add water, then mix in dates, pecans, figs or cherries, and the dry ingredients.
Fold in stiffly beaten egg whites.
Pour into a loaf pan and bake at 300-350°F until done.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MRS. WHEELER'S STRAWBERRY SHORTCAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- Pie pastry dough
- 1/2 quart strawberries
- Sugar, to taste
- Butter, for brushing
- Whipped cream
- Whole strawberries, for garnish
<|steps|>
Roll pie pastry dough very thin and make 3 layers to fit a 6-inch pie plate.
Bake in a hot oven until browned.
Butter each layer while hot.
Crush strawberries, sweeten to taste, and fill between layers.
Top with whipped cream and garnish with whole strawberries.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MRS. SLATER'S MOLASSES PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pint molasses
- 3 eggs
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1 tablespoon butter
- 1 unbaked pie shell
<|steps|>
Cook butter and molasses for 5 minutes.
Cream eggs and sugar, then pour in molasses, stirring constantly.
Pour into an unbaked pie shell.
Bake in a slow oven until firm.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MRS. E. M. FANT'S AMERICAN PLUM PUDDING**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pound shortening
- 1 pound currants
- 1 pound light bread crumbs (ground)
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 cup peach preserves
- 1 cup buttermilk
- 1/2 cup wine or whiskey
- 1/2 cup chopped pecans
- 1 pound raisins
- 1 pound sugar
- 4 eggs
- 1 tablespoon cloves
- 1 tablespoon cinnamon
- 1 teaspoon nutmeg
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup citron, cut small
- 1/2 cup butter (for hard sauce)
- 1 cup confectioners' sugar (or 3/4 cup granulated sugar, for hard sauce)
- Nutmeg or 2/3 teaspoon vanilla and 1/3 teaspoon lemon extract (for hard sauce)
- Cream, as needed (for hard sauce)
<|steps|>
Mix shortening, currants, bread crumbs, baking soda, peach preserves, buttermilk, wine or whiskey, pecans, raisins, sugar, eggs, cloves, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt, and citron.
Thin with coffee or fruit juice if too thick.
Fill 1-pound coffee cans 3/4 full, cover, and steam for about 2 hours.
Cool in cans, then remove and wrap in paper. Optionally, return to cans and cover.
For hard sauce, cream butter and beat in confectioners' or granulated sugar.
Flavor with nutmeg or vanilla and lemon extract, adding cream to thin if desired.
Serve pudding with hard sauce. Makes 6 puddings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ISABELLE'S OLD ENGLISH PLUM PUDDING**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 pound seeded raisins
- 1/2 pound candied orange peel
- 1/2 pound candied citron peel
- 1/4 pound finely chopped beef suet
- 4 cups well-dried bread crumbs
- 1 cup fruit juice (cider, berry, or orange)
- 1/2 teaspoon cloves
- 1/2 pound figs
- 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/2 teaspoon ginger
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 6 eggs
- 1/2 cup flour
- Brandy, sherry, or rum, for flavoring
- 1/2 teaspoon mace
- 1/2 cup brown sugar
- 1/2 pound sultana raisins
- 1/2 pound candied lemon peel
<|steps|>
Mix all fruit together, then add suet and bread crumbs sprinkled with flour, salt, and spices.
Moisten with fruit juice mixed with brown sugar, then add flavoring and eggs.
Work thoroughly and let stand overnight to ripen.
Turn into molds or a pudding bowl and steam for 6 hours (less for smaller molds).
Serve, optionally with flaming snap-dragons (large raisins with brandy poured over, lit, and served ablaze).
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MRS. GRAHAM'S FRUIT ROLL**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 1/2 cups apples or other fruit
- 1 1/4 cups sugar
- 1/2 pound butter
- 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
- 1 tablespoon fat
- Biscuit dough
<|steps|>
Add 1 tablespoon fat to biscuit dough and roll thin to 8 inches in diameter.
Spread with 3/4 of the butter and 1 cup sugar.
Slice apples thinly and spread 1 1/2 cups on one edge of the dough.
Fold ends over apples and roll up.
Place in a baking dish and cut through the top crust every 2 inches.
Combine remaining sugar, butter, and apples with 1 cup warm water, pour into the pan, and bake at 350°F for about 30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **NATALIE'S CHOCOLATE ICE BOX CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 1/2 dozen lady fingers
- 1 cup unsalted butter
- 1 cup confectioners' sugar
- 3 squares (2 oz each) Baker's chocolate
- 1/2 cup granulated sugar
- 1/2 cup water
- 4 eggs, separated
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- Pinch of salt
- Whipped cream, for decoration
- Chopped nuts, for garnish
- Red cherries, for garnish
<|steps|>
In a double boiler, melt chocolate, granulated sugar, and water until smooth.
Gradually add well-beaten egg yolks and cook until thick, stirring constantly.
Cool, then cream butter and confectioners' sugar, and add the chocolate mixture.
Fold in stiffly beaten egg whites, vanilla, and a pinch of salt.
Line the bottom and sides of a pan with lady fingers.
Pour in the chocolate mixture and refrigerate for 24 hours.
Decorate with whipped cream, chopped nuts, and red cherries before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MILDRED SLATER'S CHOCOLATE DIVINITY CANDY**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 1/3 cups sugar
- 1/2 cup water
- 2/3 cup white Karo syrup
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 6 oz Baker's bittersweet chocolate, melted
- 2 egg whites
- 1 cup chopped nuts
- Pinch of salt
<|steps|>
Mix sugar, water, and Karo syrup in a saucepan.
Stir until sugar dissolves, cover, and cook to the hard ball stage.
Pour slowly over well-beaten egg whites, beating constantly.
When cool and ready to drop, add melted chocolate, nuts, vanilla, and a pinch of salt.
Drop into desired shapes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BERNIE'S BUTTERMILK CARAMEL CANDY**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups sugar
- 1 cup buttermilk
- 1/2 cup butter
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1 cup chopped pecans
<|steps|>
Combine sugar, buttermilk, butter, and baking soda in a saucepan.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture reaches the soft ball stage (235°F).
Remove from heat and stir in vanilla and pecans.
Beat until thick and creamy.
Pour into a buttered pan and let cool.
Cut into squares when set.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FROZEN BANANA SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can crushed pineapple
- 1 cup sugar
- 1/2 cup lemon juice
- 4 bananas, mashed
- 1 pint heavy cream, whipped
- 1/2 cup chopped nuts
- Lettuce, for serving
<|steps|>
Mix pineapple, sugar, and lemon juice in a saucepan and cook until sugar dissolves.
Cool slightly, then stir in mashed bananas.
Fold in whipped cream and chopped nuts.
Pour into a mold or ice tray and freeze until firm.
Unmold onto lettuce leaves to serve.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PINEAPPLE CHEESE SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 package lemon Jell-O
- 1 cup boiling water
- 1 can crushed pineapple
- 1 cup grated cheese
- 1/2 pint heavy cream, whipped
- Lettuce, for serving
<|steps|>
Dissolve Jell-O in boiling water and cool slightly.
Add crushed pineapple with its juice and grated cheese.
Fold in whipped cream.
Pour into a mold and chill until set.
Unmold onto lettuce leaves to serve.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PRUNE WHIP**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup cooked prunes, pitted and mashed
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1 teaspoon lemon juice
- 2 egg whites
- Whipped cream, for serving
<|steps|>
Mix mashed prunes, sugar, and lemon juice.
Beat egg whites until stiff and fold into the prune mixture.
Pour into a baking dish and bake at 325°F for 20 minutes.
Serve chilled with whipped cream.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHOCOLATE SOUFFLÉ**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 squares Baker's chocolate
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 2 tablespoons flour
- 1 cup milk
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 3 egg yolks
- 3 egg whites
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- Pinch of salt
<|steps|>
Melt chocolate and butter in a double boiler.
Stir in flour, then gradually add milk, stirring until thickened.
Add sugar and salt, then cool slightly.
Beat egg yolks and stir into the chocolate mixture.
Beat egg whites until stiff and fold into the mixture with vanilla.
Pour into a buttered baking dish and bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes.
Serve immediately.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CARAMEL ICING**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups brown sugar
- 1/2 cup butter
- 1/2 cup cream
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1/2 cup butter
- 1 cup confectioners' sugar
- 1 teaspoon vanilla or 1 tablespoon brandy
- Nutmeg, to taste
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1 tablespoon cornstarch
- 1 cup boiling water
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- Grated rind of 1 lemon
- Pinch of salt
- 1/2 cup butter
- 1 cup confectioners' sugar
- 1 egg, separated
- 2 tablespoons sherry or brandy
- 1/4 cup heavy cream, whipped
- 2 cups milk
- 3 egg yolks
- 1/4 cup sugar
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- Pinch of salt
<|steps|>
Combine brown sugar, butter, and cream in a saucepan.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture reaches the soft ball stage (235°F).
Remove from heat, add vanilla, and beat until thick.
Spread over cake while still warm.
**HARD SAUCE**
Cream butter and confectioners' sugar until light and fluffy.
Add vanilla or brandy and a pinch of nutmeg.
Chill until firm and serve with pudding or pie.
**LEMON SAUCE**
Mix sugar, cornstarch, and salt in a saucepan.
Gradually stir in boiling water and cook until thickened, stirring constantly.
Remove from heat and stir in butter, lemon juice, and lemon rind.
Serve warm over puddings or cakes.
**FOAMY SAUCE**
Cream butter and confectioners' sugar until light.
Add egg yolk and sherry or brandy, beating well.
Beat egg white until stiff and fold into the mixture.
Fold in whipped cream just before serving.
Serve warm over desserts.
**CUSTARD SAUCE**
Scald milk in a double boiler.
Beat egg yolks with sugar and salt, then gradually stir in hot milk.
Return to the double boiler and cook, stirring constantly, until thickened.
Remove from heat, add vanilla, and cool.
Serve chilled over desserts.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHEESE PUFFS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. margarine
- 1 cup. sifted flour
- 2 cup. shredded cheese
- 1/2 tsp. paprika
- 1/4 tsp. red pepper
- 1/2 tsp. salt
<|steps|>
Cream margarine and add cheese; cream well.
Add seasoning to flour and combine with cheese mixture; blend well.
Shape into 1-inch balls and freeze or chill thoroughly.
Place on cookie sheet and bake at 350°F for 15 minutes.
Serve with salads.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **GARLIC CHEESE STRAWS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. shortening
- 1 cup. shredded sharp American cheese
- 3 Tbsp. grated Parmesan cheese
- 3/4 tsp. garlic salt
- 1 cup. sifted regular flour
<|steps|>
Cream shortening and add cheese; beat well.
Sift flour and garlic salt together and stir into creamed mixture to form a smooth dough.
Force through a cookie press into 5-inch lengths on an ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake at 350°F for 12 minutes.
Let cool on sheet for a few minutes, then carefully remove.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HOT SAUSAGE BALLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. hot sausage
- 3 1/2 cup. Bisquick
- 10 oz. block cheese (Kraft Coon Brand)
<|steps|>
Mix Bisquick and sausage.
Grate or melt cheese and blend with sausage mixture.
Form into marble-sized balls.
Bake at 350°F for about 10 minutes.
Can be frozen and baked as needed.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SWEET-DILL PICKLES**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 gal. cucumbers
- Alum powder (1 Tbsp. per gal. of water)
- Dill sprigs
- 6 lb. sugar
- 2 pt. white sugar
- 1 box pickling spice
- 1 1/2 Tbsp. tarragon vinegar
<|steps|>
Wash cucumbers and soak in brine (strong enough to float an egg, non-iodized salt) for 8 days.
Soak in clear water for 24 hours.
Cut into strips and soak in alum water (1 Tbsp. alum per gal. water) for 48 hours.
Rinse cucumbers and jars.
Place cucumbers and dill sprigs in jars, cover with hot syrup made from sugar and pickling spice.
Add 1 1/2 Tbsp. tarragon vinegar the next morning.
Weigh down and let set for 7-10 days.
Pack in quart jars with a dill sprig, heat syrup, and seal.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CRISP SWEET CUCUMBER PICKLES**
<|ingredients|>
- 7 lb. cucumbers, sliced crosswise
- 2 cup. pickling lime
- 2 gal. water
- 2 qt. vinegar
- 4 1/2 lb. sugar
- 1 Tbsp. salt
- 1/2 can (1 1/2 oz.) pickling spices
- 6-8 cinnamon sticks
<|steps|>
Soak cucumbers in 2 c. pickling lime mixed with 2 gal. water for 24 hours.
Rinse in 3 different cool waters, then soak in ice water for 3 hours and remove.
Make syrup with vinegar, sugar, salt, pickling spices (in a cloth bag), and cinnamon sticks.
Pour syrup over cucumbers and let set overnight.
Boil mixture for 35 minutes or until cucumber slices are clear.
Can in jars, adding cinnamon sticks if desired.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **OLIVE CHEESE BALLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 24 stuffed olives, well drained
- 1/4 lb. grated natural sharp cheddar cheese (1 cup.)
- 1/2 cup. sifted all-purpose flour
- 1/4 cup. soft butter or oleo
- Salt, to taste
- Paprika, to taste
<|steps|>
Blend cheese with butter, then stir in flour, salt, and paprika; mix well.
Mold 1 tsp. dough around each olive, covering completely.
Arrange on an ungreased cookie sheet and refrigerate for about 4 hours or until very cold.
Preheat oven to 400°F 30 minutes before serving.
Bake balls for 10-15 minutes, watching carefully to avoid burning.
Serve warm or cold.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BREAD AND BUTTER PICKLES**
<|ingredients|>
- 7 qt. thinly sliced cucumbers with rind
- 1 cup. salt
- 5 qt. water
- 12 small onions, sliced
- 3 pt. vinegar
- 4 cup. sugar
- 1 Tbsp. turmeric
- 1 Tbsp. celery seed
<|steps|>
Soak cucumbers, salt, water, and onions overnight.
Rinse and drain cucumbers and onions.
Bring vinegar, sugar, turmeric, and celery seed to a boil.
Add cucumbers and onions, simmer until hot but do not boil.
Pack into sterilized jars and seal.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **DRESSING FOR GREEN SALADS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 grated garlic clove
- 1 tsp. grated onion
- 1/4 cup. chili sauce
- 1/4 cup. catsup
- 1 tsp. paprika
- 1 tsp. prepared mustard
- 1 tsp. black pepper (or more)
- 1 cup. mayonnaise
- 1 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 1 Tbsp. water
- Juice of 1 lemon
- 1/2 cup. salad oil
- Salt, to taste
- Tabasco sauce, to taste
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients thoroughly.
Chill before using.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BAKED FRUIT SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. pears
- 1 can peaches
- Raisins, to taste
- 1 stick oleo
- Prunes, to taste
- 1 tsp. curry powder
- 1 small jar red cherries
- 1 can chunk pineapple
- 3/4 cup. brown sugar
<|steps|>
Drain fruit and place in a baking dish.
Mix 1 c. fruit juice with oleo, curry powder, cherries, pineapple, and brown sugar.
Pour over fruit.
Bake uncovered at 325°F for 1 hour.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CARROT PENNIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 lb. carrots, sliced like pennies
- 1 cup. Campbell's tomato soup
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1 tsp. mustard
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- 1/2 cup. oil
- 3/4 cup. vinegar
- 1 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 1 medium onion, sliced
- 1 small green pepper, sliced in rounds
<|steps|>
Cook carrots until done.
Blend tomato soup, sugar, mustard, salt, pepper, oil, vinegar, and Worcestershire sauce.
Layer carrots, onions, and green peppers in a dish.
Pour blended sauce over layers and marinate for 1-2 days.
Heat in oven at 300°F for about 1 hour before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PINEAPPLE YAMS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 lb. raw sweet potatoes
- 1 gal. water
- 1 Tbsp. salt
- 1/2 cup. white corn syrup
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. water
- 1 cup. crushed pineapple
- 4 Tbsp. butter
<|steps|>
Add salt to 1 gal. water and shred yams directly into it.
Combine sugar, syrup, and 1/2 c. water in a saucepan; cook until it forms a light syrup.
Drain potatoes, rinse, and pat dry.
Place in a baking dish, pour pineapple over potatoes, then add cooked syrup.
Dot with butter.
Bake uncovered at 350°F for about 35 minutes or until potatoes are translucent.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LEMON ORANGE SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pkg. (3 oz.) lemon Jell-O
- 1 pkg. (3 oz.) orange Jell-O
- 2 cup. boiling water
- 1 cup. cold water
- 1 large can crushed pineapple
- 2 cans mandarin orange sections
- 1 small pkg. marshmallows
- 1 cup. whipping cream
- 1 cup. mayonnaise
- Cheddar cheese, grated
<|steps|>
Dissolve Jell-O in boiling water, add cold water, pineapple, and orange sections; mix well.
Refrigerate until firm.
Cover top with marshmallows.
Whip cream slightly, add mayonnaise, and pour over marshmallows.
Grate cheese over the top.
Cut into squares and serve. Makes 16 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **RAW CRANBERRY SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. cranberries
- 2 oranges (pulp & rind)
- 1 apple, peeled and finely cut
- 2 cup. sugar
- 1 cup. chopped nuts
- 2 cup. diced celery
- 1 pkg. Jell-O (favorite flavor)
- 1 cup. hot water
- 2 cup. bite-size marshmallows
<|steps|>
Grind cranberries and oranges, mix with apple, sugar, nuts, and celery.
Dissolve Jell-O in hot water and refrigerate until almost congealed.
Stir all ingredients together and place in a mold.
Refrigerate overnight.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SAUERKRAUT SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. vinegar
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1 Tbsp. whole pickling spice (in a cloth bag)
- 1 pkg. sauerkraut
- 1 cup. chopped celery
- 1 cup. chopped green pepper
- Onion, to taste
<|steps|>
Boil vinegar, sugar, and spices for 3 minutes, then remove spices.
Pour over sauerkraut, celery, green pepper, and onion.
Let stand for at least 12 hours.
Keeps for several weeks in the refrigerator.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SCALLOPED POTATOES**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 cup. thinly sliced raw potatoes
- 1 tsp. salt
- 2 Tbsp. butter or oleo
- 2 Tbsp. flour
- 1/8 tsp. pepper
- Approximately 1 1/2 cup. cold milk
<|steps|>
Rinse potatoes in cold water and drain.
In a greased 1 1/2 qt. casserole, layer 1/3 of potatoes, 1/2 tsp. salt, 1 Tbsp. flour, a dash of pepper, and dot with 1 Tbsp. butter.
Repeat layers, ending with potatoes.
Pour milk over potatoes to barely cover.
Bake uncovered at 350°F for 1 1/2 to 2 hours until tender.
Use hot milk to reduce oven time by about 15 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ASPARAGUS CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. thick white sauce
- 1 cup. toasted slivered almonds
- 1 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 1/8 tsp. red pepper
- 2 cup. grated cheese
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/8 tsp. black pepper
- 1 No. 2 can green asparagus, drained
<|steps|>
Combine white sauce, 1 c. grated cheese, almonds, Worcestershire sauce, salt, and peppers.
Place asparagus in a buttered baking dish and pour sauce over.
Top with remaining 1 c. grated cheese.
Bake at 350°F for 45 minutes. Serves 8.
**Thick White Sauce:**
- 2 Tbsp. fat
- 4 Tbsp. flour
- 1 c. milk
- 1/8 tsp. salt
Melt fat, add flour, and combine thoroughly.
Add milk and salt, cook on low heat until thick.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SCANDINAVIAN RELISH**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 (16 oz.) can small peas
- 2 (15 1/2 oz.) cans Blue Lake green beans, cut up
- 1 can white shoe peg corn
- 1 (2 oz.) jar pimento
- 1 diced green pepper
- 1 cup. diced celery
- 1 cup. chopped red or white onion
- 3/4 cup. sugar
- 3/4 cup. vinegar
- 1/2 cup. oil
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. pepper
<|steps|>
Drain vegetables and combine in a large bowl with celery, onions, and green pepper.
Pour sugar, vinegar, oil, salt, and pepper over all.
Chill in refrigerator. Can be made in advance and served as a vegetable.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ORANGE SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 (3 oz.) pkg. orange Jell-O
- 4 cup. apple juice
- 1/2 cup. diced celery
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/2 cup. chopped pecans or walnuts
- 2 cup. thin sliced apple strips
<|steps|>
Heat 2 c. apple juice, dissolve Jell-O and salt, then add remaining juice.
Let partially set, then add celery, nuts, and apple strips.
Refrigerate until firm.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BEAN SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can cut green beans
- 1 can cut wax beans
- 1 can red kidney beans
- 1 cup. slivered green pepper
- 1/2 cup. thinly sliced red onion
- 2/3 cup. wine vinegar
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. salad oil
- 1 clove garlic, split
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 1/8 tsp. pepper
<|steps|>
Rinse and drain beans.
In a large container, combine beans with green pepper and onion.
In a jar, combine vinegar, sugar, oil, garlic, salt, Worcestershire sauce, and pepper; shake vigorously.
Pour over beans, cover tightly, and refrigerate for at least 24 hours, stirring occasionally.
Drain before serving. Improves with longer standing.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SAUERKRAUT SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 11 oz. can sauerkraut (No. 1 can)
- 1/2 cup. chopped onion
- 1/2 cup. chopped green pepper
- 1/2 cup. chopped celery
- 4 oz. jar pimento, drained and chopped
- 1/2 tsp. mustard seed
- 1 tsp. celery seed
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1 Tbsp. vinegar
- 2 cup. mayonnaise
- 1 small chopped onion
- 1 tsp. prepared mustard
- 4-6 hard-boiled eggs, mashed or grated
- 1/2 cup. olive oil
- Dash hot sauce
- 1 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
- Salt, if needed
<|steps|>
Drain and finely chop sauerkraut.
Mix with onion, green pepper, celery, pimento, mustard seed, celery seed, sugar, and vinegar.
Chill well, preferably overnight, before serving.
**JOHNNIE'S SAUCE FOR BEANS AND SPINACH**
Mix mayonnaise and olive oil.
Add onion, mustard, eggs, hot sauce, Worcestershire sauce, and salt if needed.
Halve the recipe for family use.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SUMMER TIME HAM SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pkg. frozen green peas
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. water
- 1 cup. Minute Rice
- 1 tsp. grated onion
- 1 cup. cooked ham, diced
- 1 cup. or 1 (6 oz.) pkg. Swiss cheese strips
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 3/4 cup. mayonnaise
<|steps|>
Boil peas and salt in water for 2 minutes.
Add rice, mix to moisten, cover, and remove from heat; let stand 5 minutes.
Stir in onion, pepper, ham, and cheese; chill.
Before serving, add mayonnaise and mix lightly.
Serve on lettuce, garnish with tomato wedges, or use as a lunch meat dish.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SNOW DRIFT SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 env. unflavored gelatin
- 1/2 cup. cold water
- 1/3 cup. sugar
- 1/8 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. boiling water
- 1/4 cup. lemon juice
- 2 env. Dream Whip
- 1 can diced or crushed pineapple
- 1 cup. grated cheese
<|steps|>
Sprinkle gelatin on cold water to soften, add sugar, salt, and boiling water; stir until dissolved.
Add lemon juice, stir, and refrigerate.
Prepare Dream Whip according to package directions.
Drain pineapple.
When gelatin is cool, add to Dream Whip and beat slightly.
Add pineapple and cheese, pour into a mold, and chill thoroughly.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **AVOCADO DIP OR SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 avocado, peeled
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. garlic salt
- 1/3 cup. tomato sauce
- 2 Tbsp. grated onion
<|steps|>
Mash avocado and mix with salt, garlic salt, and grated onion.
Add tomato sauce and mix well.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SPINACH CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 pkg. frozen spinach
- 4 Tbsp. butter
- 2 Tbsp. flour
- 2 Tbsp. chopped onion
- 1/2 cup. evaporated milk
- 1/2 cup. vegetable liquid
- 1/2 tsp. black pepper
- 3/4 tsp. celery salt
- 3/4 tsp. garlic salt
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 6 oz. roll Jalapeno cheese
- 1 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
- Dash red pepper
<|steps|>
Cook spinach according to package directions, drain well, and reserve liquid.
Melt butter in a saucepan over low heat, sauté onions until clear, then add flour to make a sauce.
Add milk and vegetable liquid, stir until thick.
Add seasonings and cheese, stir until melted.
Combine with spinach in a casserole dish.
Serve immediately, or top with bread crumbs and bake, or freeze.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ROLLED GRAPE LEAVES**
<|ingredients|>
- Prepared grape leaves (from import store)
- 1 lb. coarse ground sirloin steak
- 1 cup. raw rice
- 1 tsp. salt
- 2 tsp. crushed mint leaves
- 1/2 tsp. pepper
- Juice of 2-3 lemons
- 1 cup. water
- 1 1/2 lb. lean beef, thinly sliced
- 2 bunches scallions, cut into 2-inch pieces
- 1 large can mushroom pieces
- 3 medium onions, sliced
- 1 head Chinese cabbage, shredded
- 1 can chicken broth
- 1/2 cup. soy sauce
- 1/4 cup. sugar
- 1 tsp. accent
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 can bean sprouts
- 1 can sukiyaki (no tomo) or 1 can bamboo shoots and 1 additional can mushroom pieces
- Cooked rice
- Cooking oil
<|steps|>
Unroll and rinse grape leaves one section at a time.
Combine meat, rice, salt, mint, and pepper; work together with fingers.
Place meat mixture on a leaf, fold ends or sides in, and roll firmly.
Pack rolls in a heavy saucepan or Dutch oven, pour lemon juice and water over 40-50 rolls, and sprinkle with salt.
Anchor with a bowl on top, cover, and cook over low heat for 40-50 minutes, ensuring 1/2 c. water remains.
Serve to be eaten with fingers or as part of a meal.
**SUKIYAKI**
Slice beef thinly across the grain (easier if partially frozen).
Heat a small amount of oil in a large skillet, sauté beef quickly until browned.
Add scallions, mushrooms, onions, cabbage, bean sprouts, and sukiyaki or substitutes.
Add 1 c. chicken broth, soy sauce, sugar, salt, and accent.
Cook covered for 5 minutes over medium heat, then uncovered for 5 more minutes, tossing lightly until vegetables are crisp.
Add more broth if needed.
Serve with rice, a green salad, garlic butter French bread, and iced tea.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ONE SKILLET MEAT BALLS AND SPAGHETTI**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1/4 cup. oatmeal or bread crumbs
- 1 sprig parsley, chopped or 1/2 tsp. parsley flakes
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1/2 cup. milk
- 1 egg
- 1 onion, sliced
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- 1 pkg. spaghetti
- 2 cans tomato sauce
- 1 cup. water (more if needed)
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. pepper
- 1 Tbsp. sugar
- 1 bay leaf
<|steps|>
Combine beef, oatmeal or bread crumbs, parsley, garlic, milk, egg, salt, and pepper; mix well and form into balls.
Sprinkle skillet with salt, brown meat balls, add onion, and brown slightly.
Add tomato sauce, water, salt, pepper, sugar, and bay leaf; simmer slowly.
Cook spaghetti in boiling salted water.
Serve meat balls and sauce over spaghetti. Serves 6.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LUNCHEON SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 oz. cream cheese
- 1/2 cup. sour cream
- Dash of salt
- 3/4 cup. diced celery
- 1/2 cup. chopped walnuts
- 2 Tbsp. chopped green pepper
- 1 1/2 cup. diced chicken
- 1 (13 1/2 oz.) can well-drained pineapple tidbits
- Cranberry cubes, for topping
<|steps|>
Mix cream cheese, sour cream, and salt, then stir in celery, walnuts, and green pepper.
Fold in chicken and pineapple.
Chill thoroughly.
Top with cranberry cubes before serving. Serves 5-6.
<|endofrecipe|>
