<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TEXAS CHILI**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 lb. beef, chili plate ground
- 1/2 lb. lean pork, chili plate ground
- 2 cans tomato paste
- 3 Tbsp. chili powder
- 2 Tbsp. ground cumin
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 large pod garlic
- 1 large onion
- 2 cans ranch style beans
- 2 lb. ground beef
- 1 No. 2 1/2 can tomatoes
- 1 (8 oz.) can tomato sauce
- 2 env. spaghetti sauce mix
- 1/3 pkg. lasagna noodles
- 2 (6 oz.) pkg. Mozzarella cheese
- 1 cup. cream style cottage cheese
- 1/2 cup. grated Parmesan cheese
- Salt, to taste
- Minced garlic, to taste
<|steps|>
Cook beef, pork, chopped onion, and garlic in a skillet until medium well done.
Transfer to a pot, add tomato paste, chili powder, cumin, salt, and water to desired consistency.
Simmer for 1 1/2 hours.
Add washed beans and cook for 20 more minutes.
Serve with crackers. Serves 8.
**LASAGNA**
Brown beef slowly, spooning off excess grease.
Add tomatoes, tomato sauce, spaghetti sauce mix, and garlic; simmer covered for 40 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Salt to taste.
Cook and drain noodles according to package directions.
In a greased 11 1/2 x 7 1/2 x 1 1/2 inch baking dish, layer 1/3 meat sauce, 1/2 noodles, 1/2 Mozzarella, and 1/2 cottage cheese; repeat layers, ending with sauce.
Top with Parmesan cheese.
Bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes.
Let stand before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MEAT LOAF**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 1/2 lb. ground beef
- 3/4 cup. bread cubes (about 2 slices)
- 1 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. pepper
- 1/4 cup. chopped onion
- 1 egg, beaten
- 3/4 cup. milk
- 1/3 cup. catsup
- 1 Tbsp. mustard
- 1 Tbsp. firmly packed brown sugar
<|steps|>
Beat egg, add milk and bread cubes, and let stand.
Mix bread mixture with beef, onion, salt, and pepper; shape into a loaf in a pan.
Combine catsup, mustard, and brown sugar for topping and spread over loaf.
Bake at 350°F for about 1 hour.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **GLAZED PORK CHOPS WITH ONIONS**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 large Bermuda onions, halved
- 6 loin rib or shoulder pork chops
- 1/3 cup. firmly packed brown sugar
- 1 tsp. sage
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. paprika
- 1 tsp. dry mustard
- 1/8 tsp. pepper
- 1 Tbsp. water
<|steps|>
Cook onions in boiling salted water for 10 minutes; drain well.
Place onions cut side up in a baking pan with pork chops.
Combine brown sugar, sage, salt, paprika, mustard, pepper, and water; spoon over chops.
Bake at 325°F for 1 hour, basting often, until meat is tender.
Skim fat from syrup in pan and spoon over chops and onions. Serves 6.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BEEF STROGANOFF**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 1/2 lb. sirloin, cubed
- 1 large onion, sliced
- 2 (8 oz.) cans sliced mushrooms
- 1 large clove garlic
- 1 1/2 cup. tomato juice
- 3 Tbsp. soy sauce
- 1/2 pt. sour cream
- 2 bay leaves
- 1/4 tsp. paprika
- 1/4 lb. butter or oleo
- 3 Tbsp. flour
- 3 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 3 tsp. vinegar
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
<|steps|>
Simmer meat, onion, garlic, mushrooms, bay leaves, salt, pepper, and paprika in butter until meat is slightly brown.
Add flour and blend, then add tomato juice, soy sauce, Worcestershire sauce, and vinegar.
Simmer until meat is tender.
Cool, add sour cream, and reheat without boiling.
Serve over rice or Chinese noodles.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN RICE DISH**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pkg. Uncle Ben's Wild Rice Mix
- 1/2 pkg. Lipton onion soup mix
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 1 soup can water
- 6 chicken breasts
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
<|steps|>
Pour rice into a casserole and mix in dry onion soup mix.
Dilute chicken soup with water and pour over rice; mix thoroughly.
Lay chicken breasts over rice mixture, season lightly with salt and pepper.
Cover tightly and bake at 350°F for 1 hour.
Remove cover and bake 30 minutes more to brown.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **GROUND MEAT CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1 large onion
- 1 can cream tomato soup
- 1 small can cream corn
- 1 soup can water
- 1 pkg. medium narrow noodles
- 1 tsp. dry mustard
- 1/4 tsp. black pepper
- 1 large pinch oregano
- Grated cheese, for topping
<|steps|>
Brown meat, add onion, mustard, pepper, and oregano.
Add soup, water, and corn.
Cook and drain noodles, then add to meat mixture; mix well.
Place in a casserole and bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.
Sprinkle with grated cheese for the last 10 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PORK CHOPS WITH MUSHROOMS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 small can mushrooms
- 6 pork chops
- 1/4 cup. soy sauce
- 1 Tbsp. water
- 1 tsp. sherry
- 1 1/2 tsp. cornstarch
- Powdered garlic, to taste
- 3 Tbsp. oil
- 2 green peppers, cut in strips
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. pepper
- 2 large tomatoes, diced
- 3 green onions, diced
<|steps|>
Combine soy sauce, water, sherry, and cornstarch; mix well.
Slice pork chops thinly, remove fat, and add to soy sauce mixture with a sprinkle of garlic.
Heat oil in a frying pan, add peppers and onions, and cook slowly until almost tender, stirring constantly.
Add pork chops with mixture, salt, and pepper; stir well.
Cook for 15 minutes or until meat is tender, then add mushrooms.
Serves 6.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORN BEEF HASH**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cans corn beef
- 2 Tbsp. pickle relish
- 2 Tbsp. horseradish
- 1 cup. grated cheese
- 1/2 cup. catsup
<|steps|>
Mix corn beef, pickle relish, horseradish, cheese, and catsup.
Bake at 375°F for 15 minutes.
Serve with hot peach halves.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BAKED LASAGNE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1 Tbsp. parsley flakes
- 1 Tbsp. basil
- 1 1/2 tsp. salt
- 2 cup. tomatoes
- 2 (6 oz.) cans tomato paste
- 1 (10 oz.) pkg. lasagne noodles
- 2 (12 oz.) cartons large curd cottage cheese
- 2 beaten eggs
- 2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. pepper
- 2 Tbsp. parsley flakes
- 1/2 cup. Parmesan cheese
- 1 lb. Mozzarella cheese
<|steps|>
Brown meat slowly, add garlic, 1 Tbsp. parsley, basil, 1 1/2 tsp. salt, tomatoes, and tomato paste.
Simmer uncovered until thick, 45 minutes to 1 hour, stirring occasionally.
Cook noodles until tender, drain, and rinse in cold water.
Combine cottage cheese with eggs, 2 tsp. salt, pepper, 2 Tbsp. parsley, and Parmesan.
In a 13x9x2 inch baking dish, layer 1/2 noodles, 1/2 cheese mixture, 1/2 Mozzarella, and 1/2 meat mixture; repeat layers.
Bake at 375°F for 30 minutes. Serves 6-8.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN TETRAZZINI**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 4 Tbsp. cooking sherry
- 1/2 cup. chopped onion
- 1/2 cup. chopped bell pepper
- 1 can mushroom soup
- 1 (4 oz.) can mushrooms
- 5 Tbsp. milk
- 2 cup. chicken
- 1 cup. grated cheese
- 1/2 cup. almonds
- 1 small pkg. noodles
- Oleo, for browning
- Cracker crumbs, for topping
- 2 Tbsp. oleo
- 2 Tbsp. oil
- 1 onion, chopped
- 1 1/3 lb. ground round or sirloin steak
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. pepper
- 1 Tbsp. sugar
- 1 tsp. crushed mint flakes
- Dash of cinnamon
- 1 can stewed tomatoes, pureed
- 1 tsp. tomato paste
- 1/2 cup. pine nuts
- 3 cup. self-rising flour
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 cup. shortening
- 1 cup. milk
<|steps|>
Brown onion and bell pepper in oleo until light.
Add mushroom soup, salt, pepper, Worcestershire sauce, sherry, milk, and cheese, reserving some cheese for topping.
Add chicken, mushrooms, and almonds last.
Alternate layers of mixture and cooked noodles in a casserole.
Top with cheese and cracker crumbs.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour, ensuring it's not too moist.
**MEAT PIES (LEBANESE RECIPE)**
Sauté onion in oleo and oil with meat, add salt, pepper, sugar, mint, cinnamon, tomatoes, tomato paste, and pine nuts; cook for 5-6 minutes.
Refrigerate mixture overnight, ensuring it's not soupy.
For pastry, blend flour, salt, baking powder, and shortening until meal-like, add milk, and work until it leaves the bowl.
Make 30 half-dollar-sized balls, roll out thin, and place a heaping Tbsp. of meat mixture in each.
Fold into triangles and bake on a cookie sheet at 400°F for 10-14 minutes until golden brown.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN SPAGHETTI**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 hen
- 1 lb. spaghetti
- 1 can tomato juice
- 1 can tomato paste
- 1 large onion
- 1 or more garlic cloves
- Celery (bunch)
- Red pepper, to taste
- Black pepper, to taste
<|steps|>
Boil and bone chicken.
Mix tomato juice, tomato paste, onion, garlic, celery, and peppers; cook, then mix with chicken and simmer for about 1 hour or longer.
Cook spaghetti and mix with chicken sauce just before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HAM AND GREEN BEANS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. cut leftover ham
- 1 can green beans, drained
- 4 or 5 slices Velveeta cheese
- 1 tsp. prepared mustard
- 2 tsp. cream
<|steps|>
Melt cheese, mustard, and cream in the top of a double boiler.
Add ham and beans, stir with a fork until covered with cheese.
Serve over hot cornbread, ensuring the mixture is hot.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BEEF BRISKET**
<|ingredients|>
- 4-5 lb. brisket
- 4 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 1/2 bottle liquid smoke
- Celery salt, to taste
- Meat tenderizer, to taste
- Seasoned salt, to taste
- Garlic salt, to taste
<|steps|>
Trim fat from brisket and season both sides with salts and tenderizer.
Place in a 9x13 inch pan, add Worcestershire sauce and liquid smoke, cover, and refrigerate for 24 hours.
Bake covered at 225°F for 8 hours.
Chill overnight, slice, and reheat in the same pan.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SHRIMP REMOULADE (FRENCH)**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 Tbsp. olive oil
- 2 Tbsp. vinegar
- 1 tsp. salt
- 2 tsp. prepared mustard
- 6 green onions
- 2 stalks celery, minced
- 1 tsp. paprika
- Tabasco sauce, to taste
- 3 sprigs parsley, minced
- 2 cup. cooked shrimp
<|steps|>
Beat oil, vinegar, and salt together, then add mustard, green onions, celery, paprika, Tabasco, and parsley.
Pour over shrimp and let stand for 4 hours.
Serve with toothpicks, one shrimp per serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **GLAZED HAM LOAF**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 lb. ground ham
- 1 cup. fine dry bread crumbs
- 1/4 cup. finely chopped onion
- 1 Tbsp. horseradish mustard
- 1/4 cup. cream
- 1/2 cup. catsup
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 cup. hot water
- 2 eggs, well beaten
<|steps|>
Combine all ingredients except catsup, blend well, and shape into a loaf in a loaf pan.
Pour catsup over the top.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour. Serves 6.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MEAT BALLS AND SPAGHETTI**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pod garlic, chopped
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- 3 Tbsp. cooking oil
- 1 No. 2 can tomatoes
- 2 (6 oz.) cans tomato paste
- 2 cup. water
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. pepper
- 1 Tbsp. sugar
- 1 bay leaf
- Ground beef (for meatballs, quantity not specified)
- Spaghetti (quantity not specified)
<|steps|>
Sauté garlic and onion in oil.
Add tomatoes, tomato paste, water, salt, pepper, sugar, and bay leaf; simmer.
Form ground beef into meatballs and cook in the sauce.
Cook spaghetti separately.
Serve meatballs and sauce over spaghetti.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CARAMEL LAYER CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. cake flour
- 2 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. sugar
- 2 eggs, separated
- 2/3 cup. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 coconut, grated
- 2 lemons, grated rind and juice
- 2 cup. sugar (for filling)
- 1 cup. hot water
- 1/2 cup. pecans
- 1 Tbsp. cornstarch or flour
<|steps|>
Sift flour, baking powder, and salt together.
Cream butter and sugar, add egg yolks, then flour mixture alternately with milk and vanilla.
Beat egg whites until stiff and fold into batter.
Divide batter, add nuts to one part, and bake both parts at 350-375°F for 30-40 minutes.
For filling, combine lemons, sugar, and water; bring to a boil.
Add cornstarch or flour and cook until thick, then add coconut and nuts.
Spread filling between layers and on top.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **WHITE FRUIT CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. butter
- 1/2 cup. Crisco
- 2 cup. sugar
- 5 eggs
- 3 cup. flour
- 1/2 tsp. baking powder
- 1 cup. milk
- 1 Tbsp. vanilla
- Pinch of salt
<|steps|>
Cream butter and Crisco together.
Add sugar, eggs, flour, baking powder, milk, vanilla, and salt; mix well.
Bake at 350°F for 1 1/2 hours.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **DEVIL'S FOOD CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 sq. chocolate
- 1 cup. boiling water
- 2 cup. sugar
- 2 cup. sifted cake flour
- 1/2 tsp. baking powder
- 1 tsp. soda
- 1/2 cup. milk
- 1/2 cup. shortening
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 2 eggs
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 350°F.
Stir chocolate in boiling water until melted.
Add sugar, flour, baking powder, and soda; stir with a spoon.
Add shortening and beat with a mixer on medium speed for 1 minute.
Add milk, vanilla, and eggs; beat for 1 minute more.
Bake in a 9x13 inch pan for 35-40 minutes or in two 9-inch pans for less time.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **EASY COCONUT PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 5 eggs
- 2 cup. sugar
- 1 stick oleo
- 1 can coconut
- 3/4 cup. buttermilk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 2 unbaked 9-inch pie shells
<|steps|>
Mix eggs, sugar, oleo, coconut, buttermilk, and vanilla; beat well.
Pour into two unbaked pie shells.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes. Makes two 9-inch pies.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PECAN PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 eggs
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. light Karo
- 1/2 cup. dark Karo
- 2 Tbsp. oleo
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. pecans
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 unbaked pie shell
<|steps|>
Beat eggs, add sugar and Karo, and mix well.
Add oleo, salt, pecans, and vanilla; mix until oleo is in small pieces.
Pour into an unbaked pie shell.
Bake at 325-350°F for about 1 hour.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **COCONUT CUSTARD PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 eggs
- 3/4 to 1 cup. sugar
- 2 cup. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 cup. coconut
- Meringue (optional)
<|steps|>
Beat egg yolks slightly, add sugar, milk, vanilla, and coconut; mix well.
Bake at 400°F for 15 minutes, then at 350°F for 20-25 minutes.
Top with meringue if desired.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **GRAHAM NUT PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 eggs
- 1/2 tsp. baking powder
- 1 cup. sugar
- 11 crushed graham crackers
- 1 cup. chopped nuts
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- Whipped cream or other topping
<|steps|>
Beat eggs and baking powder, gradually add sugar.
Add graham crackers, nuts, and vanilla.
Pour into a well-greased pie pan.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.
Serve with whipped cream or preferred topping.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **COCONUT PINEAPPLE PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 eggs
- 1/4 cup. sugar
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 (8 oz.) can crushed pineapple
- 1 cup. white corn syrup
- 1 cup. flaked coconut
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 2 tsp. melted margarine
- 1 unbaked 9-inch pie shell
<|steps|>
Beat eggs, then beat in sugar and salt.
Stir in undrained pineapple, corn syrup, coconut, vanilla, and margarine.
Pour into an unbaked pie shell.
Bake below oven center at 400°F for about 45 minutes until filling is set and slightly golden.
Cool before cutting.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRESH PEACH PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 1/3 cup. flour
- 2 Tbsp. sugar
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. baking powder
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 6 to 8 peaches
- 1 cup. half & half cream
- 2 egg yolks
<|steps|>
Blend flour, 2 Tbsp. sugar, butter, salt, and baking powder; press into an 8x8 inch baking dish.
Slice or halve peaches, place in crust, and sprinkle with 1 c. sugar and cinnamon.
Bake at 400°F for 15 minutes.
Blend egg yolks and cream, pour over pie, and bake for 30 minutes longer.
Serve hot or cold with ice cream.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BLACK RASPBERRY DESSERT**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 (3 oz.) pkg. black raspberry gelatin
- 2 cup. boiling water
- 1 (16 oz.) can crushed pineapple (reserve liquid)
- 1 can blueberries (reserve liquid)
- Juice from fruit plus water to make 2 cups
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- 1 cup. sour cream
- 1 tsp. vanilla flavoring
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1 cup. pecans
<|steps|>
Dissolve gelatin in boiling water, add drained fruit and 2 c. liquid.
Let congeal overnight.
Mix cream cheese, sour cream, vanilla, and sugar for topping; spread over gelatin.
Sprinkle with pecans.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CARAMEL CUSTARD CUPS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 Tbsp. light brown sugar
- 2 eggs, slightly beaten
- 1 cup. Pet evaporated milk
- 2/3 cup. water
- 1/3 cup. sugar
- 1 1/2 tsp. vanilla
- Few grains of salt
<|steps|>
Press brown sugar lightly into each of 4 custard cups.
Mix eggs, milk, water, sugar, vanilla, and salt; pour carefully over brown sugar.
Set cups in a shallow pan with 1 inch of hot water.
Bake at 350°F for 50 minutes or until a knife inserted near the edge comes out clean.
Cool, loosen edges, and unmold.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PERSIMMON PUDDING**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 qt. well-ripened wild persimmons (raw)
- 2 cup. sour milk
- 1 cup. sweet milk
- 3 eggs
- 1 cup. brown sugar
- 1 cup. white sugar
- 2 tsp. vanilla
- 3 1/2 cup. sifted flour
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 lb. butter, melted
<|steps|>
Wash persimmons and run through a colander or sieve, adding milk to ease the process.
Add eggs, brown sugar, white sugar, vanilla, flour, salt, soda, and melted butter.
Bake in a greased, floured 13x9x2 inch pan at 300-325°F for about 1 hour or until risen and settled.
Serve with whipped cream. Pulp or pudding can be frozen.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FROZEN LEMON ICE BOX PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 egg whites
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. cream of tartar
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1/2 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 cup. finely chopped pecans
- 1 can condensed milk
- 1 whole egg
- Juice of 3 lemons
- 1/2 pt. whipping cream
- 2 Tbsp. sugar
- 1/3 cup. corn oil
- 1 cup. brown sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1/3 tsp. salt
- 2 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. soda
- 1 cup. dates
- 1/2 cup. nuts
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 egg
- 1 cup. powdered sugar
- 2 Tbsp. lemon juice
<|steps|>
Beat egg whites with salt and cream of tartar until foamy, gradually add 1/2 c. sugar, and beat until very stiff.
Fold in pecans and spread into a well-greased pie pan to form a nest.
Bake at 300°F for 50-55 minutes.
Mix condensed milk and egg, gradually add lemon juice, and pour into pie shell.
Whip cream with 2 Tbsp. sugar (or use substitute) and spread over pie.
Freeze.
**DATE PUDDING WITH SPECIAL SAUCE**
Cream corn oil and brown sugar, beat for 2 minutes.
Add eggs, salt, flour, soda, dates, and nuts; mix and bake in a pan lined with waxed paper for 25 minutes.
For sauce, mix butter, egg, powdered sugar, and lemon juice as for a cake.
Cook in a double boiler and pour over pudding.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **STRAWBERRY FIG PRESERVES**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 cup. mashed figs
- 3 cup. sugar
- 2 (3 oz.) pkgs. strawberry Jell-O
<|steps|>
Mix sugar and Jell-O well, then add figs and let stand for 2 hours.
Cook on low heat, stirring to bring out syrup, then simmer for about 15 minutes or until figs are done.
Seal in jars.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FIG PRESERVES**
<|ingredients|>
- 6 lb. figs
- Juice of 2 lemons (optional)
- 4 1/2 lb. sugar
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 qt. water
<|steps|>
Soak figs in a mixture of 1 tsp. salt and 1 qt. water for 1 hour; drain.
Divide figs into two boilers, sprinkle with sugar, and let stand for 1 hour.
Boil slowly to 222°F or until transparent, about 30 minutes.
Pack into sterilized jars.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MARSHMALLOW CREAM FUDGE**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 cup. sugar
- 1 (13 oz.) can Pet milk
- 2 sticks oleo
- 1 jar marshmallow cream
- 3 (6 oz.) pkgs. chocolate chips
- 3 cup. chopped pecans
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 lb. butter
- 1 lb. light brown sugar
- 1 cup. white Karo
- 1 can Eagle Brand milk
- Nuts (optional)
- 2 cup. sugar
- 1/4 tsp. soda
- 1 cup. evaporated milk
- 2 cup. pecans
- 2 Tbsp. butter
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Combine sugar, milk, and oleo; cook until it forms a soft ball in ice water, about 20 minutes, stirring constantly.
Add marshmallow cream, chocolate chips, pecans, and vanilla; blend well.
Pour into a greased pan and chill until firm.
**CARAMELS**
Melt butter, add Karo, brown sugar, and milk; cook until it forms a soft, firm ball, stirring constantly.
Pour into a slightly buttered pan.
Add nuts if desired.
When cold, cut and wrap individually.
**PRALINES**
Mix sugar and soda well, add milk, and cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until it forms a soft ball.
Remove from heat, add butter, vanilla, and pecans.
Stir until thick and creamy enough to drop by spoon onto greased foil.
Add a spoon of water if needed to maintain dropping consistency.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **DIVINITY CANDY**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. water
- 1/4 cup. Karo
- 2 egg whites
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Combine sugar, water, and Karo; boil until it strings from a spoon.
Gradually pour into stiffly beaten egg whites, beating continuously.
Add vanilla and beat until it stands in peaks.
Drop by spoonfuls.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHRISTMAS CANDY ROLLED IN LOGS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. vanilla wafers
- 1 cup. condensed milk
- 1/2 lb. candied pineapple
- 1 lb. candied cherries
- 1 lb. dates
- 1 qt. pecans
<|steps|>
Mash vanilla wafers into crumbs and place in a large bowl; pour condensed milk over.
Cut up pineapple, cherries, and dates over the crumbs, add pecans, and mix well with hands.
Divide into fourths and form into rolls with greased hands.
Wrap in waxed paper or foil and chill well.
Slice with a sharp knife. Best served at room temperature; keeps for months in the refrigerator.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **OLD FASHIONED PEANUT BRITTLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. sugar
- 1 cup. light corn syrup
- 1 cup. water
- 2 cup. raw peanuts
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. butter
- 1/4 tsp. soda
<|steps|>
Combine sugar, corn syrup, and water; cook slowly in a heavy skillet to the soft ball stage.
Add peanuts and salt, cook to the hard crack stage (290°F), stirring constantly.
Remove from heat, add butter and soda; stir to blend (mixture will bubble).
Pour onto greased platters.
When firm but warm, lift from platter and break into pieces when cold.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TEXAS MILLIONAIRE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 1/2 lb. Kraft Caramels
- 4 Tbsp. water
- 4 cup. pecans
- 1 lb. plain Hershey bars
- 2 oz. paraffin
<|steps|>
Melt caramels with water in the top of a double boiler.
Drop in pecans and form into patties on buttered cookie sheets.
Chill in refrigerator overnight or freeze for 30-40 minutes.
Melt chocolate and paraffin in a double boiler.
Dip patties one at a time into chocolate and let harden on waxed paper.
Store in a loosely covered container.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 (5 oz.) can Swanson's boned chicken
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 1/2 cup. water
- 1/2 cup. mayonnaise
- 1 1/2 cup. cooked rice
- 1/2 cup. slivered almonds
- 1 tsp. lemon juice
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. pepper
- 1 Tbsp. finely chopped onion
- 1 can French fried onion rings
- 3 hard-boiled eggs, chopped
- 1 cup. chopped celery
- 1 cup. finely chopped celery
- 1 cup. chopped green onions
- 3 cup. mayonnaise
- 1 cup. hot mustard
- 1/3 cup. French dressing
- 1 pod garlic
- Juice of 3 lemons
- 1/2 tsp. salt
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients except onion rings.
Refrigerate overnight.
Remove 30 minutes before cooking.
Bake at 350°F for about 20 minutes or until bubbling.
Sprinkle with onion rings and bake for 10 more minutes.
**SHRIMP SAUCE**
Mix all ingredients well.
Marinate shrimp in sauce overnight in the refrigerator.
Enough for about 6 lb. of shrimp.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **EGGPLANT MEAT CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. ground beef
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- 2 Tbsp. salad oil
- 1 medium eggplant
- 1/3 cup. all-purpose flour
- 1/4 cup. olive oil
- 2 (8 oz.) cans tomato sauce
- 1/2 tsp. oregano
- 1 Tbsp. Parmesan cheese
- 1 cup. shredded cheddar cheese
<|steps|>
Shape beef into patties, season with salt and pepper, and brown in salad oil.
Slice unpeeled eggplant thickly, season with salt and pepper, coat with flour, and brown in olive oil.
Place eggplant slices in a shallow baking dish, top each with a meat patty.
Cover with tomato sauce, sprinkle with oregano and Parmesan.
Top with cheddar cheese.
Bake at 300°F for 35 minutes. Serves 6.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **THOUSAND ISLAND DRESSING**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 small bottle stuffed olives
- 3/4 cup. mayonnaise
- 1/2 cup. chili sauce
- 3 boiled eggs (chopped whites, mashed yolks)
- Salt, to taste
- Small amount finely chopped onion
<|steps|>
Mix olives, mayonnaise, chili sauce, eggs, salt, and onion together.
Store in the refrigerator; keeps well for long periods.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PEA AND WATER CHESTNUT CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/3 cup. chopped onion
- 1/2 cup. finely chopped celery
- 1/2 stick oleo
- 1 can mushroom soup
- 1 can English peas, drained
- 1 can water chestnuts, drained
<|steps|>
Cook onion and celery in oleo over low heat until tender.
Add mushroom soup.
Thinly slice water chestnuts and add to the mixture.
Mix in peas.
Place in a casserole and bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SHRIMP DIP**
<|ingredients|>
- 10 large cooked shrimp
- 1/4 cup. mayonnaise
- 3 shakes Tabasco sauce
- 1 tsp. grated onion
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- 1 pint sour cream
<|steps|>
Blend shrimp, mayonnaise, Tabasco, onion, salt, pepper, and sour cream in a blender.
Chill before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **JOHNNY MARZETTI**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. hamburger
- 1 medium chopped onion
- 1 small can tomato sauce
- 3 or 4 slices Velveeta cheese
- 1/2 pkg. thin noodles
<|steps|>
Brown hamburger and onion, place in the bottom of a casserole.
Cook noodles and add with broth to the casserole.
Pour tomato sauce over the top, then layer with cheese.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour or until most moisture is gone.
Can be frozen or made ahead and refrigerated.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHEESE GRITS**
<|ingredients|>
- 6 cup. water
- 1 1/2 cup. uncooked Quick grits
- 1 lb. box Velveeta cheese
- 1 1/2 sticks oleo
- 2 tsp. salt
- 2 tsp. Accent
- 3 beaten eggs
<|steps|>
Bring water to a boil, add grits, and cook in a heavy saucepan until thick.
Add cubed Velveeta, oleo, salt, and Accent.
Remove from heat, cool slightly, and add eggs.
Pour into a 9x13x2 inch casserole and bake at 250°F for 1 1/2 hours until brown on top.
Serve hot.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SQUASH CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 1/2 cup. cooked squash
- 3 Tbsp. chopped pimento
- 1 cup. cracker crumbs
- 3 Tbsp. melted butter
- 1 cup. scalded milk
- 1 cup. diced sharp cheese
- 2 eggs, well beaten
- 3 Tbsp. chopped onion
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
<|steps|>
Combine squash, pimento, cracker crumbs, butter, cheese, eggs, onion, salt, and pepper.
Add hot milk last and mix well.
Pour into a well-greased 6x12 inch baking dish.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour. Serves 8.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ASPARAGUS CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 (300) cans cut asparagus
- 1 (10 1/2 oz.) can cream of mushroom soup
- 2 hard-boiled eggs, diced
- 1 cup. grated cheese
- 1 cup. cracker crumbs
<|steps|>
Drain asparagus.
Alternate layers of asparagus, soup, eggs, cheese, and crumbs in a greased casserole.
Bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CRANBERRY PUNCH**
<|ingredients|>
- 9 cup. unsweetened pineapple juice
- 9 cup. cranberry juice cocktail
- 4 1/4 cup. water
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. brown sugar
- Red cake coloring
- 4 1/4 tsp. whole cloves
- 4 cinnamon sticks
<|steps|>
Place pineapple juice, cranberry juice, water, and salt in the bottom of a percolator.
Place brown sugar, red cake coloring, cloves, and cinnamon sticks in the top.
Let perk through the cycle.
Serve hot or cold. Serves 34.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **INSTANT SPICED TEA**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 1/2 cup. sugar
- 2 cup. Tang
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 tsp. cloves
- 3/4 cup. Lipton's Instant Tea with lemon
<|steps|>
Mix sugar, Tang, cinnamon, cloves, and tea well.
Store in a large jar.
Use 3 heaping teaspoons per cup of hot water.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HOT CHOCOLATE MIX**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. instant cocoa mix
- 1/2 cup. powdered sugar
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1/2 cup. powdered cream
- 4 cup. powdered skim milk
<|steps|>
Combine all ingredients and store in closed containers.
To use, stir 5 Tbsp. mix into a cup of hot water.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ASPARAGUS WITH CHESTNUTS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 (12 oz.) can white asparagus
- 1 (10.5 oz.) can cream of celery soup
- 1 (8 oz.) can sliced water chestnuts
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Butter or margarine
- Cracker crumbs, for topping
<|steps|>
In a buttered casserole dish, layer white asparagus, cream of celery soup, and sliced water chestnuts alternately.
Sprinkle cracker crumbs over the top and dot with butter or margarine.
Bake at 350°F until bubbling hot, about 25-30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BEEF STROGANOFF**
<|ingredients|>
- 7 tablespoons flour
- 3 tablespoons shortening
- 2 pounds beef for stew, cut in 1/2-inch cubes
- 11/2 teaspoons salt
- 1/4 teaspoon pepper
- 1 cup chopped onion
- 1 cup tomato juice
- 2 cups liquid (water and liquid from mushrooms)
- 2 bouillon cubes
- 1 can (4 oz) mushrooms
- 1 cup sour cream
<|steps|>
Rub beef with garlic.
Combine 6 tablespoons flour, salt, and pepper, reserving 1 tablespoon flour for later; dredge meat in seasoned flour.
Brown meat in shortening in a skillet, then remove.
Sauté onion in skillet drippings, drain excess grease, and return meat to skillet.
Dissolve bouillon cubes in 1½ cups liquid, add to meat with tomato juice, cover, and simmer for 1½ hours.
Add mushrooms.
Combine reserved 1 tablespoon flour with remaining ½ cup liquid, add to skillet, and stir until mixture thickens.
Heat thoroughly and fold in sour cream just before serving.
Serve over cooked noodles or parsleyed rice.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **COUNTRY CAPTAIN**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 hen or 2 fryers
- 1 green pepper, chopped
- 1 pod garlic, chopped
- 1 onion, chopped
- 1 can (No. 2) tomatoes
- 1/4 cup raisins
- 1/4 cup almonds
- 1 teaspoon curry powder
- 1 teaspoon thyme
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- 3 tablespoons corn oil
- 1 can (4 oz) mushrooms
<|steps|>
Boil, bone, and chop chicken, reserving stock.
Sauté green pepper and onion in corn oil until tender.
Add chicken stock, garlic, tomatoes, mushrooms, curry powder, thyme, salt, and pepper; simmer for 10 minutes.
Add chopped chicken, raisins, and almonds; simmer for 1 hour.
Serve over rice, garnished with additional raisins and almonds.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN A LA KING**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 tablespoons flour
- 1 can (4 oz) mushrooms
- 1/4 cup green pepper, chopped
- 1 tablespoon minced onion
- 1/4 cup butter or margarine
- 2 cups thin cream
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Paprika, to taste
- 2 beaten egg yolks
- 21/2 cups diced cooked chicken
- 2 tablespoons finely cut pimento
<|steps|>
Lightly brown mushrooms, green pepper, and onion in butter.
Add flour and blend, then add cream and seasonings.
Cook until thick, stirring constantly.
Stir some of the hot mixture into egg yolks, then add to remaining hot mixture and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Add chicken and pimento.
Serve on pastry shells or toast cups.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN LITTLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 tablespoons salad oil
- 1 (2-pound) chicken fryer
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/8 teaspoon pepper
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- Juice of 2 lemons
- 1 cup water
- 1/2 pound mushrooms
- 1/4 teaspoon savory
- 1/8 teaspoon thyme
- 1 clove garlic
- 1 medium onion, sliced
- 1 medium green pepper, cut in strips
<|steps|>
Cut chicken into serving pieces and sprinkle with salt, pepper, and paprika.
Heat oil in a skillet, place chicken skin side down, and brown for 20 minutes on both sides.
Add lemon juice, water, savory, thyme, and garlic; cover and cook for 10 minutes.
Add mushrooms, onion, and green pepper; cook for 15 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PRESSED CHICKEN**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 (4-pound) hen
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- 2 cups chopped celery
- 4 hard-cooked eggs
- 1 cup mayonnaise
- 2 tablespoons gelatin
- 1/2 cup cold water
- 1 cup hot chicken stock
<|steps|>
Boil hen until tender, remove from bones, grind, and season with salt and pepper.
Combine ground chicken with chopped celery, hard-cooked eggs, and mayonnaise; mix well.
Soak gelatin in cold water for 5 minutes, then add to hot chicken stock and stir until dissolved.
Pour gelatin over chicken mixture and mix.
Pour into a large mold and refrigerate until set.
Unmold and garnish as desired.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SHRIMP STUFFED EGGPLANT**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 stalk celery, diced
- 1 quart soft bread crumbs
- 1 large eggplant
- 3 tablespoons butter or olive oil
- 11/2 pounds shrimp, fresh or frozen
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- 1/3 cup water
- ¾ teaspoon oregano
- 1/2 cup fine dried bread crumbs
- 1 tablespoon melted butter
- Parsley, for garnish
<|steps|>
Shell and devein shrimp.
Cut eggplant lengthwise into halves, scrape out pulp leaving ½-inch thick shells, and cook pulp in water just to cover until tender (about 15 minutes); drain well.
Cook shrimp in boiling salted water for 3 minutes, drain, soak in cold water, and dice, reserving a few whole shrimp for garnish.
Melt 3 tablespoons butter in a skillet, add onion and celery, and cook until tender but not browned.
Add soft bread crumbs, water, salt, oregano, cooked eggplant, and diced shrimp to skillet; toss gently until well mixed.
Fill eggplant shells with mixture.
Combine dried bread crumbs with 1 tablespoon melted butter and sprinkle over shrimp mixture.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes or until crumbs are browned.
Garnish with whole shrimp and parsley.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TAMALE PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 bag (6 oz) Fritos, crushed
- 2 cans (151/2 oz) chili con carne
- 1/2 cup American cheese, grated
- 1 medium onion, chopped
<|steps|>
Line a 1½-quart casserole with a layer of crushed Fritos.
Add a layer of one can of chili con carne, then another layer of Fritos.
Add a layer of chopped onion, followed by another layer of Fritos.
Add a layer of the second can of chili con carne, then top with a final layer of Fritos.
Bake at 450°F for 30 minutes.
Immediately top with grated cheese to melt.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TEXAS HASH**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 tablespoons fat
- 2 medium onions, sliced
- 1 green pepper, sliced
- 1 pound ground beef
- ¾ cup uncooked rice
- 1 can (No. 21/2) tomatoes
- 2 teaspoons salt
- 1/4 teaspoon pepper
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- 2 bunches broccoli
- 2 tablespoons onion, chopped fine
- 21/2 tablespoons butter or margarine
- 11/2 cups sour cream
- 2 teaspoons sugar
- 1 teaspoon vinegar
- 1 teaspoon salt
- Dash of pepper
- 1/4 cup chopped peanuts
<|steps|>
Melt fat in a heavy skillet, then cook onions and green pepper until they begin to brown.
Add ground beef and stir until browned.
Add rice, tomatoes, salt, pepper, and chili powder.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes.
**BROCCOLI WITH SOUR CREAM SAUCE**
Trim and wash broccoli, then cook in boiling salted water until tender; drain.
For the sauce, melt butter in the top of a double boiler over hot water, add onion, and cook until soft.
Add sour cream, sugar, vinegar, salt, and pepper to the butter and onion; cook for 10 minutes.
Pour sauce over broccoli and sprinkle with chopped peanuts to serve.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CREAMED ONIONS**
<|ingredients|>
- 11/2 pounds small white onions
- 1/2 cup ground almonds
- 31/2 tablespoons butter
- 11/2 tablespoons flour
- 11/2 cups milk
- ¾ teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
- 1/8 teaspoon pepper
- 3 tablespoons fine bread crumbs
<|steps|>
Wash and peel onions, then boil for about 5 minutes or until just tender; drain well and place in a greased baking dish.
Melt 1½ tablespoons butter, blend in flour, and slowly stir in milk; cook until slightly thickened.
Add ground almonds, salt, pepper, and nutmeg to the sauce.
Pour sauce over onions.
Mix bread crumbs with remaining 2 tablespoons melted butter and sprinkle over the top.
Bake at 375°F for 30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **DILL GREEN BEAN CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cans (1 pound) whole green beans
- 11/4 teaspoons dill seeds
- 2 tablespoons bacon drippings
- 6 tablespoons flour
- 6 tablespoons oleo
- 3 teaspoons grated onion
- 21/2 teaspoons Accent
- Dash of Tabasco
- 1 cup bean juice
- 11/2 cups milk
- 1 teaspoon pepper
- Salt, to taste
<|steps|>
Cook green beans with dill seeds and bacon drippings for 45 minutes, reserving 1 cup of bean juice; let cool.
For the white sauce, melt oleo, then stir in flour, grated onion, Accent, Tabasco, pepper, and salt; cook until thick.
Add bean juice and milk to the sauce, stirring until thickened.
Place green beans in a greased 2-quart casserole, pour white sauce over, and bake at 350°F for 20-25 minutes or until piping hot.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **EASY BAKED BEANS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can (1 pound) pork and beans
- 2 tablespoons brown sugar
- 2 tablespoons catsup
- 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
- Dash of black pepper
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients together.
Bake in a shallow baking dish at 350°F for 30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CANDIED SWEET POTATOES**
<|ingredients|>
- 6 small sweet potatoes
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup water
- ¾ cup brown sugar
- 1/2 cup margarine, melted
- 1/2 cup water
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/4 cup sugar
<|steps|>
Wash, peel, and parboil sweet potatoes in salted water for about 15 minutes.
Place potatoes in a greased baking dish.
Combine brown sugar, margarine, ½ cup water, cinnamon, and sugar to make a syrup; pour over potatoes.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes, basting occasionally.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PEAR RELISH**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 quarts ground pears
- 2 quarts ground white onions
- 8 green bell peppers
- 4 red bell peppers
- 2 hot peppers
- 12 large dill pickles
- 4 cups sugar
- 2 quarts vinegar
- 4 tablespoons salt
- 6 tablespoons turmeric
- 8 tablespoons mustard (dry or prepared)
- 2 tablespoons flour
<|steps|>
Sprinkle salt over ground pears and let stand for 5 minutes; drain.
Grind onions, bell peppers, hot peppers, and dill pickles, then mix with drained pears.
Add vinegar and bring to a boil for 5 minutes.
Add flour, sugar, mustard, and turmeric; cook until flour is well done.
Can the relish in jars.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PEPPER RELISH**
<|ingredients|>
- 12 red peppers
- 12 green peppers
- 12 onions
- 2 cups vinegar
- 11/2 cups sugar
- 2 tablespoons salt
<|steps|>
Coarsely cut or grind peppers and onions.
Cover with boiling water and let stand for 5 minutes; drain.
Cover again with boiling water and let stand for 10 minutes; drain.
Combine vinegar, sugar, and salt; boil for 5 minutes.
Add vegetables and boil together for 10 minutes.
Can the relish in jars.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **RED CABBAGE AND APPLES**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 tart apples, sliced
- 4 slices bacon
- 2 small red cabbages, shredded
- 2 cups boiling water
- 1/2 cup vinegar
- 6 tablespoons brown sugar
- 2 teaspoons salt
- Dash of red pepper
- 2 small onions, thinly sliced
<|steps|>
Fry bacon until crisp.
Add apples, cabbage, boiling water, vinegar, brown sugar, salt, red pepper, and onions to the bacon.
Simmer until cabbage is tender.
Serve hot.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PICKLED BEETS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 No. 303 can sliced beets
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1/2 cup vinegar
- 1/2 cup beet liquid
- 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/2 teaspoon cloves
- 1/2 teaspoon allspice
- 1 cup mayonnaise
- 1 tablespoon prepared mustard
<|steps|>
Combine sugar, vinegar, beet liquid, cinnamon, cloves, and allspice; heat to boiling.
Pour over sliced, cooked beets.
Let stand in the refrigerator for 24 hours before serving.
**SAUCE FOR FROZEN CAULIFLOWER OR BROCCOLI**
Combine mayonnaise and mustard.
Pour over cooked, drained cauliflower or broccoli in a 1-quart casserole.
Place under a broiler for 5 minutes.
Serve immediately.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SWEET POTATO MARSHMALLOW BALLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can (No. 2) sweet potatoes, drained
- 2 cups gingersnap crumbs, crushed
- 1 tablespoon undiluted frozen orange juice
- 1 cup brown sugar
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon
- Cloves, to taste
- Allspice, to taste
- 1/2 cup pecans, chopped
- 1 (6 oz) package marshmallows
<|steps|>
Mash sweet potatoes, then add cinnamon, cloves, allspice, brown sugar, and orange juice.
Form a ball around 3 small marshmallows or 1 large marshmallow.
Roll in gingersnap crumbs and chopped pecans.
Place on a greased cookie sheet and bake at 425°F for 10 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FAVORITE PARTY SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 large can sliced pineapple
- 1 small bottle cherries
- 1 pound marshmallows
- 1 pound shelled pecans
- 1 pint whipping cream
- Juice of 1 lemon
- 3 egg yolks
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 3 tablespoons vinegar
- 3 tablespoons water
<|steps|>
Cut marshmallows into quarters, drain and cut pineapple and cherries into small pieces, and chop pecans.
Mix marshmallows, fruit, pecans, and lemon juice.
For the dressing, combine slightly beaten egg yolks, vinegar, and water in a double boiler; cook until thick.
Cool dressing, add salt and whipped cream, and mix thoroughly with the salad.
Place in a large covered bowl or pour into 18 individual molds; refrigerate for 24 hours.
Serve on crisp lettuce with cheese crackers.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRUIT SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 tablespoon unflavored gelatin
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 1 (8 oz) package Philadelphia cream cheese
- 1 cup mayonnaise
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1 tablespoon sugar
- 1/2 cup cream, whipped
- 1/2 cup chopped nuts
- 1/2 cup maraschino cherries, chopped
- 1 small can crushed pineapple, drained
- 1 small can fruit cocktail, drained
<|steps|>
Soften gelatin in lemon juice, then set in a pan of boiling water to dissolve.
Combine cream cheese, mayonnaise, salt, and sugar; add dissolved gelatin.
Fold in whipped cream, nuts, cherries, pineapple, and fruit cocktail.
Pour into a tray and refrigerate until firm, several hours or overnight.
Slice and serve on a lettuce leaf with a dab of mayonnaise and a cherry on top.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **GINGER ALE SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 tablespoon gelatin
- 2 tablespoons cold water
- 1/2 cup boiling water
- 1/2 cup ginger ale
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 4 tablespoons sugar
- 1/2 cup sliced peaches or pears
- 1/2 cup orange sections
- 1/2 cup fresh strawberries, sliced
- 1/4 cup grapes, halved, or 1/4 cup diced pineapple
<|steps|>
Soften gelatin in cold water, then add boiling water, ginger ale, lemon juice, and sugar; stir to dissolve.
Cool, then add peaches or pears, orange sections, strawberries, and grapes or pineapple.
Pour into a 1-quart mold or 8 (½-cup) individual molds; chill for 6-8 hours or overnight.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MANDARIN ORANGE SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cans mandarin oranges
- 1 cup miniature marshmallows
- 1/2 pint sour cream
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1 cup coconut
- 1/2 cup slivered almonds
- 1 small can crushed pineapple
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients together.
Store in the refrigerator overnight.
Serve on lettuce.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PEACH SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 small box raspberry jello
- 2 cups water (minus 2 tablespoons), boiling
- 2 tablespoons vinegar
- 6 peach halves
<|steps|>
Dissolve jello in boiling water, add vinegar, and let stand until cool.
Place peach halves upside down in an 8 x 8 x 2-inch pan, pour jello over, and chill until firm.
Serve on lettuce leaves with salad dressing.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ONE-TWO-THREE SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can (12 oz) cocktail vegetable juice
- 1 package (3 oz) lemon-flavored gelatin
- 1 can (121/2 oz) condensed vegetable soup
<|steps|>
Lightly oil six (½-cup) molds with salad oil and set aside.
Heat vegetable juice until very hot, pour over gelatin in a bowl, and stir until completely dissolved.
Blend in vegetable soup.
Pour into molds and chill until set.
Unmold onto crisp lettuce.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SEAFOOD MEDLEY IN CUCUMBER RING**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 packages lime gelatin
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 2 tablespoons sugar
- 1 cup pineapple juice
- 1/4 cup vinegar
- 2 cups grated cucumber
- 1 cup finely diced unpeeled cucumber
- 1 pound crab meat
- 1 pound lobster meat
- 1 pound shrimp
- 2 cups chopped celery
- 2 tablespoons grated onion
- 1/2 teaspoon pepper
- Dash of paprika
- 1/2 cup prepared mustard
- 1/2 cup light cream
- 1/2 cup granulated sugar
- 1/3 cup lemon juice
<|steps|>
Dissolve gelatin, salt, and sugar in hot water, then add pineapple juice, vinegar, and grated cucumber; chill until slightly thickened.
Lightly salt diced cucumber and fold into thickened gelatin.
Pour into a 1½-quart ring mold and congeal.
For the seafood medley, combine crab meat, lobster meat, shrimp, celery, grated onion, salt, pepper, and paprika; toss together.
For the dressing, combine mustard, light cream, granulated sugar, lemon juice, salt, and pepper; beat with a rotary beater until light and fluffy.
Dress the seafood medley with the dressing and fill the center of the cucumber ring.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHEESE ROLL**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pound American cheese
- 1 (3 oz) package Philadelphia cream cheese
- 1 or more cloves garlic
- Pinch of salt
- Dash of Worcestershire sauce
<|steps|>
Grate American cheese finely and mash or grate garlic finely.
Mix all ingredients thoroughly.
Roll into a long roll about the size of a half dollar and coat thoroughly with paprika.
Wrap in wax paper, then aluminum foil, and refrigerate for 2-3 days before use.
Slice and serve with crackers.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **COLOSSAL CORN BREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 package active dry yeast or cake yeast
- 1/4 cup very warm water
- 2 cups milk, scalded
- 1/3 cup granulated sugar
- 1/3 cup shortening
- 1 tablespoon salt
- 3 cups sifted all-purpose flour
- 2 eggs, well-beaten
- 1 cup yellow corn meal
- 4 to 41/2 cups sifted all-purpose flour
<|steps|>
Sprinkle yeast into very warm water in a measuring cup and stir until dissolved.
In a large mixing bowl, combine scalded milk, sugar, shortening, and salt; stir in 3 cups flour until blended.
Add eggs, yeast mixture, and corn meal; gradually stir in 4 cups flour.
On a lightly floured board, knead dough for 10 minutes until smooth and plastic, using remaining flour as needed.
Place dough in a large greased bowl, turning to grease all sides; cover with a towel and let rise in a warm place (85°F) for about 1½ hours or until doubled in size.
Grease two Pyrex loaf pans.
Turn dough onto a floured surface, knead for 1-2 minutes, shape into loaves, and place seam side down in pans.
Let rise in a warm place until doubled in size.
Bake at 375°F (or 350°F for Pyrex) for 35-45 minutes.
Turn out to cool on their sides on a wire rack.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORN BREAD DE LUXE**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 large ears of corn, cut from cob and scraped, or 1 can (No. 2) cream-style corn
- 2 eggs
- 1 cup sour cream
- 1/4 pound longhorn cheese, diced
- 1 small can chili, cut fine
- 1 cup yellow corn meal
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 cup shortening, oil, oleo, or butter
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients together.
Pour into a well-greased 8 x 8 x 2-inch pan or 8-inch iron skillet.
Bake at 375°F until done.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **DATE NUT LOAF**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 (61/2 oz) package pitted dates
- 2 tablespoons shortening
- 11/2 cups boiling water
- 1 egg, beaten
- 11/2 cups sugar
- 21/2 cups sifted flour
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 cup chopped nuts
- 1/2 teaspoon lemon extract
<|steps|>
Cut dates into quarters, add shortening, and pour boiling water over; cool.
Add egg and sugar to the date mixture and mix.
Sift flour, salt, and baking soda together; combine with nuts and lemon extract.
Add dry ingredients to the date mixture.
Pour into a greased 9 x 5 x 3-inch loaf pan.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **NUT BREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- ¾ cup sugar
- 3 tablespoons baking powder
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup chopped nuts
- 2 eggs
- 1 cup milk
- 3 tablespoons shortening, melted
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
<|steps|>
Sift flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt; add chopped nuts and set aside.
Beat eggs until frothy, then add milk, vanilla, and cooled melted shortening.
Stir dry ingredients into the egg mixture until just blended.
Pour into a well-greased 9 x 5 x 3-inch loaf pan.
Bake at 350°F for 50-55 minutes.
Cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then remove and cool completely before slicing.
Slice thinly and spread with softened butter, cream cheese, or apricot jam.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **REFRIGERATOR ROLLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1¾ cups warm water (110-115°F)
- 2 packages active dry yeast
- 1/2 cup granulated sugar
- 1 tablespoon salt
- 1 egg, unbeaten
- 1/4 cup soft butter or margarine
- 6 cups sifted all-purpose flour
- 1 tablespoon butter, melted
<|steps|>
Pour warm water into a large bowl (rinsed with hot water) and check temperature to ensure it's warm, not hot.
Sprinkle yeast over water, add sugar and salt, and stir to dissolve completely.
Add egg, soft butter, and 3 cups flour; beat with a wooden spoon or electric mixer at medium speed for 2 minutes until smooth.
Gradually add 1 cup flour, beating hard after each addition, then work in remaining 2 cups flour with hands until smooth and elastic.
Brush the top of the dough with melted butter, cover with a double thickness of plastic wrap or a damp towel, and let rise in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or until doubled in bulk.
Punch down dough and refrigerate, punching down once a day for 1-3 days.
Shape into rolls, place in greased pans, and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size.
Bake at 400-425°F for 15-20 minutes, depending on roll shape and size.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BRUNCH CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 tablespoons butter, melted
- 1/2 cup walnuts, chopped
- 1/2 cup brown sugar
- 2 tablespoons flour
- 2 teaspoons cinnamon
- 1/4 cup butter
- 1 cup sugar
- 2 eggs
- 2 cups flour
- 2 teaspoons baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- ¾ cup milk
<|steps|>
Melt 2 tablespoons butter and pour into the bottom of a 13 x 9 x 2-inch pan.
Mix walnuts, brown sugar, 2 tablespoons flour, and cinnamon; sprinkle 1/3 of this mixture over the bottom of the pan.
Cream ¼ cup butter and sugar, then add eggs one at a time, blending well.
Sift together 2 cups flour, baking powder, and salt; add to creamed mixture alternately with milk.
Pour half the batter into the pan and spread carefully over the bottom.
Sprinkle 1/3 of the nut mixture over the batter, then pour in remaining batter.
Sprinkle remaining nut mixture on top.
Bake at 375°F for 25-30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BUTTER CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup butter
- 2 cups sugar
- 6 eggs
- 2 cups flour
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar.
Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each.
Gradually add sifted flour and mix well.
Add vanilla.
Pour into a tube pan and bake at 325°F for 1 hour and 15 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BUTTERMILK CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 cups sugar
- 1/2 cup butter
- 1/2 cup Crisco
- 5 eggs
- 3 cups flour
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 tablespoon water
- Buttermilk (to fill cup after water)
<|steps|>
Cream butter, Crisco, and sugar.
Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each.
Dissolve baking soda in a cup with 1 tablespoon water, then quickly fill with buttermilk.
Add flour and buttermilk mixture alternately to the creamed mixture, mixing well.
Pour into a tube pan and place in a cold oven.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour to 1 hour and 10 minutes; do not open oven for the first 30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **GRATED SWEET POTATO PUDDING**
<|ingredients|>
- 21/4 cups grated or ground sweet potato
- 1 cup sugar
- 1 cup milk
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon ginger
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 2 eggs, slightly beaten
- 2 tablespoons butter
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients together.
Pour into a buttered baking dish and bake uncovered at 350°F for 45 minutes.
When the top browns, turn under and let brown again to give a grainy texture.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHOCOLATE PEANUT BARS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup light corn syrup
- 1/2 cup brown sugar
- Dash of salt
- 1 cup peanut butter
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 2 cups crisp rice cereal
- 1 cup corn flakes, crushed
- 1 (6 oz) package semi-sweet chocolate pieces
<|steps|>
Combine sugar, corn syrup, and salt in a saucepan; bring to a full boil.
Stir in peanut butter and remove from heat.
Stir in vanilla, rice cereal, corn flakes, and chocolate pieces.
Press into a buttered 9 x 9 x 2-inch pan.
Chill for about 1 hour.
Cut into small bars or squares.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FIG CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 11/2 cups butter
- 1 cup sugar
- 2 eggs
- 2 cups sifted flour
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/2 teaspoon cloves
- 1/2 cup buttermilk
- 1 cup fig juice
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1 quart canned figs or 2 (1-pound 1 oz) jars, drained and chopped
- 1 cup chopped pecans
- 1/2 teaspoon cornstarch
- 1 cup brown sugar, packed
- 1/4 cup milk
- 1¾ cups sifted confectioners' sugar
<|steps|>
Cream 1 cup butter and sugar, then beat in eggs.
Sift flour, salt, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and cloves together.
Combine buttermilk and 2/3 cup fig juice; add alternately with dry ingredients to the creamed mixture, beating until smooth.
Add vanilla, then fold in figs (reserving 2/3 cup for filling) and pecans.
Pour into two greased 8-inch round pans and bake at 325°F for over 1 hour.
For the filling, cook cornstarch with 1/3 cup fig juice until clear, then fold in reserved 2/3 cup figs; spread between layers.
For the frosting, melt ½ cup butter, add brown sugar, and boil over low heat for 2 minutes, stirring.
Add ¼ cup milk, bring to a boil, and cool.
Add confectioners' sugar, beat until smooth, and frost the cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRUIT COCKTAIL CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 11/2 cups sugar
- 2 cups flour
- 2 teaspoons baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 2 eggs
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1 can (No. 2) fruit cocktail
- 1 cup coconut
- 1/2 cup pecans
- 1/2 cup brown sugar
- 1 stick margarine
- 1/2 cup milk
- 1 cup sugar
<|steps|>
Sift flour, 1½ cups sugar, baking soda, and salt together.
Add eggs, vanilla, and fruit cocktail; beat well by hand (do not use a mixer).
Pour into a greased 13 x 9 x 3-inch pan.
Mix ½ cup coconut, pecans, and brown sugar; sprinkle over the batter.
Bake at 325°F for 1 hour; do not remove from pan.
For the frosting, cook margarine, ½ cup milk, and 1 cup sugar for about 1 minute; pour over the hot cake.
Sprinkle remaining ½ cup coconut and ½ cup pecans on top.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FUDGE NUGGETS**
<|ingredients|>
- ¾ cup shortening
- 1 cup sugar
- 1 egg
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 2 (1 oz) squares unsweetened chocolate, melted and slightly cooled
- 2 cups sifted all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 2 teaspoons instant coffee (dry)
- 1/2 cup milk
- 1 cup quick-cooking rolled oats
- 1/2 cup chopped nuts
<|steps|>
Cream shortening and sugar until fluffy, then beat in egg and vanilla.
Stir in melted chocolate.
Sift flour, salt, and instant coffee together; add to chocolate mixture alternately with milk.
Stir in rolled oats and nuts.
Drop by teaspoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake at 350°F for 15 minutes or until done.
Dust with confectioners' sugar.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LEMON-COCONUT COOKIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup butter
- 11/2 cups sugar
- 1 egg
- 1/2 teaspoon grated lemon rind
- 2 cups sifted flour
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup flaked coconut
<|steps|>
Cream butter, add sugar, and continue creaming until light and fluffy.
Add egg and grated lemon rind; beat well.
Sift flour and salt together, then stir into the creamed mixture.
Blend in flaked coconut.
Drop by teaspoonfuls onto an ungreased baking sheet.
Bake at 325°F for 15-20 minutes until lightly browned around the edges.
Remove from baking sheets and cool on wire racks.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LITTLE PECAN PIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 (3 oz) package cream cheese
- 1 stick margarine
- 1 cup flour
- 1 egg
- 1 cup light brown sugar
- Dash of salt
- 1 tablespoon vanilla
- 2/3 cup chopped nuts
<|steps|>
Let cream cheese and margarine soften at room temperature, then cream together and gradually add flour.
Chill dough in the refrigerator for 2 hours.
Take small portions (about 1 teaspoon) of dough and press into small ungreased muffin tins to form shells.
For the filling, lightly beat egg, then add brown sugar, salt, vanilla, and nuts.
Spoon filling into pie shells, filling about 2/3 full.
Bake at 325°F for 12-15 minutes.
Cool in tins for about 10 minutes before removing.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MOLASSES NUT CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- ¾ cup butter or margarine
- 1/2 cup brown sugar, packed
- ¾ cup molasses
- 3 eggs, well-beaten
- 21/2 cups sifted flour
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 cup chopped nuts
<|steps|>
Cream butter and brown sugar, then blend in molasses.
Add eggs.
Sift flour, salt, baking powder, and baking soda together; blend nuts into dry ingredients.
Add dry ingredients gradually to the molasses mixture.
Pour into a greased 9 x 9 x 2-inch pan.
Bake at 350°F for 45 minutes.
Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan.
For the frosting, melt a 6 oz package of chocolate pieces over hot water, cool, then blend with ½ cup dairy sour cream and 1 teaspoon vanilla; spread on cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PINEAPPLE-CHEESE ICE BOX PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup graham cracker crumbs
- 4 tablespoons melted margarine or butter
- 2 tablespoons sugar
- 1 tablespoon plain gelatin
- 1/4 cup cold water
- 3 egg yolks, slightly beaten
- 1 cup crushed pineapple (with syrup)
- 1 teaspoon grated lemon peel
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 1/4 cup sugar
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1 cup cottage cheese
- 1 cup butter
- 1 2/3 cups sugar
- 5 eggs
- 2 cups flour
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- Pinch of salt
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla
- 5 tablespoons milk
<|steps|>
Mix graham cracker crumbs, melted margarine, and 2 tablespoons sugar; press into a 9-inch pie pan, reserving 3 tablespoons crumbs for topping.
Chill crust thoroughly or bake at 375°F for 8 minutes; cool.
Soften gelatin in cold water and set aside.
In a cold double boiler, combine egg yolks, pineapple, lemon peel, lemon juice, and ¼ cup sugar; cook over hot water, stirring until thick.
Add gelatin to the hot mixture, stirring until melted; remove from heat.
Put cottage cheese through a wire strainer and add to the hot mixture.
Heap filling into the chilled crust, sprinkle with reserved crumbs, and chill for 3 hours.
**PLAIN POUND CAKE**
Cream butter and sugar.
Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each.
Sift flour, baking powder, and salt together; add alternately with milk to the creamed mixture.
Add vanilla.
Pour into a tube pan and bake at 325°F for 45 minutes to 1 hour.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **POWDERED SUGAR COOKIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup butter or margarine
- 1/2 cup powdered sugar
- 21/4 cups flour
- Dash of salt
- 2 teaspoons vanilla
- ¾ cup chopped nut meats
<|steps|>
Cream butter and powdered sugar.
Add flour, salt, vanilla, and nuts; mix well.
Using a teaspoon, place small amounts (about the size of a marble) on a cookie sheet.
Bake at 400°F for 14-17 minutes.
Cool, then roll in powdered sugar.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **VANILLA WAFER CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 sticks oleo
- 2 cups sugar
- 6 eggs
- 1 box (12 oz) vanilla wafers
- 1/2 cup milk
- 1 cup pecans, chopped
- 1 can (7 oz) angel flake coconut
<|steps|>
Cream oleo and sugar.
Crush vanilla wafers until very fine.
Add wafers to creamed mixture alternately with milk and eggs; blend well.
Add pecans and coconut.
Pour into a tube pan and bake at 325°F for 1½ hours or until firm and golden brown.
Let cool in the pan before removing.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **WAIOLI DATE BARS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups dates
- 1/2 cup brown sugar
- 1/2 cup water
- 1 tablespoon flour
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1¾ cups flour
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 21/4 cups quick rolled oats
- 1 cup brown sugar
- 1 cup butter, melted
<|steps|>
Cook dates, ½ cup brown sugar, water, and 1 tablespoon flour slowly until thick but soft; add vanilla and set aside.
Mix 1¾ cups flour, baking soda, oats, and 1 cup brown sugar; add melted butter to form a dry mixture.
Press half the dry mixture into a greased 8 x 8-inch pan.
Pour the date mixture over the dry layer.
Press the remaining dry mixture over the date layer.
Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ARRDP CON POLLO**
<|ingredients|>
- Stewing chicken, cut in pieces (Save 4 cups broth)
- 11/2 pounds small shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 2 cans Mushrooms, stems and pieces
- 1 box frozen English Peas
- 1 can (4 oz.) Pimento-sliced
- 2 small onions, chopped fine
- 1/2 green pepper, chopped fine
- 2 cups canned tomatoes
- 2 teaspoons salt
- 2 teaspoons paprika
- 4 tablespoons fat
- 2 cups raw rice
- 1/2 cup parsley, chopped
<|steps|>
Boil chicken, save broth.
Brown rice in hot fat.
Add chicken broth, bring to boil and simmer.
When rice is half done add frozen peas, cubed chicken pieces, whole shrimp, mushrooms, pimento, onion, green pepper, salt, paprika and tomatoes.
Simmer until peas, shrimp and rice are done.
Stir with a fork occasionally.
Broth should be all absorbed.
Garnish with parsley.
Serve with Guacamole on lettuce cup garnished with tomato wedges in Mexican atmosphere.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BAKED CANADIAN BACON**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/4 cup brown sugar
- ¾ teaspoon dry mustard
- 1/2 cup unsweetened pineapple juice
- 2 pounds Canadian bacon, in one piece
<|steps|>
Combine sugar, mustard, and pineapple juice; spread over bacon and bake uncovered at 325°, one hour.
Baste every 15 minutes.
When sliced in one inch slices, may be served with broiled pineapple slices on top of each slice of meat.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BEEF CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups leftover pot roast or 1 pound ground beef
- 1 large onion
- 3 stalks celery
- 1 green pepper
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 1 can (101/2 ounces) mushroom soup
- 1/2 cup water
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- Dark pepper
- 1 can (3 ounce) chow mein noodles
<|steps|>
Start oven at 325°.
Cut onion, celery and pepper coarsely.
Chop left over beef in small cubes.
Cook beef in 1 tablespoon fat (butter) for several minutes (if ground beef, cook until brown) and transfer to medium size casserole.
Put remaining butter or margarine in pan, toss in chopped vegetables and cook until limp.
Stir in mushroom soup, water, salt, pepper and pour over beef, Mix well.
Cover and bake 30 minutes.
Remove cover and sprinkle with chow mein noodles and bake 10 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN SPAGHETTI**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 3 pound fryer or hen
- 2 tablespoons cooking oil or oleo
- ¾ cup celery chopped
- 1 cup bell pepper chopped
- 2 cup onion chopped
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 1 can chicken broth
- ¾ cup grated cheese
- Salt and pepper
<|steps|>
Season chicken with salt and pepper, cook in small amount of water until tender.
When cool, bone chicken, cut in small pieces.
Saute in cooking oil or oleo, celery, onions, and pepper.
Add cream of chicken soup and broth, let simmer.
Add boned chicken.
Cook spaghetti as usual, drain.
Place in layers in greased casserole.
Sprinkle top with grated cheese.
Bake 350° for 30 to 35 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CRANBERRY CHICKEN LAYER**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 envelope unflavored gelatine
- 1/4 cup cold water
- 1 pound can whole cranberry sauce
- 1 - 9 ounce can crushed pineapple
- 1/2 cup chopped pecans or other nuts
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- Salad oil
- 1/4 cup chicken stock
- 1 cup mayonnaise
- 1/2 cup chicken stock
- 1/2 cup diced celery
- 2 tablespoons chopped parsley
- Pecan half
<|steps|>
Soften 1 envelope unflavored gelatine in ¼ cup cold water.
Dissolve over hot water.
Add 1 pound can whole cranberry sauce; 1 - 9 ounce can crushed pineapple; ½ cup chopped pecans or other nuts; 1 tablespoon lemon juice.
Pour into 10 x 16 x 1½ baking dish, which has been rubbed with salad oil - chill until set.
Meanwhile soften 1 envelope unflavored gelatine in ¼ cup chicken stock.
Dissolve over hot water.
Blend 1 cup mayonnaise, ½ cup chicken stock; ½ cup diced celery, 2 tablespoons chopped parsley.
Mix well, pour over first layer.
Chill till firm.
Cut into squares, invert on salad greens.
Top with mayonnaise and pecan half.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SAUSAGE RING**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 pounds bulk sausage meat
- 11/2 cups cracker crumbs
- 2 eggs slightly beaten
- 1/4 cup minced onion
- 1 cup finely chopped apple
- Scrambled or creamed eggs (optional)
- Fried or stewed apples (optional)
- Creamed chicken (optional)
- Broiled pineapple (optional)
- Peach halves (optional)
- Apricots (optional)
<|steps|>
Mix ingredients in order given.
Form into ring in a shallow baking pan.
Bake at 350° for one hour.
Drain fat from pan.
Fill center with scrambled or creamed eggs, fried or stewed apples, or creamed chicken.
Garnish ring with broiled pineapple, peach halves or apricots.
May be prepared and cooked one half the baking time the day before it is to be served, then complete the baking at serving time.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SKILLET STROGANOFF SANDWICHES**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 tablespoons butter or margarine
- 1 cup chopped onion
- 1/4 teaspoon finely chopped garlic
- 1 pound (2 cups) ground beef
- 1 tablespoon flour
- 2 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1 teaspoon nutmeg
- 1/2 cup chopped cooked mushrooms
- 1 (No.1) can condensed cream of mushroom soup
- 1 cup sour cream
- 10 sliced sandwich buns
<|steps|>
Melt butter or margarine in skillet.
Add onion, garlic, and ground beef and saute until browned.
Combine flour, salt, paprika, and nutmeg.
Sprinkle over meat mixture, and stir until blended.
Add mushrooms and mushroom soup to meat mixture.
Simmer for 10 minutes at low heat.
Pour sour cream over top.
Cover, and simmer 5 minutes longer.
To serve, place 1/3 cup hamburger Stroganoff in each bun.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CAULIFLOWER WITH ONION RINGS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 medium cauliflower (2 packages frozen)
- 11/2 cups water
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 small can evaporated milk
- 4 tablespoons butter
- 4 tablespoons flour
- ⅛ teaspoon pepper
- 1 cup grated yellow cheese
- 1 can fried onion rings
<|steps|>
Divide cauliflower into flowettes.
Cook until just tender.
Drain and save stock.
Add enough stock to canned milk to make two cups.
Make sauce of 4 tablespoons butter, 4 tablespoons flour, ⅛ teaspoon pepper and the two cups of stock-milk mixture.
Arrange in casserole in following order: ½ the cauliflower; ½ cheese; ½ sauce; ½ onion rings.
Repeat.
Bake 25 to 30 minutes at 350° or until very hot and bubbly.
May be made several hours or day before and refrigerated until 30 minutes before serving time.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRIED RICE WITH ALMONDS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 tablespoons salad oil
- 1 small onion, chopped
- 1 green pepper, chopped
- 1 teaspoon garlic salt
- 1 teaspoon pepper
- 2 cups boiled rice (can be cold)
- 2 tablespoons Soy Sauce
- 1 cup blanched almonds, split lengthwise
<|steps|>
Cook onion, green pepper, garlic salt, and pepper in oil for five minutes.
Add the rice, Soy sauce, and almonds: mix well, and steam until thoroughly heated.
Good with Sweet and Sour Spareribs, chicken or shrimp.
It is easy to serve buffet style.
Can be prepared in advance and reheated at the last minute.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **GLORIOUS GRITS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup grits
- 1 roll garlic cheese or American cheese
- 1 stick margarine
- 3 eggs
- Milk, (enough to make 1 cup when adding the three beaten eggs)
- 1/4 pound sharpe cheese
<|steps|>
Cook 1 cup grits, while grits is still hot, add 1 roll garlic cheese, 1 stick margarine, 3 eggs beaten with enough milk to make 1 cup.
Place in casserole dish and bake 3 minutes, at 350 degrees F.
Sprinkle with sharp cheese and put back in oven until cheese melts.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **GREEN BEAN BAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can chedder cheese soup
- ⅓ cup milk
- 3 cups cooked and drained French Style green beans
- 1 can (31/2 oz.) French Fried onions
<|steps|>
In 1½ quart casserole, stir chedder cheese soup until smooth.
Gradually add milk.
Mix cooked beans and 1 can onions into soup mixture.
Bake 350°F for 20 minutes or until bubbling.
Sprinkle remaining onions on top of casserole.
Bake 5 minutes longer.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **RICE O'BRIEN**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup diced green pepper
- 1/4 cup butter or margarine
- 2 cups uncooked rice
- 4 cups chicken broth
- 2 teaspoons salt
- 1 cup chopped pimiento
<|steps|>
Cook green pepper in butter until tender.
Add rice, chicken broth, and salt.
Heat to boiling; stir once.
Cover.
Reduce heat and simmer for 14 minutes, or until liquid is absorbed.
Remove from heat and toss lightly with pimiento.
Serve hot.
Rice keeps well in refrigerator and reheats easily.
May be frozen too.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TUNA CHOW**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can mushroom soup
- 1/4 cup water
- 2 cups chow mein noodles
- 1 can tuna fish
- 1 cup sliced celery
- 1/4 cup chopped onion
- 1/2 cup salted cashew nuts
- Dash of pepper
- 1 can mandarin orange sections
<|steps|>
Combine soup and water.
Add 1 cup of noodles and all other things.
Toss lightly.
Place in ungreased baking dish.
Sprinkle remaining noodles over top.
Bake at 375° for ½ hour.
Just before serving put 1 can of drained mandarin orange sections over top.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **APRICOT SALAD WITH TOPPING**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 packages orange jello
- 31/2 cups hot water
- 16 marshmallows (cut fine)
- 1 large can peeled apricots, cut and drained
- Liquid from apricots
- 1 7 ounce can crushed pineapple, drained
- Liquid from pineapple
- **Topping Ingredients:**
- 1/4 cup sugar
- 1 heaping tablespoon cornstarch
- Dash of salt
- 1/4 cup apricot juice
- 1/4 cup pineapple juice
- 1 teaspoon butter
- 1/2 pint whipped cream
<|steps|>
Dissolve jello in hot water, cool and add marshmallows and fruit.
Pour into individual mold, chill until set.
**Topping Steps:**
Combine sugar, constarch, salt and juices.
Cook until thick then add butter.
Let cool and fold in whipped cream.
Pour topping over jello.
Keep cold.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **COLE SLAW SOUFFLE' SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup hot water
- 1 package lemon flavored gelatin
- 1/2 cup cold water
- 2 tablespoons vinegar
- 1/4 cup mayonnaise
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 dash pepper
- 2 cups finely chopped cabbage
- 2 tablespoons minced green pepper
- 1 tablespoons minced onion
- 1/4 teaspoon celery seeds
<|steps|>
Dissolve gelatin in hot water, add cold water, vinegar, mayonnaise, salt, pepper.
Beat with egg beater until well blended.
Pour into ice tray put in freezer 15 to 20 minutes or until firm about 1" from edges but soft in center.
Turn into bowl, with egg beater, beat until fluffy.
Fold in cabbage, pepper, onion, celery seeds.
Pour into mold.
Refrigerate until firm.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ICE BOX DESSERT (OR SALAD)**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 eggs
- 1 cup sugar
- 2 lemons (juice)
- 1 tablespoon (1 pkg.) gelatin
- 1/4 cup cold water
- 1 box dream whip
- 1 no. 3 can sliced Pineapple (chopped)
- 1 can Morgan dark sweet cherries
- 1 cup pecans
- 2 cup miniature marshmallows
<|steps|>
Beat eggs until thick, add sugar, juice of lemons.
Cook until thick (like pie).
Add gelatin dissolved in water.
Stir well with egg mix.
Set aside to cool.
Whip dream whip.
Chop pineapple, cherries and pecans.
Fold fruit, nuts, marshmallows and cream into egg.
Mix.
Chill at least 24 hours.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PINEAPPLE CHEESE SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 number 2 can crushed pineapple
- Juice of 1 lemon
- ¾ cup sugar
- Pinch of salt
- 2 packages of gelatin
- 1 cup water
- ¾ cup grated cheese
- 1 cup cream, whipped
<|steps|>
Combine pineapple, lemon juice, sugar, salt and bring to a boil.
Add to gelatin that has been soaked water.
Beat vigorously and cool.
Stir occasionally.
When it begins to set add cheese and whipped cream.
Let congeal overnight.
Serve on lettuce and top with mayonnaise.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **S. J. S. SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 no. 2 cans tomatoes - pulpy
- 1 box lemon jello
- 2 tablespoons vinegar
- Dash of salt
- 1/2 cup diced celery
- 1 teaspoon celery seed
<|steps|>
Break tomatoes to a pulp.
Add vinegar, dash of salt, celery seed.
Cook to boiling point and pour over jello.
Cool.
Add to celery, put into molds to congeal.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SHRIMP DIP**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 3 ounce packages cream cheese
- 1/2 cup salad dressing
- 3 tablespoons chili sauce
- 2 teaspoons lemon juice
- 1/2 teaspoon onion juice
- 4 teaspoon worchestershire sauce
- 1 pound cooked shrimp or (1 - 15 ounce can), well chopped
<|steps|>
Blend cheese with seasoning.
Add well chopped shrimp.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TUNA SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cans tuna
- 1/2 cup stuffed olives (chopped)
- 2 tablespoons minced onion
- 3 boiled eggs (chopped)
- 1 cup diced celery
- 2 envelopes plain gelatin
- 1/2 cup cold water
- 2 cups mayonnaise
<|steps|>
Dissolve gelatin in cold water and set over pan of hot water.
Then add mayonnaise and rest of ingredients.
Chill in flat pan or dish.
Very much better if made the day before used.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **APRICOT LOAF**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups sifted all-purpose flour
- 1 cup sugar
- 2 teaspoons baking powder
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 egg unbeaten
- 1 cup milk
- 2 tablespoons melted shortening or salad oil
- 1 to 2 cups dried apricots, washed and drained, cut in fourths with scissors
- 1 tablespoon grated orange rind (optional)
<|steps|>
Sift dry ingredients together into small bowl.
Add egg, milk and shortening.
Mix until just blended, about 30 seconds.
Cut apricots in fourths with scissors and fold in with orange rind, being careful not to overmix the batter.
Pour into greased 9 x 5 x 3 inch loaf pan.
Bake in oven 350° for 55 to 60 minutes.
Remove from pan and cool before cutting.
**To Mix by Hand Steps:**
Sift dry ingredients into bowl.
Beat egg and add with milk and shortening to dry ingredients.
Mix until just blended.
Fold in apricots and orange rind, being careful not to overmix.
Bake as stated above.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BUTTER-NUT SNOWBALLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 sticks (1 cup) butter
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 2 teaspoons vanilla
- 2 cups sifted flour
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 2 cups finely chopped pecans
- Powdered sugar
<|steps|>
Cream butter, sugar, and vanilla until fluffy.
Sift flour with salt and add to the mixture, blending thoroughly.
Add pecans and mix well.
Shape into 1 inch balls and place on baking sheet.
Bake in a slow oven (325°F.) about 20 minutes.
Do not brown.
Cool.
Then roll in powdered sugar.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BUTTERSCOTCH COOKIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup butter
- 1 cup brown sugar
- 1 egg or 2 egg yolks
- 1 tablespoon cream
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla
- 1 1/2 cups flour
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 cup chopped walnuts
- 1/2 pound soft butter (not melted)
- 2 cups sugar
- 4 big eggs, whole
- 3 ¾ cups plain flour
- 1 cup milk
- 2 teaspoons baking powder
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1 small box honey graham cracker crumbs
- 1 stick melted butter
- 2 tablespoons powdered sugar
- 2 cups sugar
- 1 large package cream cheese
- 2 teaspoons vanilla
- 1 package lemon jello - small
- 1 cup hot water
- 1 large can evaporated milk (cold), whipped thoroughly
<|steps|>
Melt butter and sugar in sauce pan.
When melted, stir in other ingredients in order listed.
Pour onto buttered cookie sheet.
Bake at above temperature till light touch with finger leaves very slight imprint.
Cookies become chewier and tastier every day they are stored.
**1-2-3-4-CAKE**
Cream butter and sugar well.
Drop in eggs one at a time, beat.
Add milk and flour alternately starting and ending with flour.
Add baking powder to last cup of flour, sifting well.
Add vanilla to last portion of milk.
Important to have everything out of the refrigerator at least an hour before mixing.
**CHEESECAKE**
Line a large dish or pan with a mixture made from crumbs, butter and powdered sugar, saving a few crumbs to sprinkle on top.
Cream sugar and cheese together with vanilla.
Mix lemon jello in one cup hot water.
Let cool.
Whip evaporated milk which has been chilled thoroughly.
Add cream cheese mixture and jello to the milk.
Put mixture in dish, sprinkle crumbs on top and chill.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHERRY WINKS**
<|ingredients|>
- 21/2 cups sifted flour
- 1 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon soda
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- ¾ cup butter
- 1 cup sugar
- 2 eggs
- 2 tablespoons milk
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1 ⅓ cup drained and chopped Maraschino cherries
- 1 cup chopped dates
- 1 cup chopped pecans
- 21/2 cups crushed corn flakes
- One-fourth cherry for topping
<|steps|>
Sift together flour, baking powder, soda, and salt.
Blend together butter, sugar, eggs, milk, and vanilla.
Beat well and blend into the dry ingredients.
Add drained and chopped Maraschino cherries, chopped dates, and chopped pecans.
Drop by rounded teaspoons onto crushed corn flakes.
Toss lightly to form a ball and coat with corn flakes.
Place on baking sheet and top with one-fourth cherry.
Bake 12 - 15 minutes at 375 degrees.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CREAM CHEESE PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 11/2 cups sugar
- ⅓ cup oleo
- 1 tablespoon flour
- 3 eggs
- 1 cup evaporated milk
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- ⅛ teaspoon salt
- 9 inch unbaked pastry
<|steps|>
Place sugar, oleo and flour in bowl, cream.
Add eggs one at a time, beat thoroughly.
Add milk flavoring and salt mix.
Pour in pastry.
Bake in 400°F for 15 minutes.
Reduce heat to 350° and bake 30 minutes longer.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FEUD CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 6 eggs
- 1¾ cups sugar
- 21/2 tablespoons flour
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 3 cups finely ground pecans (like meal)
- 3 cups whipped cream (sweetened)
- Ground pecans for topping
<|steps|>
Separate eggs.
Beat egg yolks with mixer for 5 minutes or by hand for 15 minutes.
Gradually add sugar, then gradually add flour and baking powder.
Stir in pecans.
Fold in beaten egg whites.
Pour into greased, lightly floured pans.
Bake for 30 minutes at 350°.
When cool, frost with sweetened whipped cream.
Sprinkle top with ground pecans.
Keeps several days refrigerated.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **JAM CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup butter
- 3 cups flour
- 2 cups sugar
- 1 cup buttermilk
