- 1 cup blackberry jam (preserves)
- 1 teaspoon soda
- Eggs (implied by steps)
<|steps|>
Cream butter.
Add sugar gradually.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each.
Sift dry ingredients and add alternately with buttermilk and jam.
Bake in 3 nine inch layers at 350°.
**Filling Ingredients:**
- 1 cup crushed pineapple
- 2 tablespoons flour
- 1 tablespoon butter
**Filling Steps:**
Mix all ingredients and cook until thickened, stirring constantly.
When cool spread between layers and on top.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MINCEMEAT CHIFFON PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 envelope (1 tablespoon) unflavored gelatin
- 1/2 cup water
- 1 jar (28 oz.) mincemeat
- 3 egg whites
- 1/2 teaspoon cream of tartar
- 1 cup sugar
- 9 inch baked pie shell, cooled
<|steps|>
Prepare 9 inch baked pie shell and cool.
Soften gelatin in water in saucepan.
Place over low heat, stirring constantly, until gelatin is dissolved.
Remove from heat.
Stir in mincemeat.
Chill until mixture mounds slightly when dropped from spoon.
Beat egg whites with cream of tartar until frothy.
Gradually beat in sugar, a little at a time.
Continue beating until stiff and glossy.
Carefully fold mincemeat into egg white mixture.
Pile into cooked pie shell.
Chill at least 1 hour before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PINEAPPLE UPSIDE-DOWN CAKE MIX**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 box yellow cake mix
- 1 large can crushed pineapple
- 1 box coconut
- 11/2 sticks margarine
- 1/2 pint whipping cream (optional)
- 10 cherries (optional)
<|steps|>
Melt margarine in bottom of pan or casserole dish.
Add the dry cake mix, distributing evenly on top of margarine.
Add crushed pineapple on top of the cake mix, distributing evenly.
Add coconut distributing evenly.
Bake around 35 minutes until coconut is lightly brown.
Top if desired with whipped cream and cherries.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **STRAWBERRY CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 box strawberry jello
- 1/2 cup hot water
- 4 eggs
- Juice of a 1 pound box of frozen strawberries
- White cake mix
- **Icing Ingredients:**
- 1 stick oleo or butter
- 1 box confectioners sugar
- Drained strawberries (left from cake)
<|steps|>
Dissolve the jello in hot water.
Add strawberry juice and eggs.
Mix with the white cake mix.
Beat and cook according to package directions.
Make 4 layers.
**Icing Steps:**
Combine ingredients.
Beat with mixer until of spreading consistency.
Spread on cool layers.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **STRAWBERRY LUSCIOUS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 packages Strawberry gelatin
- 2 cups boiling water
- 1 large package frozen strawberries
- 2 ripe bananas, mashed and whipped
- 1/2 carton dairy sour cream
- 1 #2 can crushed pineapple, undrained
<|steps|>
Dissolve gelatin in boiling water.
Add thawed strawberries with juice, undrained pineapple and bananas which have been mashed and whipped.
Pour half of mixture into an 8 x 12 pan and chill until set.
Spread sour cream over top of congealed layer.
Cover with remaining gelatin.
Chill until firm.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **EASY FUDGE**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 cups sugar
- ¾ cup margarine
- 1 12 ounce can evaporated milk
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1/2 cup chopped nuts
- 1 7 ounce package semi-sweet chocolate bits
- 1 ounce jar marshmallow creme
<|steps|>
Combine sugar, margarine and milk in a sauce pan and bring to a boil.
Stir until the mixture reaches soft ball stage or 238°.
Remove from heat, stir in chocolate bits, add marshmallow creme, vanilla and nuts.
Beat only until well blended.
Pour into a buttered pan.
Cool.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PECAN PRALINES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 1/2 cups sugar
- 1/2 cup buttermilk
- 1/2 teaspoon soda
- 1 tablespoon white corn syrup
- 1 tablespoon oleo or butter
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 2 cups pecans
<|steps|>
Mix first four ingredients in sauce pan and cook over medium heat until it forms a soft ball.
Remove from heat and add oleo and vanilla.
Beat until it looks frothy, add pecans and spoon onto waxed paper.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PETTICOAT TAILS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup soft butter
- 1 cup sifted confectioner's sugar
- 1 teaspoon flavoring (vanilla, almond, wintergreen or rose)
- 21/2 cups sifted plain flour
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
<|steps|>
Mix thoroughly with hands.
Press and mold into a long roll about 2 inches in diameter.
Wrap in wax paper, and chill until stiff (several hours or overnight).
With thin, sharp knife, cut slices ⅛ to 1/16 inches thick.
Place slices a little apart on ungreased baking sheet.
Bake at 400° for 8 to 10 minutes until lightly browned.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ALMOST INSTANT COFFEE CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- ¾ cup firmly packed brown sugar
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/2 cup (1 stick) butter, melted
- 2 packages 8 ounces each; refrigerated biscuit
<|steps|>
In a small bowl blend together sugar and cinnamon.
Put 2 tablespoons melted butter in bottom of mold.
Sprinkle in 4 tablespoons of the sugar-cinnamon mixture.
Dip each biscuit in melted butter.
Then dip in sugar-cinnamon mixture.
Place biscuits from one package in bottom of mold overlapping edges slightly.
Repeat a second layer, with remaining package of biscuits.
Bake at 400° for 12 to 15 minutes.
Allow to stand about 5 minutes.
Loosen around edge with spatula and turn out on serving plate.
Serve immediately.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **OATMEAL MUFFINS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup quick cooking oatmeal
- 1 cup buttermilk
- 1 egg
- 1 cup sugar
- 1 cup cooking oil
- 1 cup sifted flour
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 2 teaspoon soda
<|steps|>
Soak oatmeal in buttermilk one hour.
Add egg and beat well.
Then add sugar and cooking oil.
Add flour sifted with baking powder, salt, and soda.
Stir just enough to mix well.
Fill well-greased muffin tins two thirds full and bake at 400° for 15 to 20 minutes.
These muffins keep fresh for several days.
They can be made several days ahead and warmed as needed.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ANGEL PECAN PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 egg whites beaten stiff
- 1 cup sugar
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1/4 teaspoon baking powder
- ¾ cups graham cracker crumbs
- 1 cup pecans (chopped)
- Whipped cream
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients except whipped cream.
Place in greased pie dish.
Bake 25 minutes at 350°.
Let cool.
Cover with whipped cream.
Let stand awhile before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **APPLE SPICE "DUMP" CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 no. 2 can of sliced pie apples with juice
- ⅓ cup brown sugar
- 1 box prepared spice cake mix
- 1 cup chopped pecans
- 2 sticks oleo or butter, sliced
<|steps|>
Butter cake pan well.
"Dump in" can of pie apples with juice.
Sprinkle with brown sugar.
"Dump in" spice cake mix.
Sprinkle with pecans.
Dot top with sliced butter.
Bake at 350° for 50 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BROWNIE CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup butter
- 1/2 cup shortening
- 3 cups sugar
- 5 eggs
- 3 cups sifted flour
- 1/2 cup cocoa
- 1 cup milk
- 1 cup chopped pecans
<|steps|>
Cream butter, and Crisco until fluffy.
Add sugar gradually and beat until thoroughly mixed.
Add eggs one at a time and beat until smooth.
Add flour and cocoa alternately with milk, beginning and ending with flour.
Pour into greased tube pan.
Sprinkle chopped pecans on top.
Put into cold oven.
Bake at 300° for 2 hours.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ARROZ CON POLLO (CHICKEN WITH RICE)**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 stewing chicken, cut into pieces (save 4 cups broth)
- 11/2 pounds small shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 2 cans mushrooms, stems and pieces
- 1 box frozen English peas
- 1 can (4 oz) pimento, sliced
- 2 small onions, chopped fine
- 1/2 green pepper, chopped fine
- 2 cups canned tomatoes
- 2 teaspoons salt
- 2 teaspoons paprika
- 4 tablespoons fat
- 2 cups raw rice
- 1/2 cup parsley, chopped
<|steps|>
Boil chicken and save 4 cups of broth.
Brown rice in hot fat.
Add chicken broth, bring to a boil, and simmer.
When rice is half done, add frozen peas, cubed chicken pieces, whole shrimp, mushrooms, pimento, onion, green pepper, salt, paprika, and tomatoes.
Simmer until peas, shrimp, and rice are done, stirring occasionally with a fork.
Ensure all broth is absorbed.
Garnish with parsley.
Serve with guacamole in a lettuce cup, garnished with tomato wedges in a Mexican atmosphere.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BAKED CANADIAN BACON**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup brown sugar
- 1 teaspoon dry mustard
- 2 cups unsweetened pineapple juice
- 2 pounds Canadian bacon, in one piece
<|steps|>
Combine brown sugar, dry mustard, and pineapple juice.
Spread mixture over the Canadian bacon.
Bake uncovered at 325°F for 1 hour, basting every 15 minutes.
Slice into 1-inch slices and serve with broiled pineapple slices on top of each slice, if desired.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BEEF CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups leftover pot roast or 1 pound ground beef
- 1 large onion, coarsely cut
- 3 stalks celery, coarsely cut
- 1 green pepper, coarsely cut
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 1 can (101/2 oz) mushroom soup
- 1/2 cup water
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- Dash of black pepper
- 1 can (3 oz) chow mein noodles
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 325°F.
If using ground beef, cook until browned in 1 tablespoon butter; if using pot roast, chop into small cubes and cook for several minutes in 1 tablespoon butter.
Transfer beef to a medium-sized casserole dish.
In the same pan, add remaining butter and cook chopped onion, celery, and green pepper until limp.
Stir in mushroom soup, water, salt, and pepper, then pour over beef in the casserole dish and mix well.
Cover and bake for 30 minutes.
Remove cover, sprinkle chow mein noodles on top, and bake for an additional 10 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN LIVERS ON TOAST POINTS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 pounds chicken livers
- 1¾ cups flour
- 1/8 teaspoon black pepper
- 8 slices salt pork or country bacon
- 2 medium onions, finely chopped
- 1/2 pound thin-sliced mushrooms
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 5 cups chicken broth
- 2 or 3 drops Kitchen Bouquet (optional)
- Pinch of nutmeg
- 11/2 cups sherry
- 1 cup sour cream
- Toast points
- Paprika, for garnish
<|steps|>
Cut chicken livers in half and toss in 1 cup flour mixed with 1/8 teaspoon pepper.
Sauté salt pork or bacon until very crisp, remove, drain on paper towels, and keep warm.
Sauté livers in the drippings until cooked, then remove and drain on paper towels.
Sauté onions in the same pan until almost tender, add mushrooms, and cook until tender; remove and add to livers.
Add 2 tablespoons butter to the drippings, stir in ¾ cup flour, and cook, stirring constantly, until flour begins to brown (avoid burning).
Add chicken broth and stir until smooth and thickened.
If the sauce looks pale, add Kitchen Bouquet for color.
Season with nutmeg, salt, and pepper to taste.
Return livers, onions, and mushrooms to the sauce and heat through.
Stir in sour cream and sherry.
Serve on toast points, sprinkle with crumbled pork or bacon, and dust with paprika.
Note: Can be prepared ahead, reheated at serving time (add cream and sherry then), or frozen.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN SPAGHETTI**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 (3-pound) fryer or hen
- 2 tablespoons cooking oil or oleo
- ¾ cup celery, chopped
- 1 cup bell pepper, chopped
- 1 cup onion, chopped
- 2 cans cream of chicken soup
- 1 can chicken broth
- ¾ cup grated cheese
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Spaghetti (quantity not specified, cook as needed)
<|steps|>
Season chicken with salt and pepper, cook in a small amount of water until tender, then cool and bone, cutting into small pieces.
Sauté celery, onions, and bell pepper in cooking oil or oleo.
Add cream of chicken soup and chicken broth, then let simmer.
Add boned chicken to the mixture.
Cook spaghetti as usual and drain.
In a greased 2-quart casserole, layer spaghetti and chicken mixture.
Sprinkle grated cheese on top.
Bake at 350°F for 30-35 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CRANBERRY CHICKEN LAYER**
<|ingredients|>
- **Layer I:**
- 1 envelope unflavored gelatin
- 1/4 cup cold water
- 1 pound can whole cranberry sauce
- 1 (9 oz) can crushed pineapple
- 1/2 cup chopped pecans or other nuts
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- **Layer II:**
- 1 envelope unflavored gelatin
- 1/4 cup chicken stock
- 1 cup mayonnaise
- 1/2 cup chicken stock
- 1/2 cup diced celery
- 2 tablespoons chopped parsley
- Salad greens, mayonnaise, and pecan halves for garnish
<|steps|>
**Layer I:** Soften 1 envelope gelatin in ¼ cup cold water, dissolve over hot water.
Add cranberry sauce, crushed pineapple, chopped pecans, and lemon juice to gelatin.
Pour into a 10 x 16 x 1½-inch baking dish rubbed with salad oil, chill until set.
**Layer II:** Soften 1 envelope gelatin in ¼ cup chicken stock, dissolve over hot water.
Blend mayonnaise, ½ cup chicken stock, diced celery, and chopped parsley with gelatin.
Pour over the set first layer and chill until firm.
Cut into squares, invert onto salad greens, and top with mayonnaise and a pecan half.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SAUSAGE RING**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 pounds bulk sausage meat
- 11/2 cups cracker crumbs
- 2 eggs, slightly beaten
- 1/4 cup minced onion
- 1 cup finely chopped apple
- Scrambled or creamed eggs, fried or stewed apples, or creamed chicken for filling
- Broiled pineapple, peach halves, or apricots for garnish
<|steps|>
Mix sausage, cracker crumbs, eggs, onion, and apple in the order given.
Form into a ring in a shallow baking pan.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour, then drain fat from the pan.
Fill the center with scrambled or creamed eggs, fried or stewed apples, or creamed chicken.
Garnish with broiled pineapple, peach halves, or apricots.
Note: Can be prepared and baked for half the time the day before, then complete baking at serving time.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SKILLET STROGANOFF SANDWICHES**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 tablespoons butter or margarine
- 1 cup chopped onion
- 1/2 teaspoon finely chopped garlic
- 1 pound (2 cups) ground beef
- 2 tablespoons flour
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
- 1/2 cup chopped cooked mushrooms
- 1 can (No. 1) condensed cream of mushroom soup
- 1 cup sour cream
- 10 sliced sandwich buns
<|steps|>
Melt butter in a skillet, add onion, garlic, and ground beef, and sauté until browned.
Combine flour, salt, paprika, and nutmeg, sprinkle over the meat mixture, and stir until blended.
Add mushrooms and mushroom soup to the meat mixture, then simmer for 10 minutes on low heat.
Pour sour cream over the top, cover, and simmer for 5 minutes longer.
Serve by placing 1/3 cup of the hamburger stroganoff in each bun.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ASPARAGUS WITH CHESTNUTS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can (12 oz) white asparagus
- 1 can regular celery soup
- 1 can water chestnuts, sliced
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Oleo or butter
- Cracker crumb topping
<|steps|>
In a buttered 1-quart casserole, layer white asparagus, celery soup, and sliced water chestnuts alternately.
Sprinkle cracker crumbs on top and dot with oleo or butter.
Bake at 375°F for 20-25 minutes until bubbling hot.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CAULIFLOWER WITH ONION RINGS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 medium cauliflowers (or 2 packages frozen)
- 11/2 cups water
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 small can evaporated milk
- 4 tablespoons butter
- 4 tablespoons flour
- 1/8 teaspoon pepper
- 1 cup grated yellow cheese
- 1 can fried onion rings
<|steps|>
Divide cauliflower into florets and cook until just tender; drain and save stock.
Add enough stock to evaporated milk to make 2 cups.
Make a sauce with 4 tablespoons butter, 4 tablespoons flour, 1/8 teaspoon pepper, and the 2 cups stock-milk mixture.
In a 1½- or 2-quart casserole, layer half the cauliflower, half the cheese, half the sauce, and half the onion rings; repeat layers.
Bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes until very hot and bubbly.
Note: Can be made several hours or a day ahead and refrigerated until 30 minutes before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRIED RICE WITH ALMONDS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 tablespoons salad oil
- 1 small onion, chopped
- 1/2 green pepper, chopped
- 1 teaspoon garlic salt
- 1 teaspoon pepper
- 2 cups boiled rice (can be cold)
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 1/2 cup blanched almonds, split lengthwise
<|steps|>
Cook onion, green pepper, garlic salt, and pepper in salad oil for 5 minutes.
Add rice, soy sauce, and almonds; mix well.
Steam until thoroughly heated.
Note: Can be prepared in advance and reheated; good with sweet and sour spareribs, chicken, or shrimp, and easy for buffet-style serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **GLORIOUS GRITS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup grits
- 1 roll garlic cheese or American cheese
- 1 stick margarine
- 3 eggs
- Milk (enough to make 1 cup when added to beaten eggs)
- 1/4 pound sharp cheese, grated
<|steps|>
Cook 1 cup grits according to package instructions.
While grits are hot, add garlic or American cheese and margarine, stirring until melted.
Beat 3 eggs with enough milk to make 1 cup, then add to grits mixture.
Place in a 1½-quart casserole dish and bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.
Sprinkle with sharp cheese and return to oven until cheese melts.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **GREEN BEAN BAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can cheddar cheese soup
- 1/3 cup milk
- 3 cups cooked and drained French-style green beans (fresh, canned, or frozen)
- 1 can (31/2 oz) French fried onions
<|steps|>
In a 1½-quart casserole, stir cheddar cheese soup until smooth, then gradually add milk.
Mix in cooked green beans and half the can of French fried onions.
Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes or until bubbling.
Sprinkle remaining onions on top and bake for an additional 5 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HUNGRY BOY CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- **Casserole:**
- 1 pound ground meat
- 1 cup diced celery
- 1 cup chopped onion
- 1/2 cup green peppers
- 1 clove minced garlic
- 11/4 cups water
- ¾ cup tomato paste (6 oz can)
- ¾ teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon Accent
- 1 pound can pork and beans
- 1 can lima beans, drained
- **Biscuits:**
- 11/2 cups flour
- 2 teaspoons baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 cup shortening
- 1 egg
- Milk (enough to make 1/2 cup with egg)
- 1 tablespoon salad oil
- 1/2 cup sliced stuffed olives
- 1/2 cup slivered almonds
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- 1 cup reserved meat mixture
<|steps|>
**Casserole:** Sauté ground meat, celery, onion, green peppers, and garlic in a large skillet; drain.
Add water, tomato paste, salt, paprika, and Accent; simmer for 5 minutes.
Reserve 1 cup of meat mixture for biscuits.
Add pork and beans and lima beans to the remaining meat mixture, then transfer to an 8 x 13-inch or 2-quart baking dish.
**Biscuits:** Sift flour, baking powder, and salt; cut in shortening.
Combine egg with enough milk to make ½ cup, add to flour mixture, and stir until dough clings together.
Knead dough lightly about 12 times, then roll into a triangle.
Brush with salad oil, combine reserved meat, olives, almonds, and paprika, and spread on dough.
Roll dough as for a jelly roll, slice into 1-inch biscuits, and place on top of casserole.
Dot biscuits with butter and sprinkle with paprika.
Bake at 425°F for 25-30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LIVER DE LUXE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pound calf's liver
- Flour, for dredging
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- 1/4 teaspoon garlic salt
- Butter, for browning
- 1 cup chopped onion
- 1 small can mushrooms
- 1/3 cup burgundy wine
<|steps|>
Dredge liver pieces with flour seasoned with salt, pepper, and garlic salt.
Brown liver gently on both sides in butter.
Blend onion, mushrooms, and burgundy wine to make a sauce.
Pour sauce over liver and cook on very low heat for 25 minutes.
Place on a hot serving platter and top with the sauce.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **RICE O'BRIEN**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup diced green pepper
- 1/4 cup butter or margarine
- 2 cups uncooked rice
- 4 cups chicken broth
- 2 teaspoons salt
- 1 cup chopped pimiento
<|steps|>
Cook green pepper in butter until tender.
Add rice, chicken broth, and salt; heat to boiling and stir once.
Cover, reduce heat, and simmer for 14 minutes or until liquid is absorbed.
Remove from heat and toss lightly with pimiento.
Serve hot.
Note: Rice keeps well in the refrigerator, reheats easily, and can be frozen.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TUNA CHOW**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can mushroom soup
- 1/4 cup water
- 2 cups chow mein noodles
- 1 can tuna fish
- 1 cup sliced celery
- 1/2 cup chopped onion
- 1/4 cup salted cashew nuts
- Dash of pepper
- 1 can mandarin orange sections, drained
<|steps|>
Combine mushroom soup and water.
Add 1 cup chow mein noodles, tuna, celery, onion, cashew nuts, and pepper; toss lightly.
Place in an ungreased 1-quart baking dish and sprinkle remaining noodles on top.
Bake at 375°F for 30 minutes.
Just before serving, top with drained mandarin orange sections.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **APRICOT SALAD WITH TOPPING**
<|ingredients|>
- **Salad:**
- 2 packages orange jello
- 31/2 cups hot water
- 16 marshmallows, cut fine
- Liquid from apricots
- 1 large can peeled apricots, cut and drained
- 1 (7 oz) can crushed pineapple, drained
- Liquid from pineapple
- **Topping:**
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1 heaping tablespoon cornstarch
- Dash of salt
- 1/2 cup apricot juice
- 1/2 cup pineapple juice
- 1 teaspoon butter
- 1/2 pint whipped cream
<|steps|>
**Salad:** Dissolve jello in hot water, cool, and add marshmallows, apricots, pineapple, and their liquids.
Pour into 8 individual molds and chill until set.
**Topping:** Combine sugar, cornstarch, salt, apricot juice, and pineapple juice; cook until thick.
Add butter, let cool, then fold in whipped cream.
Pour topping over set jello and keep cold.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN SALAD - TOMATO ASPIC RING**
<|ingredients|>
- **Chicken Salad:**
- 2 cups diced, cooked chicken
- 2 cups diced celery
- French dressing
- 2 tablespoons thin slices of pickles or olives
- Mayonnaise dressing
- **Tomato Aspic:**
- 2 teaspoons gelatin
- 2 2/3 cups tomato juice
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- Few grains pepper
- Lettuce leaves for serving
<|steps|>
**Chicken Salad:** Mix chicken, celery, and pickles; moisten with French dressing and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
**Tomato Aspic:** Mix 2/3 cup tomato juice with gelatin and let stand for 5 minutes.
Heat remaining tomato juice with salt and pepper for 5 minutes, dissolve gelatin in the hot juice, strain, and cool.
Pour aspic into a large ring mold or 8 cup rings and refrigerate until firm.
Arrange chicken salad in the center of the aspic ring, place on cup-shaped lettuce leaves, and garnish with mayonnaise.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **COLE SLAW SOUFFLÉ SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup hot water
- 1 package lemon-flavored gelatin
- 1/2 cup cold water
- 1/4 cup mayonnaise
- 2 tablespoons vinegar
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- Dash of pepper
- 2 cups finely chopped cabbage
- 2 tablespoons minced green pepper
- 2 tablespoons minced onion
- 1/4 teaspoon celery seeds
<|steps|>
Dissolve gelatin in hot water, add cold water, mayonnaise, vinegar, salt, and pepper; beat with an egg beater until well blended.
Pour into an ice tray and freeze for 15-20 minutes until firm about 1 inch from edges but soft in the center.
Turn into a bowl and beat with an egg beater until fluffy.
Fold in cabbage, green pepper, onion, and celery seeds.
Pour into a ring mold and refrigerate until firm.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ICE BOX DESSERT (OR SALAD)**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 eggs
- 1 cup sugar
- Juice of 2 lemons
- 1 tablespoon (1 pkg) gelatin
- 1/4 cup cold water
- 1 box Dream Whip
- 1 No. 3 can sliced pineapple, chopped
- 1 can Morgan dark sweet cherries
- 1/2 cup miniature marshmallows
- 1/2 cup pecans, chopped
<|steps|>
Beat eggs until thick, add sugar and lemon juice, and cook until thick (like pie filling).
Dissolve gelatin in cold water, then stir into the egg mixture; set aside to cool.
Prepare Dream Whip according to package instructions.
Chop pineapple, cherries, and pecans.
Fold fruit, nuts, marshmallows, and Dream Whip into the cooled egg mixture.
Pour into a large pan and chill for at least 24 hours.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PINEAPPLE CHEESE SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 No. 2 can crushed pineapple
- Juice of 1 lemon
- ¾ cup sugar
- Pinch of salt
- 2 packages gelatin
- 1 cup water
- ¾ cup grated cheese
- 1 cup cream, whipped
- Lettuce and mayonnaise for serving
<|steps|>
Combine pineapple, lemon juice, sugar, and salt; bring to a boil.
Soak gelatin in water, then add to the hot pineapple mixture; beat vigorously and cool, stirring occasionally.
When the mixture begins to set, add grated cheese and whipped cream.
Pour into individual molds, an 8 x 12-inch pan, or a large ring mold; let congeal overnight.
Serve on lettuce, topped with mayonnaise.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **S.J.'S SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 No. 2 can tomatoes, pulpy
- 1 box lemon jello
- 2 tablespoons vinegar
- Dash of salt
- 1 teaspoon celery seed
- 1/2 cup diced celery
<|steps|>
Break tomatoes into a pulp, add vinegar, salt, and celery seed; cook to boiling point.
Pour hot tomato mixture over jello to dissolve.
Cool, then add diced celery.
Pour into individual molds and chill until congealed.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SHRIMP DIP**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 (3 oz) packages cream cheese
- 1/2 cup salad dressing
- 3 tablespoons chili sauce
- 2 teaspoons lemon juice
- 1/2 teaspoon onion juice
- 4 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce
- 1 pound cooked shrimp or 1 (15 oz) can, well chopped
<|steps|>
Blend cream cheese with salad dressing, chili sauce, lemon juice, onion juice, and Worcestershire sauce.
Add well-chopped shrimp and mix thoroughly.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TUNA SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cans tuna
- 1/2 cup stuffed olives, chopped
- 2 tablespoons minced onion
- 3 boiled eggs, chopped
- 1 cup diced celery
- 2 envelopes plain gelatin
- 1/2 cup cold water
- 2 cups mayonnaise
<|steps|>
Dissolve gelatin in cold water and set over a pan of hot water to melt.
Combine melted gelatin with mayonnaise, tuna, olives, onion, eggs, and celery; mix well.
Pour into a flat pan or dish and chill, preferably overnight.
Cut into squares of desired size for serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **APRICOT LOAF**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups sifted all-purpose flour
- 1 cup sugar
- 2 teaspoons baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 egg, unbeaten
- 1 cup milk
- 2 tablespoons melted shortening or salad oil
- 1 to 2 cups dried apricots, washed and drained
- 1 tablespoon grated orange rind (optional)
<|steps|>
Sift flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt into a small bowl.
Add egg, milk, and shortening; mix until just blended, about 30 seconds.
Cut apricots into fourths with scissors and fold into the batter with orange rind, being careful not to overmix.
Pour into a greased 9 x 5 x 3-inch loaf pan.
Bake at 350°F for 55-60 minutes.
Remove from pan and cool before cutting.
**By Hand:** Beat egg, then mix with milk and shortening; add to sifted dry ingredients, blend, fold in apricots and orange rind, and bake as above.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ALMOST INSTANT COFFEE CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- ¾ cup firmly packed brown sugar
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/2 cup (1 stick) butter, melted
- 2 (8 oz) packages refrigerated biscuits
<|steps|>
Blend brown sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl.
Pour 2 tablespoons melted butter into the bottom of a ring mold, then sprinkle with 4 tablespoons of the sugar-cinnamon mixture.
Dip each biscuit in melted butter, then in the sugar-cinnamon mixture.
Place biscuits from one package in the bottom of the mold, overlapping edges slightly; repeat with the second package for a second layer.
Bake at 400°F for 12-15 minutes.
Let stand for about 5 minutes, loosen edges with a spatula, and turn out onto a serving plate.
Serve immediately.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **OATMEAL MUFFINS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup quick-cooking oatmeal
- 1 cup buttermilk
- 1 egg
- 1 cup sugar
- 1/4 cup cooking oil
- 1 cup sifted flour
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
<|steps|>
Soak oatmeal in buttermilk for 1 hour.
Add egg and beat well, then add sugar and cooking oil.
Sift flour with baking powder, salt, and baking soda; add to oatmeal mixture and stir just enough to mix well.
Fill well-greased muffin tins two-thirds full.
Bake at 400°F for 15-20 minutes.
Note: Muffins keep fresh for several days and can be made ahead and warmed as needed.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ANGEL PECAN PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 egg whites, beaten stiff
- 1 cup sugar
- 1/4 teaspoon baking powder
- ¾ cup graham cracker crumbs
- 1 cup chopped pecans
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- Whipped cream, for topping
<|steps|>
Combine sugar, baking powder, graham cracker crumbs, pecans, and vanilla; fold into beaten egg whites.
Place mixture in a greased 8-inch pie dish.
Bake at 350°F for 25 minutes.
Let cool, then cover with whipped cream and let stand before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **APPLE SPICE "DUMP" CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 No. 2 can sliced pie apples
- 1/3 cup brown sugar
- 1 box prepared spice cake mix
- 1 cup chopped pecans
- 2 sticks oleo or butter
<|steps|>
Butter a cake pan well.
Pour in the can of pie apples with juice, sprinkle with brown sugar.
Add spice cake mix, sprinkle with pecans, and dot with sliced butter.
Bake at 350°F for 50 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BROWNIE CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup butter
- 1/2 cup shortening
- 3 cups sugar
- 5 eggs
- 3 cups sifted flour
- 1/2 cup cocoa
- 1 cup milk
- 1/2 cup chopped pecans
<|steps|>
Cream butter and shortening until fluffy.
Gradually add sugar and beat until thoroughly mixed.
Add eggs one at a time, beating until smooth.
Add flour and cocoa alternately with milk, beginning and ending with flour.
Pour into a greased tube pan and sprinkle chopped pecans on top.
Place in a cold oven, then bake at 300°F for 2 hours.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BUTTER-NUT SNOWBALLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup (2 sticks) butter
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 2 teaspoons vanilla
- 2 cups sifted flour
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 2 cups finely chopped pecans
- Powdered sugar, for coating
<|steps|>
Cream butter, sugar, and vanilla until fluffy.
Sift flour with salt and add to the butter mixture, blending thoroughly.
Add pecans and mix well.
Shape into 1-inch balls and place on a baking sheet.
Bake at 325°F for about 20 minutes; do not brown.
Cool, then roll in powdered sugar.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BUTTERSCOTCH COOKIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup butter
- 1 cup brown sugar
- 1 egg or 2 egg yolks
- 1 tablespoon cream
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla
- 11/2 cups flour
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 cup chopped walnuts
<|steps|>
Melt butter and brown sugar in a saucepan.
Stir in egg, cream, vanilla, flour, baking powder, and walnuts in the order listed.
Pour onto a buttered cookie sheet.
Bake at 350°F for 20-25 minutes until a light touch with a finger leaves a very slight imprint.
Note: Cookies become chewier and tastier when stored.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **1-2-3-4 CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 pound soft butter (not melted)
- 2 cups sugar
- 4 large eggs
- 3¾ cups plain flour
- 1 cup milk
- 2 teaspoons baking powder
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1 small box honey graham cracker crumbs
- 1 stick melted butter
- 2 tablespoons powdered sugar
- 1 large package cream cheese
- 1 cup sugar
- 2 teaspoons vanilla
- 1 small package lemon jello
- 1 cup hot water
- 1 large can evaporated milk, chilled
<|steps|>
Ensure all ingredients are at room temperature (out of the refrigerator for at least 1 hour).
Cream butter and sugar well.
Add eggs one at a time, beating after each addition.
Add milk and flour alternately, starting and ending with flour.
Sift baking powder with the last cup of flour.
Add vanilla to the last portion of milk.
Pour into a greased and floured tube pan.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour.
**CHEESECAKE**
Mix graham cracker crumbs, melted butter, and powdered sugar; line a large dish or pan with the mixture, reserving some crumbs for topping.
Cream sugar, cream cheese, and vanilla together.
Dissolve lemon jello in 1 cup hot water and let cool.
Whip chilled evaporated milk, then add cream cheese mixture and cooled jello.
Pour into the crumb-lined dish, sprinkle reserved crumbs on top, and chill.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHERRY WINKS**
<|ingredients|>
- 21/2 cups sifted flour
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- ¾ cup butter
- 1 cup sugar
- 2 eggs
- 2 tablespoons milk
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1 cup chopped dates
- 1 cup chopped pecans
- 1/3 cup drained and chopped maraschino cherries
- 21/2 cups crushed corn flakes
- Additional maraschino cherries, quartered, for topping
<|steps|>
Sift flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together.
Blend butter, sugar, eggs, milk, and vanilla; beat well.
Mix wet ingredients into dry ingredients, then add dates, pecans, and chopped cherries.
Drop by rounded teaspoons into crushed corn flakes, toss lightly to coat, and form into balls.
Place on a baking sheet and top each with a quarter of a maraschino cherry.
Bake at 375°F for 12-15 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CREAM CHESS PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 11/2 cups sugar
- 1/3 cup oleo
- 1 tablespoon flour
- 3 eggs
- 1 cup evaporated milk
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1/8 teaspoon salt
- 9-inch unbaked pastry shell
<|steps|>
Cream sugar, oleo, and flour in a bowl.
Add eggs one at a time, beating thoroughly.
Mix in evaporated milk, vanilla, and salt.
Pour into the unbaked pastry shell.
Bake at 400°F for 15 minutes, then reduce heat to 350°F and bake for 30 minutes longer.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FEUD CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 6 eggs
- 11/2 cups sugar
- 21/2 tablespoons flour
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 3 cups finely ground pecans (like meal)
- 3 cups whipped cream, sweetened (preferably with confectioners' sugar)
- Additional ground pecans for topping
<|steps|>
Separate eggs; beat yolks with a mixer for 5 minutes or by hand for 15 minutes.
Gradually add sugar, then flour and baking powder.
Stir in ground pecans, then fold in beaten egg whites.
Pour into two greased and lightly floured 8 x 8-inch pans.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.
When cool, frost with sweetened whipped cream and sprinkle with ground pecans.
Refrigerate; keeps for several days.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **JAM CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- **Cake:**
- 1 cup butter
- 2 cups sugar
- 3 eggs
- 3 cups flour
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 cup buttermilk
- 1 cup blackberry jam (preserves)
- **Filling:**
- 1 cup crushed pineapple
- 1 tablespoon flour
- 2 tablespoons butter
<|steps|>
**Cake:** Cream butter, then gradually add sugar.
Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each.
Sift flour and baking soda together, then add alternately with buttermilk and jam.
Pour into three 9-inch layer pans and bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.
**Filling:** Mix pineapple, flour, and butter; cook until thickened, stirring constantly.
When cool, spread filling between layers and on top of the cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MINCEMEAT CHIFFON PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 envelope (1 tablespoon) unflavored gelatin
- 1/2 cup water
- 1 (28 oz) jar mincemeat
- 3 egg whites
- 1/4 teaspoon cream of tartar
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 9-inch baked pie shell
<|steps|>
Soften gelatin in water in a saucepan, then heat over low heat, stirring until dissolved.
Remove from heat and stir in mincemeat; chill until the mixture mounds slightly when dropped from a spoon.
Beat egg whites with cream of tartar until frothy, then gradually beat in sugar until stiff and glossy.
Fold mincemeat mixture into egg whites.
Pile into the baked pie shell and chill for at least 1 hour before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PINEAPPLE UPSIDE-DOWN CAKE MIX**
<|ingredients|>
- 11/2 sticks margarine
- 1 box yellow cake mix
- 1 large can crushed pineapple
- 1 box coconut
- 1/2 pint whipping cream (optional)
- 10 cherries (optional)
<|steps|>
Melt margarine in the bottom of a 9 x 12-inch pan or casserole dish.
Sprinkle dry yellow cake mix evenly over the margarine.
Spread crushed pineapple evenly over the cake mix.
Sprinkle coconut evenly on top.
Bake at 325°F for about 35 minutes until the coconut is lightly browned.
Top with whipped cream and cherries, if desired.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **STRAWBERRY CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- **Cake:**
- 1 box strawberry jello
- 1/2 cup hot water
- Juice from a 1-pound box of frozen strawberries
- 4 eggs
- 1 box white cake mix
- **Icing:**
- 1 stick oleo or butter
- 1 box confectioners' sugar
- Drained strawberries (from cake)
<|steps|>
**Cake:** Dissolve jello in hot water, then add strawberry juice and eggs.
Mix with white cake mix and beat according to package directions.
Pour into four 8 x 12-inch pans and bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes.
**Icing:** Combine oleo, confectioners' sugar, and drained strawberries; beat until spreadable.
Spread icing on cooled cake layers.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **STRAWBERRY LUSCIOUS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 packages strawberry gelatin
- 2 cups boiling water
- 1 large package frozen strawberries
- 1 No. 2 can crushed pineapple
- 2 ripe bananas
- 1/2 carton dairy sour cream
<|steps|>
Dissolve gelatin in boiling water.
Add thawed strawberries with juice, undrained pineapple, and mashed, whipped bananas.
Pour half the mixture into an 8 x 12-inch pan and chill until set.
Spread sour cream over the congealed layer.
Cover with the remaining gelatin mixture and chill until firm.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **EASY FUDGE**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 cups sugar
- ¾ cup margarine
- 1 (6 oz) can evaporated milk
- 1 (12 oz) package semi-sweet chocolate bits
- 1 (7 oz) jar marshmallow creme
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1 cup chopped nuts
<|steps|>
Combine sugar, margarine, and evaporated milk in a saucepan and bring to a boil.
Cook, stirring, until the mixture reaches the soft ball stage or 238°F.
Remove from heat and stir in chocolate bits.
Add marshmallow creme, vanilla, and nuts; beat until well blended.
Pour into a buttered 13 x 9-inch pan and cool.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PECAN PRALINES**
<|ingredients|>
- 11/2 cups sugar
- 1/2 cup buttermilk
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 tablespoon white corn syrup
- 1 tablespoon oleo or butter
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla
- 11/2 cups pecans
<|steps|>
Mix sugar, buttermilk, baking soda, and corn syrup in a saucepan.
Cook over medium heat until the mixture forms a soft ball.
Remove from heat, add oleo and vanilla, and beat until frothy.
Add pecans and spoon onto waxed paper to form 8-10 pralines.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PETTICOAT TAILS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup soft butter
- 1 cup sifted confectioners' sugar
- 1 teaspoon flavoring (vanilla, almond, wintergreen, or rose)
- 21/2 cups sifted plain flour
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
<|steps|>
Mix butter, confectioners' sugar, and flavoring thoroughly with hands.
Sift flour and salt together, then stir into the butter mixture.
Press and mold into a long roll about 2 inches in diameter, wrap in wax paper, and chill until stiff (several hours or overnight).
Slice into 1/8- to 1/16-inch thick slices with a thin, sharp knife.
Place slices slightly apart on an ungreased baking sheet.
Bake at 400°F for 8-10 minutes until lightly browned.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HOT BUTTERED PUNCH**
<|ingredients|>
- ¾ cup brown sugar, firmly packed
- 1 cup water
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
- 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/2 teaspoon allspice
- ¾ teaspoon cloves
- 2 cans jellied cranberries
- 3 cups water
- 1 quart pineapple juice
- Butter, for serving
<|steps|>
Bring brown sugar, 1 cup water, salt, nutmeg, cinnamon, allspice, and cloves to a boil.
Crush cranberry sauce with a fork or mixer, add 3 cups water, and beat until smooth.
Add cranberry liquid and pineapple juice to the spiced syrup and heat to boiling.
Serve hot, with dots of butter in each cup of punch.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **GINGER ALE SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 tbsp. gelatin
- 2 tbsp. cold water
- 1/2 cup. boiling water
- 1/2 cup. ginger ale
- 2 tbsp. lemon juice
- 1 cup. sliced peaches or pears
- 1 cup. orange sections
- 1/4 cup. fresh strawberries, sliced
- 1/4 cup. grapes, halved or 1/2 cup. diced pineapple
<|steps|>
Soften gelatin in cold water.
Add boiling water, ginger ale, lemon juice, and sugar.
Cool, then add fruits.
Pour into a 1-quart mold or 8 1/2-cup individual molds and chill 6 to 8 hours or overnight.
Makes 8 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **THREE BEAN SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. (1 lb. can) cut green beans, drained
- 2 cup. (1 lb. can) lima beans, drained
- 2 cup. (1 lb. can) kidney beans, drained
- 1 cup. diced peeled tomatoes
- 1 cup. sliced celery
- 1/2 cup. chopped sweet pickle
- French dressing
<|steps|>
Combine vegetables, pickle, and enough dressing to moisten, toss lightly.
Chill.
10 to 12 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TWENTY FOUR HOUR SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. cherries, halved, pitted, and drained
- 2 cup. diced pineapple, drained
- 2 cup. white seedless grapes
- 2 cup. tiny marshmallows
- 1/4 cup. slivered almonds, toasted lightly
- 2 eggs
- Juice of 1 lemon
- 1/4 cup. light cream
- 1 cup. heavy cream
- 2 tbsp. sugar
<|steps|>
Beat eggs until light.
Add sugar, light cream, and lemon juice.
Cook in a double boiler until smooth and thick, stirring constantly.
Let cool.
Whip heavy cream and fold into the above mixture.
Mix lightly with fruit, nuts, and marshmallows.
Chill 24 hours. Do not freeze.
Serve in lettuce cups.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ASPARAGUS ENGLISH PEA CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. asparagus tips
- 1 can mushroom soup
- 1/2 cup. cracker crumbs
- 1 cup. English peas, drained
- 2 hard-cooked eggs, sliced
<|steps|>
Make alternate layers of peas, asparagus, and egg slices in a baking dish.
Add a layer of soup last.
Top with cracker crumbs and dot with butter.
Bake in a 350-degree oven until brown.
Yield: 6 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SEAFOAM SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pkg. lime Jello
- 1 lg. cream cheese
- 1 med. can pears
- 1 carton whipping cream
<|steps|>
Drain pears and cut into bite-size pieces.
Heat 1 cup of pear juice and dissolve the Jello.
Have cream cheese at room temperature and add to pear juice and Jello while it is warm.
Refrigerate and start to congeal.
Add 1 cup of whipped cream and pears.
Congeal.
Cut into squares and serve on lettuce topped with mayonnaise and a cherry.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BARBECUED BEANS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 tall cans pork and beans
- 1/2 cup. syrup
- 1 cup. chopped onions
- 1 cup. chopped celery
- 1 tbsp. chili powder
- 1 tbsp. mustard
- 1 cup. catsup
- 1/2 tsp. black pepper
- 1/2 stick margarine
- 1/2 cup. barbecue sauce
<|steps|>
Cook onions and celery in butter until tender (not brown).
Add all other ingredients and bake 1 1/2 to 2 hours in a slow oven, 300 degrees.
Place several strips of bacon across the top of beans the last hour of baking.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ASPARAGUS PEA CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/4 stick butter
- 1 can asparagus tips
- 2 tbsp. cheese, grated
- 1/2 cup. milk
- 1/2 cup. almonds, sliced (optional)
- 2 cup. canned sweet peas, drained
- 2 hard-boiled eggs, sliced
- 1 can mushroom soup, undiluted
- 1/2 cup. cracker crumbs
<|steps|>
Use part of the butter to grease a casserole dish.
Make layers of peas, asparagus, egg slices, and cheese in the casserole.
Add soup and milk.
Cover with cracker crumbs and almonds.
Dot with remaining butter.
Bake 30 minutes at 425 degrees.
Yield: 6 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **WHITE POTATO PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. hot mashed potatoes (white sweet potatoes)
- 2/3 cup. evaporated milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1 stick oleo
- 5 eggs
<|steps|>
Add sugar and oleo to hot potatoes and let melt.
Add milk, then eggs, one at a time.
Add vanilla and blend well.
Pour into an unbaked pie shell.
Bake at 350 degrees for about 1 hour or until firm.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **WHITE SWEET POTATO PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. cooked potatoes
- 1 tall can evaporated milk
- 4 eggs
- 1 tbsp. vanilla
- 2 sticks margarine
- 3 cup. sugar
- 3 tbsp. flour
- 1 tbsp. lemon
<|steps|>
Pour into unbaked pie shells.
Bake at 350 to 375 degrees until firm.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN TETRAZZINI**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 hen or large fryer
- Salt and pepper
- 1 pkg. spaghetti
- 4 cans cream of mushroom soup
- 1 cup. chopped celery
- 4 small garlic cloves
- 4 medium onions, chopped
- 1/2 cup. chopped almonds
- 2 medium bell peppers, chopped
<|steps|>
Boil hen until completely tender. Cut into chunks.
Cook spaghetti in the boiling chicken broth until tender.
Chop together celery, peppers, onions, and minced garlic. Tenderize in a little oil or fat.
Add to the spaghetti.
Add the chopped chicken and mushroom soup.
Add chopped almonds, salt, and pepper.
Pour into a casserole. Cover with grated cheese.
Bake in a moderate oven for 30 to 40 minutes.
Number of servings: 8 to 10.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HAMBURGER PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 small onion, chopped
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. Accent
- 1 can tomato soup
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1 can green beans
- 2 cup. mashed potatoes
<|steps|>
Heat oven to 350 degrees.
Cook onion in 2 tablespoons of hot fat until yellow, add meat, and cook until brown.
Add seasonings, drained beans, and soup.
Pour into a 1 1/2-quart baking dish.
Spoon mashed potatoes over the top of the mixture.
Bake 30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HOMEMADE CHILI**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 lb. ground beef
- 1 can tomato paste
- 1 can red beans
<|steps|>
Season meat and brown in Wesson oil.
Put in tomato paste and red beans and add about 3 cans of water.
Put in a little sugar to keep tomato from tasting flat and chili powder to taste.
Makes from 4 to 6 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRENCH SHRIMP SHELLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 tbsp. butter or oleo
- 3 tbsp. flour
- 1 1/2 cup. milk
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- Dash pepper
- 1/4 dry sherry
- 1 lb. small, shelled, cooked shrimp
- Grated Parmesan cheese
- Dash paprika
<|steps|>
Melt butter in a saucepan, stir in flour.
Add milk, cook, and stir until thickened.
Stir in salt, pepper, paprika, sherry, and shrimp.
Pour into 5 baking shells.
Sprinkle each with 1 tablespoon Parmesan cheese.
Place under broiler 3 or 4" from heat. Broil until cheese browns.
Lobster or crab may be substituted for shrimp.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **YUMMY PORCUPINE MEATBALLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can (10 1/2 oz.) condensed tomato soup
- 1 lb. ground meat
- 1/4 cup. uncooked rice
- 1 egg, slightly beaten
- 1/4 cup. minced onion
- 2 tbsp. minced parsley
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 small clove garlic, minced
- 2 tbsp. shortening
- 1 cup. water
- 1 pkg. spaghetti
- 2 tbsp. cooking oil
- 1 1/2 lb. ground beef
- 1 tsp. salt
- 2 tbsp. onion, chopped
- 2 tbsp. green pepper, chopped
- Juice of 1/2 lemon
- 2 tbsp. Worcestershire
- 1 can tomato paste
- 1 can water
- 1 can tomato sauce
- 1 can water
- 2 bay leaves
- Dash Tabasco sauce
<|steps|>
Mix 1/4 cup soup with beef, rice, egg, onion, parsley, and salt.
Shape into 1 1/2" balls (about 16).
Brown meatballs and garlic in shortening in a skillet; blend in remaining soup and water.
Cover; simmer 40 minutes or until rice is tender; stir often.
4 servings.
**SPAGHETTI AND MEAT SAUCE**
Brown meat, pepper, and onions in oil.
Add other ingredients and simmer slowly, about 2 hours.
Cook spaghetti according to package directions, drain thoroughly.
Serve sauce over spaghetti.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORNED BEEF CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 onions, chopped
- 1 cup. cheese, grated
- 1 pkg. noodles, cooked
- 1 can corned beef, broken
- 2 slices bread, toasted
- 1/2 cup. bell pepper, chopped
- 1 tbsp. butter
- 1 can mushroom soup, heated
- 2 tbsp. bacon drippings
<|steps|>
Cook onions and pepper in bacon fat until tender.
Cook noodles according to directions on the package.
Add cheese to hot soup.
Combine all ingredients in a casserole, folding in corned beef.
Top with bread crumbs.
Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.
Yield: 10 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BEEF STEW**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 to 1 1/2 lbs. boneless beef, cut in 1 1/2" pieces
- 2 tbsp. flour
- 4 tbsp. shortening
- 2 cup. boiling water
- Minced garlic (optional)
- 4 medium potatoes
- 1 bay leaf
- 2 tsp. salt
- 4 carrots
- 1 cup. chopped onion
<|steps|>
Roll meat in flour and brown with onion slowly for 15 minutes.
Add the bay leaf, half the water, and half the salt.
Cover and simmer for 1 1/2 hours.
Add vegetables, remaining water, salt, and garlic.
Cover again and cook 30 minutes more.
Thicken gravy with 3 tablespoons browned flour.
Serves 4.
Never boil a stew. Let it simmer gently.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **JACK POT CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. round steak, ground
- 1/4 cup. chopped onion
- 1 1/2 cup. water
- 1/2 pkg. noodles
- 1/4 cup. chopped ripe olives
- 2 tbsp. fat
- 1 can tomato soup
- 2 tbsp. Worcestershire
- 1 #2 can cream-style corn
- 1 cup. grated American cheese
<|steps|>
Brown meat in hot fat.
Add onions, cook until golden.
Add tomato soup, water, and noodles.
Cook until noodles are tender, stirring frequently.
Season to taste with salt and black pepper.
Add corn, olives, 1/2 cup of cheese, and Worcestershire sauce.
Pour into a greased 2-quart baking dish.
Sprinkle with remaining cheese.
Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.
Serves eight.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **EASY CHICKEN & RICE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. (scant) cooked rice
- 1 cup. chicken stock
- 2 cup. cooked chicken, chopped
- Grated cheese
- 4 hard-cooked eggs, sliced
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
<|steps|>
Place rice in a casserole, add stock.
Cover with a layer of chicken and egg slices.
Pour soup over this.
Top with cheese.
Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until hot or bubbly.
Yield: 6 to 8 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **KING RANCH CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 fryer or hen
- 1 doz. tortillas
- 1 onion, chopped
- 2 cup. grated cheese
- **Sauce:**
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 1/2 can tomatoes and green chilies
- 1/2 can (soup) chicken broth
<|steps|>
Cook chicken in a small amount of water, lightly salted, until tender.
Bone chicken and cut into pieces.
Into a 2 1/2-quart greased casserole, place a layer of chicken, 1/2 of the tortillas, cut into pieces, 1/2 of the onion, 1/2 of the cheese, and 1/2 of the sauce.
Repeat the layers, ending with cheese.
Bake uncovered in a 350-degree oven for 1 hour.
Serves 8 or 10.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ICE BOX CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 pts. fresh strawberries (save out 12 nice ones for garnish, slice the rest)
- 1 egg plus 1 egg yolk, beaten
- 1 1/2 tsp. vanilla (save 1/2 for whipped cream)
- 1 1/2 cup. heavy cream, whipped
- 3/4 cup. soft butter
- 2 cup. vanilla wafer crumbs (reserve 2 tsp. for top)
- 3 cup. powdered sugar, save 2 tbsp. for cream when whipped
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add beaten egg and 1 teaspoon vanilla.
Consistency should be pourable, but not watery. If the mixture seems too thick, set the bowl in a pan of hot water and stir until thin enough to pour.
Put half the wafer crumbs on the bottom of a pan (a square pan of about 2-quart capacity is about right).
Pour half the cream mixture over the crumb layer, add half the berries, then half of the whipped cream (repeat layers).
Sprinkle reserved crumbs on top.
This dessert should be served partially frozen. If you put it in the freezer for 1 hour, it will be perfect.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LEMON JELLO CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pkg. lemon gelatin
- 1 box lemon cake mix
- 3/4 cup. Wesson oil
- 1 cup. boiling water
- 4 eggs
- 1 tbsp. lemon extract
- **Lemon Glaze:**
- 1/4 cup. lemon juice
- 1 1/2 cup. confectioners' sugar
<|steps|>
Dissolve gelatin in water and let cool slightly.
Add this to the cake mix, then add egg and cooking oil.
After this mixture has cooled, pour into a tube pan and bake in a 350-degree oven for 1 hour.
For the glaze, mix together lemon juice and sugar until smooth.
Ice hot cake.
Note: You may use orange Jello if you wish.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRUIT COCKTAIL CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 1/2 cup. white sugar
- 2 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 cup. vegetable shortening or oleo
- 2 eggs
- 1 #303 can fruit cocktail with juice
- 1/2 cup. brown sugar
- 1/2 cup. pecans
- **Topping:**
- 1 cup. white sugar
- 2 tsp. vanilla
- 1 small can evaporated milk
- 1 stick butter or oleo
<|steps|>
Sift together the first 5 dry ingredients. (If self-rising flour is used, omit salt and baking powder.)
Blend in shortening, beaten eggs, then add fruit cocktail, including juice.
Pour into a greased 9x13" pan.
Smooth down and sprinkle with the brown sugar and pecans.
Bake at 325 degrees for 45 minutes.
For the topping, combine sugar, evaporated milk, butter, and cook for 2 minutes.
Add vanilla and spread over cake while both are still hot.
Sprinkle with 1/2 cup flaked coconut.
Serve hot or cold, cut in squares.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HAPPY DAY CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 1/2 cup. flour
- 3 tsp. baking powder
- 3 egg whites
- 1 cup. milk
- 1 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1/4 tbsp. salt
- 1/2 cup. shortening
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Sift flour once, measure, sift flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a mixing bowl.
Cut in shortening.
Add milk and beat at high speed for 2 minutes.
Add egg whites and vanilla and beat 1 more minute at medium speed.
Pour into 2 greased 8" cake pans and bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until done.
Stack with favorite filling. Delicious with 7-minute frosting and coconut.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SOUR CREAM CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 cup. sugar
- 2 sticks soft butter
- 6 eggs, beat in 1 at a time
- 2 tsp. vanilla extract
- 3 cup. flour with 1/4 tsp. soda sifted in it
- 1/2 pt. sour cream
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar.
Add eggs, then flour a little at a time with cream.
Bake 1 1/2 hours in a big tube pan at 325 degrees or until done.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **STRAWBERRY CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pkg. yellow cake mix
- 1 pkg. strawberry Jello
- 4 eggs
- 2/3 cup. Wesson oil
- 1/2 cup. water
- 1/2 cup. strawberries and juice
- **Strawberry Frosting:**
- 1 pkg. confectioners' sugar
- 2 tbsp. soft butter
- The remainder of the strawberries and juice, 10 oz. pkg.
<|steps|>
Beat eggs well and add oil.
Mix Jello with dry cake mix.
Beat into eggs and oil.
Add water and strawberries.
Makes 3 or 4 layers.
Bake at about 250 degrees. Can bake it in 2 angel food cake pans.
For the frosting, mix together and spread on cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ICE BOX FRUIT CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 1/2 cup. milk
- 1 1/2 lbs. raisins
- 1 lb. marshmallows
- 1 lb. crushed graham crackers
- 1 lg. bottle cherries, drained
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 1/2 pts. nuts
- 1 box coconut
- 1 box confectioners' sugar
- 6 eggs
- 3 sticks margarine or butter
- 1 box flour, measured in sugar box
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Dissolve marshmallows in the milk.
Add other ingredients, mixing well (crystallized fruits and citron, chopped fine, may be added if desired).
Press firmly into a mold and let stand 6 hours.
Use as desired.
**CONFECTIONERS POUND CAKE**
Have butter at room temperature.
Blend sugar and butter together until smooth.
Add eggs, one at a time.
Blend small portions of the cake flour with each egg.
Beat well after each mixture.
Continue adding eggs and flour together until all are blended well.
Place in a round tube pan for 1 hour at 300 degrees.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHOCOLATE DELIGHT CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. flour
- 2 cup. sugar
- 3 tbsp. cocoa
- 1/2 cup. buttermilk
- 1 tsp. soda
- 2 eggs
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 cup. water
- 2 sticks butter
- **Icing:**
- 1 stick butter
- 6 tbsp. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 3 tbsp. cocoa
- 1 box powdered sugar
- 1/2 cup. chopped pecans
<|steps|>
Mix sugar and flour.
Heat butter, cocoa, and water to boiling; pour over dry ingredients and mix.
Add buttermilk, soda, eggs, and vanilla. Mix well.
Bake 20 minutes at 400 degrees (it might take a little longer because the mixture will be soupy).
Makes a large loaf cake.
For the icing, mix butter with cocoa and milk.
Heat to boiling and remove from heat and add powdered sugar.
Mix well and add vanilla and nuts.
Pour over warm cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **WHIPPED CREAM CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 6 eggs
- 1 cup. whipping cream
- 3 cup. flour
- 2 sticks butter
- 3 cup. sugar
- 1 tbsp. pure vanilla flavoring
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add eggs and beat.
Add cream and flour alternately.
Then add vanilla.
Pour into a greased tube pan and bake at 300 degrees for 1 1/2 to 2 hours.
May be iced or not.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **APPLE NUT CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. white sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1 tsp. soda
- 1/2 tsp. cinnamon and nutmeg
- 1 1/2 cup. cooking oil
- 3 cup. plain flour
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. pure vanilla
<|steps|>
Mix the ingredients, then fold in 3 cups thinly sliced apples, cut up real fine, and 1 cup nuts, cut up.
Pour into a tube pan and bake at 300 degrees for 1 1/2 hours.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ORANGE DATE CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. butter or Crisco
- 4 eggs
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 tsp. soda
- 1 1/3 cup. buttermilk
- 1 cup. chopped dates
- 2 cup. sugar
- 2 tbsp. grated orange rind
- 3 1/2 cup. sifted cake flour
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 cup. sifted cake flour
- 1 cup. chopped pecans
- **Sauce:**
- 1 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1 cup. fresh orange juice
- 2 tbsp. grated rind
<|steps|>
Cream butter or Crisco, add sugar, and cream until smooth.
Blend in eggs, one at a time.
Add orange rind and vanilla.
Sift dry ingredients, measure, and sift together and add to creamed mixture, alternating with milk.
Mix 1/2 cup cake flour with chopped dates and pecans and fold into cake mixture.
Turn into a greased tube pan.
Bake at 325 to 350 degrees for 1 1/2 hours or until done.
For the sauce, blend together sugar, orange juice, and grated rind.
Pour over hot cake immediately after removing from oven.
Let cool in pan.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **REFRIGERATOR ROLLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 3/4 cup. water, warm
- 1/2 cup. granulated sugar
- 1 egg, unbeaten
- 6 cup. sifted all-purpose flour
- 2 pkgs. active dry yeast
- 1 tbsp. sugar
- 1/4 cup. soft butter or margarine
- 1 tbsp. butter, melted
<|steps|>
Pour warm water into a large bowl.
Sprinkle the yeast over the water; add sugar and salt; stir to dissolve completely.
Add eggs, soft butter, and 3 cups flour.
With a wooden spoon or electric mixer at medium speed, beat very hard for 2 minutes or until smooth.
Gradually add 1 cup flour, beating hard after each addition.
Using hands, work remaining 2 cups flour into dough, with hands, until smooth and elastic.
Brush the top of the dough with melted butter; cover with a double thickness of saran or with a damp towel.
Let the dough rise in the refrigerator at least 2 hours, or until it is double in bulk.
Punch down dough and refrigerate.
Store in refrigerator 1 to 3 days, punching it down once a day.
Shape and bake at 400 to 425 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CARROT CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. grated carrots
- 2 cup. plain flour
- 1 1/2 cup. Wesson oil
- 1 tsp. salt
- 2 cup. sugar
- 4 eggs
- 2 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 heaping tsp. soda
- **Frosting:**
- 1 8-oz. pkg. cream cheese
- 2 tsp. vanilla
- 1 cup. chopped toasted pecans
- 1 stick oleo or butter
- 1 box confectioners' sugar
<|steps|>
Sift flour, salt, soda, cinnamon, and sugar together.
Beat eggs slightly, add oil and carrots.
Add flour mixture.
Pour into 2 greased, floured pans.
Bake 25 minutes at 350 degrees.
For the frosting, cream cheese and butter, add sugar and flavoring.
Spread on layers and sides.
Sprinkle pecans on top and in between layers.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BLACKBERRY JAM CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. butter
- 2 cup. sugar
- 3 cup. sifted flour
- 1 cup. buttermilk
- 2 cup. blackberry jam
- 1 1/2 tsp. soda
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 tsp. allspice
- 1 tsp. cloves
- 6 eggs
- **Filling:**
- 2 eggs
- 1 cup. raisins
- 1 cup. pecans, chopped
- 1 can angel flake coconut
- 1 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1 cup. sweet milk
- 1 tbsp. flour
- **Frosting:**
- 1 stick butter, soft
- 2 egg yolks
- 1 box confectioners' sugar
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 4 tbsp. cream
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add eggs one at a time, beating well after each.
Dissolve soda in buttermilk.
Sift spices and flour together.
Add alternately with milk.
Fold in jam last.
Bake in 3 layers 9" pans greased and floured in a 350-degree oven for 30 or 40 minutes.
For the filling, mix all ingredients and cook until thick enough to spread between layers.
For the frosting, mix butter, eggs, vanilla, and cream.
Beat together, add sugar until of right consistency to spread on top and sides of cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **STRAWBERRY PECAN CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 box white cake mix
- 1 box strawberry Jello
- 1 cup. Wesson oil
- 1/2 cup. milk
- 4 eggs
- 1 cup. frozen strawberries
- 1 cup. coconut
- 1 cup. chopped pecans
- **Icing:**
- 1 stick oleo
- 1 box confectioners' sugar
- 1/2 cup. drained strawberries
- 1/2 cup. pecans
- 1/2 cup. coconut
<|steps|>
Mix cake mix and Jello together dry.
Add oil, milk, and eggs one at a time and beat until smooth.
Combine other ingredients.
Bake in 3 layers at 350 degrees.
For the icing, cream sugar and butter, adding other ingredients.
Spread on cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **STRAWBERRY CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 box white cake mix
- 1 cup. cooking oil
- 4 eggs
- 1 box strawberry Jello
- 1/2 cup. water
- 1/2 box frozen strawberries
- **Icing:**
- 1/2 box frozen strawberries
- 1 box confectioners' sugar
- 1 stick butter
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Combine all ingredients and beat for 10 minutes.
Put into 3 greased pans.
Bake 25 to 30 minutes.
For the icing, have butter and frozen strawberries at room temperature.
Mix with confectioners' sugar and spread on strawberry cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHOCOLATE MARSHMALLOW CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. butter
- 2 cup. sugar
- 4 tbsp. cocoa
- 4 eggs
- 1 1/3 cup. flour
- 4 cup. nuts
- **Icing:**
- 1 box powdered sugar
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 2 tbsp. cocoa
- 5 tbsp. milk
- 1 1/2 cup. Crisco
- 5 eggs
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 2 cup. flour
- 1 3/4 cup. sugar
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. lemon flavoring
<|steps|>
Bake 40 minutes at 350 degrees in an 11x14" pan.
While the cake is cooking, cut marshmallows in half.
Remove cake promptly and place cut marshmallows on it as fast as possible so they will melt while the cake is hot.
Cover with the icing: mix powdered sugar, butter, cocoa, and milk.
**POUND CAKE WITH CRISP CRUST**
Cream Crisco and sugar.
Add eggs one at a time. Beat well.
Add flour. Do not overbeat.
Bake at 325 degrees for 1 hour or 5 or 10 minutes more.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **STRAWBERRY PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. water or 17-Up + 2 oz.
- 1 cup. sugar
- 2 tbsp. cornstarch
- 2 tbsp. Karo syrup
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 3-oz. pkg. strawberry Jello
- 1 to 1 1/2 pt. fresh strawberries
<|steps|>
Mix and boil above ingredients, except Jello and strawberries, until thick and completely clear, about 4 minutes.
Remove and add Jello, stir until dissolved.
Cook pie pastry and while hot, sprinkle 3 tablespoons of sugar over shell. Let cool.
Wash and drain berries, place in pastry whole.
Pour syrup mixture over berries.
Let cool.
Whipped cream is used as topping and may be put on pie when served in individual pieces or on whole pie before cut.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **COCONUT PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/8 tsp. salt
- 2 tbsp. flour
- 3 eggs
- 1 cup. white Karo
- 1 cup. grated coconut
<|steps|>
Combine sugar and flour.
Beat eggs and add sugar and flour mixture.
Add vanilla, salt, Karo, and coconut.
Pour into an unbaked pie shell and bake at 350 degrees until set.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ICE CREAM PUNCH FOR 50**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 1/2 gal. sherbet
- 6 bottles ginger ale
- 4 cup. pineapple juice
- 1 gal. vanilla ice cream
- 2 small cans orange juice
<|steps|>
Combine all ingredients in a large punch bowl.
Stir gently to mix and serve immediately.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **WEDDING PUNCH FOR 100**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/4 lb. tea, brewed
- 2 large cans grapefruit juice
- 4 qts. ginger ale
- 2 large cans pineapple juice
- 3 large cans frozen lemonade
- Sugar to taste
- 3 tbsp. tea leaves
- 4 cup. boiling water
- 1 1/2 or 2 cup. sugar
- 1 1/2 cup. boiling water
- 8 whole cloves
- 6 oranges or 1 can concentrate
- 6 lemons or 1 can concentrate
- 1 46-oz. can pineapple juice
- 1 tsp. almond extract
- 3 qts. ice water or ginger ale
- 1 bottle maraschino cherry juice
<|steps|>
Brew tea and let cool.
Combine tea with grapefruit juice, pineapple juice, and frozen lemonade.
Add sugar to taste.
Just before serving, add ginger ale and stir gently.
Serve chilled.
**PUNCH**
Steep tea in 4 cups boiling water for 5 minutes. Strain and cool.
Make a syrup by boiling 1 1/2 cups water, 1 1/2 cups sugar, cloves, 1 orange, and 1 lemon peel for 5 minutes and cool.
When cool, combine tea, syrup, and other ingredients except chilled water or ginger ale.
Allow to stand 1 hour or until ready to serve.
Add chilled water and chipped ice.
Serves 25.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PINK PUNCH**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 large 46-oz. can pineapple juice
- 2 cup. boiling water
- 2 pkgs. strawberry Jello
- 6 cup. cold water
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1 can frozen orange juice
- 1 can frozen lemonade
- 1 qt. ginger ale
<|steps|>
Add boiling water to Jello. Stir until dissolved.
Add cold water and juices.
Add ginger ale just before serving.
Garnish punch bowl with slices of lemon or orange. Place a bunch of plastic flowers in the center of each slice and let float on top of punch.
Serves 35 to 40.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **RED SATIN PUNCH**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 qt. apple juice
- 10 bottles 7-Up
- 2 pts. cranberry juice cocktail
<|steps|>
Fill two trays with 7-Up and freeze until firm.
Mix together apple juice and cranberry juice cocktail.
Just before serving, add the remaining 7-Up.
Pour into a punch bowl over frozen 7-Up.
Serves 35.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MINT TEA PUNCH**
<|ingredients|>
- 8 cup. brisk tea
- 1 cup. frozen lemonade
- 3/4 cup. mint syrup
- **Mint Syrup:**
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1 cup. water
- 30 mint leaves
<|steps|>
For the mint syrup, bruise mint leaves in sugar.
Add water and stir over heat until sugar dissolves.
Simmer 3 to 5 minutes. Strain out leaves, store in refrigerator.
Combine tea, lemonade, and mint syrup.
Serve chilled.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HOT SPICED TEA**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 qts. water
- 1 tsp. whole cloves
- 1 stick cinnamon
- 1/3 cup. tea or 15 tea bags
- 1 1/4 cup. sugar
- 1 cup. orange juice
- 3/4 cup. fresh lemon juice
<|steps|>
Add spices to water. Bring water to a full boil.
Remove from heat. Add tea immediately.
Brew 4 minutes. Strain.
Add sugar, stir until dissolved.
Add fruit juices.
To reheat for serving, place over low heat. Do not boil.
Serves 25 to 30.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BEATEN BISCUIT**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 cups flour
- 1 tbsp lard
- 1 tsp salt
- Cold water, as needed
<|steps|>
Mix flour, lard, and salt, adding enough cold water to make a stiff dough.
Place on a marble slab and beat with a bat or rolling pin until dough begins to blister, at least 500 strokes.
Roll out about 0.5 inch thick, cut with a small biscuit cutter, and prick the top of each biscuit with a fork.
Bake in a slow oven until golden brown.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SPOON BREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1.5 cups water
- 1 tsp salt
- 1 cup white corn meal
- Large piece of butter
- 2 egg yolks
- 1 cup sweet milk
- 2 egg whites, well beaten
<|steps|>
Bring water and salt to a boil, then gradually stir in corn meal.
When smooth, add butter, egg yolks, and sweet milk.
Mix well, then add well-beaten egg whites.
Pour into a greased baking dish and bake in a moderate oven for about 30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHEESE BISCUITS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb old cheese, grated
- 0.25 lb butter
- 1 cup flour
- 1 egg white
- Few shelled pecans
- Paprika, to taste
- Red pepper, to taste
- Salt, to taste
<|steps|>
Cream butter, then mix with cheese.
Sift flour, paprika, red pepper, and salt; combine with butter and cheese mixture.
Form into a roll, wrap in oiled paper, and chill.
Slice, place half a pecan on each biscuit, glaze with egg white, and bake in a moderate oven.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHEESE STRAWS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups flour
- 1 cup shortening
- 1 tbsp ice water
- 1 tsp salt
- 1 cup grated cheese
- 1 tsp paprika
- 1 tsp red pepper
<|steps|>
Cut shortening into flour, salt, and paprika until thoroughly mixed.
Add ice water and knead to a smooth consistency.
Roll out dough, sprinkle with grated cheese, paprika, and red pepper.
Roll up and work cheese mixture into dough with hands.
Roll into a thin sheet, cut into narrow strips, and bake in a slow oven.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **VANILLA MUFFINS**
<|ingredients|>
- 0.5 cup butter
- 1 cup sugar
- 2 eggs
- 0.5 cup sweet milk
- 2 cups flour
- 1.5 tsp baking powder
- 1 tsp vanilla
- Pinch of salt
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar together.
Add eggs one at a time, beating until light.
Sift flour with baking powder three times, then add to mixture alternately with sweet milk.
Add vanilla and salt.
Bake in greased muffin tins in a 350°F oven.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORN BREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup white corn meal
- 1 tsp salt
- 0.25 tsp baking soda
- 1 heaping tsp baking powder
- 1 egg
- 0.75 cup buttermilk, approximate
<|steps|>
Sift dry ingredients together.
Add egg and enough buttermilk to make a thick batter.
Beat well and pour into a hot, greased pan.
Bake in a 475°F oven for about 30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORN STICKS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup white corn meal
- 1 tsp salt
- 0.25 tsp baking soda
- 1 heaping tsp baking powder
- 1 egg
- 0.75 cup buttermilk, approximate
<|steps|>
Sift dry ingredients together.
Add egg and enough buttermilk to make a thick batter.
Beat well and pour into very hot, well-greased corn stick molds.
Bake in a 475°F oven for about 20-25 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORN MUFFINS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup white corn meal
- 1 tsp salt
- 0.25 tsp baking soda
- 1 heaping tsp baking powder
- 1 egg
- 0.75 cup buttermilk, approximate
<|steps|>
Sift dry ingredients together.
Add egg and enough buttermilk to make a thick batter.
Beat well and pour into very hot, well-greased muffin molds.
Bake in a 475°F oven for about 20-25 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORN CAKES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup white corn meal
- 1 tsp salt
- 0.25 tsp baking soda
- 1 heaping tsp baking powder
- 1 egg
- 1 cup buttermilk, approximate
<|steps|>
Sift dry ingredients together.
Add egg and enough buttermilk to make a thin batter.
Beat well and cook on a hot griddle, like pancakes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CRACKLIN' BREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups white corn meal
- Hot water, as needed
- 1 tsp salt
- 2 tbsp lard
- 2 cups finely chopped or ground cracklings
<|steps|>
Mix corn meal with hot water to make a soft dough.
Add salt, lard, and cracklings.
Mold into flat, oval cakes with hands.
Place on a greased baking sheet and bake in a hot oven until brown.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORN PONE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups white corn meal
- 1 tsp salt
- 2 cups boiling water
<|steps|>
Mix corn meal, salt, and boiling water thoroughly.
Shape into oval cakes, about 0.5 inch thick.
Place on a greased pan and bake in a quick oven or on top of the stove, turning to brown both sides.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **QUICK ROLLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 6 cups flour
- 2 tbsp sugar
- 2 tsp salt
- 1 cup warm sweet milk
- 2 cakes yeast, dissolved in warm water
- 2 tbsp melted lard
- 1 cup flour, for rolling
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients together and let rise for 2 hours.
Roll out, cut into rolls using about 1 cup of flour.
Let rise for 1 hour.
Bake in a moderate oven.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **NUT BREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup nuts
- 3 cups flour
- 1 cup sugar
- 1 tsp salt
- 5 tsp baking powder
- 1 egg yolk
- 1 cup milk
<|steps|>
Combine all ingredients and mix well.
Bake in a moderate oven until done, making two small or one large loaf.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SOUTHERN BISCUIT**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups flour
- 1 tsp salt
- 0.25 tsp baking soda
- 2 tsp baking powder
- 1 heaping tbsp lard
- 1 cup buttermilk, approximate
- 2.25 cups flour
- 1 tsp salt
- 0.25 tsp baking soda
- 1 tsp sugar
- 2 tsp baking powder
- 1 egg
- 6 tbsp melted lard
- 1 cup buttermilk, approximate
<|steps|>
Sift dry ingredients and work in lard.
Add buttermilk to make a soft dough.
Knead well, roll out to 0.5 inch thickness.
Bake in a 450°F oven until golden brown.
**WAFFLES**
Sift dry ingredients together.
Add buttermilk to make a thin batter, then add egg and beat well.
Add melted lard.
Bake in a waffle iron.
Serve with melted butter and sorghum.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SALLY LUNN**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pint milk
- 1 cake yeast
- 1 heaping tbsp butter
- 1 heaping tbsp shortening
- 3 eggs, well beaten
- 0.75 cup sugar
- 1 quart flour
- 1 tsp salt
<|steps|>
Warm milk and dissolve yeast.
Add butter, shortening, eggs, sugar, flour, and salt; mix until smooth.
Let rise until double in bulk.
Stir down and let rise again.
Bake in a loaf pan in a moderate oven.
Serve hot with butter.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SOUTHERN PUFFS**
<|ingredients|>
- Biscuit dough (as for Southern Biscuit)
- Hot fat or cooking oil
<|steps|>
Roll biscuit dough thin and cut into finger-length strips, 1 inch across.
Drop into hot fat or cooking oil and cook until golden brown.
Serve hot with fried chicken.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SOUTHERN FRIED CORN**
<|ingredients|>
- 5-6 ears corn
- 2 cups cold water
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- 2 tbsp bacon drippings or lard
<|steps|>
Cut corn from cobs, removing about half the kernels, then scrape cobs thoroughly to get all the milk.
Add cold water, salt, and pepper.
Cook in a skillet with hot bacon drippings or lard, stirring constantly over medium heat until the mixture thickens.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORN PUDDING**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups fresh corn, boiled and cut from cob, or 1 No. 2 can small kernel white corn
- 1.25 tbsp sugar
- 1 tbsp flour
- 2 eggs
- 0.5 tsp salt
- 0.75 cup milk
- 0.33 stick butter
<|steps|>
Mix sugar and flour, then add corn, salt, beaten eggs, milk, and melted butter.
Pour into a buttered baking dish.
Bake at 300°F, stirring from edges to center until pudding begins to firm.
Continue baking until brown.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRIED EGGPLANT**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 eggplant
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- 1 onion, chopped
- 1 egg
<|steps|>
Wash, pare, and cut eggplant into pieces.
Boil eggplant, onion, salt, and pepper in water to cover until tender.
Drain in a colander, then mix with beaten egg.
Drop mixture by spoonfuls into a hot greased skillet and fry like hotcakes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ASPARAGUS CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 large can green asparagus
- 4 hard-cooked eggs
- 2 tbsp butter
- 2 heaping tbsp flour
- 1 cup milk
- 1 cup asparagus liquor
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- 0.25 cup butter
- 1 cup cracker crumbs
- Paprika, for sprinkling
<|steps|>
Melt 2 tbsp butter in a double boiler, add flour, then milk and asparagus liquor; cook until thickened.
Season with salt and pepper.
In another pan, melt 0.25 cup butter and mix with cracker crumbs.
Butter a baking dish, sprinkle half the buttered crumbs on the bottom.
Layer asparagus, sliced eggs, and half the white sauce.
Add remaining asparagus, eggs, and white sauce.
Top with remaining buttered crumbs and sprinkle with paprika.
Bake until golden brown.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BAKED SQUASH**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb yellow or white squash
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- 2 tbsp butter
- 0.5 cup bread crumbs
<|steps|>
Wash and trim squash, then cut into small pieces.
Boil squash and onion in water to cover until tender.
Add salt and pepper, then drain.
Melt butter in a skillet, add squash, and fry for several minutes.
Place mixture in a buttered casserole, cover with bread crumbs, and dot with butter.
Bake in a moderate oven for 20 minutes or until brown.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SWEET POTATO PUDDING**
<|ingredients|>
- 1.5 lbs raw sweet potatoes
- 0.33 lb butter
- 1 cup sugar
- Juice and rind of 1 lemon
- 6 eggs
- 1 cup rice
- 0.25 cup salt
- Water, for boiling
- Melted butter or gravy, for serving
<|steps|>
Grate potatoes carefully, then heat with butter over a slow fire.
Remove from heat, add egg yolks beaten with sugar and lemon.
Mix well and fold in stiffly beaten egg whites.
Bake in a deep pan in a moderate oven for about 1 hour.
**RICE**
Wash rice through at least 4 waters.
Bring a gallon of water with salt to a rolling boil.
Slowly pour in rice and boil for 20 minutes or until tender.
Drain in a colander, then rinse under cold water for 1 minute.
Place colander in an oven or warmer to dry out.
Serve with melted butter or gravy, or piled in the center of a platter surrounded by chicken or meat.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LYE HOMINY**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 quart shelled corn
- 2 tsp concentrated lye
- Water, as needed
- 1 tsp salt
<|steps|>
Place corn in a vessel that holds 2 gallons, fill nearly full with water mixed with lye, and bring to a boil.
Cook for 30 minutes, then remove from heat and rinse with cold water until free of lye.
Refill pan with water, add salt, and bring to a boil.
Place in a deep-well cooker or low heat and cook for about 4 hours until tender.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CANDIED YAMS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 sweet potatoes, about the size of a pint jar
- Water, as needed
- Butter, for dotting
- Sugar, for sprinkling
- Whole pods of okra, tops on
- Water, to cover
- Melted butter, for serving
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
<|steps|>
Peel and thickly slice sweet potatoes, about 0.5 inch.
Place in a casserole and add enough water to half fill the dish.
Dot with butter and sprinkle heavily with sugar.
Bake in a moderate oven until done.
**OKRA**
Boil okra pods in enough water to cover until tender.
Pour melted butter over okra, sprinkle with salt and pepper, and serve.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BLACK EYED PEAS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb fresh black eyed peas
- 0.25 lb streak o'lean (salt pork)
- Salt, to taste
- Water, to cover
- Small piece of red pepper, optional
