<|steps|>
Shell, wash, and drain peas.
Place salt pork in a pan with water and bring to a boil.
Add peas, salt, and optional red pepper.
Cook slowly until tender, about 2 hours.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **OKRA AND TOMATOES CREOLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb okra, diced
- 2 tsp fat or bacon grease
- 1 onion, chopped
- 1 green pepper, chopped
- 1 small clove garlic
- 1 tsp minced parsley
- 1 tsp salt
- Red pepper, to taste
- 1 can tomatoes, mashed through a sieve
<|steps|>
Place diced okra in a skillet with hot grease.
Add onion, green pepper, garlic, parsley, salt, and red pepper.
Cook for about 20 minutes until slightly brown.
Add mashed tomatoes and simmer slowly for about 1 hour before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TURNIP GREENS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 bunches turnip greens
- 0.25 lb streaked meat (salt pork)
- Water, as needed
- Salt, to taste
<|steps|>
Pick off stems and wash greens thoroughly.
Boil streaked meat in a vessel half full of water.
Drop greens into the vessel and cook for at least 3 hours, adding salt and more water if needed.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SNAP BEANS**
<|ingredients|>
- Snap beans
- 0.25 lb streaked meat (salt pork)
- Water, as needed
- Salt, to taste
- Sugar, to taste
<|steps|>
Wash and prepare beans for cooking.
Boil streaked meat in a vessel half full of water.
Add beans and salt, cooking for about 2-3 hours, adding more water if needed.
Add a little sugar to enhance flavor.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRIED CHICKEN**
<|ingredients|>
- 1.5-2 lb chicken
- 0.5 cup flour
- 1 heaping tsp salt
- 1 tsp black pepper
- Hot grease, for frying
- Flour, remaining from fried chicken
- Hot grease, from frying
- Hot water, as needed
<|steps|>
Dress and cut up chicken for frying.
Sift flour, salt, and pepper into a clean paper bag.
Drop chicken pieces into the bag and shake until well floured.
Fry slowly in a skillet half full of hot grease until golden brown, turning after about 20 minutes per side.
Do not cover.
Remove to a platter when tender.
**GRAVY**
Add remaining flour to hot grease in the skillet and stir until brown.
Add enough hot water to make a thick gravy.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SHRIMP CREOLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 lbs large shrimp
- 4 tbsp fat
- 2 tbsp flour
- 1 bay leaf
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1 tbsp green pepper, chopped
- 1 tbsp parsley, chopped
- 0.5 tsp sugar
- 1 No. 2 can tomatoes
- 1 cup water
<|steps|>
Boil shrimp for 20 minutes, peel, and remove black veins (or use canned shrimp).
Heat fat in a large skillet, add flour, and stir until brown.
Add onion, tomatoes, water, shrimp, bay leaf, garlic, green pepper, parsley, and sugar.
Cook slowly for 40 minutes.
Serve over boiled rice on a large platter.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN A LA KING**
<|ingredients|>
- 7 cups cooked chicken
- 5.25 cups mushrooms
- 1.75 cups pimento
- 21 tbsp chicken fat
- 21 tbsp flour
- 30 cups chicken stock
- 2 cups cream
- 7 egg yolks
- 1.75 cups blanched almonds
- 7 tbsp sherry (or more)
- 1 cup water
- 0.5 cup butter
- 1 cup pastry flour
- 0.25 tsp salt
- 4 eggs
<|steps|>
Make sauce by adding flour to chicken fat, then chicken stock and cream.
When sauce is smooth and boiling, add well-beaten egg yolks.
Add chicken, mushrooms, pimento, almonds, and sherry.
Keep hot in a pan of hot water until served.
Serve in puffs (see below) for 30 people.
**PUFFS**
Heat water and butter in a saucepan until boiling.
Add flour and salt, stirring and cooking over a slow fire.
Add unbeaten eggs one at a time, beating well after each.
Drop by teaspoonfuls onto a greased cookie sheet.
Bake at 450°F for 15 minutes, then at 325°F for 20 minutes.
Cut puffs in half and fill with chicken a la king or creamed mixtures.
Heat in oven before serving, making 36-40 puffs.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRIED FISH**
<|ingredients|>
- Fish, medium pieces
- 1 cup white corn meal
- 1 tsp salt
- 0.5 tsp black pepper
<|steps|>
Clean and cut fish into medium pieces.
Sift corn meal, salt, and pepper together.
Dip fish in meal mixture and fry in deep, hot fat until golden brown.
Serve with corn pone.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LOBSTER THERMIDOR**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 tbsp melted butter
- 1 tsp finely chopped onion
- 1 medium green pepper, chopped
- 2 tbsp flour
- 2 cups sweet milk
- 1 can lobster meat or meat of 1 large or 2 small lobsters
- 2 hard-cooked eggs, chopped
- 3 slices bread
- 1 cup grated cheese
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
<|steps|>
Cook onion and green pepper in melted butter until soft.
Add flour and sweet milk, cooking until the cream sauce thickens.
Add lobster meat and chopped eggs.
Toast bread slices in a slow oven until crisp and dry.
Break one slice into small pieces and add to the lobster mixture in a baking dish.
Season with salt and pepper.
Roll remaining two toast slices into fine crumbs, mix with grated cheese, and sprinkle over the top.
Bake in a moderate oven until nicely browned.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **OYSTERS ROCKEFELLER**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 dozen medium-size oysters, in shells
- 1 tbsp chopped onion or shallot
- 2 tbsp chopped parsley
- 2 tbsp butter
- 0.25 cup cooked spinach
- 0.33 cup bread crumbs
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Paprika, to taste
- Chopped bacon, optional
<|steps|>
Remove oysters from shells, wash shells, and replace oysters.
Mix onion, parsley, seasonings, and half the butter; spread on oysters.
Top with finely chopped spinach and bread crumbs.
Dot with remaining butter and brown in a hot oven for about 10 minutes.
Serve with quartered lemon, on a greased oven-proof platter or individual casseroles if not using shells.
Add chopped bacon if desired.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BARBECUED CHICKEN**
<|ingredients|>
- 2-2.5 lb chicken
- Butter, for greasing
- 1 cup vinegar
- 1 cup water
- 0.33 cup catsup
- 1 lb butter
- 1 tsp sugar
- 2 tbsp Worcestershire sauce
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Cayenne pepper, optional
<|steps|>
Split chicken down the back and break the breast bone to lie flat.
Grease both sides with butter and warm in an oven or on the stove slowly.
Boil vinegar, water, catsup, butter, sugar, Worcestershire sauce, salt, pepper, and optional cayenne for 10 minutes.
Pour sauce over browned chicken.
Bake in a 350°F oven for about 1.25 hours, basting and turning frequently until done.
Optionally, cook over charcoal burners for a superior barbecue.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BARBECUED RIBS**
<|ingredients|>
- Spare ribs
- Butter, for greasing
- 1 cup vinegar
- 1 cup water
- 0.33 cup catsup
- 1 lb butter
- 1 tsp sugar
- 2 tbsp Worcestershire sauce
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Cayenne pepper, optional
- 6 quail
- 2 tbsp butter
- 2 tbsp flour
- 6 strips bacon
- 0.5 cup hot water
- Chopped parsley, for serving
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
<|steps|>
Grease ribs with butter and warm in an oven or on the stove slowly.
Boil vinegar, water, catsup, butter, sugar, Worcestershire sauce, salt, pepper, and optional cayenne for 10 minutes.
Pour sauce over browned ribs.
Bake in a 350°F oven for about 1.25 hours, basting and turning frequently until done.
Optionally, cook over charcoal burners for a superior barbecue.
**QUAIL**
Pick, draw, and clean quail, then split down the back.
Rub each bird with butter, sprinkle with salt, pepper, and flour.
Wrap with bacon strips and place in a large skillet or roasting pan.
Cook under a broiler until well browned, turning frequently.
Add hot water, cover, and bake in a moderate oven until tender.
Serve on toast, sprinkled with chopped parsley.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BAKED HAM**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 ham
- 2 cups flour
- 2 cups brown sugar
- 1 tsp ground cloves
- 1 tsp allspice
- 1 tsp black pepper
- Water, as needed
- Whole cloves, for scoring
- Brown sugar, for rubbing
- Crumbs, for rubbing
<|steps|>
Mix flour, brown sugar, cloves, allspice, and black pepper with enough water to make a stiff dough.
Roll out thin, like pie crust, and wrap the ham completely.
Bake in a slow oven for 30 minutes per pound.
Remove crust and skin, score the fat side, and stick in whole cloves.
Rub with brown sugar and crumbs, then brown in the oven.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TAMALE PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 lbs ground steak
- 1 can tomatoes
- 1 heaping tbsp chili powder
- 1 tsp salt
- 1 heaping tsp comino powder
- 0.5 tsp black pepper
- Red pepper, to taste
- 1 quart boiling water
- 0.25 lb butter
- 3 cups white corn meal
- Salt, to taste
<|steps|>
Brown meat lightly in a skillet with a small amount of fat.
Stir in mashed tomatoes, chili powder, salt, comino, black pepper, and red pepper; simmer for 1 hour.
Scald corn meal, then add slowly to boiling water, stirring constantly.
Season with butter and salt.
In a double boiler or baking dish, pour half the mush mixture, then the meat mixture, and cover with remaining mush.
Steam for 2 hours.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRIED CUSTARD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pint milk
- 0.5 cup sugar
- 3 egg yolks
- 2 tsp flour
- 2 tsp cornstarch
- 1 tsp butter
- 1 tsp vanilla
- Crumbs, for coating
- 1 egg, slightly beaten
- Deep fat, for frying
<|steps|>
Cook milk, sugar, egg yolks, flour, cornstarch, butter, and vanilla in a double boiler until thick.
Pour into a buttered 2-inch deep dish and chill overnight.
Cut custard into squares, dip in crumbs, then in slightly beaten egg, and back into crumbs.
Fry in deep fat and dry out in the oven.
Serve with broiled chicken.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **OYSTER CHOWDER**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups cracker crumbs
- 4 tbsp butter
- 1 pint oysters
- 2 pieces pimento
- Milk, as needed
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
<|steps|>
Place 0.67 cup cracker crumbs in the bottom of a casserole.
Drain oysters and place half on crumbs.
Dot with butter, sprinkle with salt, pepper, and finely chopped pimento.
Add 0.67 cup crumbs, remaining oysters, salt, pepper, butter, and pimento.
Top with remaining crumbs.
Pour in enough milk to come just below the top.
Bake slowly at 350°F for 45 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **RICE DRESSING FOR GAME OR FOWL**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 tbsp cooking fat
- 1 cup uncooked rice
- 1 quart chicken stock
- 1 cup chopped green pepper
- 1 cup chopped onion
- 1 egg
- Chopped giblets, optional
<|steps|>
Melt cooking fat in an iron skillet and add washed, dried rice.
Stir over heat until rice is light brown.
Add onion, green pepper, and chicken stock.
Cook slowly until rice is tender, adding hot water if too thick.
Just before removing from heat, add whole egg and optional giblets, stirring well.
Use as stuffing or serve with fowl.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TURKEY OR CHICKEN DRESSING**
<|ingredients|>
- 6 cups crumbled corn bread
- 2 cups crumbled soda biscuit
- Rich, hot turkey stock, as needed
- 2 onions, chopped
- 2 cups chopped celery
- 6 eggs
- 1 cup milk
- Salt, to taste
- 1 gallon green peppers
- 6 large onions
- 0.5 gallon vinegar
- 2 tsp salt
- 2 tsp black pepper
- 2 tsp allspice
- 0.5 cup brown sugar
- 3 pints good vinegar
- 0.25 cup soft butter
- 1 tsp lemon juice
- 0.5 tbsp anchovy paste
- 1 No. 2 can tomatoes or equal amount fresh tomatoes
- 1 green pepper, chopped
- 0.5 cup vinegar
- 1 cup sugar
- 1 tsp black pepper
- 1.5 tsp salt
- 1 tsp horseradish
- 0.25 tsp Tabasco sauce
- 2 tbsp lemon juice
- 3 tbsp catsup
- 0.5 tsp salt
- 1 tbsp Worcestershire sauce
- Chili sauce, optional
- Allspice, optional
<|steps|>
Mix corn bread and soda biscuit in a deep bowl.
Add turkey stock to moisten thoroughly, then add onions, celery, eggs, milk, and salt.
Adjust with more stock if too stiff, aiming for corn bread batter consistency.
Place in and around turkey to bake.
**BARBARA SAUCE**
Boil green peppers, onions, and 0.5 gallon vinegar until tender and soft.
Mash well and season with salt, black pepper, allspice, and brown sugar.
Return to heat and boil for 15 minutes.
Remove from heat, add 3 pints vinegar, and seal in jars.
**LEMON ANCHOVY SAUCE**
Combine butter with lemon juice.
Add anchovy paste and mix well.
Serve on fish, green asparagus, or broccoli.
**RED SAUCE FOR MEAT OR BLACK EYED PEAS**
Cook all ingredients together over slow heat until the consistency of chili sauce.
Serve hot.
**SHRIMP COCKTAIL SAUCE**
Mix horseradish, Tabasco, lemon juice, catsup, salt, and Worcestershire sauce well.
Add chili sauce and allspice if desired.
Serve on chilled shrimp.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TOMATO ASPIC**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 No. 2 can tomato juice
- 1 cup sugar
- 0.5 cup vinegar
- 1 large piece celery, chopped
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- Small piece garlic
- 1 tsp salt
- 1 tsp black pepper
- 1 tbsp pickling spice
- 1.5 envelopes gelatine
- Cold water, for soaking
- Chopped olives, optional
- Pecans, optional
- Celery, optional
- Shrimp, optional
<|steps|>
Boil tomato juice, sugar, vinegar, celery, onion, garlic, salt, pepper, and pickling spice for 10 minutes.
If too thick, add a little water.
Strain and, while hot, add gelatine soaked in cold water for 5 minutes.
Serve plain after chilling, or add chopped olives, pecans, celery, or shrimp as it begins to congeal.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MOLDED EGG AND CAVIAR SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 6 hard-cooked eggs
- 2 tbsp melted butter
- Pinch of mustard
- 1 oz jar caviar
- Juice of 0.5 lemon
- 1 tbsp Worcestershire sauce
- Mayonnaise, for serving
- Anchovy, for topping
<|steps|>
Chop eggs in a grinder.
Combine with butter, mustard, caviar, lemon juice, and Worcestershire sauce.
Pack tightly in small molds or demi-tasse cups and chill overnight.
Unmold and serve on a slice of tomato on shredded lettuce.
Cover with mayonnaise and top with a rolled anchovy.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN MOUSSE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 tbsp gelatine
- 1 cup cold chicken stock
- 1 cup boiling chicken stock
- 1 tbsp lemon juice
- 1 cup mayonnaise
- 1 cup whipping cream
- 1 cup chicken, chopped
- 1 cup celery, chopped
- 0.33 cup pickle, chopped
- 2 tbsp pimento, chopped
- 2 tbsp green pepper, chopped
- 0.5 tsp salt
<|steps|>
Dissolve gelatine in cold stock, then add boiling stock.
Add lemon juice, mayonnaise, whipped cream, chicken, celery, pickle, pimento, green pepper, and salt, one at a time.
Congeal in a mold.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CONGEALED VEGETABLE SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 tbsp gelatine
- 0.5 cup cold water
- 0.5 cup vinegar
- 2 tbsp lemon juice
- 2 cups boiling water
- 0.25 cup sugar
- 1 tsp salt
- 1 cup cabbage, finely shredded
- 1 large cucumber, chopped
- 1 bunch celery, chopped
- 1 large green pepper, chopped
- 1 large sweet red pepper, chopped
- 1 tbsp finely chopped onion
- Several small radishes, sliced
<|steps|>
Soak gelatine in cold water for 5 minutes.
Add vinegar, lemon juice, sugar, salt, and boiling water.
When mixture begins to congeal, add chopped vegetables.
Chill and serve on lettuce or watercress, garnished with mayonnaise.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **JELLIED TUNA SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can tuna
- 0.75 cup celery, finely chopped
- 1 pimento
- 1 tbsp onion juice
- Small bottle stuffed green olives, sliced
- 1 green pepper, chopped
- 4 hard-cooked eggs, chopped
- 1 cup mayonnaise
- 1 envelope gelatine
- 0.25 cup cold water
- Juice of 1 lemon
- Salt, to taste
- Cayenne pepper, to taste
- Paprika, to taste
<|steps|>
Soak gelatine in cold water for 5 minutes, then melt over hot water.
Add gelatine to mayonnaise.
Combine tuna, celery, pimento, onion juice, olives, green pepper, eggs, salt, cayenne, and paprika.
Add mayonnaise mixture and mix thoroughly.
Pour into individual molds or one large mold and chill until firm.
Serve with mayonnaise.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **1860 POTATO SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 6 large Irish potatoes
- Salt, for boiling
- 1 tbsp butter
- Black pepper, to taste
- 0.5 cup vinegar
- 2 tbsp sugar
- 1 tsp chopped green pepper
- 0.5 cup finely chopped celery
- 1 medium onion, finely chopped
- 2 hard-cooked eggs, chopped
- 0.5 cup chow-chow pickle
- 2 tbsp mayonnaise
- Green pepper slices, for garnish
- Egg slices, for garnish
- Parsley, for garnish
<|steps|>
Boil potatoes in salted water until done, then mash.
Add butter and beat until light.
Add vinegar, sugar, green pepper, celery, onion, eggs, chow-chow pickle, and black pepper; blend well.
Add mayonnaise and mix.
Arrange green pepper slices and egg slices on top.
Trim the edge of the bowl with parsley.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FROZEN KENTUCKY SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 0.25 cup sugar
- 2 tbsp flour
- 0.25 tsp salt
- 1 egg yolk
- 0.33 cup lemon juice
- 0.33 cup pineapple juice
- 1 cup pineapple chunks
- 1 cup white cherries
- 0.75 cup blanched almonds or pecans
- 0.75 cup whipping cream
- Mayonnaise, optional
<|steps|>
Heat lemon and pineapple juice in a double boiler.
Blend sugar, flour, and salt with egg yolk, then add to heated juices.
Cook to the consistency of boiled dressing, then cool.
Whip cream and fold in the cooled mixture, then add coarsely chopped fruit and nuts.
Pour into a refrigerator tray and freeze for about 3 hours.
Serve on lettuce with or without mayonnaise.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BERMUDA SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 small cauliflower
- 0.5 large Bermuda onion
- 0.5 cup stuffed olives
- 0.67 cup French dressing
- 1 head lettuce
- 2 cups Roquefort or Blue cheese
<|steps|>
Separate cauliflower into flowerets and slice thin crosswise.
Slice Bermuda onion and separate into rings.
Slice stuffed olives and place all in a bowl with French dressing.
Marinate for 30 minutes.
Break up lettuce and crumble cheese.
Toss all together lightly just before serving.
Serve from the bowl and pass extra French dressing.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: - Shrimp
<|ingredients|>
- 1 egg
- 1 heaping tsp sugar
- 1 tsp salt
- Juice of 0.5 large lemon
- 1 tsp prepared mustard
- 1 pint salad oil
<|steps|>
Clean shrimp and place on a bed of crisp lettuce.
Mix olive oil with salt and white pepper in a bowl.
Blend mustard with oil a few drops at a time, adding a few drops of vinegar to prevent curdling.
When well blended, add paprika, parsley, celery, and onion.
Pour sauce over shrimp and lettuce.
**MAYONNAISE**
Beat egg in a mixer or bowl.
Add sugar, salt, lemon juice, and mustard.
While beating, add salad oil a little at a time.
Beat to desired thickness.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FROZEN FRUIT SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 3-oz package cream cheese
- 0.25 cup mayonnaise
- 0.67 cup whipping cream
- 2 tbsp lemon juice
- 0.75 cup chopped dates
- 0.75 cup crushed pineapple, drained
<|steps|>
Mash cream cheese and blend in mayonnaise.
Whip cream until stiff, add lemon juice, and fold in fruit and cheese mixture.
Pour into a freezing tray, optionally using cube partitions for individual servings.
Freeze until firm.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PINEAPPLE CHEESE RING WITH FRUIT**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 packages cream cheese
- 0.5 pint cream, whipped
- 0.5 cup grated pineapple
- 2 tbsp gelatine
- 0.25 cup milk
- Mayonnaise, for serving
- Halved pears, for serving
- Peaches, for serving
- White cherries, for serving
- Grapefruit sections, for serving
<|steps|>
Soak gelatine in milk and dissolve over hot water.
Mix cream cheese with pineapple.
Add whipped cream mixed with cooled gelatine.
Place in a ring mold to congeal.
Serve with a bowl of mayonnaise in the center, surrounded by halved pears, peaches, white cherries, and grapefruit sections.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHEESE SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 cakes cream cheese
- Cream, as needed
- 2 tbsp green pepper, finely chopped
- 2 tbsp pimento, finely chopped
- 2 tbsp onion, finely chopped
- Garlic, to taste, optional
- Cayenne pepper, to taste
- Salt, to taste
- 1 cup finely chopped almonds
- Mayonnaise, for serving
<|steps|>
Soften cream cheese with cream to the consistency of cake batter.
Add green pepper, pimento, onion, optional garlic, cayenne, salt, and almonds.
Place in a mold and chill until congealed.
Serve with mayonnaise.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **GRAPEFRUIT DRESSING**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 egg yolks
- 3 tbsp butter
- 2 tbsp sugar
- Juice of 1 lemon
- Salt, to taste
- Paprika, to taste
- 1 pint cream, stiffly whipped
<|steps|>
Cook egg yolks, butter, and sugar, stirring until thick.
Remove from heat, add lemon juice, salt, and paprika, and return to cook until thick.
Remove, beat well, and cool.
Fold in whipped cream.
Serve with grapefruit or fruit salads.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **NUT CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb flour
- 1 lb butter
- 1.5 lbs sugar
- 10 eggs
- 1.5 lbs seeded raisins
- 1 lb shelled pecans
- 0.25 lb citron
- 1 grated nutmeg
- 0.5 pint whiskey, wine, or brandy
<|steps|>
Dredge raisins, pecans, and citron with part of the flour.
Melt butter, add sugar, then eggs one at a time.
Add remaining flour, then floured fruit and nuts, nutmeg, and whiskey.
Steam for 3 hours, then bake in a moderate oven for 1 hour.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **COCOANUT PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1.5 cups milk
- 3 tbsp flour
- 1 cup sugar
- 2 eggs, separated
- 1 tbsp butter
- 1 cup moist cocoanut, grated
- 1 tsp vanilla
<|steps|>
Scald milk in a double boiler.
Mix flour, sugar, and egg yolks, then add to milk.
Cook until thick, remove from heat, and add butter, cocoanut, and vanilla.
Pour into a baked pie shell.
Top with meringue made from egg whites, optionally sprinkling with reserved cocoanut.
Brown meringue in a slow oven.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TIPSY CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 eggs
- 1.125 cups flour
- 1 cup sugar
- 3 tbsp cold water
- 1 tsp baking powder
- 0.33 tsp salt
- Grated rind of 0.5 lemon
- 4 cups milk
- 4 eggs
- 8 tbsp sugar
- 0.5 tsp salt
- 1 tsp vanilla
- 1.5 cups blanched almonds
- 12 tbsp whiskey or sherry
- Whipped cream, for topping
<|steps|>
Separate 3 eggs, beat yolks with sugar, add water, lemon rind, and flour sifted twice with baking powder and 0.33 tsp salt.
Fold in beaten egg whites, pour into a greased 9-inch square pan, and bake at 320°F until done.
Heat 4 cups milk, combine 4 eggs, 8 tbsp sugar, and 0.5 tsp salt, and stir into hot milk.
Cook over hot water until custard coats a spoon, add vanilla, and chill.
Split cake into two layers, stick almonds into each cut side, using half the nuts per layer.
Sprinkle one layer with half the whiskey, pour over half the chilled custard.
Place the second layer almond-side up, sprinkle with remaining whiskey, and pour over remaining custard.
Top with a thick layer of whipped cream.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TRANSPARENT PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup butter
- 2 cups sugar
- 1 tsp nutmeg
- 3 eggs
- Pastry, for pie tin
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, then add eggs one at a time, beating thoroughly.
Add nutmeg.
Line a pie tin with pastry, pour in custard.
Bake in a slow 250°F oven for 1.5 hours.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **JEW CAKES A LA HOLLY SPRINGS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups dark brown sugar
- 4 eggs
- 1 tbsp cinnamon
- 1.5 tbsp allspice
- 3 tsp baking powder
- 1 heaping cup chopped black walnuts or pecans
- 0.75 cup citron, finely chopped
- 5 cups flour, approximate
- Boiled icing, for coating
<|steps|>
Combine sugar, eggs, cinnamon, allspice, baking powder, walnuts, and citron.
Gradually work in flour until dough can be rolled out, avoiding too much flour.
Roll to medium thickness and cut into 2-inch rounds.
Bake in a very moderate oven, watching to prevent browning.
Ice each with thin boiled icing to keep soft and hold flavor.
Store in tins.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **WINE JELLY**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 package gelatine
- 0.5 pint cold water
- 1 lb sugar
- Juice of 2 lemons
- Grated rind of 1 lemon
- 0.5 tsp cinnamon
- 1 pint water
- 0.5 pint wine
- 1 fresh cocoanut
- 1 dozen oranges
- Sugar, to taste
<|steps|>
Soak gelatine in cold water.
Combine sugar, lemon juice, lemon rind, cinnamon, and 1 pint water; bring to a boil.
Add gelatine and water, stirring until dissolved.
Strain and cool, then add wine.
Pour into wet molds and chill to congeal.
**AMBROSIA**
Peel oranges and skin the sections.
Grate cocoanut.
Mix oranges and cocoanut, sweeten to taste.
Let stand for several hours before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **JAM CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups flour
- 0.5 cup butter
- 1 cup sugar
- 3 eggs
- 0.5 cup sour milk
- 1 tsp baking soda
- 1 tsp cloves
- 1 tsp cinnamon
- 1 tsp nutmeg
- 0.5 tsp baking powder
- 1 cup blackberry jam
- White or mocha icing, for topping
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar.
Separate eggs, add beaten yolks, then sour milk with dissolved baking soda.
Sift flour with cloves, cinnamon, nutmeg, and baking powder; add to mixture.
Stir in jam, then fold in stiffly beaten egg whites.
Bake in layer pans in a moderate oven.
Ice with white or mocha icing.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FUDGE CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup boiling water
- 0.5 cup cocoa
- 1.5 cups sugar
- 0.5 cup shortening
- 2 egg yolks
- 0.75 cup sour milk
- 2 cups flour
- 1 tsp baking soda
- 1 tsp baking powder
- Pinch of salt
- 2 egg whites
- 1 tsp vanilla
<|steps|>
Combine boiling water and cocoa, mixing well.
Combine sugar, shortening, egg yolks, and sour milk.
Sift flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt together.
Add dry ingredients and sugar mixture alternately to cocoa mixture.
Fold in stiffly beaten egg whites and vanilla.
Bake in an 8-inch square pan at 350°F for 35 minutes.
Cut into squares.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **COCOANUT CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup butter
- 2 cups sugar
- 1 cup sweet milk
- 3.5 cups flour
- 2 tsp baking powder
- 6 egg whites
- 2 cups sugar, for filling
- Milk of 1 cocoanut
- 1 tsp cream of tartar
- 3 egg whites, for filling
- Grated meat of 1 cocoanut
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, gradually add flour sifted with baking powder, and sweet milk.
Fold in stiffly beaten egg whites.
Pour into layer pans and bake in a moderate oven.
For filling, cook sugar and cocoanut milk until it ropes.
Add cream of tartar, pour over stiffly beaten egg whites, and beat.
Add grated cocoanut and ice the cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PECAN PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 tbsp butter
- 1 cup sugar
- 2 eggs, well beaten
- 2 tbsp flour
- 1 cup brown corn syrup
- 2 cups pecans
- 0.5 tsp vanilla
- Pinch of salt
- Unbaked pie shell
<|steps|>
Mix butter, sugar, eggs, flour, and corn syrup well.
Add pecans, vanilla, and salt.
Pour into an unbaked pie shell.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHARLOTTE RUSSE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 pints rich milk
- 0.75 package gelatine
- 1 quart milk
- 1 lb sugar
- 8 egg yolks
- 1 quart rich cream, whipped
- Stale sponge cake, for lining
<|steps|>
Soak gelatine in 2 pints milk.
Make a custard with 1 quart milk, sugar, and egg yolks in a double boiler until thick.
Add milk and gelatine, then cool.
When it begins to congeal, stir in whipped cream.
Line a large mold with stale sponge cake and pour in the mixture.
Set on ice to congeal.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **STRAWBERRY SHORTCAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 pints strawberries
- 1 cup sugar
- 1 cup flour, for pastry
- 0.5 cup lard
- 0.25 tsp salt
- 0.25 tsp baking powder
- 4 tbsp boiling water
- Whipped cream, for topping
- 10 macaroons
- 1 pint cream
- 4 oz sugar
- Juice of 1 lemon
- Grated rind of 0.5 lemon
- 1 small wine glass sherry or Madeira
- Pinch of cinnamon
- Almond flavoring, to taste
- 0.5 cup lard
- 1 cup butter
- 1 cup sugar
- 1 egg
- 1 cup molasses
- 0.67 cup hot water
- 2.5 cups sifted flour
- 1.5 tsp baking soda
- 1 tsp cinnamon
- 1 tsp ginger
- 0.25 tsp cloves
- 0.25 tsp salt
- Whipped cream, for serving
<|steps|>
Wash and stem strawberries, mix with sugar in a bowl.
For pastry, combine flour, lard, salt, baking powder, and boiling water; chill thoroughly.
Roll out pastry as thin as possible and bake until brown on the back of a pie tin.
Place sweetened berries in the baked pastry shell and top with whipped cream.
**SYLLABUB**
Mix sugar, lemon juice, lemon rind, cinnamon, sherry, and a few drops of almond flavoring in a large bowl.
Stir until sugar dissolves, then add cream and whip to a froth.
Arrange macaroons compactly on the bottom of a deep dish.
Skim froth from syllabub and place on macaroons, continuing to beat and skim until all is froth.
Store in a cool place for at least 12 hours before serving.
**GINGERBREAD**
Cream lard, butter, and sugar until smooth.
Add egg and mix thoroughly, then stir in molasses.
Alternate hot water with flour sifted with baking soda, cinnamon, ginger, cloves, and salt.
Place in a greased and floured shallow loaf pan.
Bake at 350°F.
Serve warm or cold with whipped cream.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHRISTMAS PUDDING**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 quart bread crumbs
- Cold water, for soaking
- 1 cup sugar
- 0.5 cup molasses
- 1 cup raisins
- 0.25 cup currants
- 1 tsp ginger
- 1 tsp nutmeg
- 1 tsp cinnamon
- 0.5 tsp cloves
- 0.5 tsp allspice
- 1 tbsp shortening
- 1 tsp baking soda
- Hot water, for dissolving
- Hard sauce, for serving
<|steps|>
Soak bread crumbs in cold water until soft, then squeeze dry.
Add sugar, molasses, raisins, currants, ginger, nutmeg, cinnamon, cloves, allspice, and shortening.
When ready to steam, dissolve baking soda in a little hot water and add.
Steam in a double boiler for 4 hours.
Serve with hard sauce.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **APPLE FLOAT**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 quart cooked apples
- Nutmeg, to taste
- Sugar, to taste
- 4 egg whites
- 1 pint boiled custard, optional
<|steps|>
Mash cooked apples through a sieve, sweeten, and flavor with nutmeg.
Mix with beaten egg whites.
Serve plain or pour over boiled custard.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **STRAWBERRY MOUSSE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pint strawberries
- 1 cup granulated sugar
- Pinch of salt
- 2 cups whipping cream
- 2 tsp lemon juice
- 2 egg whites
- Whipped cream, optional
<|steps|>
Wash and stem strawberries, add sugar, and crush.
Heat until sugar dissolves, then strain and chill.
Add lemon juice to berry mixture.
Fold in whipped cream and stiffly beaten egg whites with salt.
Pour into a freezing tray, mold, or individual cups.
Freeze without stirring.
Serve plain or with whipped cream.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PRUNE CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup sugar
- 0.25 cup butter
- 2 eggs
- 0.5 cup milk
- 1.5 cups flour
- 1 tsp baking powder
- 1 tsp baking soda
- Pinch of salt
- 1 tsp cinnamon
- 1 cup stewed, chopped prunes
- 1 cup pure maple syrup
- 2 egg whites
- 1 cup brown sugar
- 0.75 cup shortening
- 2 eggs
- 2 cups flour
- 1 package dates
- 0.5 package seedless raisins
- 2 cups pecans
- 1 tsp allspice
- 1 tsp baking soda
- 1 tbsp boiling water
<|steps|>
Cream sugar and butter, then add eggs one at a time and milk.
Sift flour with baking powder, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon; stir into mixture.
Add prunes and mix.
Bake in a loaf pan at 350°F for about 40 minutes.
Boil maple syrup until it spins a thread, pour over stiffly beaten egg whites, and beat until thick.
Ice the cake with maple icing.
**ROCKS**
Cream shortening and sugar, then add beaten eggs.
Dredge dates, raisins, and pecans in flour, then add to mixture.
Dissolve baking soda in boiling water and add.
Drop by teaspoonfuls onto a cookie sheet.
Bake in a moderate oven for about 20 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MOUSSES PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup sugar
- 2 tbsp cornstarch
- 3 eggs
- 1 cup sorghum molasses
- 2 tbsp vinegar
- 2 tbsp butter
- 0.125 tsp salt
- 1 cup pecans, optional
- Unbaked pastry, for pie pan
<|steps|>
Mix cornstarch with sugar, then add beaten eggs, molasses, vinegar, melted butter, and salt.
Add pecans if desired.
Pour into a large pie pan lined with unbaked pastry.
Bake slowly in a moderate oven until the custard mixture is set.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHESS CAKES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 fresh cocoanut
- 2 cups sugar
- 0.67 pint water
- 0.5 lb butter
- 7 egg yolks
- Rich, unbaked pastry, for lining
- 1.25 coffee cups prepared cocoanut, if not fresh
- 0.5 cup butter
- 1 cup powdered sugar
- 4 tbsp boiling water
- Sherry, rum, or brandy flavoring, to taste
- Nutmeg, optional
<|steps|>
Peel and grate cocoanut if fresh.
Boil sugar in water for 15 minutes, stir in grated cocoanut, and boil 15 minutes longer.
While warm, stir in butter and well-beaten egg yolks.
Pour into patty pans or pie pans lined with rich, unbaked pastry.
Bake in a moderate oven until done, making 24 tiny pies or 2 large pies.
**HARD SAUCE**
Beat butter until creamy, then add half the sugar and 2 tbsp boiling water.
Beat well, then add remaining sugar and water.
When light and fluffy, add flavoring and optional nutmeg.
Store in a cool place until used.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LEMON FILLING FOR CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 8 egg yolks or 4 whole eggs
- 1 cup butter
- 1 cup sugar
- Juice of 4 lemons
- 1 tbsp fine corn meal
- White icing, for topping
- 1 cup sugar
- 0.5 cup corn syrup
- 1 cup water
- 3 squares chocolate
- 1 tsp vanilla
- Pinch of salt
- 1 cup evaporated milk
- 0.5 cup sugar
- 0.5 cup butter
- 1.5 cups sugar
- 0.75 cup sweet milk
- Pinch of salt
- 2 cups brown sugar
- 0.67 cup milk
- 1 heaping cup whole pecans
<|steps|>
Cook egg yolks, butter, sugar, lemon juice, and corn meal in a double boiler until thick.
Spread between layers of white cake.
Cover cake with plain white icing.
**CHOCOLATE SAUCE**
Boil sugar, corn syrup, and water without stirring until it threads or forms a soft ball in cold water.
Remove from heat, add chocolate, vanilla, and salt.
Slowly stir in evaporated milk.
**CARAMEL SAUCE**
In an iron skillet, shake sugar and butter until brown, without stirring.
In a separate vessel, cook 1.5 cups sugar, milk, and salt until it coats a spoon.
Add hot browned sugar mixture to the milk mixture.
Remove from heat and beat well.
**PRALINES**
Boil brown sugar and milk, stirring often, until it forms a soft ball in cold water.
Remove from heat and beat until it thickens.
Add pecans.
Drop onto buttered paper to form rounds about 3 inches in diameter.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CREOLE KISSES**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 egg whites
- 1 cup sugar
- 0.5 lb nuts (black walnuts preferred)
- 1 tsp vanilla
<|steps|>
Beat egg whites, gradually adding sugar until the mixture holds its shape.
Add nuts and vanilla.
Drop by spoonfuls onto ungreased brown paper.
Bake in a medium oven until golden brown.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **COCOANUT CANDY**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 cups white sugar
- Water, to cover
- Pinch of cream of tartar
- 1 tsp vanilla
- Freshly grated cocoanut
<|steps|>
Cook sugar, water, and cream of tartar until it forms a soft ball in water.
Cool in the pan, then stir slowly until it creams.
Add vanilla, form into balls, and roll in grated cocoanut.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **COCOANUT FONDANT**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cocoanut, grated
- 2 lbs granulated sugar
- Milk of cocoanut
- Water, as needed
<|steps|>
Combine sugar, cocoanut milk, and a little water; cook in a double boiler until a small amount creams when tested in a saucer.
Add to grated cocoanut and beat until it holds its shape when dropped onto a buttered plate.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **DIVINITY FUDGE**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 egg whites
- 3.5 cups sugar
- 1 cup white corn syrup
- 1 cup nuts (or more)
- 1.5 cups water
- 2 tsp vanilla
- 4 egg whites
- 3.5 cups sugar
- 1 cup white corn syrup
- 1.5 cups water
- Oil of peppermint, to taste
- Food coloring, optional
<|steps|>
Cook 1 cup sugar and 0.5 cup water until it spins a thread, then pour over stiffly beaten egg whites and beat well.
Cook 2.5 cups sugar, 1 cup water, and corn syrup until very brittle in cold water.
Pour this syrup over the egg white mixture.
Add vanilla and nuts, beating until it holds its shape.
Drop by spoonfuls onto waxed paper.
**MINTS**
Cook 1 cup sugar and 0.5 cup water until it spins a thread, then pour over stiffly beaten egg whites and beat well.
Cook 2.5 cups sugar, 1 cup water, and corn syrup until very brittle in cold water.
Pour this syrup over the egg white mixture.
Add a drop or two of oil of peppermint and optional food coloring, beating until it holds its shape.
Drop by spoonfuls onto waxed paper.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHOCOLATE FUDGE**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 cups sugar
- 7 tbsp cocoa
- 3 tbsp white corn syrup
- 1.5 cups sweet milk
- 1 tsp vanilla
- Butter, size of an egg
- 1 cup nuts
<|steps|>
Stir sugar, cocoa, corn syrup, and milk well, then cook until a small amount hardens in a saucer.
Remove from heat, add vanilla and butter.
Beat until the mixture thickens, then add nuts.
Pour onto a greased platter.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MINT JULEP**
<|ingredients|>
- Sugar, 0.5 inch per glass
- Water, to dampen
- Finely crushed ice
- 2 sprigs fresh mint per glass
- 0.5-1 jigger bourbon per glass
- Grated nutmeg, for sprinkling
- 12 eggs, separated
- 1.5 pints whiskey
- 2 pints cream
- 1 pint sugar
- Nutmeg, for sprinkling
<|steps|>
Place sugar in each glass and dampen with water.
Pack glass with crushed ice, placing mint sprigs inside the sides.
Add bourbon and sprinkle with nutmeg.
Stir lightly to frost the glass and serve immediately.
**EGGNOG**
Beat egg yolks well, then gradually add sugar, continuing to beat.
Add whiskey a little at a time.
Add 1 pint unbeaten cream, then stiffly beaten egg whites, stirring well.
Whip remaining 1 pint cream and stir in.
Chill overnight, then shake nutmeg on top of each cup before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BLACKBERRY ACID**
<|ingredients|>
- 12 lbs blackberries
- 2 quarts boiling water
- 5 oz tartaric acid
- White sugar, 1 lb per pint of juice
<|steps|>
Add boiling water to blackberries and let stand for 48 hours.
Drip juice without squeezing.
Add tartaric acid to juice.
Measure juice and add 1 lb sugar per pint.
Let stand until sugar dissolves, then bottle.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **DEEP SOUTH PUNCH**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup sugar
- Juice of 6 lemons
- 1 pint sherry
- 1 pint claret
- 1 pint club soda
- Large lump of ice
<|steps|>
Dissolve sugar in lemon juice.
Add sherry and claret, mixing well.
Pour into a bowl with a large lump of ice.
Add club soda and serve in punch cups.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **WATERMELON RIND PRESERVES**
<|ingredients|>
- 10 cups peeled watermelon rind
- 10 cups sugar
- 10 tbsp finely chopped orange peel
<|steps|>
Mix watermelon rind and sugar, letting stand overnight.
Add orange peel and cook until a clear, rich yellow color.
Seal in jars.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHOW-CHOW PICKLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 gallons cabbage, chopped
- 1 quart onions, chopped
- 1 cup salt
- 1 gallon vinegar
- 4 lbs brown sugar
- 5 tbsp mustard
- 2 scant tbsp black pepper
- 1 tbsp ground cloves
- 1.5 tbsp turmeric
- 2 tbsp celery seed
- 1.5 cups white mustard seed
<|steps|>
Combine cabbage, onions, and salt; let stand overnight.
Drain in the morning and add vinegar, brown sugar, mustard, black pepper, cloves, turmeric, celery seed, and mustard seed.
Cook for about 2 hours.
Seal in jars.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SWEET PICKLED PEACHES**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 lbs peaches
- 1 tsp mace
- 2 lbs sugar
- 1 tsp cinnamon
- 1 pint apple vinegar
- 1 tsp allspice
- 1 tsp cloves
<|steps|>
Mix vinegar, sugar, mace, cinnamon, allspice, and cloves; bring to a good boil.
Add peaches and cook until very tender.
Seal in jars.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CUCUMBER PICKLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 gallon cucumbers
- 1.5 lbs brown sugar
- 2 tbsp celery seed
- 2 tbsp mustard seed
- 2 tbsp turmeric
- 2 onions, chopped
- Several pieces horseradish, finely chopped
- 2 tbsp black pepper
- 1 pod red pepper
- 0.5 gallon vinegar
<|steps|>
Boil vinegar, brown sugar, celery seed, mustard seed, turmeric, onions, horseradish, black pepper, and red pepper for 30 minutes.
Pour over cucumbers.
Seal in jars.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **WATERMELON PICKLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 lbs watermelon rind
- Alum water, for soaking
- Clear water, for soaking
- Weak ginger water, for boiling
- 3 cups sugar
- 1 pint vinegar
- 1 tbsp cloves
- 1 tbsp whole spice
<|steps|>
Prepare rind and soak in alum water for 24 hours.
Soak in clear water for 5 hours.
Drain and boil in weak ginger water until tender.
Drain, then pour a syrup of sugar, vinegar, cloves, and whole spice over rinds.
Bring to a hard boil and seal in jars.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PRESERVED PEARS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 quarts pears
- 1 quart sugar
- Water, to moisten
- Ginger or pineapple, optional
<|steps|>
Select smooth, sweet pears; peel, halve, and remove cores, dropping into cold water to prevent blackening.
Heat sugar and water until warm, then add pears.
Cook slowly for several hours until syrup is thick.
Add ginger or pineapple for flavor if desired.
Seal in jars.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SPICED GRAPES OR MUSCADINES**
<|ingredients|>
- 5 lbs grapes or muscadines
- 0.75 cup water
- 2.5 lbs sugar
- 2 tbsp cinnamon
- 2 tbsp allspice
- 0.5 tbsp ground cloves
- 0.5 cup vinegar, to taste
<|steps|>
Wash and pulp grapes.
Boil skins with water until tender.
Cook pulps in their own juice until seeds can be removed through a colander.
Mix skins and pulps, then add sugar, cinnamon, allspice, cloves, and vinegar.
Boil, stirring occasionally, until rather thick.
Seal in jars.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **AVOCADO DIP**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 ripe avocado
- 1 small onion, diced
- 1 small block cream cheese
- 1/4 cup lemon juice
<|steps|>
Place avocado, diced onion, cream cheese, and lemon juice in a mixer.
Blend until smooth.
Serve with chips or crackers.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SHRIMP PARTY DIP**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can frozen Cream of Shrimp Soup
- 1 3-oz. package cream cheese, softened
- Dash of garlic powder
- Dash of paprika
<|steps|>
Thaw the Cream of Shrimp Soup just before using.
Add softened cream cheese and beat until smooth.
Mix in garlic powder and paprika.
Chill before serving. Yields 1 1/2 cups.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SHRIMP DIP**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can shrimp, drained
- 1 can Pet Milk
- 1 package cream cheese, softened
- 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce
- Garlic salt, to taste
- Onion salt, to taste
<|steps|>
Combine drained shrimp, Pet Milk, and softened cream cheese in a blender.
Add Worcestershire sauce, garlic salt, and onion salt to taste.
Blend until smooth.
Chill and serve with crackers or vegetables.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CINNAMON NUTS**
<|ingredients|>
- 6 tablespoons milk
- 1 cup granulated sugar
- 2 cups English walnuts or pecans
- 1/3 teaspoon cinnamon
- Pinch of salt
<|steps|>
Boil sugar, cinnamon, salt, and milk until it forms a soft ball in cold water (about 235°F).
Remove from heat and stir in walnuts or pecans.
Mix well and pour onto wax paper.
Separate nuts when cool.
Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BAKED HAM AND ASPARAGUS ROLLS**
<|ingredients|>
- Baked ham, thinly sliced
- Asparagus spears, trimmed
- Melted butter
- Parmesan cheese, grated
<|steps|>
Place 3 asparagus spears on each slice of ham.
Roll up and secure with a toothpick.
Place rolls in a broiler pan.
Drizzle with melted butter and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
Broil until hot and bubbly, about 5-7 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SPICY PECANS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 egg white
- 2 tablespoons water
- 1 6-oz. can pecans
- 2/3 cup sugar
- 2 teaspoons cinnamon
- 1/2 teaspoon ginger
- 1/4 cup cornstarch
<|steps|>
Beat egg white with water until slightly frothy.
Stir in pecans until well coated.
Combine sugar, cinnamon, ginger, and cornstarch; sift into a shallow pan.
Toss pecans in the sugar mixture to coat thoroughly.
Bake at 250°F for 1 1/2 hours, stirring occasionally.
Cool and store. Yields about 3/4 pound.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MINTY GLAZED NUTS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 1/2 cups sugar
- 1/2 cup light corn syrup
- 1/2 cup water
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 2 cups shelled walnuts
- 3 tablespoons melted butter
- 1 teaspoon peppermint extract
<|steps|>
Combine sugar, corn syrup, water, and salt in a saucepan.
Stir over low heat until sugar dissolves.
Cook to hard-crack stage (300°F).
Remove from heat and stir in walnuts, butter, and peppermint extract.
Spread into a greased shallow pan.
Separate nuts with a fork as they cool. Yields 1 pound.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SMOKY PEANUTS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/3 cup liquid smoke
- 1/3 cup water
- 1 13 1/2-oz. can salted peanuts
- 2 tablespoons butter
- Salt, to taste
<|steps|>
Combine liquid smoke and water in a saucepan and bring to a boil.
Pour over peanuts in a shallow pan and let stand for 1 hour.
Drain liquid and spread peanuts in the pan.
Toast at 250°F for 1 hour.
Toss with butter and salt to taste. Yields about 3/4 pound.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHEESE ROLL**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 8-oz. piece cheddar cheese
- 1 3-oz. package cream cheese
- 1 minced garlic pod or 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
- Paprika, for coating
<|steps|>
Cream cheddar and cream cheese together until smooth.
Add minced garlic or garlic powder and mix well.
Spread paprika on wax paper.
Roll cheese mixture on paprika to form a log.
Refrigerate until firm.
Slice and serve with crackers.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHEESE PUFFS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 lb. grated cheese
- 1/2 lb. butter, softened
- 2 cups sifted flour
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon paprika
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 350°F.
Mix grated cheese and softened butter until creamy.
Sift flour, salt, and paprika together.
Combine dry ingredients with cheese mixture to form a dough.
Shape into small balls and place on a baking sheet.
Bake for 15-20 minutes until lightly browned. Yields about 4 dozen.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PARTY ICE TEA**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 tablespoons tea
- 4 cups sugar
- 1 bunch fresh mint
- 1 quart boiling water
- Juice of 12 lemons
- Juice of 6 oranges
- Water, to make 1 gallon
- Cracked ice
- Orange slices, for garnish
- Mint sprigs, for garnish
<|steps|>
Pour boiling water over tea, sugar, and mint; let steep briefly.
Strain and add lemon and orange juices.
Add water to make 1 gallon.
Serve over cracked ice, garnished with orange slices and mint sprigs. Serves 15.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SANTA'S 7-UP SURPRISE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 46-oz. can pineapple juice
- 10 7-oz. bottles 7-Up
- 2 6-oz. cans frozen orange juice, thawed
- 1/2 teaspoon peppermint extract
- Maraschino cherries
- 2 trays 7-Up ice cubes
<|steps|>
Chill pineapple juice and 7-Up.
Pour additional 7-Up into 2 ice cube trays, placing a maraschino cherry in each cube, and freeze.
Combine pineapple juice and thawed orange juice in a punch bowl.
Add peppermint extract.
Slowly pour in chilled 7-Up and add 7-Up ice cubes.
Serve in punch cups. Yields about 30 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CRANBERRY PUNCH**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1/2 cup water
- 1 cup frozen orange juice
- 1/2 cup lemon juice
- 2 cups cranberry juice cocktail
- 1 quart ginger ale
<|steps|>
Cook sugar and water until boiling, then simmer for 5 minutes.
Cool syrup, then add orange juice, lemon juice, and cranberry juice.
Pour over ice and add ginger ale just before serving. Serves 20-25.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **7-UP EVERGREEN BOWL**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 pints lime sherbet
- 12 7-oz. bottles 7-Up
<|steps|>
Spoon 3 pints lime sherbet into a punch bowl and soften for 5 minutes.
Slowly pour in chilled 7-Up, stirring slightly.
Float scoops of remaining sherbet on top.
Serve in punch cups. Yields about 36 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHEESE BREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 3/4 cup coarsely grated Cheddar cheese
- 3 3/4 cups prepared biscuit mix
- 6 strips bacon, cooked and crumbled
- 1 1/2 cups buttermilk
- 1 egg
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 350°F.
Mix cheese, biscuit mix, and bacon together.
Beat buttermilk and egg together, then stir into dry ingredients.
Pour into a greased 9 x 5 x 3-inch loaf pan.
Bake for 1 hour.
Cool, optionally freeze for up to 1 month; thaw for 4-5 hours and reheat at 350°F for 45 minutes.
Slice and serve warm.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **RAISIN BANANA MUFFINS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup seedless raisins, washed and drained
- 1 egg
- 1/3 cup milk
- 1 cup bran cereal
- 2/3 cup mashed banana
- 2 tablespoons melted shortening
- 1 cup sifted flour
- 1/3 cup sugar
- 4 teaspoons baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 400°F.
Beat egg lightly, add milk and bran cereal, and let stand for 5 minutes.
Blend in banana, raisins, and shortening.
Sift flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt together.
Add dry ingredients to wet mixture, stirring until moistened.
Fill greased muffin tins.
Bake for 20-25 minutes. Yields 15 muffins.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORN BREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup sifted corn meal
- 1/4 cup flour
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- Buttermilk, as needed
- 1 egg (optional)
- 1 tablespoon oil (optional)
- Oil, for pan
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 425°F.
Sift corn meal, flour, salt, baking powder, and baking soda together.
Add enough buttermilk to form a batter.
Optionally, mix in egg and 1 tablespoon oil.
Heat oil in a baking pan.
Pour batter into the hot pan.
Bake for 25 minutes or until golden brown.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HOME MADE BISCUIT MIX**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 tablespoon salt
- 3 tablespoons baking powder
- 6 cups sifted flour
- 1 cup vegetable shortening
- 3/4 cup milk (per 2 1/2 cups mix)
<|steps|>
Sift salt, baking powder, and flour together.
Cut in shortening until mixture resembles coarse corn meal.
Store in a covered container. Yields enough for 60 biscuits.
To make biscuits, combine 2 1/2 cups mix with 3/4 cup milk.
Knead lightly, roll to 1/2-inch thickness, and cut into biscuits.
Bake at 425°F for 15 minutes. Yields 20 biscuits per batch.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SPOON BREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 cups milk
- 1 cup corn meal
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 1 3/4 teaspoons salt
- 4 eggs, well-beaten
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 425°F.
Scald milk in a double boiler.
Gradually stir in corn meal and cook until mush consistency.
Add butter and salt.
Pour mixture over beaten eggs, stirring constantly.
Pour into a greased 1 1/2-quart baking dish.
Bake for 45 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CREAM CHEESE BISCUITS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup sifted bread flour
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 3-oz. package cream cheese
- 1/2 cup butter
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 425°F.
Sift flour and salt together twice.
Cream or sieve cream cheese with butter until smooth.
Blend cheese mixture into flour.
Knead for 30 seconds on a lightly floured board.
Roll out to 1/4-inch thickness and cut with a biscuit cutter.
Bake on an ungreased cookie sheet for 15 minutes.
Serve warm. Yields about 18 biscuits.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CREOLE CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can English peas, drained
- 1 cup grated Cheddar cheese
- 1/2 cup buttered bread crumbs
- 1 recipe Creole sauce
- 2 cups thick white sauce
- 3 tablespoons grated cheese
- Mustard, to taste
- Durkee's horseradish mayonnaise, to taste
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
<|steps|>
Season the white sauce with mustard, Durkee's horseradish mayonnaise, salt, and pepper to taste.
Add 1 cup grated Cheddar cheese to the white sauce and mix well.
Place buttered bread crumbs in the bottom of a casserole dish.
Layer alternately with drained peas, white sauce, and Creole sauce.
Finish with a sprinkle of 3 tablespoons grated cheese on top.
Bake in the oven until browned before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **POT LIKKER**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 lb. salt pork
- 3 quarts cold water
- Young turnip greens, washed and cleaned
- 1 1/2 cups pot likker (cooking liquid)
- Cornmeal dodgers (optional)
<|steps|>
Place salt pork in 3 quarts cold water and boil for 45 minutes.
Add washed turnip greens and boil slowly for 1 hour.
Drain, reserving 1 1/2 cups of the pot likker.
Chop greens on a hot dish and top with sliced salt pork.
Pour reserved pot likker over greens and pork.
Optionally, serve with cornmeal dodgers.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORN MEAL DODGER FOR POT LIKKER**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 pint white corn meal
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 2 tablespoons melted shortening
- Cold water, as needed
<|steps|>
Mix salt and corn meal, then stir in melted shortening.
Add enough cold water to form a dough that holds its shape.
Shape into biscuit-sized pieces.
Drop into boiling pot likker.
Boil in a covered pot for 20 minutes.
Serve with pot likker greens.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BAKED STUFFED TOMATOES**
<|ingredients|>
- 6 firm tomatoes, unpeeled
- 2 onions, finely chopped
- 1 bell pepper, finely chopped
- 3 ribs celery, finely chopped
- 2 tablespoons butter
- Salt, to taste
- 1 cup cooked rice
- Ground ham (optional)
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 350°F.
Cut tops off tomatoes and scoop out insides, leaving shells.
Sprinkle shells with salt and invert to drain.
Fry onions, bell pepper, and celery in butter until tender.
Add tomato insides and simmer until broken down.
Stir in cooked rice and cook until nearly dry. Optionally, add ground ham.
Stuff tomato shells with the mixture.
Bake for 15 minutes. Serves 6.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **GREEN BEAN BAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 1 teaspoon soy sauce
- 1 3 1/2-oz. can French-fried onions
- 3 cups cooked French-style green beans
- Pepper, to taste
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 350°F.
Stir soup and soy sauce in a 1-quart casserole until smooth.
Mix in half the French-fried onions, green beans, and pepper.
Bake for 20 minutes.
Top with remaining onions and bake for 5 more minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MINTED GLAZED CARROTS**
<|ingredients|>
- 12 fresh carrots, cut into strips
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1/4 cup butter
- 2 tablespoons chopped mint or dried mint flakes
<|steps|>
Cook carrots in boiling salted water until tender.
Drain and pour sugar and butter over hot carrots.
Cook slowly until glazed, avoiding browning.
Drain excess juice and sprinkle with mint before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BARBECUED LIMAS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups dried lima beans
- 1/4 lb. salt pork, cubed
- 1/4 lb. salt pork, sliced
- 1 small onion, sliced
- 帮助我们改进翻译
- 1 clove garlic, chopped
- 1/4 cup fat
- 1 1/2 tablespoons chili powder
- 1 tablespoon salt
- 1 10 1/2-oz. can condensed tomato soup
- 1/3 cup vinegar
- 1 1/2 tablespoons prepared mustard
- 2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce
<|steps|>
Soak lima beans, then drain.
Cook beans with cubed salt pork in water until tender.
Drain, reserving 1 1/2 cups liquid.
Brown onion and garlic in fat.
Add chili powder, salt, tomato soup, vinegar, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, and reserved liquid; cook for 5 minutes.
Layer sauce and limas in a greased casserole, topping with sliced salt pork.
Bake covered at 400°F for 30 minutes. Serves 8.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SPINACH DELICIOUS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 14-oz. package frozen spinach or 1 lb. fresh spinach, cooked
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 2 tablespoons horseradish
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/8 teaspoon pepper
- 1/4 cup light cream
- Hard-cooked eggs, for garnish
<|steps|>
Prepare spinach as directed or cook fresh spinach, then chop.
Add butter, horseradish, salt, pepper, and cream.
Heat through.
Garnish with sliced hard-cooked eggs. Serves 4-5.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRIED OKRA**
<|ingredients|>
- Fresh okra, sliced
- Corn meal
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Oil, for frying
<|steps|>
Slice okra into rounds and season with salt and pepper.
Roll okra slices in corn meal to coat.
Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Fry okra until golden brown, about 3-5 minutes per side.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BAKED BEANS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 No. 2 cans baked beans
- 1 medium onion, finely chopped
- 3/4 cup catsup
- 1 small can crushed pineapple
- 1/2 cup molasses or Karo syrup
- 2 teaspoons mustard
- 2 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce
- Sliced cheese, for garnish
- Cherries with stems, for garnish
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 300°F.
Mix baked beans, onion, catsup, pineapple, molasses, mustard, and Worcestershire sauce.
Pour into a baking dish.
Bake for 1 hour.
Cut cheese slices with a doughnut cutter, removing centers.
Place cheese rings on top, with a cherry in each center for garnish.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CRANBERRY SALAD SUPREME**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 cups raw cranberries
- 2 1/2 cups water
- 1 cup sugar
- 2 packages lemon Jell-O
- Juice of 1 pineapple
- 1 can crushed pineapple
- 1 cup white grapes
- 1 cup chopped nuts
<|steps|>
Cook cranberries, sugar, and water until berries are soft.
Add lemon Jell-O and pineapple juice, then cool.
Stir in crushed pineapple, white grapes, and chopped nuts.
Pour into a large mold or individual molds.
Chill until set. Serves 14.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SUGAR COOKIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 cups sifted flour
- 2 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 2/3 cup shortening
- 1 1/2 cups sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 4 teaspoons milk
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 375°F.
Cream shortening and sugar, then add eggs and mix well.
Sift flour, baking powder, and salt together.
Stir dry ingredients into creamed mixture with vanilla and milk.
Chill dough for easier handling.
Roll out dough and cut with cookie cutters.
Bake for 10 minutes. Yields 4-5 dozen cookies.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHOCOLATE CHIP KISSES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup sweetened condensed milk
- 1 1/2 cups shredded coconut
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 1 cup chocolate pieces
- 1/2 cup sifted cake flour
- Dash of salt
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 3 tablespoons shortening
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 2 tablespoons strained honey syrup
- 1 egg, beaten
- 1 oz. melted chocolate
- 1 tablespoon hot water
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1/2 cup chopped pecans
- 1/2 strip bacon per can
- Stew meat, cut into bite-sized pieces
- Flour, for coating
- Oil, for browning
- Sliced raw onions
- Cubed potatoes
- Green pepper rings
- Sliced carrots (optional)
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- Canned tomatoes or water
- 16 graham crackers
- 8 plain flat chocolate bars
- 8 marshmallows
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 325°F.
Combine condensed milk, coconut, and baking powder.
Stir in chocolate pieces.
Drop by teaspoonfuls onto a greased baking sheet.
Bake for 25 minutes or until edges are browned. Yields 2 dozen.
**BROWNIES**
Preheat oven to 350°F.
Sift flour, salt, and baking powder together.
Cream shortening and sugar until fluffy, then add egg and mix well.
Stir in melted chocolate.
Add dry ingredients, hot water, and vanilla, blending well.
Mix in pecans.
Spread in an 8-inch pan and bake for 20 minutes. Yields 36 brownies.
**COFFEE CAN STEW**
Place a half strip of bacon in the bottom of a 1-lb. coffee can for each person.
Coat stew meat in seasoned flour and brown in oil.
Layer browned meat over bacon in the can.
Add layers of onions, potatoes, green pepper, and carrots if desired.
Season with salt and pepper.
Spoon canned tomatoes or water over the top.
Cook on hot coals for about 70 minutes.
**S'MORES**
Break each chocolate bar in half and place each half on a graham cracker.
Toast a marshmallow over a fire.
Place the toasted marshmallow on top of the chocolate.
Cover with another graham cracker and press together.
Serve immediately. Yields 8 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **GRILLED BACON-WRAPPED WIENERS**
<|ingredients|>
- 16 wieners
- 1 lb. cheddar cheese
- 16 slices bacon or ham
- 16 buttered buns
<|steps|>
Split wieners lengthwise partway.
Cut cheese into long strips and place one in each wiener.
Press wiener together and wrap with bacon or ham, securing ends with toothpicks.
Roast on a grill over hot coals until bacon is crisp and wieners are heated through.
Serve in buttered buns. Yields 8 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MULLIGAN STEW**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. stew meat, cut into small pieces
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 can condensed tomato soup
- 1 can water
- 3 carrots, thickly sliced
- 3 potatoes, quartered
- 3 onions, halved
- Fat, for browning
<|steps|>
Brown stew meat in hot fat in a heavy frying pan.
Add salt, tomato soup, and water.
Cover tightly and cook slowly until tender, about 1 1/2 hours.
Add carrots, potatoes, and onions.
Cook slowly for 30 minutes.
Add water if needed; cook uncovered to thicken sauce if too thin. Yields 6 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CAMPFIRE PIZZA**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 1/2 cups prepared biscuit mix
- 2/3 cup milk or water
- 1 cup cooked tomatoes
- 1/2 cup cubed American cheese
- 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese
- 1/2 cup salad oil
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
<|steps|>
Mix biscuit mix with milk or water and beat for 1 minute.
Spread dough in a well-greased 10-inch skillet.
Cover with cooked tomatoes.
Sprinkle with American cheese, Parmesan cheese, and drizzle with salad oil.
Season with salt and pepper.
Cover and cook over a slow fire for 20-25 minutes, until lightly browned underneath and cheese is melted.
Cut into pie-shaped pieces and serve hot. Yields 6 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CUCUMBER PICKLES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 gal. cucumbers
- 1 cup. coarse, sack salt
- 1 gal. water
- 1 Tbsp. alum
- Vinegar (enough to cover)
- 5 lbs. cucumbers (weighed after cutting)
- 3 lbs. sugar
- Pickling spices (in 3 small bags)
- 2 Tbsp. Wesson oil
<|steps|>
Soak cucumbers in brine of salt and water for 1 week or longer.
Remove from brine, cut into 1/8 or 1/4 inch round pieces.
Place in alum water (1 Tbsp. alum to 1 gal. water), let stand overnight.
Remove from alum water, cover with vinegar for 24 hours.
Drain vinegar, weigh 5 lbs. cucumbers to 3 lbs. sugar.
Layer cucumbers and sugar in a large jar, placing a bag of pickling spices at the bottom, middle, and top.
When sugar dissolves, add Wesson oil to the top.
Preserve for one year.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ICE CREAM PICKLES**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 gal. cucumbers
- 2 cup. salt
- 2 Tbsp. alum
- Boiling water (enough to cover)
- Vinegar (for syrup)
- Sugar (for syrup)
- Spices (for syrup)
<|steps|>
Pour boiling water over salt and cucumbers, let stand overnight.
Drain, cover with clear boiling water, let stand overnight, drain.
Make syrup of vinegar, sugar, and spices, bring to boil, pour over pickles.
Let stand for 3 days.
On the fourth day, reheat syrup, pack pickles in jars, pour hot syrup over pickles, and seal.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **GREEN TOMATO PICKLES**
<|ingredients|>
- 7 lb. full-grown green tomatoes
- 2 gal. water
- 3 cup. powdered lime
- 5 lb. sugar
- 3 pt. vinegar
- 2 heaping Tbsp. whole, mixed spice (in bag)
<|steps|>
Wash tomatoes, cut out stems, slice 1/4 inch thick.
Soak in lime and water in a large pot for 24 hours.
Soak in clear water for 4 hours, changing water every 30 minutes.
Drain well, place in large pot.
Mix sugar and vinegar in another pot, bring to a rolling boil, pour over tomatoes, let stand overnight.
Add spice bag, cook slowly for 1 hour.
Put in jars and seal.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TOMATO JUICE APPETIZER**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 qt., 14 oz. can tomato juice
- 1/2 tsp. seasoned salt (savor salt)
- 2 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 2 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 1 lb. butter
- 1 qt. water
- 1/2 cup. best vinegar
- 1 large onion (or 2 small)
- 1 clove garlic, chopped
- 1 tsp. Tabasco sauce
- 1/2 cup. tomato catsup
- 2 tsp. chili powder
- 1 Tbsp. black pepper
- Salt to taste
- Green Bell pepper (optional)
- Celery (optional)
- Hot red pepper (optional)
- 1/2 cup. cooking oil
- 3 small garlic cloves, chopped fine
- 1 large onion, chopped fine
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 2 No. 2 cans tomatoes, strained
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/3 tsp. pepper
- Grated Parmesan cheese
- 1 cup. butter or margarine
- 1 minced clove garlic
- 4 tsp. flour
- 2/3 cup. water
- 1 Tbsp. sugar
- 4 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 6 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 1/4 tsp. Tabasco sauce
- 1/2 tsp. dried thyme
<|steps|>
Combine all ingredients.
Chill well before serving.
**BARBECUE SAUCE**
Bring all ingredients to boiling point, then simmer for 30 minutes.
If using, cook celery and Bell pepper until tender, add to mixture, bring to boil.
**ITALIAN SPAGHETTI SAUCE**
Pour oil into fryer or pan, add garlic and onion, fry until brown.
Add ground beef, brown it.
Add tomatoes and seasonings, cover, cook until sauce is thick, about 2 hours.
Serve over cooked spaghetti, sprinkle with grated cheese.
**LEMON BARBECUE SAUCE**
Mix minced garlic with butter in a saucepan, stir in flour.
Add remaining ingredients, cook, stirring until lightly thickened.
Cool, use as a baster when barbecuing.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PEPPER RELISH**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 doz. Bell peppers
- 2 doz. hot peppers
- 2 doz. onions
- 1 qt. vinegar
- 3 cup. sugar
- 6 tsp. salt
<|steps|>
Grind peppers and onions in food chopper.
Boil with vinegar, sugar, and salt for 30 minutes.
Put in jars.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CRANBERRY APPLE RELISH**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 cup. fresh cranberries
- 2 oranges, quartered and seeded
- 1 lemon, quartered and seeded
- 2 cup. sugar
- 2 apples
<|steps|>
Put cranberries, oranges, and lemon through food chopper.
Add diced apples and sugar, blend well.
Chill thoroughly before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SWEET CRISP CUCUMBER PICKLES**
<|ingredients|>
- Medium size cucumbers
- 2 tsp. alum
- 1 qt. water (for alum solution)
- 1 qt. sugar
- 1 qt. vinegar
- Spices (to taste)
- Ice water (equal parts ice and water)
- 1 cup. mayonnaise
- 1/2 cup. chili sauce
- 1/2 cup. catsup
- 1 tsp. Tabasco sauce
<|steps|>
Slice cucumbers 1/8 inch thick, soak overnight in alum water (2 tsp. alum to 1 qt. water).
Drain, cover with same alum solution, simmer 2 hours (do not boil).
Drain, place in ice water until cold.
Make syrup of sugar, vinegar, and spices, boil until thick.
Place cucumbers in syrup one jar at a time, bring to boil, replace in jar, let drain.
Repeat until all cucumbers are processed.
Boil syrup to thicken, pour over pickles, seal.
**SHRIMP SAUCE**
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ICICLE PICKLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 7 lb. cucumbers
- 2 gal. water
- 2 cup. lime
- 3 qt. vinegar
- 3 lb. sugar
- 3 sticks cinnamon
- 2 Tbsp. spice
- 2 Tbsp. whole cloves
- 2 Tbsp. celery seed
- Pears (quantity not specified)
- White vinegar (enough to cover)
- 3 cup. sugar
- 3 Tbsp. mixed pickling spices
- 1 cup. red sweet peppers
- 1 pk. pears
- 2 qt. onions
- 8 green sweet peppers
- 4 red sweet peppers
- 2 hot peppers
- 12 dill pickles
- 2 cup. salt (or 1 cup. if less salty desired)
- 2 Tbsp. turmeric
- 3 Tbsp. dry mustard
- 8 Tbsp. flour
- 4 cup. sugar
- 2 qt. vinegar
<|steps|>
Slice cucumbers 1/4 inch thick, soak in lime water (lime and water) for 24 hours.
Remove from lime water, place in clear water, changing every hour for 4 hours.
Mix vinegar, sugar, and spices, bring to boil, add cucumbers, bring to boiling point.
Remove from heat, let stand overnight.
Bring to boil again, place in jars.
**PEAR RELISH (RECIPE 1)**
Put pears through coarse plate of food chopper, cover with vinegar, let stand 1/2 hour.
Drain off vinegar.
For each pint of pears, add sugar, pickling spices, and red sweet peppers, simmer 15 minutes.
Put in hot jars and seal.
**PEAR RELISH (RECIPE 2)**
Grind all vegetables and pickles, mix with salt, let stand overnight, drain thoroughly.
Mix dry ingredients with vinegar to make a smooth paste, cook until thickened.
Add ground mixture, cook for 10 minutes after it boils.
Put in jars.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHILLED VEGETABLE SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pkg. lime Jell-O
- 1/8 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. hot water
- 1 Tbsp. lemon juice or vinegar
- 1 large orange
- 1 medium size grapefruit
- 1 cup. shredded cabbage
- 1 Tbsp. thinly sliced scallions
- 1 large can asparagus
- 3 or 4 hard-boiled eggs
- 1 cup. grated cheese
- 2 cup. sweet milk
- 4 Tbsp. flour or cornstarch
- Lump of butter or oleo
- Salt and pepper to taste
- Cracker or bread crumbs
<|steps|>
Dissolve Jell-O and salt in hot water, add lemon juice.
Section orange and grapefruit, reserve juice, add water to juice to make 1 c., add to Jell-O mixture with cabbage and scallions.
Pour into 1 1/2 quart ring mold, chill until firm.
Serve with mayonnaise.
**CASSEROLE ASPARAGUS WITH CHEESE SAUCE**
Make white sauce: cook milk, flour, butter, salt, and pepper until fairly thick, remove from stove, add cheese, stir until melted.
Layer asparagus in casserole, slice eggs over asparagus, cover with sauce, top with crumbs.
Bake until heated through.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **RICE VALUE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. rice
- 2 cup. cold water
- 1 tsp. salt
<|steps|>
Bring rice, water, and salt to a sharp boil.
Turn heat to low, cover, leave for 14 minutes.
Keep lid on to maintain fluffiness, leave small opening to prevent boiling over.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORN PUDDING**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 No. 2 can cream-style corn
- 3 Tbsp. melted butter
- 2 eggs
- 1/4 cup. chopped pimiento
- 1/4 cup. chopped Bell pepper
- 1/2 tsp. black pepper
- 1 tsp. salt
- 10 crackers, rolled fine
- 3 Tbsp. chopped onions
- 3 Tbsp. chopped celery
- 1 cup. sweet milk
<|steps|>
Beat eggs, add melted butter, blend in remaining ingredients.
Pour into greased baking dish.
Bake at 400°F for 45 minutes.
Can be prepared day before, stored in refrigerator.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LIMA BEAN SCALLOP**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 1/2 cup. dried lima beans
- 3 cup. water
- 2 tsp. onion, finely chopped
- 5 Tbsp. shortening
- 4 Tbsp. all-purpose flour
- 1 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/8 tsp. pepper
- 1 cup. evaporated milk
- 3/4 cup. liquid, drained from beans
- 1 cup. grated cheese
- 1/4 cup. bread crumbs
<|steps|>
Wash beans, soak overnight in 3 c. water.
Cook on simmer until tender (about 2 hours), drain, save liquid.
Cook onion in shortening until tender but not brown (5 minutes).
Blend in flour, salt, and pepper, add milk and bean liquid, stir until thickened.
Add cheese, stir until melted.
Layer beans and cheese sauce in greased casserole, sprinkle with bread crumbs.
Bake with oven meal.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **COLE SLAW SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- Cabbage (quantity not specified)
- 1 small carrot
- 3 Tbsp. mayonnaise
- 1/3 cup. vinegar
- 3 tsp. sugar
- Canned cream
<|steps|>
Chop cabbage fine, add grated small carrot.
Mix mayonnaise and vinegar until blended, add sugar.
Add cream until creamy and thick.
Combine with cabbage and carrot.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PINEAPPLE-STRAWBERRY SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pt. strawberries
- 1/2 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 3/4 cup. pineapple, sweetened if fresh
- 1/3 cup. mayonnaise
- 1/3 cup. whipped cream
- Sugar (to taste)
- Nut meats (optional)
<|steps|>
Sprinkle berries with lemon juice and sugar, add well-drained pineapple.
Arrange on lettuce, top with dressing of mayonnaise and whipped cream.
Add nut meats if desired.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **KENNINGTON'S TEA ROOM SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pkg. lime Jell-O
- 1 cup. grated American cheese
- 1 small can pimiento, mashed fine
- 1 medium can crushed pineapple
- 1/2 pt. whipped cream
- Maraschino cherry (for topping)
<|steps|>
Prepare Jell-O, beat with rotary or electric mixer when set.
Add cheese, pimiento, and pineapple, mix well.
Fold in whipped cream, mold, top with maraschino cherry.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORN RELISH**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 doz. ears corn
- 1 head cabbage
- 3 sweet red peppers
- 1 Tbsp. celery seed
- 1 Tbsp. salt
- 2 Tbsp. mustard
- 1 cup. sugar
<|steps|>
Cook corn for 3 minutes in boiling water to set milk, cool, cut from cob.
Cook all ingredients together for 20 minutes.
Pack into clean, hot jars, process.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TOMATO SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 Tbsp. cream cornstarch
- 3/4 tsp. salt
- 2 Tbsp. vinegar
- 2 cup. tomato juice
- 1 Tbsp. salt (for dressing)
- 1/2 tsp. prepared mustard
- 3/4 cup. vinegar
- 1/2 tsp. sugar
- 1/2 tsp. paprika
- 3/4 cup. salad oil
<|steps|>
Combine cream cornstarch, salt, and vinegar, gradually add tomato juice, heat to boiling, boil 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Pour into individual molds rinsed in cold water, chill until firm, about 3 hours.
Serve on lettuce, top with French dressing.
For French dressing, put dry ingredients in pint jar, add vinegar and salad oil, seal jar, shake vigorously.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **EGG-PLANT CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 large eggplant
- 3 Tbsp. salt
- 3 Tbsp. margarine
- 3 Tbsp. flour
- 1/2 cup. sweet milk
- 1/4 tsp. paprika
- 1/4 tsp. celery salt
- 1/4 tsp. onion salt
- 1/2 cup. grated cheese
- 1/2 cup. bread crumbs
<|steps|>
Pare and slice eggplant, sprinkle salt over slices, let stand 1 hour.
Drain, rinse, dice, cook until tender, drain, mash.
Make sauce of flour, milk, and margarine, cook until thick, add paprika, celery salt, onion salt, and cheese.
Pour into baking dish, sprinkle with crumbs, bake at 350°F for 15-20 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRENCH FRIED ONIONS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 egg
- 1 cup. milk
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 6 medium onions
- 1 cup. flour
- Wesson oil or Snowdrift (for frying)
<|steps|>
Beat egg, add salt and flour, beat until free from lumps.
Slice onions about 1/4 inch thick, separate into rings, dip into batter.
Fry in hot grease a few at a time.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BAKED BEANS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 1/2 cup. dried beans
- 1/4 cup. chopped onion
- 1/4 lb. sliced salt pork
- 2 Tbsp. or more dark molasses
- 2 or 3 Tbsp. catsup
- 1 Tbsp. dry mustard
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/2 cup. boiling bean water
- Well-seasoned stock or reserved bean water (as needed)
- 1 pkg. lemon Jell-O
- 1 pkg. Philadelphia cream cheese
- 1 can crushed pineapple
- 1 cup. chopped nuts
- 1/2 cup. chopped celery
- 1/4 pt. cream, whipped
<|steps|>
Soak beans covered overnight.
Cover with water, bring to boil, simmer slowly for 30 minutes or until skins burst when blown on, drain, reserve cooking water.
Add onion, salt pork, molasses, catsup, mustard, salt, and 1/2 c. boiling bean water.
Place in greased baker, decorate with salt pork, bake covered at 250°F for 6-8 hours.
Add stock or reserved bean water if dry, uncover for last hour.
**CONGEALED SALAD (RECIPE 1)**
Dissolve Jell-O in 1 c. boiling water, use pineapple juice for 1 c. liquid.
When Jell-O begins to congeal, add cream cheese, pineapple, nuts, celery, and whipped cream.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **WALNUT PEACHERINO SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 pkg. lemon gelatin
- 1 3/4 cup. boiling water
- 2 tsp. lemon juice
- 3/4 cup. syrup from canned peaches
- 1/3 cup. chopped walnuts
- 12 to 16 cling peaches
- 4 maraschino cherries, cut up
- 1/2 cup. commercial sour cream or cottage cheese, well drained
<|steps|>
Dissolve gelatin in boiling water, add lemon juice and peach syrup.
Cool until slightly thickened, add walnuts, peaches, cherries, and sour cream or cottage cheese.
Pour into mold, chill until firm.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRUIT SALAD SUPREME**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/3 cup. Pet evaporated milk
- 1/2 cup. fresh peaches, cut in small pieces
- 2 Tbsp. sugar
- 6 marshmallows, cut in eighths
- 1/2 cup. drained, crushed pineapple
- 1/2 cup. thinly sliced banana
- 1/4 cup. sliced maraschino cherries
- 1 - 3 oz. pkg. softened white cream cheese
- 2 Tbsp. sugar
- 2 Tbsp. mayonnaise
- 2 tsp. lemon juice
<|steps|>
Chill evaporated milk until ice crystals form around edges.
Mix peaches, 2 Tbsp. sugar, marshmallows, pineapple, banana, and cherries, let stand.
Stir cream cheese with 2 Tbsp. sugar and mayonnaise until smooth.
Whip chilled milk with lemon juice until stiff, fold in fruit and cheese mixtures.
Freeze in tray without stirring until firm.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TOMATO ASPIC**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 large can tomatoes
- 1/4 cup. chopped olives
- 1/2 cup. grated cheese
- 1 envelope Knox gelatin
- 1/4 cup. chopped sweet pickle
<|steps|>
Dissolve gelatin in 1/2 c. tomato juice.
Heat tomatoes in saucepan, remove from fire when boiling, add gelatin and cheese, stir until dissolved.
Cool mixture, add olives and pickles.
Place in bowl or individual molds, refrigerate to congeal.
Serve with mayonnaise on crisp lettuce leaf.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HARVARD BEETS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 lb. beets
- 1 Tbsp. cornstarch
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. water
- 1/2 cup. lemon juice or vinegar
- 1/2 tsp. salt
<|steps|>
Cook beets until tender, slice or quarter.
Cook cornstarch, sugar, water, lemon juice, and salt together for 5 minutes.
Pour sauce over beets, let stand for a few minutes before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CANDIED SWEET POTATOES**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. water
- 1 cup. sugar
- Pinch of salt
- Juice of small lemon
- Sweet potatoes (quantity not specified)
<|steps|>
Make syrup of water, sugar, salt, and lemon juice.
Cut potatoes lengthwise in quarters or eights, drop in boiling syrup, cook until tender, turning once or twice.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LIME JELLO SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 box lime Jell-O
- 1 No. 2 can crushed pineapple
- 1 cup. celery, cut fine
- 1 pkg. Philadelphia cream cheese
- 1 cup. hot water
- 1/2 pt. whipping cream
- 1/2 cup. nuts, chopped fine
<|steps|>
Pour hot water over Jell-O, stir until dissolved, add pineapple.
Let stand until it begins to set, add celery, cheese, and nuts.
Whip cream stiff, fold in last, let set again.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRUIT SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 large can crushed pineapple
- 4 bananas
- 1 pkg. dates
- 1/2 lb. grapes
- 1/4 lb. marshmallows
- 1 cup. pineapple juice
- Juice of 1 orange
- Juice of 1 lemon
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1 Tbsp. cornstarch
- 2 eggs, well beaten
<|steps|>
Combine pineapple, bananas, dates, grapes, and marshmallows.
Make dressing: combine pineapple juice, orange juice, lemon juice, sugar, cornstarch, and eggs, cook slowly until thick.
Cool dressing, pour over fruits.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FROZEN FRUIT SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 oz. pkg. cream cheese
- 1 tsp. unflavored gelatin
- 2 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 1/4 cup. mayonnaise
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 2 Tbsp. sugar
- 1/4 cup. heavy cream, whipped
- 1 cup. chopped pecans
- 1/4 cup. quartered maraschino cherries
- 1 drained No. 2 can crushed pineapple or 1 can fruit cocktail
- 1 banana
- 2 Tbsp. gelatin
- 3 oranges
- 1 cup. syrup, drained from crushed pineapple
- 1 cup. drained, crushed pineapple
- 1/4 cup. sugar
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 lemon
- 1 small bottle red cherries
- 1 small bottle green cherries
<|steps|>
Soften gelatin in measuring cup, set in boiling water, stir until dissolved.
Combine cheese, mayonnaise, salt, and sugar, add dissolved gelatin.
Fold in whipped cream, pecans, cherries, pineapple or fruit cocktail, and banana.
Pour into ice cube tray, freeze until just firm.
Slice, serve on crisp lettuce.
**CONGEALED SALAD (RECIPE 2)**
Soak gelatin in 1/4 c. cold water, cut oranges in pieces, drain juice, add water to make 1/2 c.
