Add pineapple syrup, bring juices to boiling point, add sugar and salt, cool.
Add lemon juice, orange pieces, pineapple, and cherries cut in pieces.
Mold, place in cool place to congeal.
Serve on lettuce with mayonnaise.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HOT CHICKEN SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. chopped chicken
- 3/4 cup. chopped celery
- 1 tsp. chopped pickle
- 1/4 cup. salad dressing
- Salt and pepper
- Butter or margarine
- 12 slices bread
<|steps|>
Heat salad dressing in small saucepan over low heat.
Add chopped chicken, celery, pickles, salt, and pepper.
Place hot filling between buttered slices of bread or serve as toasted sandwich.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **RAINBOW SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pkg. lime Jell-O
- 1 cup. boiling water
- 1 cup. Coca-Cola
- 1 finely chopped delicious apple
- Cottage cheese (firmly packed, dry)
- 1 pkg. orange Jell-O
- 2 cup. hot water
- 1 can crushed, drained pineapple
<|steps|>
Mix lime Jell-O with boiling water, dissolve, cool, add Coca-Cola.
When ready to congeal, add apple, let stand in refrigerator overnight.
Place 1-inch thick layer of cottage cheese over lime Jell-O.
Mix orange Jell-O with hot water, when ready to congeal, add pineapple, whip, pour over cottage cheese.
Let stand in refrigerator, slice, serve on lettuce with favorite dressing.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SALMON SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can pink salmon
- 1 large onion
- 3 hard-boiled eggs
- 1 apple
- Pepper and salt to taste
- 3 Tbsp. mayonnaise
<|steps|>
Chop salmon, onion, eggs, and apple together.
Add mayonnaise, pepper, and salt, mix well.
Serve.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BING CHERRY SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can Bing cherries
- 1 large can crushed pineapple
- 1 pkg. cream cheese
- 2 pkg. cherry Jell-O
- 1 cup. pecans
- 2 warm Coca-Colas
<|steps|>
Combine cherry and pineapple juice, heat to boiling point, dissolve Jell-O in most of juice.
Use balance of juice to dissolve cheese, pour into Jell-O, cool.
Pit cherries, add pineapple, pecans, and Jell-O, slowly add Coca-Colas, chill.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORN SOUFFLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pt. canned corn
- 2 eggs, beaten lightly
- 1 cup. milk
- 1 tsp. mustard
- Salt and pepper to taste
- 1 Tbsp. chopped onion
- 1/2 stick butter or oleo
- 1 Tbsp. chopped olives
- 1 Tbsp. chopped pimiento
<|steps|>
Cook butter and onions in skillet until onions are clear or light brown, remove from heat.
Add corn, eggs, milk, mustard, salt, pepper, olives, and pimiento.
Cook in moderate oven until set and slightly browned on top.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHILI AND BEANS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. bag red kidney beans
- 1 lb. hamburger meat
- 1 medium onion
- 4 Tbsp. shortening
- 3 Tbsp. chili powder
- 2 Tbsp. garlic salt
- Salt and pepper
<|steps|>
Soak beans in hot water for 2-3 hours, wash, cook in fresh hot water until tender.
Add diced onion, chili powder, and 1 Tbsp. garlic salt.
Brown meat in shortening, add 1 Tbsp. garlic salt while browning.
Add meat mixture to beans, add salt and pepper to taste, simmer until very thick.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **YUM YUM PINEAPPLE SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. crushed pineapple
- Juice of 1 lemon
- 2 Tbsp. gelatin
- 1 cup. grated American cheese
- 2 Tbsp. finely chopped green pepper
- 1/2 pt. cream, beaten stiff
- 2 Tbsp. finely chopped pimientos
- 1/2 cup. sugar
<|steps|>
Heat pineapple, add lemon juice and sugar, stir until sugar dissolves.
Soak gelatin in 1/2 c. cold water for 10 minutes, add to hot mixture.
When cool and beginning to set, add cheese, cream, green pepper, and pimientos.
Mix thoroughly, put in mold, refrigerate until firm.
Remove from molds, serve on lettuce with dressing.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BLACK CHERRY SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 pkg. cherry Jell-O
- 2 No. 2 cans black, pitted cherries
- 1 No. 2 can crushed pineapple
- 1 envelope Knox plain gelatin
<|steps|>
Take liquid from cherries and pineapple, finish out to 4 cups liquid.
Heat liquid, pour over Jell-O.
Soften gelatin in 2 Tbsp. water, add to Jell-O mixture, stir in cherries and pineapple.
Set in refrigerator for at least 2 hours before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BEEF STEW**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 lbs. lean beef
- 2 Tbsp. fat
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/8 tsp. pepper
- 1 medium onion
- 1 cup. diced celery
- 2 cup. diced carrots
- 2 cup. diced potatoes
- 1 cup. canned tomatoes
- 1 tsp. sugar
- 1 cup. cold water
- 2 Tbsp. flour
<|steps|>
Cut beef in 1-inch cubes, brown in fat in heavy kettle.
Add salt, pepper, onion, and enough water to cover meat, simmer 2 hours or until nearly tender.
Add celery, carrots, potatoes, tomatoes, and sugar, cook 30 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
Mix flour with cold water to make a paste, stir into stew to thicken, cook 10 minutes longer.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **STUFFED PEPPERS**
<|ingredients|>
- 6 green peppers
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1/4 cup. chopped onion
- 1 cup. cooked rice
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/8 tsp. pepper
- 1 cup. tomato sauce
<|steps|>
Cut tops off peppers, remove seeds and membranes.
Mix beef, onion, rice, salt, and pepper, stuff peppers.
Place in baking dish, pour tomato sauce over and around peppers.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour, basting occasionally.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MEAT LOAF**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1/2 lb. ground pork
- 1 cup. bread crumbs
- 1 egg
- 1/2 cup. milk
- 1/4 cup. chopped onion
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 tsp. dry mustard
- 1/4 cup. catsup
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients thoroughly.
Shape into loaf, place in baking pan.
Bake at 350°F for 1 1/2 hours.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MEAT CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1/2 cup. chopped onion
- 1/2 cup. chopped celery
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 1 cup. cooked noodles
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 cup. grated cheese
<|steps|>
Brown beef with onion and celery in skillet.
Add soup, noodles, salt, and pepper, mix well.
Pour into greased casserole, top with cheese.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BROILED HAMBURGERS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/4 cup. chopped onion (optional)
<|steps|>
Mix beef, salt, pepper, and onion if using.
Shape into patties.
Broil 3-4 inches from heat for 5-7 minutes per side.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PAN BROILED PORK CHOPS**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 pork chops
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/4 cup. water
- 1 slice ham (1 inch thick)
- 1/2 cup. orange juice
- 1/4 cup. brown sugar
- 1 Tbsp. cornstarch
- 1/4 cup. water
- 1/4 tsp. dry mustard
<|steps|>
Season chops with salt and pepper.
Heat skillet, brown chops on both sides.
Add water, cover, simmer 30-40 minutes until tender.
**HAM WITH ORANGE SAUCE**
Bake ham at 325°F for 30 minutes.
Mix orange juice, brown sugar, cornstarch, water, and mustard in saucepan, cook until thickened.
Pour sauce over ham, bake 10 minutes more.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SPANISH PORK CHOPS**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 pork chops
- 1/2 cup. chopped onion
- 1/2 cup. chopped green pepper
- 1 can tomato sauce
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
<|steps|>
Brown chops in skillet, remove.
Sauté onion and green pepper in skillet.
Return chops, add tomato sauce, salt, and pepper.
Cover, simmer 45 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BAKED TURKEY**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 turkey (10-12 lbs.)
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 cup. water
<|steps|>
Rub turkey with butter, season with salt and pepper.
Place in roasting pan, add water, cover.
Bake at 325°F for 3-4 hours, basting occasionally, until internal temperature reaches 165°F.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MY FAVORITE CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1/2 cup. chopped onion
- 1 can cream of celery soup
- 1 cup. cooked green beans
- 1 cup. mashed potatoes
- 1/2 cup. grated cheese
<|steps|>
Brown beef and onion in skillet.
Add soup and green beans, mix well.
Pour into casserole, top with mashed potatoes and cheese.
Bake at 350°F for 25 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. buttermilk
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. soda
- 1/8 cup. shortening
- 2 cup. flour (more or less as needed)
- 1/2 or 3 lb. chicken
- 4 Tbsp. butter
- 2 1/2 tsp. black pepper
- 1 qt. water (for boiling)
<|steps|>
Mix together buttermilk, soda, salt, and shortening.
Add enough flour to make a stiff dough. Work it until quite firm.
Roll out about 2/3 of dough very thin. Cut into small pieces for dumplings.
Cut the chicken in pieces and boil in about 1 qt. of water until tender. Salt to suit taste.
Place the chicken and broth in 10 inch pan or casserole.
Drop in dumplings. Sprinkle in pepper and dot with butter.
Roll out remainder of dough large as pan and place on top.
Bake until brown, brush with butter and serve hot.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN AND SPAGHETTI**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 baking size chicken
- 2 slices bacon
- 1 cup. onions
- 1 green pepper
- 2 or 3 stems of celery
- 2 cup. tomatoes or juice
- 1 pkg. spaghetti
- Pepper and salt to taste
<|steps|>
Boil or steam chicken until tender. Remove chicken from broth and remove bones and cool.
Fry bacon until crisp. Remove from pan; into drippings add chopped onion and pepper and celery.
Crumble bacon back into mixture.
Add tomatoes, pepper, and salt.
Steam at 10 pounds of pressure for 15 minutes or simmer in covered saucepan for 45 minutes.
Add chicken that has been shredded fine.
Cook spaghetti in chicken broth.
Serve hot with sauce.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SWISS STEAK**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 lbs. round steak
- 1/4 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 2 Tbsp. fat
- 1 cup. chopped onion
- 1 can tomatoes
- 1/2 cup. water
<|steps|>
Pound flour, salt, and pepper into steak.
Brown steak in fat, add onion, tomatoes, and water.
Cover, simmer 1 1/2 hours or until tender.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MEAT AND SPAGHETTI**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1/2 cup. chopped onion
- 1 can tomato sauce
- 1 lb. spaghetti
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 cup. grated cheese
<|steps|>
Brown beef and onion, add tomato sauce, salt, and pepper, simmer 15 minutes.
Cook spaghetti, drain.
Mix spaghetti with meat sauce, place in casserole, top with cheese.
Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BAR-B-Q-CHICKEN IN THE BAG**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 chicken, cut up
- 1/2 cup. barbecue sauce
- 1/4 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
<|steps|>
Season chicken with salt and pepper, coat with flour.
Place in oven bag, pour barbecue sauce over chicken.
Seal bag, make a few slits, bake at 350°F for 1 hour.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BAKED PORK CHOPS**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 pork chops
- 1/2 cup. bread crumbs
- 1 egg, beaten
- 1/4 cup. milk
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
<|steps|>
Season chops with salt and pepper.
Dip in egg mixed with milk, coat with bread crumbs.
Place in baking dish, bake at 350°F for 45 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BARBECUED RIBS**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 lbs. spareribs
- 1 cup. barbecue sauce
- 1/2 cup. chopped onion
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
<|steps|>
Season ribs with salt and pepper, place in baking dish.
Mix barbecue sauce and onion, pour over ribs.
Bake at 350°F for 1 1/2 hours, basting occasionally.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORNED BEEF PATTIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can corned beef
- 1/2 cup. mashed potatoes
- 1 egg
- 1/4 cup. chopped onion
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 2 Tbsp. fat
<|steps|>
Mix corned beef, potatoes, egg, onion, and pepper.
Shape into patties.
Fry in hot fat until browned on both sides.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BARBECUED CHICKEN**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 chicken, cut up
- 1/2 cup. barbecue sauce
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
<|steps|>
Season chicken with salt and pepper.
Place in baking dish, pour barbecue sauce over.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour, basting occasionally.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HAMBURGER PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1/2 cup. chopped onion
- 1 can green beans, drained
- 1 can tomato soup
- 1 cup. mashed potatoes
- 1/2 cup. grated cheese
- 2 lbs. beef or lamb
- 2 Tbsp. fat
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1 cup. chopped onion
- 1 cup. diced carrots
- 1 cup. diced potatoes
- 1 cup. peas
- 1/2 cup. water
- 2 Tbsp. flour
<|steps|>
Brown beef and onion, add beans and soup, mix well.
Pour into casserole, top with mashed potatoes and cheese.
Bake at 350°F for 25 minutes.
**STEW**
Cut meat in cubes, brown in fat.
Add salt, pepper, onion, and water, simmer 1 1/2 hours.
Add carrots, potatoes, and peas, cook 30 minutes.
Mix flour with water to make paste, stir in to thicken, cook 10 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **STUFFED SQUASH**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 yellow squash
- 1/2 cup. cooked ground beef
- 1/4 cup. bread crumbs
- 1/4 cup. chopped onion
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 cup. tomato sauce
<|steps|>
Cut squash in half, scoop out centers.
Mix beef, bread crumbs, onion, salt, and pepper, stuff squash.
Place in baking dish, pour tomato sauce over.
Bake at 350°F for 45 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **GYPSY CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1/2 cup. chopped onion
- 1/2 cup. chopped green pepper
- 1 can corn, drained
- 1 can tomato sauce
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 cup. grated cheese
<|steps|>
Brown beef, onion, and green pepper.
Add corn, tomato sauce, salt, and pepper, mix well.
Pour into casserole, top with cheese.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SCALLOPED CHICKEN**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cooked chicken, deboned
- 1 cup. chicken broth
- 1 cup. bread crumbs
- 1/2 cup. chopped celery
- 1/4 cup. chopped onion
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 cup. melted butter
<|steps|>
Mix chicken, broth, bread crumbs, celery, onion, salt, and pepper.
Pour into greased casserole, drizzle with butter.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PORK CHOP AND POTATO CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 pork chops
- 4 medium potatoes, sliced
- 1/2 cup. chopped onion
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 1/2 cup. milk
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
<|steps|>
Brown chops, place in casserole.
Layer potatoes and onion over chops.
Mix soup, milk, salt, and pepper, pour over.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SAVORY MEAT LOAF**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1/2 lb. ground pork
- 1 cup. bread crumbs
- 1 egg
- 1/2 cup. milk
- 1/4 cup. chopped green pepper
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients thoroughly.
Shape into loaf, place in baking pan.
Bake at 350°F for 1 1/2 hours.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SOUTHERN CHICKEN**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 chicken, cut up
- 1/2 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/4 cup. fat
- 1 cup. chicken broth
- 1/2 cup. cream
<|steps|>
Season chicken with salt and pepper, coat with flour.
Brown in fat, remove to baking dish.
Mix broth and cream, pour over chicken.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN PILAU**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 chicken, cut up
- 1 cup. rice
- 1/2 cup. chopped onion
- 1/2 cup. chopped celery
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 2 cup. chicken broth
<|steps|>
Cook chicken in broth until tender, remove, debone.
Sauté onion and celery, add rice, salt, and pepper.
Add broth and chicken, simmer 20 minutes until rice is tender.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRIED APPLES WITH HAM**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 apples, sliced
- 1/4 cup. butter
- 1/4 cup. sugar
- 1/2 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 lb. ham slices
<|steps|>
Fry ham slices, remove from skillet.
Melt butter in skillet, add apples, sugar, and cinnamon.
Cook until apples are tender, serve with ham.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SUGAR CURED HAM**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 ham (8-10 lbs.)
- 1 cup. brown sugar
- 1/2 cup. water
- 1 tsp. dry mustard
- 1/4 tsp. cloves
<|steps|>
Place ham in roasting pan, add water, cover.
Bake at 325°F for 3-4 hours.
Mix brown sugar, mustard, and cloves, spread over ham, bake 30 minutes more.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN SPAGHETTI**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cooked chicken, deboned
- 1 lb. spaghetti
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 1/2 cup. chopped onion
- 1/2 cup. chopped green pepper
- 1/2 cup. grated cheese
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
<|steps|>
Cook spaghetti, drain.
Sauté onion and green pepper, add soup, salt, and pepper.
Mix chicken, spaghetti, and sauce, place in casserole, top with cheese.
Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SWISS STEAK**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 lbs. round steak
- 1/4 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 2 Tbsp. fat
- 1 cup. chopped onion
- 1 can tomatoes
- 1/2 cup. water
<|steps|>
Pound flour, salt, and pepper into steak.
Brown steak in fat, add onion, tomatoes, and water.
Cover, simmer 1 1/2 hours or until tender.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SALMON DELIGHT**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can salmon
- 1 cup. bread crumbs
- 1/2 cup. chopped celery
- 1/4 cup. chopped onion
- 1 egg
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/4 cup. milk
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients thoroughly.
Shape into loaf or patties, place in greased baking dish.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **STEAMED SHRIMP**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. shrimp
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 cup. water
- 1 lemon, sliced
<|steps|>
Place shrimp, salt, pepper, water, and lemon in steamer.
Steam 10-15 minutes until shrimp are pink.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SALMON LOAF**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can salmon
- 1 cup. bread crumbs
- 1/2 cup. milk
- 1 egg
- 1/4 cup. chopped onion
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients thoroughly.
Shape into loaf, place in greased baking dish.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHILI CON CARNE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1/2 cup. chopped onion
- 1 can kidney beans
- 1 can tomato sauce
- 1 Tbsp. chili powder
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
<|steps|>
Brown beef and onion, add beans, tomato sauce, chili powder, salt, and pepper.
Simmer 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BARBECUED CHICKEN**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 chicken, cut up
- 1/2 cup. barbecue sauce
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
<|steps|>
Season chicken with salt and pepper.
Place in baking dish, pour barbecue sauce over.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour, basting occasionally.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SMOTHERED CHICKEN**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 chicken, cut up
- 1/2 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/4 cup. fat
- 1 cup. chopped onion
- 1 cup. chicken broth
<|steps|>
Season chicken with salt and pepper, coat with flour.
Brown in fat, add onion and broth.
Cover, simmer 45 minutes until tender.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ARABIAN STEW**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 lbs. lamb
- 2 Tbsp. fat
- 1 cup. chopped onion
- 1 cup. diced carrots
- 1 cup. diced potatoes
- 1 cup. raisins
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 cup. water
<|steps|>
Cut lamb in cubes, brown in fat.
Add onion, carrots, potatoes, raisins, salt, pepper, cinnamon, and water.
Simmer 1 1/2 hours until tender.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SALMON CROQUETTES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can salmon
- 1/2 cup. bread crumbs
- 1 egg
- 1/4 cup. chopped onion
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/4 cup. milk
- 1/4 cup. fat
<|steps|>
Mix salmon, bread crumbs, egg, onion, salt, pepper, and milk.
Shape into patties.
Fry in hot fat until browned on both sides.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **EVERLASTING ICEBOX ROLLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. mashed potatoes
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. shortening
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. warm water
- 1 pkg. yeast
- 2 eggs
- 5-6 cup. flour
<|steps|>
Mix potatoes, sugar, shortening, and salt.
Dissolve yeast in warm water, add to potato mixture with eggs.
Add flour to make soft dough, knead until smooth.
Place in greased bowl, refrigerate, use as needed.
Shape into rolls, let rise, bake at 400°F for 15-20 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORN MUFFINS OR CORN BREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. cornmeal
- 1 cup. flour
- 1/4 cup. sugar
- 4 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. milk
- 1 egg
- 1/4 cup. melted shortening
<|steps|>
Mix dry ingredients.
Combine milk, egg, and shortening, add to dry ingredients, stir until just mixed.
Pour into greased muffin tins or baking pan.
Bake at 425°F for 20-25 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BANANA NUT BREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. shortening
- 1 cup. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1 cup. mashed bananas
- 2 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 cup. chopped nuts
<|steps|>
Cream shortening and sugar, add eggs and bananas.
Mix flour, baking soda, and salt, add to creamed mixture.
Stir in nuts, pour into greased loaf pan.
Bake at 350°F for 60-70 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **NUT BREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. flour
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 3 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. milk
- 1 egg
- 1/2 cup. chopped nuts
<|steps|>
Mix dry ingredients.
Combine milk and egg, add to dry ingredients, stir in nuts.
Pour into greased loaf pan.
Bake at 350°F for 50-60 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CRACKLIN GOOD CORNBREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. cornmeal
- 1/2 cup. flour
- 2 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. cracklings
- 1 cup. milk
- 1 egg
<|steps|>
Mix dry ingredients, add cracklings.
Combine milk and egg, add to dry ingredients.
Pour into greased baking pan.
Bake at 425°F for 20-25 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BUTTERMILK BISCUIT**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. flour
- 2 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 cup. shortening
- 3/4 cup. buttermilk
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1 cup. mashed bananas
- 2 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 cup. chopped walnuts
- 1/2 cup. shortening
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1 egg
- 1 cup. molasses
- 2 1/2 cup. flour
- 1 1/2 tsp. baking soda
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 tsp. ginger
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. hot water
<|steps|>
Mix dry ingredients, cut in shortening.
Add buttermilk, stir until dough forms.
Knead lightly, roll out, cut into biscuits.
Bake at 450°F for 10-12 minutes.
**BANANA NUT BREAD (RECIPE 2)**
Cream butter and sugar, add eggs and bananas.
Mix flour, baking soda, and salt, add to creamed mixture.
Stir in walnuts, pour into greased loaf pan.
Bake at 350°F for 60-70 minutes.
**GINGERBREAD**
Cream shortening and sugar, add egg and molasses.
Mix dry ingredients, add alternately with hot water to creamed mixture.
Pour into greased baking pan.
Bake at 350°F for 40-45 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ALL BRAN MUFFINS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. All-Bran cereal
- 1 cup. flour
- 1/4 cup. sugar
- 3 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. milk
- 1 egg
- 1/4 cup. melted shortening
<|steps|>
Mix cereal and milk, let stand 5 minutes.
Mix dry ingredients, add to cereal mixture with egg and shortening, stir until just mixed.
Pour into greased muffin tins.
Bake at 400°F for 20-25 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SELF-RISING ROLLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. self-rising flour
- 1/4 cup. shortening
- 3/4 cup. milk
- 1 Tbsp. sugar
<|steps|>
Mix flour and sugar, cut in shortening.
Add milk, stir until dough forms.
Knead lightly, roll out, cut into rolls.
Bake at 450°F for 10-12 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ICEBOX ROLLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. mashed potatoes
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. shortening
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. warm water
- 1 pkg. yeast
- 2 eggs
- 5-6 cup. flour
- 2 cup. flour
- 3 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 cup. shortening
- 3/4 cup. milk
<|steps|>
Mix potatoes, sugar, shortening, and salt.
Dissolve yeast in warm water, add to potato mixture with eggs.
Add flour to make soft dough, knead until smooth.
Place in greased bowl, refrigerate, use as needed.
Shape into rolls, let rise, bake at 400°F for 15-20 minutes.
**ROLLS**
Mix dry ingredients, cut in shortening.
Add milk, stir until dough forms.
Knead lightly, roll out, cut into rolls.
Bake at 450°F for 10-12 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **QUICK GINGERBREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. shortening
- 1 egg
- 1 cup. molasses
- 2 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/2 tsp. ginger
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. hot water
<|steps|>
Cream sugar and shortening, add egg and molasses.
Mix dry ingredients, add alternately with hot water to creamed mixture.
Pour into greased baking pan.
Bake at 350°F for 35-40 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHEESE STRAWS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. flour
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. cayenne pepper
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. grated cheese
<|steps|>
Mix flour, salt, and cayenne, cut in butter.
Add cheese, mix to form dough.
Roll out, cut into strips.
Bake at 400°F for 10-12 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HUSH PUPPIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. cornmeal
- 1/2 cup. flour
- 2 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 cup. chopped onion
- 1 egg
- 1/2 cup. milk

<|steps|>
Mix dry ingredients, add onion.
Combine egg and milk, add to dry ingredients.
Drop by spoonfuls into hot fat, fry until golden brown.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PECAN ROLLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pkg. yeast
- 1/4 cup. warm water
- 1 cup. milk, scalded
- 1/4 cup. sugar
- 1/4 cup. shortening
- 1 tsp. salt
- 3 1/2 cup. flour
- 1 egg
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1/2 cup. brown sugar
- 1/2 cup. pecans
<|steps|>
Dissolve yeast in warm water.
Mix milk, sugar, shortening, and salt, cool, add yeast, egg, and flour, knead until smooth.
Let rise until doubled, punch down, roll out.
Spread with butter, brown sugar, and pecans, roll up, cut into slices.
Place in greased pan, let rise, bake at 375°F for 20-25 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **JELLY ROLL**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 eggs
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1/3 cup. water
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 cup. jelly
<|steps|>
Beat eggs and sugar until thick, add water and vanilla.
Mix flour, baking powder, and salt, fold into egg mixture.
Pour into greased jelly roll pan, bake at 375°F for 12-15 minutes.
Turn onto towel dusted with powdered sugar, roll up, cool, unroll, spread with jelly, reroll.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **RICH PASTRY PIE CRUST**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. flour
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/3 cup. shortening
- 2-3 Tbsp. cold water
<|steps|>
Mix flour and salt, cut in shortening.
Add water, mix until dough forms.
Roll out to fit pie pan.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ORANGE CHIFFON PIE**
<|ingredients|>

- 1/4 cup. cold water
- 1 cup. orange juice
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 1 cup. heavy cream, whipped
- 1 baked pie crust
<|steps|>
Soften gelatin in cold water.
Heat orange juice, sugar, and salt, add gelatin, stir until dissolved.
Cool, add lemon juice, fold in whipped cream.
Pour into pie crust, chill until set.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CARROT PIE**

- 1/2 cup. sugar

- 1/4 tsp. nutmeg

- 1 unbaked pie crust
<|steps|>
Mix carrots, milk, sugar, eggs, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt.
Pour into pie crust.
Bake at 400°F for 10 minutes, then 350°F for 30-35 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BANANA CREAM PIE**

- 1/4 tsp. salt

- 3 egg yolks

- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 2 bananas, sliced
- 1 baked pie crust
- Whipped cream
<|steps|>
Mix sugar, cornstarch, and salt, add milk, cook until thickened.
Beat egg yolks, add some hot mixture, return to pan, cook 2 minutes.
Add butter and vanilla, cool.
Layer bananas in pie crust, pour custard over, top with whipped cream.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CRISCO PIE CRUST**

Add water, mix until dough forms.
Roll out to fit pie pan.
<|endofrecipe|>

TITLE: **PUMPKIN PIE**

Pour into pie crust.
Bake at 425°F for 15 minutes, then 350°F for 40-45 minutes.

TITLE: **LEMON ICEBOX PIE**

Bake at 350°F for 40-45 minutes.

Pour into pie crust.

- 1 baked pie crust
- Meringue (2 egg whites, 1/4 cup. sugar)
<|steps|>
Mix sugar, flour, and salt, add milk, cook until thickened.
Beat egg yolks, add some hot mixture, return to pan, cook 2 minutes.
Add coconut, butter, and vanilla, cool.
Pour into pie crust, top with meringue, bake at 350°F for 10-12 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **QUICK AND EASY PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. self-rising flour
- 1/2 cup. butter, melted
- 2 eggs
- 1 cup. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 cup. coconut or 1 cup. fruit preserves
- 1 unbaked pie crust
<|steps|>
Mix sugar, flour, butter, eggs, milk, and vanilla.
Stir in coconut or fruit preserves.
Pour into pie crust.
Bake at 350°F for 40-45 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHOCOLATE CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. shortening
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 cup. cocoa
- 1/2 cup. hot water
- 2 cup. flour
- 2 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. buttermilk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Cream sugar and shortening, add eggs.
Mix cocoa with hot water, add to creamed mixture.
Mix flour, baking soda, and salt, add alternately with buttermilk and vanilla.
Pour into greased cake pans, bake at 350°F for 30-35 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **WHITE CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. butter
- 2 cup. sugar
- 3 cup. flour
- 3 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 4 egg whites, beaten stiff
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar.
Mix flour, baking powder, and salt, add alternately with milk and vanilla.
Fold in egg whites.
Pour into greased cake pans, bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **DEVIL'S FOOD CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 2 cup. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 cup. cocoa
- 1/2 cup. hot water
- 2 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. buttermilk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add eggs.
Mix cocoa with hot water, add to creamed mixture.
Mix flour, baking soda, and salt, add alternately with buttermilk and vanilla.
Pour into greased cake pans, bake at 350°F for 30-35 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SPICE CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. brown sugar
- 2 eggs
- 2 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/2 tsp. nutmeg
- 1/2 tsp. cloves
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. buttermilk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 cup. butter
- 2 cup. sugar
- 4 eggs
- 3 cup. flour
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 1 cup. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Cream butter, sugar, and brown sugar, add eggs.
Mix flour, baking soda, spices, and salt, add alternately with buttermilk and vanilla.
Pour into greased cake pans, bake at 350°F for 30-35 minutes.
**POUND CAKE**
Cream butter and sugar, add eggs one at a time.
Mix flour, salt, and baking powder, add alternately with milk and vanilla.
Pour into greased loaf pan, bake at 325°F for 60-70 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CARAMEL CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 2 cup. flour
- 2 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 3/4 cup. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 cup. brown sugar
- 1/4 cup. butter
- 1/4 cup. milk
- 2 cup. powdered sugar
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add eggs.
Mix flour, baking powder, and salt, add alternately with milk and vanilla.
Pour into greased cake pans, bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes.
For icing, melt brown sugar, butter, and milk, boil 2 minutes, cool, add powdered sugar, beat until smooth, spread on cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRUIT CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. butter
- 1 lb. sugar
- 10 eggs
- 1 lb. flour
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 tsp. nutmeg
- 1/2 tsp. cloves
- 1/2 tsp. allspice
- 1 lb. raisins
- 1 lb. currants
- 1 lb. candied cherries
- 1 lb. candied pineapple
- 1 lb. pecans
- 1/2 cup. wine or brandy
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add eggs one at a time.
Mix flour, baking powder, and spices, add to creamed mixture.
Stir in fruits, nuts, and wine or brandy.
Pour into greased loaf pans, bake at 275°F for 2 1/2-3 hours.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PRUNE CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. sugar
- 3 eggs
- 2 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/2 tsp. nutmeg
- 1/2 tsp. allspice
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. buttermilk
- 1 cup. cooked, chopped prunes
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add eggs.
Mix flour, baking soda, spices, and salt, add alternately with buttermilk.
Stir in prunes and vanilla.
Pour into greased cake pans, bake at 350°F for 30-35 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **OATMEAL CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. quick oats
- 1 1/2 cup. boiling water
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1 cup. brown sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1 1/2 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1/4 cup. milk
- 1 cup. brown sugar
- 1 cup. coconut
<|steps|>
Pour boiling water over oats, let stand 20 minutes.
Cream butter, sugar, and brown sugar, add eggs.
Mix flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt, add to creamed mixture with oats.
Pour into greased pan, bake at 350°F for 35-40 minutes.
For topping, melt butter, milk, and brown sugar, stir in coconut, spread on cake, broil until bubbly.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **COCONUT CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 1/2 cup. sugar
- 3 eggs
- 2 1/2 cup. flour
- 3 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 cup. coconut
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1/4 cup. water
- 1 cup. coconut (for frosting)
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add eggs.
Mix flour, baking powder, and salt, add alternately with milk and vanilla.
Stir in coconut.
Pour into greased cake pans, bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes.
For frosting, boil sugar and water to soft ball stage, beat with coconut, spread on cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **DATE NUT CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 2 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. buttermilk
- 1 cup. chopped dates
- 1 cup. chopped nuts
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add eggs.
Mix flour, baking soda, and salt, add alternately with buttermilk.
Stir in dates, nuts, and vanilla.
Pour into greased loaf pan, bake at 350°F for 60-70 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **APPLESAUCE CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1 egg
- 1 cup. applesauce
- 2 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/2 tsp. cloves
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. raisins
- 1/2 cup. nuts
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add egg and applesauce.
Mix flour, baking soda, spices, and salt, add to creamed mixture.
Stir in raisins and nuts.
Pour into greased loaf pan, bake at 350°F for 60-70 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **JAM CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. sugar
- 3 eggs
- 2 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/2 tsp. cloves
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. buttermilk
- 1 cup. blackberry jam
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add eggs.
Mix flour, baking soda, spices, and salt, add alternately with buttermilk.
Stir in jam and vanilla.
Pour into greased cake pans, bake at 350°F for 30-35 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LEMON CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 1/2 cup. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 2 cup. flour
- 2 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. milk
- 1 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 1 tsp. lemon extract
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1/4 cup. lemon juice (for glaze)
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add eggs.
Mix flour, baking powder, and salt, add alternately with milk, lemon juice, and lemon extract.
Pour into greased cake pans, bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes.
For glaze, mix sugar and lemon juice, pour over warm cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ORANGE CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 1/2 cup. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 2 cup. flour
- 2 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. orange juice
- 1 Tbsp. orange zest
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1/4 cup. orange juice (for glaze)
- 1 cup. butter
- 1 1/2 cup. brown sugar
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 4 eggs
- 3 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add eggs.
Mix flour, baking powder, and salt, add alternately with orange juice and zest.
Pour into greased cake pans, bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes.
For glaze, mix sugar and orange juice, pour over warm cake.
**BROWN SUGAR POUND CAKE**
Cream butter, brown sugar, and sugar, add eggs one at a time.
Mix flour, baking powder, and salt, add alternately with milk and vanilla.
Pour into greased loaf pan, bake at 325°F for 60-70 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MARBLE CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 1/2 cup. sugar
- 3 eggs
- 2 1/2 cup. flour
- 3 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/4 cup. cocoa
- 1/4 cup. hot water
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add eggs.
Mix flour, baking powder, and salt, add alternately with milk and vanilla.
Divide batter, mix cocoa and hot water, add to half the batter.
Spoon both batters into greased pan, swirl, bake at 350°F for 30-35 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ANGEL FOOD CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. cake flour
- 1 1/2 cup. sugar
- 12 egg whites
- 1 tsp. cream of tartar
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 tsp. almond extract
<|steps|>
Sift flour and 1/2 c. sugar.
Beat egg whites with cream of tartar and salt until foamy, gradually add remaining sugar, beat until stiff peaks form.
Fold in flour mixture, vanilla, and almond extract.
Pour into ungreased tube pan, bake at 375°F for 35-40 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHOCOLATE ICING**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/4 cup. butter
- 2 cup. powdered sugar
- 1/4 cup. cocoa
- 1/4 cup. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Melt butter, mix with powdered sugar and cocoa.
Add milk and vanilla, beat until smooth.
Spread on cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CARAMEL ICING**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. brown sugar
- 1/4 cup. milk
- 2 cup. powdered sugar
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Melt butter and brown sugar, boil 2 minutes.
Add milk, bring to boil, cool.
Add powdered sugar and vanilla, beat until smooth.
Spread on cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LEMON ICING**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/4 cup. butter
- 2 cup. powdered sugar
- 2 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 1 tsp. lemon zest
- 1-2 Tbsp. milk
<|steps|>
Cream butter and powdered sugar.
Add lemon juice, zest, and milk, beat until smooth.
Spread on cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BROWN SUGAR FROSTING**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. brown sugar
- 1/4 cup. milk
- 2 cup. powdered sugar
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Melt butter and brown sugar, boil 2 minutes.
Add milk, bring to boil, cool.
Add powdered sugar and vanilla, beat until smooth.
Spread on cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SEVEN MINUTE FROSTING**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 egg whites
- 1 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1/3 cup. water
- 1/4 tsp. cream of tartar
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Combine egg whites, sugar, water, and cream of tartar in double boiler.
Beat over boiling water for 7 minutes until stiff peaks form.
Remove from heat, add vanilla, beat until spreadable.
Spread on cake.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHOCOLATE FUDGE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. cocoa
- 1/2 cup. milk
- 1/4 cup. butter
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 cup. chopped nuts (optional)
<|steps|>
Mix sugar, cocoa, and milk, cook to soft ball stage (235°F).
Remove from heat, add butter and vanilla, cool without stirring.
Beat until thick, add nuts if using, pour into greased pan, cut when set.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PEANUT BRITTLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. corn syrup
- 1/4 cup. water
- 1 cup. peanuts
- 1 Tbsp. butter
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 2 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. corn syrup
- 1/2 cup. water
- 2 egg whites
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 cup. chopped nuts (optional)
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1 cup. brown sugar
- 1/2 cup. milk
- 1/4 cup. butter
- 1 cup. pecans
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 2 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. milk
- 1/4 cup. butter
- 1/4 cup. cocoa
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 cup. chopped nuts (optional)
<|steps|>
Cook sugar, corn syrup, and water to 275°F, add peanuts and butter.
Cook to 300°F, remove from heat, add baking soda and salt, stir.
Pour onto greased slab, spread thin, break when cool.
**DIVINITY**
Cook sugar, corn syrup, and water to hard ball stage (250°F).
Beat egg whites until stiff, slowly pour in hot syrup, beating constantly.
Add vanilla and nuts, beat until mixture holds shape.
Drop by spoonfuls onto waxed paper.
**PRALINES**
Cook sugar, brown sugar, and milk to soft ball stage (235°F).
Add butter and pecans, cook 2 minutes more.
Remove from heat, add vanilla, beat until thick.
Drop by spoonfuls onto waxed paper.
**FUDGE**
Cook sugar, milk, butter, and cocoa to soft ball stage (235°F).
Remove from heat, add vanilla, cool without stirring.
Beat until thick, add nuts if using, pour into greased pan, cut when set.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SEA FOAM CANDY**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. water
- 2 egg whites
- 1/2 cup. corn syrup
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 cup. chopped nuts (optional)
- 2 cup. sugar
- 1 cup. corn syrup
- 1/2 cup. water
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 2 Tbsp. butter
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1 cup. brown sugar
- 1 cup. corn syrup
- 1 cup. cream
- 1/4 cup. butter
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1/3 cup. cocoa
- 1/2 cup. flour
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 cup. chopped nuts (optional)
<|steps|>
Cook sugar, water, and corn syrup to hard ball stage (250°F).
Beat egg whites until stiff, slowly pour in hot syrup, beating constantly.
Add vanilla and nuts, beat until mixture holds shape.
Drop by spoonfuls onto waxed paper.
**TAFFY**
Cook sugar, corn syrup, water, and salt to hard ball stage (250°F).
Remove from heat, add vanilla and butter, pour onto greased slab.
Cool until manageable, pull until white and porous, cut into pieces.
**CARAMELS**
Cook sugar, brown sugar, corn syrup, and cream to firm ball stage (245°F).
Remove from heat, add butter and vanilla, pour into greased pan.
Cool, cut into squares, wrap in waxed paper.
**BROWNIES**
Melt butter, mix with sugar, eggs, and cocoa.
Add flour, salt, vanilla, and nuts, stir until blended.
Pour into greased 8x8 pan, bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **DATE BARS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. chopped dates
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. water
- 1 cup. flour
- 1 cup. brown sugar
- 1 cup. oats
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1/2 tsp. baking soda
- 1/4 tsp. salt
<|steps|>
Cook dates, sugar, and water until thick, cool.
Mix flour, brown sugar, oats, butter, baking soda, and salt until crumbly.
Press half of crumb mixture into greased 8x8 pan, spread with date filling, top with remaining crumbs.
Bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **OATMEAL COOKIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. brown sugar
- 1 egg
- 1 cup. flour
- 1/2 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 cup. quick oats
- 1/2 cup. raisins
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Cream butter, sugar, and brown sugar, add egg and vanilla.
Mix flour, baking soda, and salt, add to creamed mixture.
Stir in oats and raisins.
Drop by spoonfuls onto greased cookie sheet, bake at 375°F for 10-12 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PEANUT BUTTER COOKIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1/2 cup. peanut butter
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1/2 cup. brown sugar
- 1 egg
- 1 1/4 cup. flour
- 1/2 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 tsp. baking powder
- 1/4 tsp. salt

Cream butter, peanut butter, sugar, and brown sugar, add egg.
Mix flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt, add to creamed mixture.
Shape into balls, flatten with fork, bake at 375°F for 10-12 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SUGAR COOKIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1 egg
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 2 cup. flour
- 1/2 tsp. baking powder
- 1/4 tsp. salt
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add egg and vanilla.
Mix flour, baking powder, and salt, add to creamed mixture.
Roll out, cut into shapes, bake at 375°F for 8-10 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **GINGER SNAPS**
<|ingredients|>
- 3/4 cup. shortening
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1/4 cup. molasses
- 1 egg
- 2 cup. flour
- 2 tsp. baking soda
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 tsp. ginger
- 1/2 tsp. cloves
- 1/2 tsp. salt
<|steps|>
Cream shortening and sugar, add molasses and egg.
Mix flour, baking soda, spices, and salt, add to creamed mixture.
Shape into balls, roll in sugar, bake at 375°F for 10-12 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHOCOLATE DROP COOKIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1 egg
- 1/4 cup. cocoa
- 1 1/2 cup. flour
- 1/2 tsp. baking soda
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1/2 cup. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add egg and cocoa.
Mix flour, baking soda, and salt, add alternately with milk and vanilla.
Drop by spoonfuls onto greased cookie sheet, bake at 375°F for 10-12 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **COCONUT MACAROONS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 egg whites
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 2 cup. coconut
<|steps|>
Beat egg whites until foamy, gradually add sugar and salt, beat until stiff peaks form.
Fold in vanilla and coconut.
Drop by spoonfuls onto greased cookie sheet, bake at 325°F for 20-25 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LEMON BARS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. flour
- 1/4 cup. powdered sugar
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 2 eggs
- 1 cup. sugar
- 1/4 cup. lemon juice
- 1/2 tsp. baking powder
- 1/4 tsp. salt
<|steps|>
Mix flour, powdered sugar, and butter, press into 8x8 pan, bake at 350°F for 20 minutes.
Beat eggs, sugar, lemon juice, baking powder, and salt, pour over crust.
Bake at 350°F for 20-25 minutes, dust with powdered sugar.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TEA CAKES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup. butter
- 1 cup. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 2 cup. flour
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add eggs and vanilla.
Mix flour, baking powder, and salt, add to creamed mixture.
Roll out, cut into rounds, bake at 375°F for 8-10 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BUTTER COOKIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup. butter
- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 1 egg
- 2 cup. flour
- 1/2 tsp. baking powder
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Cream butter and sugar, add egg and vanilla.
Mix flour, baking powder, and salt, add to creamed mixture.
Shape into balls or press through cookie press, bake at 375°F for 10-12 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MOLASSES PECAN PIE**
<|ingredients|>

- 1/2 cup. sugar
- 3 eggs
- 1/4 cup. butter, melted
- 1 cup. pecans
