<|steps|>
Mix molasses, sugar, eggs, and butter, stir in pecans.
Pour into pie crust.
Bake at 350°F for 50-55 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BRUNSWICK STEW**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 3-lb chicken
- 1 tbsp salt
- Few peppercorns
- 1 carrot
- 2 celery ribs with leaves
- 1 onion
- 1.5 quarts water
- 1 can tomatoes
- 3 medium onions, sliced thin
- 6 medium potatoes, sliced thin
- 1.5 cups fresh lima beans or 1 pkg frozen
- 2 cups fresh white corn or 1 can cream style
- 1 tbsp soy sauce
- 1 tsp sugar
- 1 tbsp Worcestershire sauce
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
<|steps|>
Steam chicken, salt, peppercorns, carrot, celery, onion, and water until chicken is very tender.
Strain stock, shred chicken, and return to stock.
Add tomatoes, potatoes, onions, lima beans, and seasonings.
Cook until vegetables are tender.
Add corn and cook 10 minutes longer.
Serve on split cornbread for 8-10 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **DEVILED OYSTERS**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 bunches green onions, including tops, chopped
- 6 stalks celery, finely chopped
- 1 large bell pepper, chopped
- 1 tbsp parsley, chopped
- 3 tbsp flour
- 1 tsp Worcestershire sauce
- 1 pint oysters, chopped, with liquid
- 0.5 stick margarine
- 0.125 tsp black pepper
- 0.5 tsp salt
<|steps|>
Sauté green onions, celery, bell pepper, and parsley in margarine.
Add flour, oysters, oyster liquid, Worcestershire sauce, black pepper, and salt.
Cook until thickened.
Serve in small bite-size patty shells, piping hot, for about 20 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SHRIMP GUMBO**
<|ingredients|>
- 0.33 cup butter
- 2 tbsp flour
- 1 medium green pepper, thinly sliced
- 2 medium onions, sliced
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 No. 2 can tomatoes
- 1 pkg frozen cut okra
- 3 beef bouillon cubes
- 4 tsp Worcestershire sauce
- 0.25 tsp ground cloves
- 0.5 tsp chili powder
- 2 bay leaves
- 1.5 tbsp salt
- 0.25 tsp pepper
- 3 cups water
- 2 lbs shelled raw shrimp
- 3 cups hot cooked rice
- 0.75 cup snipped parsley
<|steps|>
Melt butter in a Dutch oven, stir in flour, and cook over low heat until brown.
Add green pepper, onions, and garlic; cook slowly until tender.
Add tomatoes, bouillon cubes, Worcestershire sauce, cloves, chili powder, bay leaves, salt, pepper, and water.
Simmer uncovered for 15 minutes.
Add okra and simmer for 30 minutes.
Heat to boiling, add shrimp, and simmer covered until shrimp are pink and tender.
Remove bay leaves.
Toss rice with parsley, form a ring on shallow plates, and fill center with gumbo for 6-8 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FLOUNDER FLORENTINE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pkg frozen chopped spinach
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- 1 tbsp butter or margarine
- 1 12-oz pkg frozen flounder fillets, thawed
- 0.5 cup undiluted evaporated milk
- 1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese
- 0.5 tsp Worcestershire sauce
- 0.5 tsp dry mustard
- Dash nutmeg
- Paprika, optional
- Red pepper, optional
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 375°F.
Cook spinach as label directs; season with salt, pepper, and butter.
Place spinach in a greased 10x6x2-inch baking dish.
Arrange fillets on spinach.
Mix milk, cheese, Worcestershire sauce, mustard, and nutmeg; pour over fillets.
Bake 25 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork.
Sprinkle with paprika and red pepper if desired, for 3-4 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BREAST OF CHICKEN ALMONDINE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup uncooked rice
- 2.5 cups water
- 2 cups chopped celery
- 1 tsp instant minced onion
- 1 cup cream of mushroom soup
- 0.25 cup slivered almonds
- 2.25 tsp salt
- 3 large whole chicken breasts, halved
- 0.25 tsp pepper
- 0.66 cup milk
- 2 tbsp butter
<|steps|>
Cook rice with 1 tsp salt in 2 cups water; bring to a boil, then simmer covered over low heat for 14 minutes.
Remove from heat and let stand covered for 10 minutes.
Melt butter in a skillet, brown chicken breasts slowly on both sides, then drain.
Cook celery in 0.5 cup water, covered, until tender, about 8-10 minutes.
Spread rice in a greased 8x12x2-inch shallow baking dish.
Spread celery over rice, then place chicken skin side up.
Sprinkle chicken with 0.25 tsp salt, pepper, and onion.
Mix milk and mushroom soup, pour over chicken and rice.
Bake at 350°F for 45 minutes.
Melt 2 tbsp butter, stir in almonds to coat, and spread over soup.
Bake 15 minutes more until almonds are brown, for 6 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN OR TURKEY TETRAZZINI**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 tsp salt
- 0.25 tsp red pepper
- 1 tbsp Worcestershire sauce
- 4 tbsp sherry
- 1 cup chopped onion
- 0.5 cup bell pepper, chopped
- 2 tbsp margarine or butter
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 1 4-oz can mushrooms
- 5 tbsp milk
- 2 cups cooked chicken or turkey, diced
- 1 cup sharp grated cheese
- 0.5 cup almonds, cut in small pieces
- 1 small pkg noodles, cooked
<|steps|>
Brown onion and bell pepper in margarine until light brown.
Add soup, salt, red pepper, Worcestershire sauce, 0.5 cup cheese, milk, and sherry; stir until cheese melts.
Add chicken or turkey, mushrooms, and almonds.
Layer noodles and mixture in a casserole dish, topping with remaining cheese and almonds.
Bake at 400°F for 20 minutes, adding chicken stock if more liquid is needed, for 6-8 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HAWAIIAN SUPPER**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups cooked ham, in julienne strips
- 1 9-oz can pineapple tidbits
- 2 tbsp brown sugar
- 1.5 tbsp cornstarch
- 1 tsp monosodium glutamate
- 3 tsp vinegar
- 2 tsp prepared mustard
- 0.75 cup water
- 1 green pepper, cut in strips
- Hot cooked rice
<|steps|>
Brown ham in a small amount of hot fat.
Drain pineapple, reserving syrup.
Mix brown sugar, cornstarch, monosodium glutamate, vinegar, and mustard; stir in pineapple syrup and water.
Add mixture to ham, cook and stir until thickened.
Cover and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add pineapple and green pepper, simmer for 7 minutes.
Serve on rice for 4 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TUNA FISH CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 6 tbsp evaporated milk
- 0.25 cup water
- 0.5 cup Velveeta cheese
- 2 tsp butter
- 0.5 cup bread crumbs
- 1.5 tsp onion, minced
- 0.33 cup tuna fish
- 0.33 tsp salt
- Pepper, to taste
- 1 egg
- 1 cup cooked macaroni
<|steps|>
Combine milk, water, cheese, and butter in a saucepan; melt slowly.
Mix in onion, tuna, salt, pepper, egg, and macaroni.
Pour into a greased casserole dish.
Top with bread crumbs.
Bake at 350°F for 40 minutes, for 4-6 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HOMINY AND ALMOND CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 10.5-oz can condensed cream of mushroom soup
- 0.5 cup coffee cream
- 0.25 tsp cayenne
- 1 tsp Worcestershire sauce
- 1 tsp celery seed
- 0.5 tsp freshly ground pepper
- 1 tsp salt
- 1 No. 2.5 can hominy
- 0.5 lb almonds, toasted and halved
- 1 cup buttered crumbs
<|steps|>
Mix soup, cream, cayenne, Worcestershire sauce, celery seed, pepper, and salt; simmer until blended.
Drain hominy and place in a buttered casserole.
Add almonds to soup mixture and pour over hominy.
Cover with buttered crumbs.
Bake at 350°F for 30-40 minutes, for 6-8 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ESCALLOPED EGGPLANT WITH TOMATOES**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 medium eggplants
- 0.33 cup oil for sautéing
- Flour for dredging
- 1 can tomatoes
- 2 tbsp minced onion
- 1 tbsp margarine
- 1 tsp salt
- 0.25 tsp pepper
- 0.25 cup minced parsley
<|steps|>
Peel eggplants, cut into 0.75-inch fingers, sprinkle with salt, and let stand for 1 hour.
Drain, dry between paper towels, dredge lightly with flour, and sauté in oil until lightly browned.
For tomato sauce, sauté onions in margarine until tender.
Add tomatoes, salt, pepper, and parsley; simmer for 20 minutes, then strain to remove seeds and pulp.
Arrange eggplant and tomato sauce in alternate layers in a baking pan.
Bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes, for 12 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **STUFFED SUMMER SQUASH**
<|ingredients|>
- 12 small yellow squash
- 1 small onion, chopped
- 2 tbsp butter
- 1 tsp salt
- 1 tbsp brown sugar
- Bread crumbs
<|steps|>
Wash squash, cut lengthwise, and scoop out insides.
Place squash pulp and onion in a pressure cooker with a small amount of water; pressure cook for 5 minutes.
Remove lid, place squash shells on a cooking sheet, and salt insides.
Mix pulp with butter, salt, and brown sugar.
Fill shells with pulp mixture and top with bread crumbs.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes, for 12 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **WHOLE STRING BEANS AND MUSHROOMS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can whole string beans
- 1 4-oz can mushroom stems and pieces
- Pepper, to taste
- Salt, to taste
- Margarine, to taste
<|steps|>
Pour beans into a saucepan; add pepper, salt, and margarine.
Bring to a simmer, add strained mushrooms, and cook for a few minutes, for 4-6 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SALAD DRESSING**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 small garlic clove, crushed
- 0.75 cup mayonnaise
- Juice of 1-2 lemons
- 0.25 cup ketchup
- Paprika, to taste
- Salt, to taste
- Pepper, to taste
- 1 No. 2 can sauerkraut
- 2 medium apples, sliced, unpeeled
- 2 tbsp brown sugar
<|steps|>
Mix garlic, mayonnaise, lemon juice, ketchup, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Optionally add blue or Roquefort cheese.
Prepare the day before for best flavor, for 6-8 servings.
**RELISH**
Add apples and brown sugar to sauerkraut.
Simmer until apples disintegrate, for 6-8 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BING CHERRY SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup chopped nuts
- 1 pkg strawberry Jell-O
- 1 pkg cherry Jell-O
- 1 can Bing cherries
- 1 can crushed pineapple
- 2 small bottles Coca-Cola, cold
- 2 small pkgs cream cheese, chopped
<|steps|>
Drain juice from cherries and pineapple to make 2 cups.
Heat juice and dissolve Jell-O; cool to syrup stage in refrigerator.
Add Coca-Cola, pineapple, cherries, nuts, and cream cheese.
Pour into a glass container and congeal, for 8-10 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FROZEN DESSERT SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 12 marshmallows
- 0.25 cup pineapple juice
- 0.33 cup cream cheese (3 oz)
- 1 cup mayonnaise
- 1 cup whipped cream
- 1 cup maraschino cherries
- 1 cup drained pineapple
- 1 cup drained peaches
<|steps|>
Soak marshmallows in pineapple juice for 30 minutes until soft.
Mash cream cheese until smooth, then stir in mayonnaise.
Mix with marshmallows and juice until creamy.
Fold in whipped cream, cherries, pineapple, and peaches.
Pour into a freezing tray and freeze until firm, about 4 hours.
Cut into squares and serve on lettuce, for 8 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LIME FRUIT SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 0.75 cup evaporated milk
- 1 pkg lime Jell-O
- 0.5 cup boiling water
- 0.5 cup cold water
- 8 marshmallows, finely cut
- 1 9-oz can crushed pineapple
- 0.5 cup chopped nuts
<|steps|>
Chill milk in an ice tray until frozen around edges.
Dissolve Jell-O in boiling water, then stir in cold water.
Add marshmallows, pineapple, and nuts.
Whip milk until stiff and fold into Jell-O mixture.
Cover and chill for about 1 hour, for 8 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PINEAPPLE CHEESE SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 envelope Knox gelatin
- 0.5 cup cold water
- 1 cup sugar
- Juice of 1 lemon
- 1 large can grated pineapple
- 1 cup pecans, chopped
- 1 cup Philadelphia cream cheese (8 oz)
- 0.5 lb Velveeta cheese, cut small
<|steps|>
Heat pineapple, sugar, and lemon juice until sugar melts.
Dissolve gelatin in cold water and add to cooled pineapple mixture.
Stir in Velveeta, cream cheese, and pecans.
Pour into molds and chill until set, for 8 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FROZEN FRUIT SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 No. 2.5 can fruit cocktail
- 1 tsp unflavored gelatin
- 2 tbsp lemon juice
- 1 3-oz pkg cream cheese
- 0.25 cup mayonnaise
- Dash salt
- 0.66 cup whipping cream, chilled
- 0.5 cup sugar
- 0.5 cup chopped nuts
<|steps|>
Drain fruit cocktail.
Soften gelatin in lemon juice, then dissolve over hot water.
Blend cream cheese with mayonnaise and salt; stir in gelatin.
Whip cream until stiff, gradually adding sugar.
Fold in cheese mixture, nuts, and fruit cocktail.
Pour into a waxed paper-lined refrigerator tray and freeze until firm, about 4 hours.
Slice and garnish with watercress, for 8 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PEANUT BUTTER BREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 0.5 cup creamy peanut butter
- 1 tbsp shortening
- 0.33 cup sugar
- 1 egg, beaten
- 2 cups sifted all-purpose flour
- 2.5 tsp baking powder
- 0.5 tsp salt
- 1 cup milk
- 1 tsp vanilla
- 1 cup chopped dates
<|steps|>
Cream peanut butter and shortening, then add sugar and beat well.
Sift flour, baking powder, and salt together.
Add flour and milk alternately to creamed mixture.
Add vanilla.
Dredge dates with flour and add to mixture.
Bake in a greased loaf pan at 350°F for 1 hour, for 8 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **DEVILED CHEESE FILLING FOR CREAM PUFFS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup grated American cheese
- 0.25 tsp prepared mustard
- 3 tbsp mayonnaise
- 0.5 tsp Worcestershire sauce
- 1 tsp grated onion
- 5-6 drops Tabasco sauce
- 0.25 tsp celery seeds
- 0.5 cup boiling water
- 0.25 cup butter or margarine
- 0.125 tsp salt
- 0.5 cup flour
- 2 eggs
<|steps|>
For filling, mix cheese, mustard, mayonnaise, Worcestershire sauce, onion, Tabasco, and celery seeds.
For puffs, boil water, butter, and salt; add flour all at once and beat over low heat until mixture forms a ball.
Remove from heat, cool slightly, and add eggs one at a time, beating well.
Beat until mixture has a satin-like sheen.
Drop 0.5 tsp dough per puff onto a baking sheet.
Bake at 375°F for 30 minutes until brown and puffy.
Fill puffs with cheese mixture, for 30-35 bite-sized puffs.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHOCOLATE CINNAMON BARS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups sifted flour
- 1 tsp baking powder
- 1.33 cups sugar
- 4 tsp cinnamon
- 0.5 cup softened butter or margarine
- 0.5 cup shortening
- 1 egg
- 1 egg, separated
- 1 6-oz pkg semi-sweet chocolate pieces
- 0.5 cup chopped nuts
<|steps|>
Mix and sift flour, baking powder, 1 cup sugar, and 3 tsp cinnamon.
Add butter, shortening, 1 egg, and 1 egg yolk; blend well.
Spread evenly in a greased 15x10x0.75-inch jelly-roll pan.
Beat egg white slightly and brush over mixture.
Combine 0.33 cup sugar, 1 tsp cinnamon, chocolate pieces, and nuts; sprinkle over top.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.
Cool and cut into bars, for about 24 bars.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PEANUT CRUNCH**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 egg whites
- 1 cup sugar
- 32 Ritz crackers, crushed
- 1 cup pecans, chopped
- 1 tsp vanilla
<|steps|>
Beat egg whites until stiff.
Fold in sugar, crackers, pecans, and vanilla.
Pour into a greased 8x10-inch pan and press firmly.
Bake at 325°F for 25-30 minutes.
Cut into squares, for about 16 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **WALDORF ASTORIA RED CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 0.5 cup shortening
- 1.25 cups white sugar
- 2 eggs
- 0.25 tsp salt
- 1 tsp vanilla
- 2 oz red food coloring
- 1 cup buttermilk
- 2.5 cups flour
- 1 tsp baking soda
- 1 tsp vinegar
- 2 tsp cocoa
- 1 cup milk
- 1 cup sugar
- 1 cup butter
- 3 tbsp flour
<|steps|>
Mix vinegar and baking soda in a small cup and let stand.
Cream shortening, sugar, and eggs.
Make a paste of cocoa and some red food coloring; add to creamed mixture.
Add remaining coloring, then alternate buttermilk, salt, and flour.
Add vanilla, then soda and vinegar mixture; stir well.
Pour into two 8-inch pans and bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.
Cool and split layers in half lengthwise.
For frosting, cook 3 tbsp flour and milk until thick, then cool.
Cream 1 cup sugar and butter until fluffy, gradually add flour-milk mixture, beating constantly.
Spread frosting between layers and on top, for 8-10 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PRUNE CAKE OR PUDDING**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup Wesson oil
- 1.5 cups sugar
- 3 eggs
- 1 cup buttermilk
- 2 cups flour
- 1 tsp baking soda
- 1 tsp baking powder
- 1 tsp cinnamon
- 1 tsp nutmeg
- 1 tsp salt
- 1 tsp vanilla
- 1 cup chopped prunes
- 1 cup chopped pecans
- 1 cup sugar
- 1 cup buttermilk
- 1 tsp baking soda
- 2 tsp Karo syrup
- 1 stick margarine or butter
<|steps|>
Mix oil and 1.5 cups sugar, then add eggs, 1 cup buttermilk, flour, 1 tsp each of baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt, and vanilla.
Flour pecans and prunes with some flour, then add to mixture.
Pour into a greased, floured 8x8x2-inch pan.
Bake at 350°F for about 1 hour.
For sauce, cook 1 cup sugar, 1 cup buttermilk, 1 tsp baking soda, Karo, and margarine to soft ball stage; add 1 tsp vanilla.
Pour hot sauce over warm cake and let stand until absorbed.
Cut into squares, for 8 large servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BOILED COOKIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups sugar
- 4 tbsp cocoa
- 0.5 stick butter or margarine
- 0.5 cup creamy peanut butter
- 2.5 cups one-minute oatmeal
- 1 tsp vanilla
- 0.5 cup milk
<|steps|>
Mix sugar and cocoa, then add milk and butter.
Boil exactly 1 minute.
Add peanut butter, oatmeal, and vanilla.
Drop by spoonfuls onto wax paper, for about 24 cookies.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **RICE CRISPIES CRUNCH**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 stick margarine
- 1 cup sugar
- 0.5 lb chopped dates
- 1 egg
- 0.5 cup nuts
- 2 cups Rice Krispies
- Coconut, for rolling
<|steps|>
Melt margarine and sugar, add dates and egg.
Cook until thick, about 10 minutes, stirring constantly.
Cool, then add nuts and Rice Krispies.
Shape into balls and roll in coconut, for about 24 balls.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHOCOLATE FUDGE**
<|ingredients|>
- 4.25 cups sugar
- 1 large can evaporated milk
- 3 pkgs semi-sweet chocolate chips
- 8 oz jar marshmallow cream
- 0.5 lb margarine
- 2 tsp vanilla
- Pinch salt
- Nuts, optional
<|steps|>
Mix salt, sugar, margarine, and milk; boil for 9-10 minutes, stirring.
Remove from heat and add chocolate chips, marshmallow cream, vanilla, and nuts.
Pour into a greased dish and cut when cool, for about 5 lbs of fudge.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FUDGE PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 eggs
- 4 tbsp cocoa
- 1 cup sugar
- 0.5 cup melted butter
- 0.5 cup flour
- 0.25 cup pecans
- 0.25 cup boiling water
- 1 tsp vanilla
<|steps|>
Melt cocoa and butter, then add sugar.
Beat eggs and add to mixture.
Mix flour and pecans, then add boiling water and vanilla.
Pour into a greased pie pan.
Bake at 325°F for 30 minutes until firm.
Serve with ice cream or whipped cream, for 6-8 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BLACK BOTTOM PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 16 ginger snaps
- 0.25 cup butter or margarine
- 1 tbsp unflavored gelatin
- 0.25 cup cold water
- 1.75 cups milk
- 1 tbsp cornstarch
- 1 cup sugar
- 0.125 tsp salt
- 2 tbsp rum flavoring
- 4 eggs, separated
- 2 squares unsweetened chocolate
- 1 tsp vanilla
- 0.125 tsp almond extract
- 0.125 tsp cream of tartar
- Shaved chocolate, for garnish
<|steps|>
Roll ginger snaps into fine crumbs and mix with softened margarine.
Press into a 10-inch pie pan and bake at 300°F for 10 minutes.
Soak gelatin in cold water.
Scald milk, then mix cornstarch, 0.5 cup sugar, and salt.
Beat egg yolks, stir in sugar-cornstarch mixture, then add warm milk.
Cook over hot water until mixture coats a spoon, then add gelatin.
Divide custard: to one half, add melted chocolate, vanilla, and almond extract; pour into crust.
Cool the other half, then beat egg whites with cream of tartar until stiff, adding 0.5 cup sugar.
Fold cooled custard and rum flavoring into egg whites, spread over chocolate layer.
Sprinkle with shaved chocolate and chill for several hours, for 8 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BLUEBERRY PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 eggs, separated
- 0.5 cup sugar
- 1 8-oz pkg Philadelphia cream cheese
- 1 cup sour cream
- 1 tsp vanilla
- 1 tbsp flour
- 1 tsp lemon juice
- 1 cup blueberries, drained
- 1 cup blueberry juice
- 0.5 cup sugar
- 2 tbsp cornstarch
<|steps|>
Beat egg yolks and whites separately.
Mix yolks with 0.5 cup sugar, cream cheese, sour cream, vanilla, flour, and lemon juice.
Fold in egg whites and pour into two 8-inch pie crusts.
Bake at 325°F for 45 minutes.
For topping, cook blueberries, juice, 0.5 cup sugar, and cornstarch until thick.
Pour over cooled pies, for 12 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HERSHEY BAR CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 sticks margarine
- 2 cups sugar
- 4 eggs
- 2.25 cups flour
- 0.25 tsp salt
- 1 cup buttermilk
- 0.5 tsp baking soda
- 2 tsp vanilla
- 8 small Hershey bars, melted
- 1 cup chopped nuts
<|steps|>
Cream sugar and margarine, then add eggs, beating well after each.
Alternate flour (mixed with baking soda and salt) and buttermilk into creamed mixture.
Melt Hershey bars in a double boiler and fold into batter.
Fold in nuts.
Bake in a greased round cake pan at 300°F for 1.25 hours, for 10-12 servings.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ONION SOUP**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 1/2 to 2 1/2 cups thinly sliced onions
- 4 Tbsp. butter
- 1 Tbsp. flour
- 6 cups soup stock or canned bouillon
- 1 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
- Salt and pepper to taste
- Toast with grated Parmesan or other cheese
<|steps|>
Sauté onions in butter until light brown.
Stir in flour, soup stock, and Worcestershire sauce.
Simmer covered for one hour or longer.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot with cheese-sprinkled toast.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **VEGETABLE SOUP**
<|ingredients|>
- Large soup bone or 2-3 lbs. soup meat and bone
- 1 Tbsp. salt
- 3 qts. water
- 1/3 cup diced carrots
- 1/2 cup chopped celery
- 1 1/2 cups diced potatoes
- 1 small onion
- 2 cups tomatoes
- 5 Tbsp. butter
- Additional 2 cups water if needed
- Salt and pepper to taste
<|steps|>
Place soup bone or meat in a large kettle, sprinkle with salt, add water.
Cook slowly for a long time.
Add carrots, celery, potatoes, onion, tomatoes, and butter.
Add more water if needed.
Season with salt and pepper.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PENNSYLVANIA BEAN DUTCH SOUP**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 lb. Navy beans
- 2 medium potatoes
- 1 large onion
- 1/2 cup diced celery
- 2 Tbsp. chopped parsley
- 1 lb. chopped ham or ham bone
<|steps|>
Wash and cover beans with water, cook for about an hour.
Add ham, potatoes, and onion.
Add celery and parsley.
Cook until beans are tender.
Sprinkle with parsley before serving. Serves 6.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PINEAPPLE COTTAGE CHEESE SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pkg. lime gelatin
- 2 pkgs. lemon gelatin
- 2 cups boiling water
- 1 No. 2 can crushed pineapple
- 1 cup evaporated milk
- 1/2 cup salad dressing
- 1 cup small curd cottage cheese
- 2 Tbsp. horseradish
- 1/2 cup chopped nuts
<|steps|>
Dissolve gelatin in boiling water.
Add crushed pineapple and juice.
Chill until partially set, then whip.
Mix evaporated milk, salad dressing, cottage cheese, horseradish, and nuts.
Fold into whipped gelatin.
Chill until ready to serve. Serves about twelve.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LIME JELLO SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 small pkgs. lime Jello
- 2 cups marshmallows
- 2 cups hot water
- 2 cups cold water
- 2 - 7 oz. pkgs. cream cheese
- 2 small cans crushed pineapple or tidbits
- 1/2 pt. whipped cream
- 1 cup chopped pecans
<|steps|>
Prepare Jello with hot water, mix thoroughly.
Add cold water and stir.
Add marshmallows while mixture is hot.
Congeal until thick.
Add whipped cream cheese, drained pineapple, pecans, and whipped cream.
Blend well, chill until firm.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CRANBERRY SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 - 3 oz. pkgs. cream cheese
- 2 Tbsp. mayonnaise
- 2 Tbsp. sugar
- 1/2 cup pecans
- 1 can whole cranberries
- 1 - 9 oz. can crushed pineapple
- 1 cup whipping cream, lightly whipped
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients together.
Chill until set.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 hen, boiled and deboned
- 2 small delicious apples
- 10 or 12 sweet pickles (whole)
- 3 or 4 hard-boiled eggs
- 5 stalks celery
- Salt to taste
- Mayonnaise to desired consistency
<|steps|>
Boil hen until tender, remove meat from bones, cut with scissors.
Chop apples, pickles, eggs, and celery.
Combine with chicken.
Add salt and mayonnaise, mix to desired consistency.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **COCA-COLA SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pkg. raspberry gelatine
- 1 pkg. cherry gelatine
- 1 can seedless white cherries
- 1 cup pecans
- 1 - 8 oz. pkg. cream cheese (frozen)
- 2 Coca-Colas (partially frozen)
- 1 large can crushed pineapple
<|steps|>
Dissolve gelatine in heated cherry and pineapple juices.
Add Coca-Colas, cherries, pineapple, and nuts.
Grate frozen cream cheese over molds.
Refrigerate to congeal. Serves 10.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SHRIMP SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. boiled shrimp
- 6 green onions, finely cut
- 2 blades celery, finely cut
- 2 kernels garlic, finely cut
- 1/2 bell pepper, finely cut
- 2 hard-boiled eggs, chopped
- 1 Tbsp. parsley
- 1/4 head lettuce, chopped
- 2 Tbsp. mayonnaise
- 1 Tbsp. vinegar
- Salt and pepper to taste
<|steps|>
Combine all ingredients.
Mix well, season with salt and pepper.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CARROT-APPLE SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pkg. orange Jello
- 1/4 cup sugar
- 1 1/2 cups boiling water
- 1 - 8 oz. cream cheese
- 1/2 cup orange juice
- 1/2 tsp. grated lemon rind
- 2 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 1 cup shredded carrots
- 1 cup chopped unpeeled apple
<|steps|>
Dissolve Jello and sugar in boiling water.
Add cream cheese, beat smooth with electric mixer.
Stir in orange juice, lemon rind, and lemon juice.
Chill until partially congealed.
Add carrots and apple.
Chill until firm.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SOUR CREAM POTATO SALAD WITH HAM ROLLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 5 cups sliced cooked potatoes
- 1/2 cup diced celery
- 1/4 cup chopped green onion with tops
- 1/4 cup thinly chopped radishes
- 2 tsp. salt
- Dash of pepper
- 1/4 cup French dressing
- 1 1/2 cups sour cream
- Thinly sliced ham
- 2 quartered hard-cooked eggs
<|steps|>
Mix potatoes, celery, green onion, and radishes.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Lightly mix in French dressing, chill 2-3 hours.
Stir in sour cream just before serving.
Place on serving platter, arrange ham rolls around salad.
Garnish with eggs.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CARMEN'S CONGEALED SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 pkg. raspberry Jello
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1 can cranberries (drained)
- 1 can pineapple (cubed)
- 1 cup chopped celery
- 1 cup chopped nuts
<|steps|>
Prepare Jello as per directions, let thicken.
Add cranberries, pineapple, celery, and nuts.
Mold or chill in individual dessert dishes.
Serve with preferred topping.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **GREEN BEAN CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can green beans (drained)
- 1 can French fried onions
- 1 can mushroom soup
- 1/4 cup liquid from beans
<|steps|>
Mix bean liquid with mushroom soup.
Place beans in casserole, salt lightly.
Sprinkle half can of onions on beans, pour soup mixture over.
Top with remaining onions.
Bake at 350°F for 20-30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SQUASH CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups cooked, mashed squash
- 2 eggs
- 1 cup sweet milk
- 1/2 stick oleo
- 1 cup bread crumbs
- 2 Tbsp. minced onion
- Salt and pepper to taste
<|steps|>
Mix squash, eggs, milk, onion, salt, and pepper.
Melt oleo, pour half over crumbs.
Place crumb mixture on top of squash mixture.
Pour remaining oleo over entire mixture.
Bake until done.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BUFFET POTATOES AU GRATIN**
<|ingredients|>
- 6 cups sliced potatoes
- 1 cup chopped onions
- 3 Tbsp. butter
- 3 Tbsp. flour
- 1 1/2 cups milk
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/8 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 tsp. paprika
- 1/2 cup shredded Cheddar cheese
<|steps|>
Boil potatoes and onions in 2 1/2 cups boiling water with 1 tsp. salt until tender.
Drain, place in a greased 2-quart casserole.
Make white sauce with butter, flour, milk, salt, pepper, and cheese.
Pour over potatoes, sprinkle with paprika.
Bake at 375°F for 20-30 minutes. Serves 8.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ASPARAGUS CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 small cans green asparagus
- 8 oz. grated sharp cheese
- 4 boiled eggs
- 1 can mushroom soup, diluted with 1 cup milk
- 25 cent bag of potato chips
<|steps|>
Arrange in casserole: layer asparagus, potato chips, soup, cheese, and chopped or sliced eggs.
Repeat layers.
Bake until heated through.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **EGGPLANT STUFFED WITH SHRIMP**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 eggplant
- 1 cup cooked rice
- 1 cup canned or fresh cooked shrimp
- 2 tsp. chopped onions
- 2 tsp. parsley
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- Pinch of pepper
- 1/4 cup yogurt
- 2 Tbsp. bread crumbs
- 2 Tbsp. melted butter or margarine
- 1/2 cup water
- 1 Tbsp. butter
<|steps|>
Cut top from eggplant, cut skin lengthwise to form alternating peeled and unpeeled stripes.
Hollow out center, mix pulp with rice, shrimp, onions, parsley, salt, pepper, and yogurt.
Fill eggplant, stand upright in a deep saucepan.
Add water and butter to saucepan, cover, steam 30-40 minutes until tender.
Slice crosswise to serve 2.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **VENISON WITH SOUR CREAM**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 lbs. venison
- 1/4 cup fat
- 1 cup diced celery
- 1/2 cup minced onion
- 1 bay leaf
- 4 Tbsp. butter
- 1 clove garlic
- 1 cup diced carrots
- 2 cups water
- 1 tsp. salt
- 4 Tbsp. flour
- 1 cup sour cream
<|steps|>
Cut venison into pieces, melt fat in a heavy frying pan.
Add meat and garlic, brown on all sides, arrange in a dish.
Cook vegetables in remaining fat for 2 minutes.
Add salt, pepper, and water, pour over meat.
Bake in a slow oven until meat is tender.
Melt butter in a frying pan, stir in flour, add meat cooking liquid, boil until thick.
Add sour cream and more salt if needed, pour over meat and vegetables.
Serve with buttered noodles and currant jelly.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MOOSE STEAK**
<|ingredients|>
- Moose steak
- 1/2 cup onions, finely chopped
- 1/2 cup sweet or sour cream
- 1 cup chopped mushrooms
- 2 Tbsp. butter
- 2 Tbsp. flour
<|steps|>
Fry onions in butter until browned.
Sear steak on both sides in butter and browned onions.
Cover and simmer for 1/2 hour.
When almost tender, add mushrooms and flour stirred into cream.
Cover and simmer for 20 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **ROAST BEEF PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 1/2 to 2 cups chopped cooked roast beef
- 2 cups boiled sliced potatoes
- 1 medium onion, sliced
- 1 boiled egg
- 2 Tbsp. margarine
- 2 Tbsp. flour
- 2 1/2 cups milk
- 1 tsp. salt
- Biscuit dough (1/2 recipe)
- 1 1/2 lbs. ground beef
- 3 or 4 cloves garlic
- 3 or 4 stalks celery
- 1 large onion
- 4 or 5 Tbsp. chili powder
- 1 can tomato sauce
- 3 or 4 Tbsp. shortening
- Salt and pepper to taste
- Red kidney beans (optional)
<|steps|>
Place chopped roast in a baking dish, top with potatoes, onions, and boiled egg.
Melt margarine, stir in flour, add milk and salt, cook 3-5 minutes until medium thick.
Pour over potatoes and meat.
Roll biscuit dough 1/2 inch thick, place on top, trim edges.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes or until crust is brown. Serves 4.
**CHILI**
Finely chop celery, onions, and garlic, sauté in shortening.
Add ground beef, stir until browned.
Add tomato sauce, chili powder, and three cups of water.
Season with salt and pepper, simmer for one hour.
If using beans, add 15 minutes before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HAWAIIAN HAM**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup hot water
- 1 bouillon cube
- 1/4 cup raisins
- 1 can (9 oz.) crushed pineapple
- 1 Tbsp. sugar
- 2 Tbsp. vinegar
- 2 Tbsp. soy sauce
- 2 Tbsp. cornstarch
- 2 cups cooked ham, cut in thin strips
- 1 lb. ground round
- 1 large onion, grated
- 1 lb. can corn (shoe-peg or yellow whole kernel)
- 1 can condensed cream of tomato soup
- 1 small can tomato sauce
- 1 tsp. chili powder
- 8 oz. noodles
- Salt and pepper
- Grated sharp cheese
<|steps|>
Combine water, bouillon cube, raisins, pineapple, sugar, soy sauce, and vinegar in a saucepan.
Blend cornstarch with a little water to make a smooth paste, stir into mixture.
Cook, stirring constantly, until thickened.
Add ham, serve with cranberry sauce.
**OLE**
Cook noodles.
Fry meat and onion in a skillet until meat browns.
Add corn, tomato soup, tomato sauce, chili powder, salt, and pepper, simmer until well blended.
In a large casserole, alternate layers of noodles and meat mixture.
Top with cheese, bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SOUTHERN BEEF STEW**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. lean boneless beef stew or round steak
- 1 large white onion
- 1/2 medium size sweet pepper
- 4 white potatoes
- 1 can vegetable soup
- 1 can tomato soup
- 1 small can cut okra
<|steps|>
Cut beef into squares, sauté with onion.
Cut potatoes into 1-inch squares, add to beef and onions, cook 5 minutes over low heat.
Add vegetable soup, tomato soup, and okra.
Cook until beef is tender.
Salt to taste, serve over rice or as a soup.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BARBECUED BEEF BURGERS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 Tbsp. oil
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1 cup finely chopped onions
- 1 cup finely chopped green pepper
- 2 Tbsp. prepared mustard
- 1 Tbsp. vinegar
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 cup catsup
- 1/2 tsp. ground cloves
<|steps|>
Heat oil in a skillet, add meat, break into small pieces.
Sauté with onions and green peppers.
Add mustard, vinegar, salt, catsup, and cloves.
Cover, simmer for 30 minutes.
Serve with French bread or hamburger buns.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HAM 'N CHEESE PUFFS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup (1 stick) butter
- 1 1/2 cups shredded cheese
- 1/2 cup finely chopped baked ham
- 1/2 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
- Dash of cayenne pepper
- 1 cup sifted flour
<|steps|>
Combine butter, cheese, ham, Worcestershire sauce, and cayenne pepper in a mixing bowl.
Mix in flour.
Shape dough into a smooth roll, form into balls the size of large marbles.
Place on a baking sheet, bake at 350°F until done.
Serve piping hot. Yields 40.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SIMPLIFIED BEEF ROAST**
<|ingredients|>
- Beef roast
- Salt and pepper to taste
- Garlic salt
- 2 large onions
- 2 Tbsp. cornstarch
- Cold water
<|steps|>
Wash roast, season with salt, pepper, and generous garlic salt.
Slice onions, place on top of roast.
Wrap securely in aluminum foil, place in a shallow pan.
Bake at 250°F for 30 minutes per pound.
Mix cornstarch with cold water, add to roast juices for gravy, adding extra water if needed.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SPAGHETTI FOR 100**
<|ingredients|>
- 20 lbs. hamburger meat
- 20 onions
- 20 cans tomato paste
- 20 bell peppers
- 3 stalks celery
- 10 bottles ketchup
- 1 jar barbecue sauce
- 2 cans celery flakes
- 1 jar garlic salt (for bread and 1 Tbsp. in sauce)
- 1 can bay leaves
- 3 Tbsp. Italian seasonings
- 2 Tbsp. parsley flakes
- 20 loaves French bread
- 2 large pkgs. napkins
- 85 boxes tea
- 5 lbs. sugar
<|steps|>
Chop onions, bell peppers, and celery finely.
Sauté with hamburger meat until browned.
Add tomato paste, ketchup, barbecue sauce, celery flakes, garlic salt, bay leaves, Italian seasonings, and parsley flakes.
Simmer until flavors meld.
Serve with French bread and tea.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HAMBURGER CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 onion
- 1 green pepper
- 1 lb. ground meat
- 1 medium size can cream style corn
- 1 can tomato soup
- 1 small pkg. noodles
- 1 stick butter
- 2 tsp. sugar
- Salt to taste
- Grated cheese
<|steps|>
Chop onion and pepper, sauté in butter.
Add meat, cook until pink.
Add tomato soup, corn, and cooked noodles.
Add sugar and salt, simmer for 30 minutes.
Let set until ready to serve.
Sprinkle with grated cheese, bake until warm and cheese melts.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHILI BAKE CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb. pork sausage
- 1/3 cup chopped onion
- 1/3 cup chopped green pepper
- 1 1/2 tsp. salt
- 2 tsp. chili powder
- 1 tsp. cumin (optional)
- 1 No. 2 1/2 can stewed tomatoes (approx. 3 1/2 cups)
- 2 - 10 oz. pkgs. frozen succotash or 2 - 1 lb. cans
- 1 1/2 cups enriched corn meal (self-rising)
- 1 egg, slightly beaten
- 1/2-3/4 cup milk
- 2 Tbsp. sausage drippings
- Green pepper rings
- Pimiento strips
<|steps|>
Brown sausage in a 10-inch skillet, add onion and green pepper, fry until tender.
Drain fat, reserve drippings.
Add salt, chili powder, cumin, tomatoes, and succotash to sausage mixture.
Bring to a boil, reduce heat, simmer 30 minutes until succotash is tender.
Mix corn meal with egg, milk, and sausage drippings until moistened.
Spoon onto hot chili mixture, top with green pepper rings and pimiento strips.
Bake at 375°F for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Serves 16.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SEA FOOD GUMBO**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup Wesson oil
- 3 lbs. peeled shrimp
- 2 lbs. crab meat
- 1 doz. cleaned whole crabs, broken in half
- 1/4 lb. ham slice, cut in tiny pieces
- 8 large onions, diced
- 1 lb. pkg. cut frozen okra
- 3 blades of celery, diced
- 2-3 bay leaves
- 1 tsp. thyme leaves
- 1 Tbsp. black pepper
- Salt to taste
- Cooked rice
<|steps|>
In a large skillet, sauté ham until lightly browned.
Add onions, celery, okra, black pepper, and thyme, sauté until tender.
Fill a 2-gallon pot 2/3 full of water, add salt, bay leaves, and whole crabs, bring to a boil.
Add sautéed ingredients and shrimp, boil slowly for 1 1/2 hours.
Add crab meat, cook 30 minutes more.
Serve with a tablespoon of cooked rice in each dish.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TUNA RICE CURRY**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 tsp. curry powder
- 2 cups cream sauce
- 1 cup cooked rice (about 1/3 cup raw)
- 3 hard-boiled eggs, chopped
- 1 can chunk tuna
- 1 onion, chopped
- 1 Tbsp. parsley
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 2 Tbsp. chopped green onion (for garnish)
<|steps|>
Mix tuna with eggs, cooked rice, onion, parsley, and salt.
Stir curry powder into cream sauce, add to tuna mixture.
Bake in a greased casserole at 325°F for one hour.
Top with chopped green onions, serve with chutney if desired.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SALMON-CHEESE CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup canned salmon (drained)
- 2 eggs, beaten
- 2 cups cooked rice
- 1 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 2 tsp. minced onion
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/8 tsp. pepper
- 2 Tbsp. butter
- 1 cup cottage cheese
<|steps|>
Flake salmon, removing bones or membrane.
Mix with eggs, rice, lemon juice, onion, salt, pepper, butter, and cottage cheese.
Pour into a buttered casserole.
Bake at 350°F for about 30 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN AND OYSTER GUMBO**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 Tbsp. flour
- 1/4 cup cooking oil
- 1 large onion, cut up
- 1 pod garlic, cut up
- 3 Tbsp. bacon drippings
- 1 Tbsp. green pepper, cut up
- 1 large fryer or hen
- Pinch of sugar
- Salt to taste
- 8 medium-sized pods okra
- 1 pt. raw oysters (with juice)
- Cooked rice
<|steps|>
Cook chicken in a large pot of salted water.
Sauté onion and green pepper in bacon drippings.
In a skillet, brown flour in cooking oil until very dark brown, being careful not to scorch.
Add browned flour, sautéed onion, and green pepper to simmering chicken.
Add sugar and garlic, cover, cook on low heat for 1 1/2 hours.
Add okra, cook until tender.
Add oysters, cook 15 minutes more.
Serve over cooked rice.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SCALLOPED OYSTERS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 qt. oysters, drained
- 3/4 cup oyster liquor
- 1/2 cup margarine
- 2 Tbsp. flour
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/8 tsp. pepper
- 2 Tbsp. minced onion
- 1 tsp. garlic juice
- 1 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 1 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 1 1/4 cups fine cracker crumbs (saltines)
<|steps|>
Warm oysters in liquor over low heat.
Melt margarine, blend in flour.
Add salt, pepper, onion, garlic juice, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, and 1 cup crumbs.
Combine with oysters and liquor.
Turn into a greased baking dish, sprinkle with remaining crumbs.
Bake at 375°F for 20 minutes or until light golden brown and bubbly. Serves 6-8.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BARBECUED SHRIMP**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 env. Good Seasons Italian Salad Dressing mix
- 1/3 cup salad oil
- 1/3 cup dry white wine
- 1/4 cup minced onion
- 2 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 2 Tbsp. minced green pepper
- 1/2 clove garlic, minced
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 lb. (18-20) shrimp, cleaned
<|steps|>
Mix all ingredients except shrimp in a shallow bowl.
Stir in shrimp, cover, marinate in refrigerator for two hours.
Grill or broil shrimp for two minutes on each side until cooked but tender. Serves 4.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SPAGHETTI WITH SHRIMP, CREOLE STYLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/4 cup butter or margarine
- 1/2 cup finely chopped onion
- 1/4 cup finely chopped green pepper
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1/4 cup enriched flour
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. chili powder
- 1/8 tsp. pepper
- 4 1/2 cups tomatoes (2-1 lb. 4 oz. cans)
- 3/4 cup water
- 1 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 1 lb. shrimp, cooked, shelled, and deveined
- 8 oz. long spaghetti
<|steps|>
Melt butter in a large, heavy skillet or saucepot.
Add onion, green pepper, and garlic, cook over low heat for 5 minutes.
Stir in flour, salt, chili powder, pepper, tomatoes, water, and Worcestershire sauce.
Cook until thickened, stirring constantly, then simmer uncovered for 15 minutes.
Cut shrimp into pieces, add to sauce, simmer 20 minutes.
Cook spaghetti in boiling salted water until tender (about 7 minutes), drain.
Serve sauce over spaghetti. Serves 6.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN SPAGHETTI**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 large hen
- 1 lb. Cheddar cheese
- 1 medium onion
- 1 pod garlic
- 1/2 green pepper
- 1 medium size can mushrooms
- 1 can tomatoes
- 1 large pkg. spaghetti
<|steps|>
Boil and bone chicken.
Sauté onions, garlic, and green pepper.
Add tomatoes, mushrooms, and half the cheese.
Boil spaghetti in chicken broth, then add tomato sauce and chicken.
Place in a casserole, top with remaining cheese.
Bake at 350°F for 45 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 can celery soup
- 1 3/4 cups Carnation milk
- 1/2 cup almonds
- 1 cup diced celery
- 2 cups diced cooked chicken
- 1 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 1 pkg. Chinese noodles
- 1/2 lb. mushrooms
<|steps|>
Place half the noodles in the bottom of a casserole.
Mix celery soup, milk, almonds, celery, chicken, Worcestershire sauce, and mushrooms.
Pour over noodles, top with remaining noodles.
Bake until heated through.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CARAMEL KISSES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup sugar
- 1/2 cup dark corn syrup
- 1 Tbsp. butter
- 1 tsp. vinegar
- 1/2 tsp. baking soda
- 1 tsp. vanilla
<|steps|>
Combine sugar, corn syrup, butter, and vinegar in a saucepan.
Cook to hard crack stage (300°F).
Remove from heat, add baking soda and vanilla, stir well.
Pour into a buttered pan, cool slightly, pull until light and porous.
Cut into pieces, wrap in waxed paper.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **DATE BALLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup sugar
- 1 stick butter
- 1 egg, well beaten
- 1 cup chopped dates
- 2 cups Rice Krispies
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- Chopped nuts or coconut
<|steps|>
Cook sugar, butter, egg, and dates over low heat until thick.
Remove from heat, add Rice Krispies and vanilla.
Shape into balls, roll in chopped nuts or coconut.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **DIVINITY FUDGE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups sugar
- 1/2 cup white corn syrup
- 1/2 cup water
- 2 egg whites
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 cup chopped nuts
<|steps|>
Boil sugar, corn syrup, and water to soft ball stage (235°F).
Beat egg whites until stiff.
Pour half the syrup slowly over egg whites, beating constantly.
Cook remaining syrup to hard ball stage (250°F).
Pour over egg white mixture, beat until creamy.
Add vanilla and nuts, drop by spoonfuls onto waxed paper.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CREAMY PRALINES**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups sugar
- 1/2 tsp. baking soda
- 1 cup buttermilk
- 2 Tbsp. white corn syrup
- 2 Tbsp. butter
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 2 cups pecans
<|steps|>
Combine sugar, baking soda, buttermilk, and corn syrup in a saucepan.
Cook to soft ball stage (235°F), stirring constantly.
Remove from heat, add butter, vanilla, and pecans.
Beat until slightly thickened, drop by spoonfuls onto waxed paper. Makes 10 pralines.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CANDY BALLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 lbs. powdered sugar
- 1 can condensed milk
- 1/4 lb. butter, melted
- 1 qt. chopped pecans
- 1 Tbsp. vanilla
- 6 squares unsweetened chocolate
- 1/2 stick paraffin
<|steps|>
Mix powdered sugar, condensed milk, butter, pecans, and vanilla.
Form into small balls, refrigerate for 3 hours.
Melt chocolate and paraffin together.
Dip balls in chocolate mixture after it cools for 2 minutes.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PECAN BARS**
<|ingredients|>
- **Crust:**
- 1/3 cup butter or oleo
- 1/2 cup brown sugar
- 1 1/2 cups sifted flour
- 1/2 tsp. baking powder
- 1/4 cup finely chopped pecans
- **Topping:**
- 2 eggs
- 3/4 cup white corn syrup
- 1/4 cup brown sugar
- 3 Tbsp. flour
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 3/4 cup chopped pecans
- 2 pkgs. butterscotch chips
- 1 small can mixed nuts
- 1 can Chow Mein noodles
<|steps|>
Cream butter and brown sugar, blend in flour, baking powder, and pecans.
Press into an oblong cake pan, bake for 10 minutes.
Beat eggs until light, stir in corn syrup, sugar, flour, salt, and vanilla.
Spread over baked crust, sprinkle with pecans.
Bake until firm.
**CANDY**
Melt butterscotch chips over warm heat.
Add nuts and noodles, stir lightly.
Drop by spoonfuls onto waxed paper, let cool.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CINNAMON PECANS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup sugar
- 1/3 cup evaporated cream
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 2 cups pecans
<|steps|>
Mix sugar and cream, bring to a boil.
Cook until a soft ball forms in cold water.
Stir in cinnamon and vanilla, add pecans.
Drop onto waxed paper, separate.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BRAZIL NUT CARAMELS**
<|ingredients|>
- 3/4 cup chopped Brazil nuts
- 1 lb. vanilla caramels
- 2 Tbsp. shortening
<|steps|>
Spread chopped Brazil nuts on a sheet of foil.
Melt caramels and shortening in a double boiler, stirring occasionally.
Drop melted caramel by teaspoon onto nuts while keeping pan over heat.
Cool until firm, wrap each caramel in waxed paper. Makes about 3 dozen.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FIG PRESERVES**
<|ingredients|>
- Ripe but firm figs
- Sugar (2 parts figs to 1 part sugar)
- Soda water (for washing)
<|steps|>
Peel or wash figs in soda water to remove fuzz, drain.
Measure figs and sugar into a deep kettle (2 parts figs to 1 part sugar).
Cook slowly until thick and fruit looks clear.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HOT TEA PUNCH**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup sugar
- 1 stick cinnamon
- 1 cup orange juice
- 4 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 2 tsp. grated lemon rind
- 3 tsp. grated orange rind
- 1 cup pineapple juice
- 1 - 13 oz. can crushed pineapple
- 6 Tbsp. tea
- 6 cups boiling water for tea
- 1 cup boiling water
<|steps|>
Make tea, steep for 5 minutes, strain.
Pour 1 cup boiling water over sugar, cinnamon, lemon, and orange rind, steep a few minutes.
Add tea, orange juice, lemon juice, pineapple juice, and crushed pineapple.
Let stand a few hours or overnight.
Serve hot. Serves 16-18.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **WEDDING PUNCH**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 cups sugar
- 3 cups water
- 6 cups grapefruit juice
- 6 cups orange juice
- 1 1/2 cups lime juice
- 1 1/2 qts. ginger ale
<|steps|>
Combine sugar and water, heat until sugar is dissolved, chill.
Add grapefruit juice, orange juice, lime juice, and ginger ale.
Serve over ice. Serves 50.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **GOOD PUNCH**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 large can apple juice
- 1 large can orange juice
- 1 large can pineapple juice
- 1 cup sugar
- 1/4 can water
<|steps|>
Combine apple juice, orange juice, pineapple juice, sugar, and water.
Mix well. Serves 25.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **EGG NOG**
<|ingredients|>
- 12 egg yolks
- 12 Tbsp. sugar
- 1 1/2 cups Bourbon whiskey
- 12 egg whites, stiffly beaten
- 1 1/2 pints cream, whipped
- Nutmeg (optional)
- 1/2 cup sweet pickle vinegar
- 1/4 cup water
- 1 bouillon cube
- 2 Tbsp. sugar
- 1/4 lb. butter
- 2 tsp. salt
- 1 Tbsp. prepared mustard
- 1 tsp. black pepper
- 1/4 tsp. cayenne pepper
- 1 medium onion, minced
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- Juice of 1 lemon
- 3 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 1 cup ketchup
- 2 small onions, grated
- 3 large green olives, grated
- 3 black olives, grated
- 1 Tbsp. sweet pickle relish
- 2 tsp. grated capers
- 3 Tbsp. mayonnaise
<|steps|>
Beat egg yolks until light, gradually add sugar.
Slowly add Bourbon whiskey, beating constantly.
Fold in stiffly beaten egg whites and whipped cream.
Serve with a dash of nutmeg on each cup if desired. Makes 1 gallon.
**BARBECUE SAUCE**
Simmer vinegar, water, bouillon cube, sugar, butter, salt, mustard, black pepper, cayenne, onion, garlic, and lemon juice until onions and garlic are soft.
Add Worcestershire sauce and ketchup, bring to a boil.
Remove from heat immediately.
**TARTAR SAUCE**
Combine all ingredients.
Mix well.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **JAMBALAYA**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb andouille sausage, sliced
- 1 lb boneless chicken thighs, diced
- 1 lb shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 1 large onion, chopped
- 1 green bell pepper, chopped
- 2 celery stalks, chopped
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 can (14.5 oz) diced tomatoes
- 2 cups long-grain rice
- 4 cups chicken broth
- 2 bay leaves
- 1 tsp smoked paprika
- 1 tsp cayenne pepper
- 1 tsp dried thyme
- Salt and pepper, to taste
- 2 tbsp olive oil
- 1/4 cup chopped parsley
<|steps|>
Heat olive oil in a large Dutch oven over medium heat. Add sausage and cook until browned, about 5 minutes. Remove and set aside.
Add chicken to the pot, season with salt and pepper, and cook until golden, about 6 minutes. Remove and set aside.
Add onion, bell pepper, celery, and garlic to the pot. Sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
Stir in rice, tomatoes, broth, bay leaves, paprika, cayenne, and thyme. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer.
Return sausage and chicken to the pot. Cover and cook for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add shrimp, cover, and cook until shrimp are pink and rice is tender, about 5-7 minutes.
Remove bay leaves, stir in parsley, and serve hot.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **MAC AND CHEESE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb elbow macaroni
- 4 cups shredded sharp cheddar cheese
- 2 cups whole milk
- 1/4 cup unsalted butter
- 1/4 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 tsp mustard powder
- 1/2 tsp garlic powder
- 1/2 tsp onion powder
- Salt and pepper, to taste
- 1/2 cup panko breadcrumbs
- 2 tbsp melted butter
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 375°F.
Cook macaroni according to package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
In a large saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Whisk in flour and cook for 2 minutes.
Slowly whisk in milk, stirring constantly until thickened, about 5 minutes.
Add mustard powder, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper. Remove from heat and stir in 3 cups cheese until melted.
Combine macaroni and cheese sauce, then transfer to a greased 9x13-inch baking dish.
Mix panko with melted butter and remaining 1 cup cheese. Sprinkle over macaroni.
Bake for 20-25 minutes until golden and bubbly. Serve hot.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN AND DUMPLINGS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 whole chicken (about 4 lbs), cut into pieces
- 1 onion, chopped
- 2 carrots, sliced
- 2 celery stalks, sliced
- 4 cups chicken broth
- 2 cups water
- 1 tsp dried thyme
- Salt and pepper, to taste
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 tbsp baking powder
- 1 tsp salt
- 1 cup whole milk
- 1/4 cup unsalted butter, melted
<|steps|>
In a large pot, combine chicken, onion, carrots, celery, broth, water, thyme, salt, and pepper. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer and cook for 1 hour until chicken is tender.
Remove chicken, shred meat, and return to pot. Discard bones and skin.
For dumplings, mix flour, baking powder, and salt in a bowl. Stir in milk and melted butter until just combined.
Drop tablespoon-sized dough balls into simmering broth. Cover and cook for 15 minutes without lifting the lid.
Serve hot with dumplings and broth.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRIED CHICKEN**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 whole chicken, cut into 8 pieces
- 2 cups buttermilk
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 tbsp paprika
- 1 tsp garlic powder
- 1 tsp onion powder
- 1 tsp cayenne pepper
- Salt and pepper, to taste
- Vegetable oil, for frying
<|steps|>
Soak chicken in buttermilk with salt and pepper for at least 2 hours or overnight in the refrigerator.
In a large bowl, mix flour, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, cayenne, salt, and pepper.
Remove chicken from buttermilk, letting excess drip off. Dredge in flour mixture, coating thoroughly.
Heat 1 inch of vegetable oil in a large skillet to 350°F.
Fry chicken in batches, turning occasionally, until golden and cooked through, about 12-15 minutes per side.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **COLLARD GREENS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 lbs collard greens, stems removed and chopped
- 1 smoked ham hock
- 1 onion, chopped
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 4 cups chicken broth
- 1 tbsp apple cider vinegar
- 1 tsp sugar
- 1/2 tsp red pepper flakes
- Salt and pepper, to taste
<|steps|>
In a large pot, combine ham hock, onion, garlic, and broth. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 1 hour.
Add collard greens, vinegar, sugar, red pepper flakes, salt, and pepper.
Simmer for 45-60 minutes until greens are tender, stirring occasionally.
Remove ham hock, shred meat, and return to pot. Serve hot.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORN BREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup yellow cornmeal
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/4 cup sugar
- 1 tbsp baking powder
- 1 tsp salt
- 1 cup whole milk
- 1/3 cup vegetable oil
- 2 large eggs
- 2 tbsp unsalted butter
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 400°F. Place butter in a 9-inch cast-iron skillet and heat in oven until melted.
In a bowl, mix cornmeal, flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, whisk milk, oil, and eggs. Combine with dry ingredients and stir until just mixed.
Pour batter into hot skillet. Bake for 20-25 minutes until golden and a toothpick comes out clean.
Serve warm with butter.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PECAN PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 unbaked 9-inch pie crust
- 1 cup light corn syrup
- 3/4 cup sugar
- 3 large eggs
- 1/4 cup unsalted butter, melted
- 1 tsp vanilla extract
- 1/2 tsp salt
- 1 1/2 cups pecan halves
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 350°F.
In a bowl, whisk corn syrup, sugar, eggs, butter, vanilla, and salt until smooth.
Stir in pecans and pour into pie crust.
Bake for 50-60 minutes until set but slightly jiggly in the center.
Cool completely before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SHRIMP AND GRITS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup stone-ground grits
- 4 cups water
- 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- 1/4 cup unsalted butter
- Salt and pepper, to taste
- 1 lb shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 4 slices bacon, chopped
- 1 small onion, chopped
- 1 green bell pepper, chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/2 cup chicken broth
- 1 tbsp lemon juice
- 1 tsp hot sauce
<|steps|>
Bring water to a boil, add grits, and simmer for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in cheese, butter, salt, and pepper. Keep warm.
In a skillet, cook bacon until crisp. Remove and set aside.
In bacon fat, sauté onion, bell pepper, and garlic until soft, about 5 minutes.
Add shrimp, broth, lemon juice, and hot sauce. Cook until shrimp are pink, about 3-4 minutes.
Serve shrimp mixture over grits, topped with bacon.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BISCUITS AND GRAVY**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 tbsp baking powder
- 1/2 tsp baking soda
- 1 tsp salt
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, cold and cubed
- 1 cup buttermilk
- 1 lb breakfast sausage
- 1/4 cup all-purpose flour
- 2 cups whole milk
- Salt and pepper, to taste
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 425°F.
Mix flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Stir in buttermilk until just combined. Knead lightly, roll out to 1/2-inch thickness, and cut into rounds.
Bake on a parchment-lined sheet for 12-15 minutes until golden.
In a skillet, cook sausage over medium heat, breaking it up, until browned. Remove and set aside.
Add flour to skillet, stirring in sausage drippings. Gradually whisk in milk and cook until thickened.
Add sausage back, season with salt and pepper, and serve over split biscuits.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SWEET POTATO CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 cups mashed sweet potatoes
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 2 large eggs
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, melted
- 1 tsp vanilla extract
- 1/2 tsp ground cinnamon
- 1/4 tsp ground nutmeg
- 1/2 cup whole milk
- 1 cup chopped pecans
- 1/2 cup brown sugar
- 1/4 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/4 cup unsalted butter, melted
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 350°F.
Mix sweet potatoes, sugar, eggs, butter, vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg, and milk until smooth. Spread in a greased 9x13-inch dish.
Combine pecans, brown sugar, flour, and melted butter. Sprinkle over sweet potato mixture.
Bake for 30-35 minutes until topping is golden and casserole is bubbly.
Serve warm.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **GUMBO**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/2 cup vegetable oil
- 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 lb andouille sausage, sliced
- 1 lb boneless chicken thighs, diced
- 1 large onion, chopped
- 1 green bell pepper, chopped
- 2 celery stalks, chopped
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 6 cups chicken broth
- 1 can (14.5 oz) diced tomatoes
- 1 lb okra, sliced
- 2 bay leaves
- 1 tsp dried thyme
- 1 tsp cayenne pepper
- 1 lb shrimp, peeled and deveined
- Salt and pepper, to taste
- 1/4 cup chopped parsley
- Cooked rice, for serving
<|steps|>
In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat. Whisk in flour and cook, stirring constantly, until roux is dark brown, about 15-20 minutes.
Add sausage and chicken, cooking until browned, about 8 minutes.
Stir in onion, bell pepper, celery, and garlic. Cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add broth, tomatoes, okra, bay leaves, thyme, and cayenne. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 45 minutes.
Add shrimp and cook until pink, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Remove bay leaves, stir in parsley, and serve over rice.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **HUSH PUPPIES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup yellow cornmeal
- 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 tbsp sugar
- 1 tsp baking powder
- 1/2 tsp baking soda
- 1/2 tsp salt
- 1/2 cup buttermilk
- 1 large egg
- 1/4 cup finely chopped onion
- Vegetable oil, for frying
<|steps|>
In a bowl, mix cornmeal, flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
In another bowl, whisk buttermilk and egg. Stir in onion.
Combine wet and dry ingredients until just mixed.
Heat 2 inches of oil in a deep skillet to 350°F.
Drop tablespoon-sized batter into hot oil. Fry until golden, about 2-3 minutes per side.
Drain on paper towels and serve warm.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BLACK-EYED PEAS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb dried black-eyed peas, soaked overnight
- 1 smoked ham hock
- 1 onion, chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 4 cups chicken broth
- 1 bay leaf
- 1/2 tsp red pepper flakes
- Salt and pepper, to taste
<|steps|>
Drain and rinse soaked peas.
In a large pot, combine peas, ham hock, onion, garlic, broth, bay leaf, and red pepper flakes.
Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer. Cook for 1-1.5 hours until peas are tender.
Remove ham hock, shred meat, and return to pot. Season with salt and pepper.
Remove bay leaf and serve hot.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BANANA PUDDING**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup sugar
- 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/2 tsp salt
- 4 cups whole milk
- 4 large egg yolks
- 1 tbsp vanilla extract
- 1 box (12 oz) vanilla wafers
- 4 ripe bananas, sliced
- 1 cup heavy cream
- 1/4 cup powdered sugar
<|steps|>
In a saucepan, mix sugar, flour, and salt. Whisk in milk and cook over medium heat until thickened, about 10 minutes.
Whisk egg yolks in a bowl, then slowly add hot milk mixture, whisking constantly. Return to saucepan and cook for 2 minutes.
Remove from heat, stir in vanilla, and cool slightly.
In a 9x13-inch dish, layer wafers, bananas, and pudding. Repeat layers, ending with pudding.
Whip cream with powdered sugar until stiff. Spread over pudding.
Chill for at least 4 hours before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CRAWFISH ÉTOUFFÉE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1/4 cup unsalted butter
- 1/4 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 onion, chopped
- 1 green bell pepper, chopped
- 2 celery stalks, chopped
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 lb crawfish tails, peeled
- 1 cup seafood stock
- 1 tsp Cajun seasoning
- 1/2 tsp cayenne pepper
- Salt and pepper, to taste
- 1/4 cup chopped parsley
- Cooked rice, for serving
<|steps|>
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Whisk in flour and cook until roux is light brown, about 10 minutes.
Add onion, bell pepper, celery, and garlic. Cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Stir in crawfish, stock, Cajun seasoning, cayenne, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 15 minutes.
Stir in parsley and serve over rice.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **RED BEANS AND RICE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb dried red kidney beans, soaked overnight
- 1 lb andouille sausage, sliced
- 1 onion, chopped
- 1 green bell pepper, chopped
- 2 celery stalks, chopped
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 6 cups chicken broth
- 2 bay leaves
- 1 tsp dried thyme
- 1 tsp smoked paprika
- 1/2 tsp cayenne pepper
- Salt and pepper, to taste
- Cooked rice, for serving
<|steps|>
Drain and rinse soaked beans.
In a large pot, cook sausage until browned, about 5 minutes. Remove and set aside.
Add onion, bell pepper, celery, and garlic to pot. Sauté until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add beans, broth, bay leaves, thyme, paprika, cayenne, salt, and pepper. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 2-2.5 hours until beans are tender.
Return sausage to pot and cook for 10 minutes. Remove bay leaves.
Serve over rice.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **OKRA AND TOMATOES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb fresh okra, sliced
- 1 can (14.5 oz) diced tomatoes
- 1 onion, chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/2 tsp red pepper flakes
- 1 tsp sugar
- 2 tbsp olive oil
- Salt and pepper, to taste
<|steps|>
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, cooking until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add okra, tomatoes, red pepper flakes, sugar, salt, and pepper.
Simmer for 20-25 minutes until okra is tender, stirring occasionally.
Serve hot as a side dish.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BUTTERMILK PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 unbaked 9-inch pie crust
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, melted
- 1 1/2 cups sugar
- 3 large eggs
- 1/4 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 cup buttermilk
- 1 tsp vanilla extract
- 1/2 tsp ground nutmeg
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 350°F.
In a bowl, whisk butter, sugar, eggs, flour, buttermilk, vanilla, and nutmeg until smooth.
Pour into pie crust.
Bake for 40-50 minutes until set and lightly golden.
Cool completely before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PIMENTO CHEESE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups shredded sharp cheddar cheese
- 1/2 cup mayonnaise
- 1/4 cup diced pimentos, drained
- 1 tsp Worcestershire sauce
- 1/2 tsp garlic powder
- 1/4 tsp cayenne pepper
- Salt and pepper, to taste
<|steps|>
In a bowl, mix cheese, mayonnaise, pimentos, Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, cayenne, salt, and pepper until well combined.
Chill for at least 1 hour before serving.
Serve with crackers or as a sandwich spread.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **DEVILED EGGS**
<|ingredients|>
- 12 large eggs
- 1/3 cup mayonnaise
- 1 tbsp Dijon mustard
- 1 tsp apple cider vinegar
- 1/4 tsp hot sauce
- Salt and pepper, to taste
- Paprika, for garnish
<|steps|>
Boil eggs for 10 minutes, then cool in ice water. Peel and halve lengthwise.
Remove yolks and mash with mayonnaise, mustard, vinegar, hot sauce, salt, and pepper.
Spoon or pipe yolk mixture back into egg whites.
Sprinkle with paprika and chill before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PEACH COBBLER**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 cups sliced fresh peaches
- 1 cup sugar
- 1/2 tsp ground cinnamon
- 1/4 tsp ground nutmeg
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 tbsp baking powder
- 1/4 tsp salt
- 1 cup whole milk
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, melted
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 375°F.
In a bowl, mix peaches, 1/2 cup sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Set aside.
In another bowl, mix flour, baking powder, salt, and remaining 1/2 cup sugar. Stir in milk and melted butter.
Pour batter into a greased 9x13-inch dish. Spoon peaches and juices over batter.
Bake for 40-45 minutes until golden and bubbly.
Serve warm with ice cream.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CANDIED YAMS**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 lbs sweet potatoes, peeled and sliced
- 1 cup brown sugar
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter
- 1/2 cup maple syrup
- 1 tsp ground cinnamon
- 1/2 tsp ground nutmeg
- 1/4 tsp salt
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 350°F.
Place sweet potatoes in a greased 9x13-inch baking dish.
In a saucepan, melt butter with brown sugar, maple syrup, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt. Pour over sweet potatoes.
Cover with foil and bake for 45 minutes. Uncover and bake for 15 more minutes until tender and glazed.
Serve warm.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CATFISH PO’BOY**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 catfish fillets
- 1 cup cornmeal
- 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 tsp Cajun seasoning
- 1/2 tsp cayenne pepper
- Salt and pepper, to taste
- 1 cup buttermilk
- Vegetable oil, for frying
- 4 hoagie rolls
- 1 cup shredded lettuce
- 1 tomato, sliced
- 1/2 cup remoulade sauce
<|steps|>
Soak catfish in buttermilk with salt and pepper for 30 minutes.
Mix cornmeal, flour, Cajun seasoning, cayenne, salt, and pepper.
Dredge catfish in cornmeal mixture.
Heat 1 inch of oil in a skillet to 350°F. Fry catfish until golden, about 3-4 minutes per side.
Drain on paper towels.
Assemble sandwiches with rolls, lettuce, tomato, catfish, and remoulade sauce. Serve immediately.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN FRIED STEAK**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 cube steaks
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 tsp garlic powder
- 1 tsp onion powder
- 1/2 tsp cayenne pepper
- Salt and pepper, to taste
- 2 large eggs
- 1/4 cup whole milk
- Vegetable oil, for frying
- 2 cups whole milk (for gravy)
- 1/4 cup all-purpose flour (for gravy)
<|steps|>
Season steaks with salt and pepper.
Mix flour, garlic powder, onion powder, cayenne, salt, and pepper.
Whisk eggs and 1/4 cup milk in a bowl.
Dredge steaks in flour, then egg mixture, then flour again.
Heat 1/2 inch oil in a skillet to 350°F. Fry steaks until golden, about 3-4 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels.
For gravy, pour off all but 1/4 cup oil. Whisk in 1/4 cup flour, then slowly add 2 cups milk, stirring until thickened. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve steaks with gravy.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **BOURBON BALLS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup crushed vanilla wafers
- 1 cup powdered sugar
- 1 cup chopped pecans
- 2 tbsp unsweetened cocoa powder
- 1/4 cup bourbon
- 2 tbsp light corn syrup
- Powdered sugar, for rolling
<|steps|>
In a bowl, mix wafer crumbs, powdered sugar, pecans, and cocoa.
Stir in bourbon and corn syrup until combined.
Shape into 1-inch balls and roll in powdered sugar.
Chill for at least 2 hours before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CORN PUDDING**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 cups fresh corn kernels
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1/4 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 tsp salt
- 1/2 tsp black pepper
- 4 large eggs
- 2 cups whole milk
- 1/4 cup unsalted butter, melted
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 350°F.
In a bowl, mix corn, sugar, flour, salt, and pepper.
Whisk eggs, milk, and butter in another bowl. Combine with corn mixture.
Pour into a greased 2-quart baking dish.
Bake for 50-60 minutes until set and golden.
Serve warm.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SOUTHERN FRIED OKRA**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 lb fresh okra, sliced
- 1 cup cornmeal
- 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 tsp salt
- 1/2 tsp black pepper
- 1/4 tsp cayenne pepper
- 1 cup buttermilk
- Vegetable oil, for frying
<|steps|>
Soak okra in buttermilk for 15 minutes.
Mix cornmeal, flour, salt, pepper, and cayenne.
Dredge okra in cornmeal mixture.
Heat 1 inch of oil in a skillet to 350°F. Fry okra in batches until golden, about 2-3 minutes.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **KEY LIME PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 1/2 cups graham cracker crumbs
- 1/3 cup sugar
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, melted
- 3 large egg yolks
- 1 can (14 oz) sweetened condensed milk
- 1/2 cup key lime juice
- 1 tsp lime zest
- 1 cup heavy cream
- 2 tbsp powdered sugar
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 350°F.
Mix crumbs, sugar, and butter. Press into a 9-inch pie dish. Bake for 10 minutes.
Whisk egg yolks, condensed milk, lime juice, and zest until smooth. Pour into crust.
Bake for 15-20 minutes until set.
Cool, then chill for 4 hours.
Whip cream with powdered sugar and spread over pie before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SQUASH CASSEROLE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 lbs yellow squash, sliced
- 1 onion, chopped
- 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- 1/2 cup sour cream
- 1/4 cup unsalted butter, melted
- 1 cup crushed Ritz crackers
- 1 tsp salt
- 1/2 tsp black pepper
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 350°F.
Boil squash and onion until tender, about 10 minutes. Drain and mash slightly.
Mix squash, onion, cheese, sour cream, salt, and pepper. Spread in a greased 2-quart baking dish.
Combine butter and cracker crumbs. Sprinkle over squash mixture.
Bake for 25-30 minutes until golden and bubbly.
Serve warm.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHEESE GRITS**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup stone-ground grits
- 4 cups water
- 1 tsp salt
- 1 cup shredded sharp cheddar cheese
- 1/4 cup unsalted butter
- 1/2 cup heavy cream
- Black pepper, to taste
<|steps|>
Bring water and salt to a boil. Slowly stir in grits.
Reduce heat and simmer for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir in cheese, butter, cream, and pepper until melted and smooth.
Serve hot as a side dish.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **COCA-COLA CAKE**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 2 cups sugar
- 1 tsp baking soda
- 1 cup Coca-Cola
- 1 cup unsalted butter
- 1/4 cup unsweetened cocoa powder
- 1/2 cup buttermilk
- 2 large eggs
- 1 tsp vanilla extract
- 1 1/2 cups mini marshmallows
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter (for icing)
- 1/3 cup Coca-Cola (for icing)
- 3 tbsp unsweetened cocoa powder (for icing)
- 4 cups powdered sugar (for icing)
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 350°F.
Mix flour, sugar, and baking soda in a bowl.
In a saucepan, bring Coca-Cola, butter, and cocoa to a boil. Pour over dry ingredients and mix.
Add buttermilk, eggs, and vanilla. Stir in marshmallows.
Pour into a greased 9x13-inch pan and bake for 30-35 minutes.
For icing, heat butter, Coca-Cola, and cocoa until boiling. Remove from heat and whisk in powdered sugar.
Pour icing over warm cake. Cool before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **FRIED GREEN TOMATOES**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 green tomatoes, sliced 1/4-inch thick
- 1 cup cornmeal
- 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 tsp salt
- 1/2 tsp black pepper
- 1/4 tsp cayenne pepper
- 1 cup buttermilk
- Vegetable oil, for frying
<|steps|>
Soak tomato slices in buttermilk for 15 minutes.
Mix cornmeal, flour, salt, pepper, and cayenne.
Dredge tomatoes in cornmeal mixture.
Heat 1/2 inch oil in a skillet to 350°F. Fry tomatoes until golden, about 2-3 minutes per side.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **PRALINES**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 1/2 cups sugar
- 1 1/2 cups brown sugar
- 1 cup heavy cream
- 1/4 cup unsalted butter
- 1 tsp vanilla extract
- 2 cups pecan halves
<|steps|>
In a saucepan, combine sugars, cream, and butter. Cook over medium heat, stirring, until mixture reaches 238°F (soft ball stage).
Remove from heat, stir in vanilla and pecans.
Drop spoonfuls onto parchment paper and let cool until set.
Store in an airtight container.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SOUTHERN COLESLAW**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 head cabbage, shredded
- 2 carrots, grated
- 1 cup mayonnaise
- 1/4 cup apple cider vinegar
- 2 tbsp sugar
- 1 tsp celery seed
- Salt and pepper, to taste
<|steps|>
In a large bowl, combine cabbage and carrots.
In another bowl, whisk mayonnaise, vinegar, sugar, celery seed, salt, and pepper.
Pour dressing over cabbage mixture and toss to coat.
Chill for at least 1 hour before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **AMBROSIA SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup mandarin orange segments, drained
- 1 cup crushed pineapple, drained
- 1 cup mini marshmallows
- 1 cup shredded coconut
- 1 cup sour cream
- 1/2 cup chopped pecans
<|steps|>
In a bowl, combine oranges, pineapple, marshmallows, coconut, sour cream, and pecans.
Mix gently until well combined.
Chill for at least 2 hours before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHICKEN BOG**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 whole chicken (about 4 lbs)
- 1 lb smoked sausage, sliced
- 1 onion, chopped
- 2 cups long-grain rice
- 4 cups chicken broth
- 1 tsp black pepper
- 1 tsp salt
- 1/2 tsp cayenne pepper
<|steps|>
In a large pot, cover chicken with water and boil until tender, about 1 hour. Remove, shred meat, and reserve broth.
In the pot, cook sausage and onion until browned, about 5 minutes.
Add rice, 4 cups reserved broth, salt, pepper, and cayenne. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 20 minutes.
Stir in shredded chicken and cook for 10 minutes until rice is tender.
Serve hot.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SOUTHERN SPOON BREAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 cup cornmeal
- 2 cups whole milk
- 1 cup water
- 1 tsp salt
- 2 tbsp unsalted butter
- 3 large eggs, separated
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 350°F.
In a saucepan, mix cornmeal, milk, water, and salt. Cook over medium heat, stirring, until thickened, about 10 minutes.
Remove from heat, stir in butter, and cool slightly.
Whisk in egg yolks. Beat egg whites to stiff peaks and fold into cornmeal mixture.
Pour into a greased 2-quart baking dish. Bake for 30-35 minutes until puffed and golden.
Serve immediately with butter.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **TOMATO PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 unbaked 9-inch pie crust
- 4 large tomatoes, sliced
- 1/2 tsp salt
- 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- 1/2 cup mayonnaise
- 1/4 cup chopped basil
- 1/4 tsp black pepper
- 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 375°F.
Place tomato slices on paper towels, sprinkle with salt, and let sit for 15 minutes to drain.
Mix cheddar, mayonnaise, basil, and pepper.
Layer tomatoes in pie crust, then spread cheese mixture over top. Sprinkle with Parmesan.
Bake for 30-35 minutes until golden and bubbly.
Cool slightly before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SOUTHERN GREEN BEANS**
<|ingredients|>
- 2 lbs fresh green beans, trimmed
- 4 slices bacon, chopped
- 1 onion, chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 cups chicken broth
- 1 tsp sugar
- Salt and pepper, to taste
<|steps|>
In a large pot, cook bacon until crisp. Remove and set aside, leaving drippings.
Add onion and garlic to pot, cooking until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add green beans, broth, sugar, salt, and pepper. Bring to a boil, then simmer for 45-60 minutes until tender.
Stir in bacon and serve hot.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **LEMON ICEBOX PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 1/2 cups graham cracker crumbs
- 1/3 cup sugar
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, melted
- 1 can (14 oz) sweetened condensed milk
- 3 large egg yolks
- 1/2 cup fresh lemon juice
- 1 tsp lemon zest
- 1 cup heavy cream
- 2 tbsp powdered sugar
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 350°F.
Mix crumbs, sugar, and butter. Press into a 9-inch pie dish. Bake for 10 minutes.
Whisk condensed milk, egg yolks, lemon juice, and zest until smooth. Pour into crust.
Bake for 15-20 minutes until set.
Cool, then chill for 4 hours.
Whip cream with powdered sugar and spread over pie before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SWEET TEA**
<|ingredients|>
- 4 family-size tea bags
- 1 gallon water
- 1 1/2 cups sugar
- 1 lemon, sliced (optional)
<|steps|>
Bring 4 cups water to a boil. Add tea bags and steep for 5-7 minutes.
Remove tea bags and stir in sugar until dissolved.
Add remaining cold water and chill.
Serve over ice with lemon slices, if desired.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **CHESS PIE**
<|ingredients|>
- 1 unbaked 9-inch pie crust
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, melted
- 1 1/2 cups sugar
- 3 large eggs
- 1/4 cup whole milk
- 1 tbsp white vinegar
- 1 tbsp cornmeal
- 1 tsp vanilla extract
<|steps|>
Preheat oven to 350°F.
Whisk butter, sugar, eggs, milk, vinegar, cornmeal, and vanilla until smooth.
Pour into pie crust.
Bake for 40-50 minutes until set and golden.
Cool completely before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>

<|startofrecipe|>
TITLE: **SOUTHERN POTATO SALAD**
<|ingredients|>
- 3 lbs russet potatoes, peeled and cubed
- 4 large eggs
- 1 cup mayonnaise
- 1/4 cup yellow mustard
- 1/2 cup chopped pickles
- 1/4 cup chopped onion
- 1 tsp celery seed
- Salt and pepper, to taste
<|steps|>
Boil potatoes until tender, about 15 minutes. Drain and cool.
Boil eggs for 10 minutes, cool, peel, and chop.
In a large bowl, mix mayonnaise, mustard, pickles, onion, celery seed, salt, and pepper.
Add potatoes and eggs, tossing gently to coat.
Chill for at least 2 hours before serving.
<|endofrecipe|>
